The HD FIRE models have a new ability to integrate with Audible to get some dramatized spoken literature, but the added cost of paying for each piece is a real limitation (I also listen to audiobooks almost constantly on my iPhone, so I love them, but they are spendy).  Compared to the availability of material enabled by the Kindle TTS, selection is limited.  Currently, TTS carries no additonal charge for use with enabled Kindle books.Text-to-speech has the potential to have an enormous impact for many large groups:With the big bulge of population moving into their older years, many of us who have had good vision in the past are finding that long stretches of reading are much more fatiguing than before.  I am a boomer who loves to read before bed, but by the end of the day my eyes are tired and even with glasses and large text, words start jumping and blurring late in the evening.  It makes it hard to keep up with the flow of the story and I will eventually give up.  With TTS, I can read along without having to backtrack.  With a huge segment of the population just coming into seniorhood, this will be a very popular way for aging readers to stay involved and informed.  Most seniors are not aware of TTS capability and even most librarians and senior advocates do not know about this.A second group that should receive specific information about this capability are what we call "weak readers".  These are people of any age who can read, but for many reasons, labor to do so.  In my years as a special ed teacher I was able to help many students go from being non-readers to getting through essential reading tasks.  However, reading remains a difficult process for them, so as adults they only read when they can't get the information otherwise.  These people are not intellectually limited or lazy--in fact they are often exceptionally bright and diligent.  They would love to have access to the vast array of reading material of any topic, but they just don't have the time or energy to struggle.  TTS opens an almost endless supply of reading material to them in a way that they can actually use.  One of the ironies of reading instruction is that the more one reads, the better one becomes at it.  By having TTS support for a printed page (i.e., a "read-along"), weak readers can continue to grow their skills over time.  This technique is universally acknowledged as the most effecitive way to teach children to read, but it is just as powerful a way to motivate and continue to grow reading skills at any age.Second-language speakers/readers can access a greater variety of material while simultaneously strengthening their own aural comprehension. Other features, like the dictionary is a great way to expand and clarify vocabulary in the context of a piece of material. People with severe vision impairments have resources available to them, but the technology is often expensive and access to it is cumbersome and limited.  A Kindle with TTS is a simple and cost-effective way for them to participate in an information society.Another large group would be accessed by integrating standardized textbooks from schools all around the country and at all grade levels into the Kindle platform.  This is a no-brainer in terms of handling and managing textual information.  The simple ability to pack a lockerful of texts in one small device is huge and cost-effective for cash-strapped districts. The game-changer is to make this material available in a larger screen, color format that maximizes the use of illustrations essential to so many subjects (especially the sciences).  For the cost of one or two standard texts, an entire school's resources can be loaded onto the Kindle when needed.  The costs of handling paper texts, storing them when not in use and replacing those that deteriorate is much less with digital versions.  The new 8.9" HD FIRE would be especially suited to this, but it does not have TTS, but now the basic FIRE does.Applying this technology to the standardized text would have a huge impact.  In a given classroom, there is always a wide range of reading abilities, with the span greater the higher the grade level.  Further, it is typical that texts are written at a reading level that is well above the intended grade (e.g.: 8th grade text written at 10th grade reading level).  This means that 50% or more of the students in that class cannot effectively use that text to get the required information.  Teachers spend an enormous amount of time trying to find other materials that convey the same information at lower reading levels in order to include students in the standard curriculum.  If all students had equal access to the standard material, this would allow them to keep up with the pace of the class, assure common information and free the teacher to give more individual time to direct instruction.  Most parents I worked with would spend whatever it took to provide their kids with a resource that would potentially help them so enormously even if the school didn't alread provide it.Amazon should be much more aggressive and explicit in marketing the TTS capabilities of the Kindle products and resources.  Targeted mail and demonstration campaigns to advocacy groups for seniors and students in particular would result in a lot of sales to both private parties and public entities.  The TTS technology is the most unique capability that distinguishes the Kindle products from the ever-growing tablet products and Amazon is missing the boat in not promoting it as far and wide as possible.

Reviews.Title: Good device, but not for me - returned it.
Reviews.Author: J.R.P.
Reviews.Content: Even though I returned this item, I really do think it's a good device overall. The price is obviously the best selling point (I was able to buy mine for $129 at a promotional price), the screen is great, I love how it works with my Amazon Prime account to stream music and video, and it is a very capable and easy to use device. One notable downside is the "recommendations" that appear at the bottom of the screen. I know Amazon sells this thing at cost and makes money by selling more on it - but the inability to turn it off is a HUGE annoyance. If it weren't for that, I'd have given it 4 stars.However, after a couple of days I discovered that it just wasn't for me. I almost hate throwing this out there because I know there are a lot of "haters" out there, but I'm a *gasp* iPhone user. I wanted a tablet, but didn't really want to spend the money for an iPad because I believe they are highly overpriced. I own a Kindle e-reader and heard good things about the Fire, so I decided to give it a try. I knew when I bought it that it wasn't going to be the same thing and had realistic expectations. Initially I was pretty impressed, but after using it for a couple of days I came to the realization that it just wasn't what I was looking for. I like the functionality and intuitive "flow" of using my iPhone. The Kindle Fire experience just wasn't the same. Navigating was not as effortless and I found myself having to search for things and sorting through things to get to apps, media, settings and the app/media stores.. Additionally, the app selection, while impressive, wasn't what I was looking for. The facebook app was less than impressive (only shows the last 2-3 hours of posts), to give one example, and a lot of the apps that I know and love simply weren't available. I know I probably would have gotten the hang of it eventually and could have lived with the app selectoin, but I simply didn't want to have to "get used to it." This device is good and a lot of people love it. But it's simply not what I was looking for. I spend a lot of time traveling and would be getting a LOT of use out of my tablet, so I didn't want something that was just "good." Even though it makes me cringe to say this, my experience with the Fire has convinced me that in order to get what I'm looking for I need to be saving my money and taking advantage of a holiday sale for an iPad. Please note, that this is NOT an advertisement or endorsement for Apple products!! **To all the Apple-haters out there, please keep your negative feedback to yourselves** This is simply my experience and my opinion. I'm the type of person who likes things a certain way and isn't afraid to pay a little more to get what I want IF IT'S NECESSARY. I tried this product in order to avoid overpaying for something I wasn't quite sure I wanted or needed, and my experience helped me realize what it is that I really want. I'm sure I'm not the only person who is in this boat, so hopefully others will find this review helpful in their search for the product that is right for them.

Reviews.Title: Charging Hassle
Reviews.Author: Cara W.
Reviews.Content: The kindle fire worked flawlessly at first but then my family saw that the connection between the kindle charger and the kindle was loose. Due to this, the charger has to be positioned in the perfect spot for it to actually charge, but this has made it almost impossible to use at the same time. At this time, it has stopped charging altogether. I find this flaw elementary and it should be fixed as soon as possible.  I am probably going to get a replacement, which I have heard was not difficult and they got great service. But I'm not sure that I should for people that have replaced them have had the same problems, and some of them are already on their fourth and still having complications. I'm considering a different product altogether to eliminate all of this.

Reviews.Title: If you want an expensive disposable device...buy this
Reviews.Author: Alkaus "ChrisE"
Reviews.Content: After a little over a year the device cannot be used because the port is so delicate that it fails and you can no longer charge the device. Many problems with charging it and all Amazon offers (if you call them) is a replacement at a discounted price of $149. Look at the 'problems' forum for kindle...many problems with the port giving out after warranty expired so that it cannot be charged and no help at all. An inferior product. They would not replace mine. I have purchased a 'kindle repair' service at ebay for $39. Hoping that works. Glad someone other than Amazon offers this service.

Reviews.Title: Charging/ port/ and battery issues
Reviews.Author: Pam P
Reviews.Content: I received this as a gift. We have had problems with it charging properly since we purchased it. We have been sent both the original charger and the "new" longer port charger. I am lucky if this charges 50% of the time. This is a tool I used daily, now it is out of warranty. Though they knew there was a problem with the ports to the point they had the engineer's reconfigure a new charger. The client's that actually owned this product were not contacted to let them know of the defect. I may be able to get a new or refurbished device for a discounted price. I have told hundreds of people about this product. A happy customer shares there story with a few people an unhappy customer shares there experiences with 7 times more people. I don't think I will waste my money on a product that the company knew there was a problem with. I may as well save my money for an IPAD and will be able to shoot videos with it. Thanks KINDLE

Reviews.Title: Can I rate ZERO stars?? How about - Buy a NOOK?????
Reviews.Author: Sally
Reviews.Content: Don't waste your money.  We bought two kindles within weeks of each other. Within days of each other, they stopped charging. BOTH of them. I contacted customer service and they actually tried to tell me it was a "rare" problem and wanted to SELL me two more.  Nope.  Now I'm out $400 for two kindles and all of the money for my apps and books.  Thanks Amazon - you released a crappy product. People have this problem like crazy and because mine are 6 months outside of the warranty period, I'm out of luck, out of kindles and out of the money I've dumped into these useless paperweights.  So disappointed to receive such garbage from a company I USED to be a HUGE fan of.BUY A NOOK.

Reviews.Title: Great Device at a Fair Price
Reviews.Author: Manderz46
Reviews.Content: I just love my Kindle Fire! I use it every day. I do a lot of reading, although reading is not the only thing I use my Kindle Fire for. There are tons of applications (plenty of which are FREE) available to include games, social media, organizational tools, and much more. You can watch videos and Netflix. You can listen to music. You can share excerpts from books you read on Facebook, Twitter, and other social media websites with a tap of your finger. You can highlight portions or text in any given book and it saves it for later referencing. You can also make notes, bookmark pages, and share your reading progress right from the page you are reading when you are reading it. You can download books via wifi right from the Kindle Fire. My FAVORITE part about the Kindle Fire is that I can read on my Kindle Fire, Cloud Reader Online, and my Amazon Kindle application on my phone and never have to worry about not knowing where I was at in a book or which device I last read on because they all sync with each other. Therefore, I have the opportunity to read basically anywhere and anytime if I'm near a computer, my phone, or my Kindle Fire. Also, once books are downloaded to the Kindle Fire device you do not need an internet connection to read. The same goes for Cloud Reader if you are sure to download the book for offline reading. The Kindle Fire is great for a fast reader because you can find another book right at your fingertips at any given time. I highly recommend the Kindle Fire for anyone who enjoys reading in general. It is VERY decently priced for its capabilities. The ONLY issue I have had with the Kindle Fire is that occasionally applications will freeze and have to be shut down, but I have experienced this problem with EVERY electronic device with applications I have ever owned so it is not a real problem in my opinion. For the price and capabilities, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Great product, excellent customer support
Reviews.Author: Kari
Reviews.Content: I got my Kindle Fire as a Christmas present last year and immediately loved it. It isn't my first eReader, but my previous eReader had a poorly lit screen and I had trouble reading in most settings other than a dark room. The screen quality and readability of the Kindle made me love it immediately; even better was the user-friendly setup that took me a few minutes. Some of the comments I read have mentioned that Kindles aren't great for use with a lot of apps. I don't use very many apps, so I can't really comment on that, but I have done some web searching and I like being able to access Facebook on the go as well. With Amazon Prime, it becomes an even better deal and the device interphases very well for music and books. And I can read new books when they first come out in hardcover, without paying $25 a book!After a year of (very) heavy use - sometimes as much as 5 books/week - I finally did have a problem with my Kindle; it stopped charging. I think the area where the charging cable plugs in just got worn out, because the cable still charges other devices. Regardless, I called Amazon's customer support line, and after maybe 15 minutes on the phone, they had put in an order for a new device for. Due to the holiday season, I was told it might be a bit of a wait, but they'd get it out to me as soon as possible and they'd let me know as soon as they had a delivery date. A couple days later I got an email with an updated arrival date of December 4th. And here I am on November 30th, able to say that the new Kindle is here, synced with my account (seamlessly), and my old Kindle is ready for return with the printable shipping labels they sent me. Total cost to me = $1, which I get refunded as soon as they receive my returned device. This is easily one of the smoothest, most hassle-free experiences I had, and it was during the Holiday shopping season!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire 7"
Reviews.Author: Toni F.
Reviews.Content: battery does not hold a charge for as long as advertised and the charging wire does not fit properly have to jiggle it to make a connection

Reviews.Title: Love the Kindle!
Reviews.Author: Jayne
Reviews.Content: I have been fighting buying the kindle since they first came out.  I love to read, but I thought how stupid reading from this little screen!  BUT WAIT, I take back everything I thought.  I love the Kindle.  It's easy to use, easy to read off the pages, and it does so much more!  If you are sitting on the fence and can't decide what to do - jump off the fence right now it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: Love Lost
Reviews.Author: Mary E. Errico
Reviews.Content: This is disgraceful! I recently returned a Kindle Fire because in order to charge it, I needed to jiggle the cord to get the LED light to light up and then, if I moved it one millimeter, I had to go through the process all over again. I just got my replacement and it does the same exact thing. When I called about it, I was told that the replacements are refurbished and that I couldn't even get one until December 6-13th! I am an English teacher and I use it every day! If this happened to both of my devices, don't you think there is an issue with it? You would think that I would be offered a BRAND NEW replacement, especially since I paid $199 for mine and now they are selling for $159 and I have to wait six weeks just to get another refurbished one that most likely will have the same problem! I asked around and I am not alone. Some friends of mine also have charging issues like this. I was an Amazon fan until this happened. This is just not right! I really love my Kindle Fire and this is beyond disappointing.

Reviews.Title: Horrible battery on my second one
Reviews.Author: Angela
Reviews.Content: I purchased my kindle last december and it broke a few months later. It would not charge at all so I had it replaced. It's broken again. This is the second time with the same problem. I called and got some guy in india who told me it was a design flaw  and he was sending me a new one. He claimed it would be looked at by a product specialist but I'm not sure I believe him.Anyway when i get my new kindle I'm going to sell it because my warranty is up in dec and I don't want to be stuck with a paper weight when the new one breaks a few months from now. Unless I would get really lucky and get a good one. I have an ipad i have had for 2 years and a galaxy tab for a year and a half and have never had a problem with either of them. I do not reccomend the kindle fire to anyone.

Reviews.Title: design flaw
Reviews.Author: Bridget
Reviews.Content: If you are considering buying a Kindle or Kindle fire do yourself a favor and google Kindle and charging problems.You will find that they are many instances of the Kindles working great initially and then they refuse to take a charge.  There seems to be a design flaw in which, over time, the kindle charger and the internal componet either don't make a connection or the internal componet refuses to respond to the charger. *this is not a problem with the charging cord*.  If this occurs within the one year warranty, great, they quickly send you a replacement. However, if you are outside of the year warranty you are out of luck and they give you several "options" where you can purchase a replacement or an upgrade at a discounted price.  No thanks.  This is not an isolated problem.  My family had a kindle and this happened and it was within the year so they sent a replacement. However, the replacement soon developed the same problem but we were now out of warranty so too bad. (note-when they send a replacement you might only get a month warranty as they don't give a year warranty with the replacement-it is covered under your original warranty. Therefore, if you had your kindle for 11 months before it started malfunctioning the replacement Kindle would only have a warranty for the remaining month of the original one year warranty.) When the Kindle Fire came out we did buy one thinking the Fire design would be new and improved.  Wrong -it lasted long enough to be out of warranty though before it stopped charging.  I spoke to customer service and they offered me options to replace with a refurbished model for 93.20 or to upgrade for even more money.If you go ahead and buy a Kindle anyway you better spend the money on an extended warranty because, based on my experience and many others, you will need it.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed
Reviews.Author: Online shopper
Reviews.Content: I received my kindle fire as a present for Christmas 2011 and it initially worked very well.I had no problem at all in accessing my Kindle library, .pdf files, facebook, websurfing, videos, games, etc. When it works, it is a really nice tablet. One oddity is that it has a camera which its software does not support, but it was nothing that counted as a problem.In August 2012 the first Kindle Fire stopped charging (as many have done, it seems) because of some kind of looseness in the connection. Amazon were great about sending an immediate replacement. I continued to use the replacement daily, with no issues.In June 2013 (this month), the 2nd Kindle died in exactly the same way. Amazon sent me a new charging kit, which had no effect. They have refused to replace the item again, on the grounds that it is out of warranty.I understand that electronics have a certain amount of build-in obsolescence, but for two separate $199 devices ($199 is what my husband paid originally) to die in less than two years is unacceptable. Nor are the various pieces of advice I was given by customer service staff at all confidence-inspiring: Lay the Kindle flat while it's charging! Did you wiggle the connector? Don't read while it's charging. Oh, you charge it overnight? Oh never do that! Overcharging could also be an issue!Lastly, when I called to report the second Kindle dead, I was initially told I'd get an immediate replacement. Then the customer service staffer called me back to say I could have a free upgrade! Then I got an email saying to call them. Then I was told that, no, no free upgrade. And no replacement. At all. But I can pay $169 for a new one! I don't usually complain about call center customer service, but OUCH!Long story short, I am not sure what to do. I do not want to pay Amazon more money for another suspect product, but I have no great love for Apple's treatment of its customers either. I'll probably just wait till a better third option shows up.

Reviews.Title: Not a good purchase at all.
Reviews.Author: Ramona Walker
Reviews.Content: I have had issues with this product since the first one I received.  It doesn't charge even after purchasing the amazon power charger for it.  Now on the 3rd Kindle Fire and same problem and now I cannot connect to WiFi.  Trying to get a refund but it is proving to be quite a hassle.  Do not waste your money buying this product.

Reviews.Title: Still Doesn't want to charge correctly
Reviews.Author: P. Ledesma "Graphic Designer"
Reviews.Content: So far, to date, I have had 3 kindle fire tablets and not a single one of them want to charge. One lasted less than 6 months, one just about a year and I just got a new one three days ago... doesn't want to charge!! Serious problem with the Kindle Fires. Not saying not worth the money but be prepared to have the battery go bad very quickly if it isn't bad when you get it!

Reviews.Title: Excellent customer service!
Reviews.Author: Anonymous
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review for anything and I do not typically buy online or from Amazon. That will change! John from customer service was pleasant, friendly, and easy to work with.  He took care of my question immediately without hesitation or needing to talk to a "supervisor".  The reason I called was because I bought the Kindle Fire the weekend before cyber monday for $30 more than the cyber monday sale price. John immediately reimbursed me the money.  Way to go Amazon! You have a loyal customer!

Reviews.Title: My Kindle went to Paris.
Reviews.Author: Lenda W.
Reviews.Content: I went to Paris for Vacation this years. I had a wonderful time, and I took my Kindle Fire with me. My kindle kept me informed about what was happening in the USA. It allowed me to post E-mails and go on Facebook with my pictures. I also listen to my favorited music. I am so glad I purchased my Kindle Fire it was worth every cent.

Reviews.Title: customer service
Reviews.Author: selena
Reviews.Content: i bought my kindle fire on febuary 25 2012 had a problem with the battery in august.it fixed itself (dont know what happened).I love my kindle fire (so does my 8 year old son).Its easy to use great to watch netflix.But the problem with the battery happened agian customer service was AWESOME! Explained the problem they are sending me a new one why cause they do not know why its doing what it is doing either and they explained it shouldnt do that said they were sorry im having a problem and said we will send you a new one. No hassle no fuss.You dont get customer service like that anymore.Thank you amazon.Your product and customer service were amazing.when i had the problem in august it was great to. sincerly,selena osheim

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire 7" - Love but should have come w/elecrical outlet charger
Reviews.Author: Charity Humphreys "Totally Lost"
Reviews.Content: I bought a Kindle Fire for each of my kids for Christmas.  I am very excited to give them this gift.  I was disappointed that the Kindle Fire did not include a charger for an electrical outlet.  I will now have to go online and buy each of them a charger.  Still excited about the purchase though!

Reviews.Title: Love My Kindle Fire!
Reviews.Author: rmjaxon
Reviews.Content: I don't know why all the Kindle Fire has such bad reviews, I have the 2nd generation KF & I love it! Right out of the box, I charged it before I used it. It works great- charges, reads touch, downloads quickly, durable, everything I could ask for. I bought mine without the advertisements (only because I got mine at Target when they still sold them) and I have ZERO complaints. I love the book selection, even some of the free books are some of the best I've ever read. The screen quality and sound is amazing for videos, music, and apps!

Reviews.Title: Incredible improvements in the Kindle Fire.
Reviews.Author: stacey
Reviews.Content: I bought my kindle fire early this year.  To encourage my son to read more, I just bought him one.  It is truly amazing how much they improved an already wonderful product in less than a year.  I was tempted to trade mine for his, but he is working hard in school, so I let him keep his reward.  I highly recommend this product to anyone who wants a fantastic e-reader with plenty of bells and whistles.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy a Kindle, you will be sorry!
Reviews.Author: robby
Reviews.Content: Unreal! I highly recommend you do not buy the Kindle. Who wants to buy a device and have it filled with advertising? That's all this thing is. You have to go past all of their offers and advertising just to get to your own stuff stored on the device.When you turn it on or take it off standby, no nice screen saver or desktop, just an advertisment. Who wants to turn it on and see an ad first thing? Not me, not on a device I PAID FOR...Want to watch a video or listen to a song? Guess what? You have to go through all their advertising and "special offers" just to get to the stored songs and video's on your device.I bought 2 of these. One for my daughter and one for my niece. I WISH I could return them for a refund because I would. They are NOT kid friendly and my daughter and niece have had it for a week and already don't use it much because they have trouble finding their stuff on there with all the ads you have to go through first. What a waste of over $300. After reading and researching about this issue, seems there are many people not too happy about it and there is no way to take the ads off. I did however read that there was going to be an option to pay amazon $15 to remove it. That is so ridiculous I don't even know where to start. PLUS, if it's true, Amazon has made it impossible to find out how to or where to have it removed.Bad deal for me. Not happy with Amazon at all. They are getting dirty Like Apple...

Reviews.Title: A Cat's Review
Reviews.Author: Jenna D.
Reviews.Content: I finally have my own Kindle Fire.  My human just purchased the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 (tips below on how to get them to purchase a second tablet so that you get your own) and gave me her old Kindle Fire.  Of course, she should have given me both, or at least the new one, but.... there you have it.... humans aren't nearly as intelligent as they think they are.I thought I'd write a review for felines, or for humans thinking of purchasing a Kindle Fire for your feline.  Humans, you really should, your cat will love you for it.I am not interested in reading books, or going on the internet, or any of the other many things you can do on this tablet and which my human loved and often did.  My interest lies solely in the apps, especially Gizzy's Friend Gizzys Friend - a Cat Toy and Squish Squash Squoosh Bugs SQUISH SQUASH SQUOOSH BUGS! .  I'm sure there are other quality apps for us cats, though if there aren't, there really should be.  For now, I am very happy with these two, but certain I will be looking for more in the future.The screen is so clear, it looks as though the bugs and mouse are real!  I will admit, the first time I saw Gizzy the mouse, I thought he WAS real and tried to pick him up in my mouth after catching him under my paw.  I only admit this so that you know just how clear and vibrant the picture is.  The sound is also wonderful --- how I adore hearing the squeaks of that mouse when I catch him, or the chirps of the bugs when I squash them!Now, for how to get your human to give you your very own tablet --- steal theirs!  Stare at them and meow pitifully until they relent and quit reading their book or surfing the web, and turn the Kindle over to you.  Be sure to have them purchase some fun apps for you to watch and/or play with (see above for suggestions).  If you fall asleep whilst your app is on, keep an ear open because your human may try to steal it.  In that case, immediately wake up and give them the hurt "How could you possibly do this to me?" look.  They should then put it back down beside you.  Note, this may happen several times, and though it's not fun to have one's sleep interrupted like this, it is a necessary step to ensure you get your very own Kindle.  Your human will eventionally see that s/he has no hope of ever finishing that book unless she gets another Kindle for herself.Be assured, you will be very pleased with your human's purchase and will spend many waking and non-waking hours enjoying this wonderful tablet.  I give it 2 paws up.

Reviews.Title: If you're looking for quality don't buy it
Reviews.Author: Ang
Reviews.Content: When i first bought the kindle fire i was pleased with it. However the device stopped charging after 6 months. It was replaced for free, but it happened again after the one year mark. This time they would not replace it. If you are looking to keep it only for a year then it's a good buy, Anything longer than that is not worth it.

Reviews.Title: BAD BUSINESS...Loved my Kindle Fire until the battery stop charging
Reviews.Author: Mrs. T
Reviews.Content: My husband gave me the Kindle fire as a birthday gift in January 2012.  Originally I loved it and had no complaints until the battery wouldn't stay charged.  I've contacted customer service twice - first time they sent me another charger - that didn't help and second was told that they didn't sell replacement battieries nor could I get the original Kindle Fire anymore but that I could purchase the Kindle Fire 4th generation or the HD. I AM VERY DISAPPOINTED!  Why would I want to purchase another Kindle Fire if I'm going to have the same issue in 17 months.  My warranty expired in January (isn't it convenient that the warranty expired and then I started having issues with the battery).  My kindle is relatively new (17 months) and it's no fault of MINE that the battery won't hold a charge.  OBVIOUSLY THAT'S A MANUFACTURING ISSUE - I'M SURE THEY PLANNED FOR THE KINDLE FIRE TO LAST MORE THAN 17 MONTHS.

Reviews.Title: Fail fail fail
Reviews.Author: Matthew Boop
Reviews.Content: My mother has been the owner of this lovely product for 1.5 years.  The power connector has not worked correctly in over 6 months.  All of the current reviews on the device show the same problem with a bad charging port.  After attempting to have this tablet replaced they informed her that the warranty was only for a year.  After explaining she had it for 1.5 years they then extended the warranty to one year and three months.  They knew of the problem but did not have anyone who could fix it and generously offered to have her purchase a new one for $150.  Needless to say I am not a fan of android.  I have informed my mother that if she wanted to read electronically she should just get an ipad mini.  Better operating system and awesome customer service.  I was an avid amazon customer but I am disappointed in the customer service regarding the kindle fire.  I can't understand how you don't fix kindle fire's but have refurbished ones for sale on the website.  Things really need to change or everyone is going to be switching to ipad mini's.  By the way I am writing this review on my ipad and it is charging appropriately........have a terrific day!

Reviews.Title: Loved it untill this week.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have had my Kindle for just a couple weeks over a year. I used it everyday and loved it! Graphics were great when watching movies as was the sound. Loved how easy and quick it was to download books, and 85% of the time the price for books was great as well. Sadly this week my kindle started acting up. It would freeze, books crashed a couple of times, and it lost my note and bookmarks a few times. Then to make it worse yesterday it refused to charge. I chatted with amazon customer service, but because my kindle was now out of warranty all they could offer was a used kindle for $100 plus shipping, they tried to help but it was still frustrating none the less. I decided to try the new kindle fire hd instead, at full price :/, with the 2 year warranty! Disappointed i had to buy a new Kindle after only a year. Really hope i am not disappointed again! If you choose to buy the kindle make sure you pay extra for the 2yr Warranty!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Library Books
Reviews.Author: concerned
Reviews.Content: If you intend to use this device to read library books.  Please check with your local library BEFORE YOU PURCHASE ANY KINDLE OR AMAZON PRODUCTS as they do not work with many of the libraries across the country.Kansas is one of those states.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire.
Reviews.Author: MJ Reviewer
Reviews.Content: I received my KIndle Fire for Christmas last year. It's so handy for business needs, self needs and much much more! My KIndle Fire is black and about the size of a toaster oven, and as thick as a Peoples magazine. ( It fits in almost any bag!) It costs about two hundred dollars. I use mine almost daily. My favorite feature about the Kindle Fire is being able to have books, apps, and entertainment all at the touch of my fingers. (Without the crazy iPad prices.)Every time you turn on the Kindle Fire it has a new unique picture waiting to be seen! The Kindle Fire is easy to use and the battery life is outstanding! This device is perfect for ages 5-70. Its a good way to keep children busy and learning. You can put locks on the Kindle to block anything out. picture, internet, movies music. This is a device you control!If you have trouble reading without your glasses, this is not a problem for the Kindle Fire. You are able to enlarge the letters and words to your specifications. Making it easy to read, anytime.As you can see this device is perfect for the modern day housewife, business woman/man, child, teen, and senior citizen.

Reviews.Title: Great Product!
Reviews.Author: davidscott
Reviews.Content: I bought 2 of these for my 4 year old twins!  After looking at the Leap Pads I figured these were a much better deal!  The kids love them!  There are tons of free and very inexpensive apps for the kids!  They are great at home or in the car!  I rented them each a movie for a road trip and never heard a peep out the back seat!  There are parental controls that are easy to set!  Overall this is a great product and I am so glad I spent a little extra for these!

Reviews.Title: Disappointment
Reviews.Author: Jennifer White
Reviews.Content: I like Amazon.com, they've treated me very well but I'll never purchase another Kindle Fire or Kindle anything ever again.  In January 2012 I paid $199 and it worked fine for about 6 months, since then I've had 2 replacements.  The 2nd replacement just died not too long ago because the battery wouldn't charge, unfortunately it was out of warranty.  I called Amazon talked over few options finally settled on a trade-in deal for $35.  (I don't even know if I want to pursue it.) I also asked CS at Amazon if it's a defect in the manufacturing and she insisted that it wasn't but there has to be something wrong because I've seen a lot of complaints on the internet about Kindle Fire devices either not charging at all or not holding a charge.  What is Amazon.com going to do to fix or rectify this issue?

Reviews.Title: 5Th Replacement
Reviews.Author: Sandra Pipersburgh "CHYNNA"
Reviews.Content: It's hard to type and takes 4ever to charge and you can't use it while it's charging. This is my 5the replacement I was offered an upgrade to the KF HD never received it then offered an 80% refund I nvr received. Talked to customer service reps at least 10xs and they were no help asked to speak to a supervisor I was told he'd call me back but received that call overall the KF has many issues and they replace them with refurbished ones that lead to more problems and the CR reps will just keep sending out replacements with no real solution like I said this is my 5th. I'd nvr buy another Kindle nor a tablet from Amazon

Reviews.Title: Second Kindle, same problem
Reviews.Author: Kathleen Tatar
Reviews.Content: This is my second kindle and I've only had it a month now.  Didn't want to get another but couldn't transfer all my unread stuff to another device so I decided to try again.  Already I am having charging problems, sometimes it charges, sometimes it doesn't, have to get it exactly right in a certain position or it won't charge.  I image it will only be a matter of time until it is not charging at all, just like the last one.  This time I will definitely not get another Kindle.  It's a great product if you can charge it.

Reviews.Title: Unbelievable
Reviews.Author: Kimberly A. Greed
Reviews.Content: My husband and kids bought me a Kindle Fire for Christmas 2011, in August of 2012 it just stopped working. Thank goodness that they purchased the extended warranty. I extended that warranty when I replaced it, and boy am I glad I did because it broke the same way yet again on July 14, 2013...they replaced it with I believe a refurbished one and here we are August 23, 2014 and it is broke again...working one minute wont turn on the next.  Warranty expired on August 18th so I am out of luck.  Would not ever purchase another Kindle.

Reviews.Title: Didn't last long
Reviews.Author: Harleigh
Reviews.Content: It was fun while it lasted!! After about 4 months it wouldn't charge!! I would save your money and buy an ipad!!

Reviews.Title: I can "READ" anywhere I please, anytime, night or day, on a parkbench, by the pool, IN the pool, on the train, "GET MY DRIFT."
Reviews.Author: YVONNE THOMAS
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased two kindles for my Grandsons, ages 7 and 10. I needed something to keep them busy as I was taking them on an extended vacation, by train.I realized before we left, I would not get much share time on their Kindles so, I got my own, mostly for reading and music. Right now I'm catching up on my reading more than my music. I'll get to that later.I was challenged a few times in our travels due to Wi-Fi issues.You will be happy to know that while on Amtrak, in Disneyworld and at Great Wolf lodge in Virginia, we did very well.I do realize that I will have to pay my Grandsons for lessons in how to better use all the features on my Kindle.Thank you for this marvelous piece of equipment, Thank your customer service reps who are so understanding and helpful.You should market this to our Senior population (I had my 73rd Birthday on July 13), There are so many ways it could benefit someone even if they are mobility or visually impaired.Think about it.I NOMINATE MY SELF AS A SPOKESPERSON.Thanks again,YVONNE M.T.

Reviews.Title: Great but app compatibility...
Reviews.Author: KB
Reviews.Content: Great device for reading on the go, basic web browsing, and some games. The interface is mostly responsive, but does lag occasionally (afterall this is an Android device). The 8GB of space is plenty if you don't download a ton of apps or movies. Movies shown are in standard def (as no high-def is available due to non-HD screen). App compatibility is a big issue though. Some apps work well, others flat-out crash almost every time. For the price, it's hard to beat. If I had the choice to do it all over again, I would have picked the kindle fire HD. You get a better screen, 2x the memory, better speakers, and a lot more processing power. With the difference in price being so low (with specials, discounts, etc) you should just go with the HD to begin with. You won't be disappointed if all you need this for is basic tasks. Overall, I'm pretty happy with the kindle fire.

Reviews.Title: ok but...
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: i received the gift for christmas. i wanted a straight up e-reader however my wife decided on the more versital fire. i'm dissappointed. the fire has issues with many websites. does not handle movie trailer/videos. i was ok with that because all i wanted was an ereader which it did fine with inside. but when in the sun; when it became a mirror.

Reviews.Title: Charge
Reviews.Author: lolastorm
Reviews.Content: When I first bought my kindle fire, I loved it. It worked great. About 3 months after I bought the kindle it would not charge. I would have to set it a certain way to make it charge and even then it would often take days to get to just 50%. I went through two chargers because the way I had to set up the kindle was ruining my chargers. I thought that I just messed something up with the charger plug in but shortly after it stopped charging my best friends also stopped charging. She had to set it a certain way to get it to charge too. She also went through three chargers instead of one. The kindle has really nice display and the internet was always fast. If you do decide on buying a kindle fire I would be as careful as possible when you charge it. Other than that, I have no other complaints.

Reviews.Title: Has Issues
Reviews.Author: Bailey
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Kindle Fire and was pleased with it until it stopped charging six months later. Support sent me a refurbished one, and it stopped charging a year later. That's right! My warranty had expired, and I have nothing! Kindle Fire 2nd generation is known for this malfunction. Beware! You are taking a gamble.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire stopped taking a charge.
Reviews.Author: cosmo
Reviews.Content: I bought the Kindle FIre in January 2012. In July 2013, it stopped taking a charge and couldn't be fixed. It had to be replaced. That is a very short life span for a product and very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: Loved it for a year and a half
Reviews.Author: PeskyMelius
Reviews.Content: I am the exclusive user of my Kindle Fire; we do not have children at home.  I received it for Christmas 2011.  I play games and read and every now and then check in on FaceBook.  Over the last few weeks I have found that its harder and harder to get the device to charge - as of now, its on the charger, the yellow/orange light is on, however, it does not show that it is actively charging.  I was told by Amazon that I could purchase a new product at a discount.  R

Reviews.Title: dissatisfied
Reviews.Author: Gypsy N
Reviews.Content: I love the premise of the kindle fire, but like many other people I am disappointed in the life of the fire. My first fire lasted five months before it stopped charging, Amazon replaced it for me and I was happy. Now barely a year later (I got my new one in late may) as soon as the warrenty ran out it stopped charging again! Now I have to buy a new one at a discount price. If you are a new purchaser I would research very carefully or spend the money for an extended warrenty! I no longer have a choice since I have ALOT of money in books and movies invested in this thing!!!

Reviews.Title: Great for 1st year
Reviews.Author: leannel80
Reviews.Content: Great product until about 14 months (once warranty ran out) and started noticing issues with wifi connection turning on/off whenever wherever, then stopped charging, was sent new charger, which I only worked 10 days, and they can't replace or wen FIX the problem only offer a discounted price for a new one! What happened to things commit with a 2 year warranty?! Guess they know it craps out after a year! Poor customer service if they any offer to at least fix (not replace) it! Probably will go to an iPad.

Reviews.Title: Amazon and Their Amazing Customer Service
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I purchased two Kindle Fire's for my twin daughters. In one year, I had to exchange BOTH of them THREE TIMES because of a defect in the metal casing where the charger plug is inserted. Thankfully, Amazon extended the one year warranty and told me that they would honor the third exchange because the manufacturing defect was widespread. When I complained that the last exchange did not include chargers and I was required to purchase my own chargers, they quickly called me on the phone and credited my account for 2 new high speed chargers. I alway shop at Amazon first because I know that they have amazing customer service. Thanks Amazon!

Reviews.Title: I HATE THIS 2ND GENERATION KINDLE FIRE
Reviews.Author: Sharyn Feller
Reviews.Content: I have a kindle fire which was given to me a couple of years ago and I absolutely love it!!! I purchased this one as a gift to my Mother in law. Why do I hate this one? Because it isn't clear when you order that you have to order it without the specials or it will come loaded with adds. I had to pay an extra 20.00 to get the adds taken off and the adds still are popping up! I've had to call Amazon 3 different times. They finally told me that I have to sync the kindle to get them off. I haven't tried that yet because my MIL doesn't live close so I will have to try that when I visit her.Another reason I hate it is because it doesn't include a charger. WTF? That doesn't even make sense to me! You have to spend extra for a charger? I complained about that to an Amazon rep after calling about the other problem and he said "All you had to do is call and ask for one and we'd send you one for free". He said they figure most people have a bunch of chargers around their house and probably wouldn't need one so this is their way of being eco friendly. I think that's a bunch of BS! If that were the case, then they should post that on the site when you order, that you should request a charger for free if you need one.

Reviews.Title: Kindle dead after a year 1/2.
Reviews.Author: Julie
Reviews.Content: My kindle fire is dead after a year & half. Went to turn it on one day and all it showed was a black screen that says kindle fire. I contacted Kindle only thing they could do was try and sell me a Fire HD. Very disappointed. I love my fire but it's not worth it for only a 1 1/2 of use. Shame on Kindle for not give me any other option.

Reviews.Title: Reasonable price for excellent product!
Reviews.Author: Holley Durham
Reviews.Content: I would recommend a refurbished Kindle Fire to anyone who may need to save a little bit of money on the front end.  It carries the same warranty as a new Kindle Fire and mine is in perfect condition aesthetically and functionally.  Overall a great deal with which I am totally satisfied!

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: c d
Reviews.Content: I bought my first Kindle Fire a little more than a year ago. It stopped charging after 8 months. They were great and sent me a new one. This one also stopped charging, but only after 2 months. They again sent me a new one, mind you it was still under warranty. The 3rd one has also stopped charging. I won't replace it this time. Just not worth the hassle. I will just get a different device. There is obviously an issue with the charging port becoming loose, or I wouldn't have gone through 3 of them in 13 months with the same issue.

Reviews.Title: This review will focus on the text to speech feature in Kindles and Kindle Fire 2nd Gen
Reviews.Author: A. "Ang"
Reviews.Content: I bought this after having the kindle with keyboard.  I loved that device (kindle keyboard) because of the "text to speech feature" where I could have it read tons of books (check if they can be read by looking for the text to speech enabled in the book description) and newspapers to me and I used this especially to listen to while driving.  I just set it before I go anywhere and stop it after I park,  so there is no need to handle the device while driving.  I am in Los Angeles after all!  A favorite thing on the kindle keyboard was the fact that it could read me Barrons Newspaper.  Now I bought the Kindle Fire 2nd generation specifically because I read that the text to speech was improved.  This is true, the voice is so much more human than the computer voices on the kindle keyboard and so much better to listen to and understand.  I also read that this new device Kindle Fire 2nd gen would read me newspapers so I was thrilled about that too until I found out that it cannot read me Barrons.  Perhaps Barrons will make an investment in the kindle and come up with an app?  Or perhaps Amazon will come to the rescue (as they sometimes do) by creating a software update that will make this work?  Either way, this is the feature that makes me love this device and not enough has been written about it so I decided to dedicate my review to it for others like me who didn't get a kindle fire 2nd generation for media but for better book and newspaper reading features!  Happy reading!It is important to note that the Kindle Paper White and the first Kindle Fire do not have the text to speech feature at all.

Reviews.Title: This Kindle Fire is the best - even better than the HD models!
Reviews.Author: DebAnna
Reviews.Content: This is actually my third Kindle Fire - and I love them!  My first Kindle Fire was well-loved by me and my grandchildren, it was used every day and in many locations.  We took it to the pediatrician, the dentist, to school meetings, and especially when in the car and heavy traffic was anticipated.  The plus-factors are the ability to download movies and/or TV shows and watch them anywhere, anytime; the many games available (even for preschoolers) so the kids are not stuck with just a movie; the wonderful books, including children's picture books, available for download.  I told everyone who commented on the Kindle Fire that I felt they should be gifted to every parent/grandparent of a preschooler, and seriously considered as an alternative to video games for older children.  One day, my granddaughter was playing with the Kindle Fire and fell asleep.  It had happened many times before, she wasn't laying on it - it didn't fall - but it did shut itself off and it never came on again.  Fortunately, I had ignored my husband when he told me NOT to buy the extended warranty (Square Trade).  I called them, they completed a form over-the-phone, sent me to a webpage for the shipping label, and my new Kindle Fire was on the way!  They even told me I could wait for the new one to arrive, put the defective one in the same box, attach the label and ship it out.  What could be simpler?  My new Kindle Fire is wonderful, and knowing I have up to four replacements available on my extended warranty - that makes a great product even better!  One word of warning - my four-year-old granddaughter has been able to navigate through the screens and de-register my Kindle Fire twice.  Easy enough to fix.  She has also purchased a few games and the entire second season of Dora the Explorer...I have turned my 1-Click settings off!  The new Kindle Free Time app looks good, I am trying it out - it allows a profile for each child, I can select books, games, apps to allow in each profile individually - AND I can set time limits!  After my free trial, there is a monthly fee - but at least I won't have to worry about several more seasons of Dora and Diego!  If you are thinking about a tablet - think about the Kindle Fire - I have several family members who now own one after seeing or hearing about mine...and all of them are happy with the Kindle Fire!One last comment - I own the Kindle Fire 7" HD with Dolby Sound as well.  When it comes to videos, I am not impressed.  It seems to always want to buffer, and then it will ask me to adjust the video quality down to allow "optimal viewing."  Even when adjusted to the lowest setting, I get "buffering."  This does not happen with my Kindle Fire 1st generation or 2nd generation - both of the non-HD models handle videos excellently - and on the same network as the constantly "buffering" HD model.  Without significant improvements, I would not recommend the HD models.  Too much money for too little enjoyment.  Stick with the simpler Kindle Fire models - you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: Charging Port
Reviews.Author: P. Pranke "Patty"
Reviews.Content: I bought my kindle Fire and I really enjoyed it until I could no longer charge it. The charging port some how gets loose and you can and it would charge I even purchased a new cord thinking that was the issue, well it wasn't. I have called Amazon and I will be getting a NEW KINDLE and I really hope it doesn't happen again. This really is a design flaw and they really should (a) FIX IT NO MATTER HOW OLD YOUR KINDLE IS (b) Allow those of us that purchase one upgrade for free. I paid $199. for my kindle and I would like to use it. Well they sent me out my New Kindle and it was not a new one at all. I could tell that it was used. The end near the charging port was all scrath up and it was already a little wiggle and on it's way to becoming loose enough so that I couldn't charge it. So I contacted Amazon and the sent me a new one in 2 days. I can already tell this one is getting loose as well. I am one my 3rd KINDLE FIRE and I am getting very upset with Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Loving this Reader!
Reviews.Author: silverbullet
Reviews.Content: I haven't made a purchase in years that has brought me as much pleasure as this Kindle Fire has.  As an avid reader, I found selecting books from the library had become a chore, and didn't want to purchase actual books to accumulate in my home.  The Kindle Fire solved that issue, and is useful in so many other ways as well.  I've actually utilized it to pay bills online when I couldn't get online with my personal computer.  This was one of the best Christmas gifts I've ever given myself, and I would highly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: First Tablet Owner!
Reviews.Author: Brittany
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet on sale on Cyber Monday. So excited to have gotten it today. Tell you the truth, still excited that I get to play with it! Since this is my first tablet, I was a little skeptical on getting it. But after getting to play with it for a few hours, I will NEVER consider getting anything other than a Kindle from now on. After reading all kinds of reviews, good & bad. I am so glad that I got this. But I do a have a problem, it doesn't come with a wall port. But thankfully, I do have a cell phone charger that I can plug the USB cord into the charger port & completely charged it in a few hours after I had drained the battery.But I do have to point something out, I hate the way the speakers are placed. I wish one speaker would have been placed on each side of the Kindle. They still work just fine & all.Other than what I have typed so far, I have no noticed anything else that I didn't like. I will update when I have noticed something new!

Reviews.Title: My new Kindle Fire Wi-Fi, 8GB
Reviews.Author: paul
Reviews.Content: I received the Kindle Fire I bought for my Granddaughter and liked it so much I ordered me one. the graphics are great and it's easy to get started using. I would recommend the Kindle Fire to anyone that likes music, books, and ease of using!!

Reviews.Title: Very surprised!
Reviews.Author: Sully4252
Reviews.Content: I received the Kindle Fire as a birthday gift from my wife, I had always been old school and felt the need to have the book in my hands!  After setting it up which was very simple to do, I loaded my first book onto it!  To my surprise I couldn't get over how much easier it was to read. I read much more at a sitting and find myself finishing books much faster!  The wife was correct in thinking that I would enjoy it and now there's not going to be books taking up space in our house anymore!

Reviews.Title: Lets me read and and surf anywhere.
Reviews.Author: Diann C Terry
Reviews.Content: I love the chose of books that I can get to read.  It also lets me check e-mail and other online things when I am in a WI-Fi enviroment.I am limited by the fact that I don't have Wi-Fi at my home, but have been able to use other resources to gets books.

Reviews.Title: excellant choice
Reviews.Author: Nooch
Reviews.Content: I purchased the kindle fire after having so many issues with a kindle touch! I love everything about it! kindle fire is a must have.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: The Parson
Reviews.Content: I purchased a Kindle Fire for my daughter more than a year ago.  It has proven to be a great product; she loves it!  We have had no problems whatsoever with it.  She even spilled a cup of coffee on it (and it sat for a period of time in that coffee), yet, once dried out, it worked perfectly.  That was several months ago.  I am planning to purchase another for someone else.  A great product!

Reviews.Title: Gift for Spouse
Reviews.Author: goldenbike
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Kindle "Fire" as a gift for my wife. I recommend it for everyone. The apps are great, the selection of books is super great. She has a hard time putting it down. One DOWN side though, "I now cook for myself!!" :(

Reviews.Title: kindle fire is great
Reviews.Author: J. brimmer "mamie"
Reviews.Content: my kindle fire is great.when i want to read, i can enlarge the font so easily, i enjoy reading again.when my grand daughter wants a movie, i use the netflix app and she is enchanted with the little tv~i only have one regret, i do wish now i had opted for the kindle with its own hot-spot.christmas is around the corner...

Reviews.Title: Kindle fire review
Reviews.Author: NDec
Reviews.Content: I have had the 1st gen kindle fire for about a year now. The video and speakers are pretty good, and with a prime membership you get a lot of movies free. Book reading is fine I have a regular kindle also and it is a better choice for strictly reading. My biggest problem with the kindle is that Amazon does not give you a way to organize your books. So if you have hundreds of books like many people do, you have to go through them all to find the book you need. A simple folder system would be better than what there is now. I do like the having the color for illustrations in cook books and such, but I would like to put all 30 cook books in one folder to look through.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful product!!
Reviews.Author: Pam Roberts
Reviews.Content: great product, easy to use, great for readers!! Like how it has unlimited storage on the cloud feature so that lots of books can be stored

Reviews.Title: once in awhile
Reviews.Author: spike
Reviews.Content: Once in a while you get a product that does everything it's supposed to do and more, this Kindle is one of those. I'm a "mature", (ok old) low tech user and even I had it set up and running in no time. I took it on vacation and was able to read books and check my e-mail with one devise. It does lots of other tricks to, but as a low tech geezer I don't use them as much.

Reviews.Title: Nooke-Oh come now surely you jest
Reviews.Author: Gorilla Boy
Reviews.Content: Listen folks--those of you who always do the right thing for the right reason and expect your retailer to respond with the same degree of loyalty and integrity--welcome to Amazon--if the purchase is made directly from Amazon.com--I CANNOT SPEAK FOR ANY VENDOR IN THE AMAZON MARKET PLACE--THERE MAY BE SOME THAT ARE VERY GOOD-I cannot imagine disappointment after a purhcase.  The Kindle Fire 7 inch second generation purchased in October 2012, as a special gift for my wife is astounding,  Both of us have had cataract surgury and the FONT SIZE WAS A CONCERN--do not worry--it can be modified at will as if the book were in your word processor.  Second, title availability--Amazon has every title one can imagine and a large number are free--our county library also has titles available at no charge--( I do not know why but our library limits the use to 30 days).  TECHNICAL SUPPORT--WITH AMAZON I FEEL LIKE I HAVE MICROSOFT ON THE PHONE-If there is something I do not understand; someone is available to answer the question with no significant waitihg(less that a minute).I have encountered two people that have a "Nooke," and one worked as a scientist for many years had to involve her daughter to figure it out and the other had to travel many miles to classes at a Barnes and Noble Store to procure instruction. While, my wife always turns to me with computer issues and on two occassions I contacted KINDLE support to ask about something; in the alternative SHE FIGURED OUT EVERYTHING MUCH FASTER THAN I WOLD HAVE EVER DREAMED CONSIDERING THE DEVICE WAS NEW--IT IS GREAT AND IT IS USER FRIENDLY.  I am so pleased that my wife reads from her KINDLE everyday.  Incidently, I purchased the Amazon recommended protective case for the KINDLE and the fast charging power adapter and the stylus (good idea for each)  The case is very substantial and the unit is well protected, the inexpensive power adapter makes charging so convenient and the stylus, also not expensive allows one to use the screen without leaving finger prints.  We use a soft dry eye glass cleaning cloth to wipe the screen--so easy. This is a matter of preference--our cable company, supplies technical support and service at no charge allowed us to switch to a wireless modme configuration for a one time charge of two dollars per month and the only extra charge each month is $2.00--the came to our home and hooked it up and now we are WI-FI, of course if we every wanted to become wireless with any other devices such as additional computers or printers we are unlimited--this is a matter of your own preference.Kindle Fire 7", LCD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB - Includes Special OffersIf one purchases an E Book brand other than the KINDLE--one is being grossly unfair to oneself. I paid $15.00 more to opt out of special offers--I am confident that Amazon would be disctrete and this is just a personal preference-- I will gladly receive special offers on our computer by e-mail--we made a decision not to use the kindle for receiving e-mail because in our case; the product is used mostly in the house--although we could have set it up for e-mail at no charge

Reviews.Title: Amazing! Former Apple User Pleased
Reviews.Author: Derek
Reviews.Content: I don't normally take the time to provide input of products, but I wanted to make sure I did for this item.  The Kindle Fire might is not the latest and greatest tablet or Kindle, but am I very pleased with with he quality and features.  I have a decent Apple library on my hard drive, so leaving that media genre was a gamble for me since I had already invested into it.  My biggest desires for this product was Kindle books(which are are ebooks that are cheaper than iTunes, plus Prime loaner books), Netflix, Amazon instant, and light web browsing.  I find my reading productivity has increased due to the ease of having multiple books at my disposal without hauling around a library and the cost of books are much cheaper than the usual in-store retail cost.  My wife is getting the Kindle HD.  Smart purchase, I definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: kindle fire rules
Reviews.Author: sioux
Reviews.Content: This is my first experience with a kindle but I'm very impressed with it.  The battery holds up really well.  I'm so glad i decided to purchase it.

Reviews.Title: I wish I realized it didn't have a plug included.....
Reviews.Author: josie
Reviews.Content: It's a great little machine.  Fun as heck.  I'm sure there is so much more we could do with it but still don't know how.  The ads are not too annoying, it's better than paying for them to go away. lol  I just wish I knew it didn't come with a power plug.  Had to buy one but it wasn't too much. Also got a great case on clearance at Target (a place that doesn't sell Kindles, ha ha)

Reviews.Title: Very Nice Design
Reviews.Author: Donna L Georgi
Reviews.Content: I first ordered the Kindle Paperwhite.  Due to my impatience with continual setbacks on delivery I decided to cancel my order and ordered the Kindle Fire.  It arrived in  a couple of days.  I was a little upset in that the delivery person just set it outside my apartment door.  Knocked and left before I had time to get to door.  If I had not been home, anyone could have picked it up, as it was obvious what it was.I really liked the Fire.  It does everything it is said it would do.  Very sharp images.  Getting around and using various features seemed very intuitive.  My only problem was that I really only wanted it for reading.  And it works well for that but it is too heavy for me to read for long.  I was used to the Kindle Touch.  So I sent it back and ordered the Paperwhite again.  I will just be patient and continue using the Touch, which is a very good Kindle.I know many many friends who have the Fire and love it.  They use it for social networking, websearching, movies, as well as reading.  Thats what it is about.  If all you want is a good e-reader, this may be overkill for you.

Reviews.Title: I love my kindle fire!!!
Reviews.Author: Monroe Beute
Reviews.Content: I just love this thing!I got it on October 10. I think this thing is great.I got a pink case, but apparently it did not fit! It was too big! But I got a new one, and it fits fine. I downloaded some things on it. I like to see my name on it, saying "Monroe's kindle." My mom got this kindle for me. I just love it dearly!I come home from school, and I am on playing on it! My sister said I was the electronic person, since I already have a laptop and a phone. When my sister saw it, she cried loudly. I, in fact, am writing this review on my kindle. The only question I have, is that I can't seem to get the offers out on my lock screen. I hope it will go away. If not, oh well! Well, the point is here, is that I love this kindle and I hope I can have it for the rest of my life!By,Monroe Beute ~age 10

Reviews.Title: love it but...
Reviews.Author: RAMONA   ALLRED
Reviews.Content: dont listen any one but me,i have had my kindle for a long time now but i hate the battery life it is said last a 8 hours but with the stuff you do on it it seems to last 2 hours and always charge the battery, i left my kindle alone instead of charging at night because i had a full battery then i got home and only one bar! trust me get the kindle but dont use the usb cable that comes with buy a wall charger! it took 11 hours to charge! but i  love their support is the best. get THE KINDLE AND A USB CHARGER!

Reviews.Title: I like it.
Reviews.Author: Karin L. Meyer
Reviews.Content: I like my Kindle. That being said I have no smartphone, and no other tablets. I purchased the Kindle because a friend of mine has those things and said she used her Kindle the most. There are plenty of free apps, and the battery lasts a long time on one overnight charge. I just wish it came with the high power charger, because it does not charge well from the computer.

Reviews.Title: Love my Kindle Fire HD!!!
Reviews.Author: gswa
Reviews.Content: I have an iPad that I've had for a couple of years.  I kept leaving it at home or at our mountain house and didn't have a book to read.  So, I thought I would buy an inexpensive Kindle to leave at the mountain house so I would never have that issue.I LOVE my Kindle.  It is lighter, faster and has everything that I want in a tablet.  I don't keep music or my calendar on my tablet because I have an iPhone.  If you did want those two things on your tablet and you are an Apple user then an iPad might be a better choice.  Otherwise, save several hundred bucks and buy a Kindle!!!

Reviews.Title: Love the Fire
Reviews.Author: L. Portz
Reviews.Content: The first Kindle Fire was my third Kindle upgrade; I started with the gen one kindle and loved it. I moved to the keyboard kindle; loved it.  And then: I broke my second kindle. I had no hesitation about buying a Kindle Fire to replace it and as I was lusting in my heart for one, the breakage may have been subconsciously directed... That being said, there was definitely an adjustment period. Although I always liked the Fire, I didn't LOVE it for a while until I got used it. Book reading: wonderful. loved that from the start. But I missed the games I used to play. It took a while; I needed to realize it's all about the apps. In fact, six months later I'm still discovering how powerful this little thing is, how I can use it instead of my laptop. Way more than an eBook so don't limit yourself by thinking of it that way. I cannot live without my Fire now. I giving my husband HD Fire for Christmas. I expect he will never touch his laptop again after he uses the Fire. Do not take my Kindle Fire away from me. Ever.

Reviews.Title: I love my Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Lori in RI
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle Fire, I go on social networks , play games, and my kids can use it with ease! I have hundreds of free books that i choose.  I am loking forward to the Kindle HD for christmas but I dont know if I can pass my fire down!!

Reviews.Title: Blank Screen
Reviews.Author: quattro4
Reviews.Content: This is my second Kindle. The screen went blank on both of them. You can keep them. I liked them when they worked, but I don't have the patience, time or money to constantly deal with the hassles and the disappointment.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT PURCHASE. AMAZON WILL NOT STAND BY QUALITY
Reviews.Author: it is the best of all video and tv apps i have
Reviews.Content: While the Kindle is ok for the price while it works it has a major defect the you can find all about with a google search.  I originally purchased two for my family.  They worked ok for what we paid for them but after about eight months they both started having trouble charging.  I would have to have the USB Port and plug in the perfect position for the device to charge.  It wasn't too much of a problem so I let it ride.  A few months later after they were past the 1 year warranty one stopped charging at all.  I ran a search about the problem and did all of the trouble shooting suggestions. Based on the amount of information about this problem it was obvious most of the Kindles sold had the same problem.I called customer service. They were great, told me that this was a very common problem and there had been a soldering defect in the USB port connections.  They sent out a replacement even though the warranty was expired!  It arrived quickly and worked out of the box.  Soon the second Kindle would not charge.  I called and had the same results.  New Kindle in the mail.  Operator said that even though the warranty was up they would replace it because it was a know problem with the device.Based on this experience I purchased another Kindle Fire for my third child.  Before buying I read where Amazon had resolved the problem with the poor soldering in the USB port.  This combine with the good customer service described above convinced me that even though the device leaves much to be desired performance wise, it was still the best value on the market.Well the third Kindle lasted 13 months and started having the same charging problems.  I was not to concerned because I was expecting Amazon to stand by their product as they had in the past.  When I called I was told that there was no defect with the product and they would not replace it.  They would offer me a discount on a new/upgraded model.  I asked to speak to a supervisor, they told me they were all busy but if I left my number one would call in 10-15 minutes.  Two hours later, no call.Very disappointed with Amazon.  Calling the Better Business Borough with my complaint.  Hopefully there will be a class action suit which forces a recall.  Otherwise Amazon has lost all of my family's business.

Reviews.Title: The only thing I don't love is...
Reviews.Author: ABQRabbit
Reviews.Content: not having an external keyboard option.  IF I had that, I would use this instead of my ipad, and give this 5 stars. But for now, it's a great reader, media viewer, email device, and net surfer.  I added the Antek explorer and drop box client to download files to work on from my drop box account. And with the installed Office Pro, I can edit them easily enough.  However it would go faster if I had a full size keyboard that could hook up with this device.  Portrait mode, it's a wee bit too big for my hands for thumb typing and in landscape mode it only works well with two finger typing.  But other than that complaint, I dig this tablet.  Oh, and at the time I got this, it was on sale for $129 & FREE shipping, couldn't beat that unless it was $79.  But I found it a bargain at $129.

Reviews.Title: Almost perfect but..
Reviews.Author: W. Brandt
Reviews.Content: It's almost a great little machine but with one major flaw. The way you power it. Almost from day one I thought it was broken because of the weird way you charge it. You have to put it into standby mode in order for it to charge. You can't charge it while using it or charge it while it's powered off. To top it off the power plug is the same kind used for some cell phones. After a few months the flimsy adapter end became loose and won't charge my fire at all anymore. I tried to mix and match other adapters with little luck. It's currently been sitting unused on my shelf for a couple weeks because it won't charge.

Reviews.Title: Old Fire rekindled (hands on)
Reviews.Author: A. Dent "Aragorn"
Reviews.Content: ________________________________________________________________IMPORTANT:If you are going to order this model or the HD make sure that you order the charger at the same time because the new Kindles come without one. This is the only opportunity to get the charger at half price.________________________________________________________________We bought our first Fire for our (then) 8 yr. old baby girl and it was love at first sight. She's been using it daily to watch movies and TV shows, learn new arts and crafts skills from posted Youtube videos, challenge herself with puzzle games she orders herself from Amazon's Appstore, Google for... whatever, learn a lot form Wikipedia and email back and forth with her friends. We liked the initial Fire because it offered the best features and quality a low price could by at the time and because the 7" screen size made it ideal for a child to use. But there were issues with that Fire and my first Fire review was a 3-stars only. I didn't appreciate Fire's almost-close 'ecosystem', its lack of some essential features (see below) and I didn't appreciate the near complete absence of parental controls or the ability to turn-off or restrict one-click ordering.Well... this 'new and improved' Fire goes a long way toward mitigating many concerns to the extent that they could be met without making major hardware changes - you will have to buy the more expensive models for a more feature-rich pad. Prior to this model's announcement we were considering getting another Kindle Fire for our other baby girl so when the new model was announced we decided to order in a heartbeat and I will explain why.MISSING FEATURES THAT ARE STILL MISSINGFirst, let me begin with the not so good news. While Amazon clearly listened and did a lot to address some of the criticism that followed the first Fire launch, not everything could be fixed without a major redesign and this IS the 'old' Fire made better mostly by taking advantage of the availability of better, less expensive components. The current iteration of the initial model still lacks a number of features I wished it had. Still missing are, in the order of importance:- microphone- camera(s)- Bluetooth- microSD slot for storage expansion- HDMI-out- GPS- compass- gyroscopeThe lack of the above means that you still won't be able to make or receive voice or video calls, won't be able to play your music on Bluetooth-linked larger speakers or use your Fire with a physical keyboard. Voice search is also out and you won't be able to use any of the Siri-like personal assistants. Not having a GPS, gyroscope and compass means that your Fire won't be able to give you directions as you drive, won't know where you are if you are out of Wi-Fi range and won't know which direction you are heading or looking which would make it impossible, for example, to use apps that that show you the night sky at the exact time and location you happen to be.On the software side, a lot was done to improve the Fire's user interface but we are still limited to whatever we can get through Amazon's Appstore. Sideloading apps is possible but most users don't have the drive, the skills or the confidence to do it meaning that most users will still be if not locked then gently held inside Amazon's ecosystem.And there is at least one thing that got worse when compared with the prior model: a charger is no longer included. Unless you have a PC and you don't mind hooking up your Fire to it for half a day at a time, I suggest that you buy Amazon's own charger - get it for half the price if ordered at the same time with the Fire - or some compatible charger.NOW THE GOOD NEWSAnd there's a lot of it. Here are the improvements briefly followed by a discussion of what they mean.- lower price (remember you will need to pay a little extra for the charger)- faster processor- longer battery life- parental controls (coming up in October 2012)- X-ray for books and movies (gimmicky but nice)- Whispersync expanded to cover games (actually useful)These improvements justify me adding a fourth star to my Fire rating and persuaded me to order this model shortly after it was announced. Parental controls are missing at the time I'm writing my review - will update it once they become available and I set them - but, once in place, they should make the use of a Kindle Fire by a child a lot safer. The faster processor means that some games will play better and a couple extra hours of battery life never hurt.
