I don't know how often we are likely to use X-ray but Whispersync is a great feature to have because our larger than average household is accessing various media through numerous devices and it's nice to be able to begin reading a book on your e-reader Kindle and pick up where you left off on your Fire tablet.WHO SHOULD BUY THIS MODEL?We are buying Kindle Fires for our children because 7" appears to be the ideal screen size for them and we/they play a lot of Amazon content. Price is also a factor. There are more technically advanced tablets 'out there' that cost about the same, from the Fire HD to the excellent Nexus 7. We already have a Nexus 7 but our children voted 'Fires' when asked what they preferred for themselves, probably because the Fire interface is familiar to them by now and it's less intimidating or maybe they just turned into Amazon fans. For this particular model which was bought for our youngest kid, some of the missing features (camera, microphone) were actually something that we preferred not to have and found desirable for a user of her age. The low amount of storage is not an issue because most of the content she's going to access will come from the Web or from Amazon's own cloud.Now, for grownups, sure, the Nexus 7 is a technically superior device but when you buy a Fire from Amazon you buy more than just a tablet. It comes with Amazon's many services and the confidence that Amazon will support you even to the point where they make it very easy to return the product if you are not happy with it. A semi-geek like me will always prefer the more open and interesting products that can be improved, tinkered with, upgraded and customized but most of the rest of my family is asking for something that delivers their content, be it games, movies, music or 'web browsing' quickly and intuitively because they don't have the time or the motivation to learn every new gadget and are happy to see the exact same user interface on all the Fires in the house.If this is not for a child, you may want this Fire if you trust Amazon and you trust that Amazon will deliver the content that you want. However, you should pay a little more and buy one of the new Fire HD models if more onboard storage, making video calls, voice chat, voice search and the opportunities that Bluetooth and the HDMI-out port open (external speakers and keyboards, output on large screens) are important to you. For significantly better performance, flexibility, upgradeability and access to Google's apps and store plus GPS, NFC and so forth, think Nexus 7.-->> Brush your teeth, it's the law! <<

Reviews.Title: LOVE the Kindle Fire, but...
Reviews.Author: hornhunter
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love my Kindle Fire! It does everything I want plus a bunch more. The operation is easy and navigation is very simple and clear for any user. The one thing I wasn't happy with was the fact that the usb charging cable that comes with it DOES NOT charge the Kindle Fire! Even tech support thought I had a faulty Kindle. I took it back to Best Buy and they couldn't figure it out either. Best Buy tried connecting with their USB ports too. They were going to replace it but someone? happened upon us and told us it won't charge with the USB cord that comes with it unless your computer is less than 6 mos old! Something about the power output. My CPU is only 1-1/2 years old. Really? So I had to purchase the power charger that sells for $20. So now the price has gone from $159 to $179! I called Amazon tech support back and explained the they need to educate their tech support staff. Amazon was very apologetic and did make it right but I really hope they make this VERY clear when purchasing the Kindle Fire so the next person is aware of this!

Reviews.Title: Not what i was expecting.
Reviews.Author: pike
Reviews.Content: I have the original Kindle Fire and, frankly, I love it.So, since I first purchased the device, my girlfriend would use it from time to time.After so gentle suggestion on my part, i convinced her to purchase her own.Now, obviously we had heard about the new Kindle Fire products. She didn't want, nor need anything too fancy, so she opted for the "All new Kindle Fire" - the $159 model.More than anything she wanted to play The Sims FreePlay, a game she had grown a sort of addiction to on my device, and was excited to get home and download it.I helped her get started with her Kindle.Immediately I noticed the myriad differences between her new kindle and my original.For one, there is a lock on the screen. I do like that, so kudos to you.I also noticed advertisements on the open screen - something I found off-putting.This isn't a rented device, I see no excuse for advertisements on a device one owns.Next up was the "carousel". This, too, was markedly different - and I think LESS intuitive.The settings are in a "drag down" format, which is helpful in a way, but I found it gets in the way as well.The app that helped to finally get my girlfriend to by the device, The Sims FreePlay, app is NOT COMPATIBLE with the NEW Kindle Fire.I'm not sure why that is, or what changed, exactly.I would hope that amazon did not "downgrade" the basic Kindle Fire (secretly wanting people to purchase the other newer, more expensive KFs.) But that seems to be the case, in some ways.Another huge issue, and I'm left shaking my head over this, is that the device does NOT come with a charger.Considering that one of the main selling points is "Works out of the box, no set up or need for a computer", and then you dont include a charger, is ridiculous.My girlfriend doesn't have a computer (part of the reason she got the KF) so then had to spend twenty more dollars on a charger.I tried to keep an open mind about the device - afterall, I was the one telling her to get it - but found it difficult to do.We had problems downloading apps (other than the sims), trouble loading them, and trouble playing them.The New Kindle Fire felt like a completely different device.That was my overall impression of the device -"Less intuitive".And it seems that, if they COULD change it, they DID change it.Change for the sake of change isn't always a good thing.Though it may be faster and have more memory, I still would rather have the "original".My girlfriend even wanted to trade devices with me and I wouldn't do it.In all, I'd give the "New and Improved" Kindle Fire 2 out of 5 stars.Everything I liked about the Kindle Fire seems to have been stripped or modified.Apps that were formerly compatible, now are not.

Reviews.Title: Stoppard working after a year
Reviews.Author: Trishann
Reviews.Content: I got my kindle as a Mother's Day gift.  It worked well for almost a year then it stopped charging.  I replaced the charger but it did not work.  I then realized that I had to reposition the cord in a certain way so that it would charge, that worked for a short time now the product is just dead.  My kids and I are so disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Loved it, until....
Reviews.Author: Kerry A. Franklin
Reviews.Content: I loved my Kindle Fire for magazines, videos, books, until....it quit charging. I owned it for 18 months. Because I have another Kindle that I use primarily for reading books, I only used it for magazines or for videos when traveling. However, now it will no longer charge. I am told by Amazon that it is out of warranty and they sent me a new charger, which did not fix the problem. For $200, I do NOT expect any product to last just a little over the warranty period. I am very disappointed in Amazon in this case, and I am a huge Amazon fan! Absolutely would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Alyssa
Reviews.Content: I've had the kindle fire for about a year and a half now. i received it as a Christmas present from my parents. when i first got it, i could not put it down. i was constantly using it for games, web browsing, reading and school purposes. the touch screen is very responsive and the exterior design is quite nice. the back of the kindle fire has a grip-type material that is comfortable when holding it. the kindle fire was great for watching videos because of the 7 inch screen. the screen quality was great. there are tons of great apps that you can install that are really fun. the two speakers on the bottom of the kindle fire projected sounds very well. the kindle fire's "cloud" allows you to view the apps/music etc. that you have uninstalled.here are some of the things about the kindle fire that are not so great:~the screen is not glare resistant. if you wish to use this device outside, it does not work very well. the screen is very glarey and makes it difficult to see.~locating the settings. you have to pull down the bar at the top of the screen to view the settings. i find it easier to have a settings application rather than a downbar.~storage. you cannot add storage using micro SD chips/cards.~the charging port. this is a major issue with this device. the charging port has stopped working over the months. the only way i can get my kindle fire to charge is to prop it up with a pencil, and sometimes, even propping it up does not work. my father and i went to the store in which he purchased it to see if we could get the charging port replaced. the tech supporter said that it would cost more than the kindle fire itself to replace the port. i was very disappointed with that. the tech supporter also informed us that many people have come to him with complaints about the charging port.over the year and a half life span of my kindle fire, it's in good condition overall. the screen is still responsive, the screen has very little to no scratches and cracks,and its still quite fast with little to no lag. the only thing i would recommend when deciding to purchase this is device is to be very gentle and careful with the charger/charging port.(i was deciding to sell my kindle fire to get a device mainly for reading such as a nook or an original kindle, but since the charging port is in bad condition, i'm not able to sell it. Also, i'm worried to purchase another 'kindle' product because i have a feeling that all of the charging ports will stop working after a while.)i give the amazon kindle fire a 3/5 stars because i thought it was a alright device, good for short term use.

Reviews.Title: Battery and Customer Service
Reviews.Author: Annie Hayes
Reviews.Content: I bought a Kindle fire for Christmas 2012, and it has already quit working and wont power up or when plugged into charger the yellow light wont come on when plugged in so it's a internal problem probably the battery! I called Amazon and had to go through all the powering up charging cord plugged in and I had already did that but to placate the call center i did it with no results. And the Customer service agent stated then they couldnt repair or replace the kindle fire! This isnt a good product and doesnt last long at all,customer service isnt any help either and they say easy returns! HAH, Target has quit carrying the Kindle due to these problems! Im going to buy my wife a samsung Tablet note and quit doing buisness with amazon, too hard to get their address or return the product!

Reviews.Title: False advertising - should be a class suit against Amazon
Reviews.Author: consumer
Reviews.Content: So the Kindle Fire doesn't come with a charger.  Simply amazing. No, the device is not dead on arrival.  They give it a 40% charge at the factory, then your child plays with it for a day or so, then it's dead.  And unless you have a 2Amp USB wall charger (most people have only 1Amp), you're on your way to Walmart to buy a 30 dollar charger. So the Fire isn't 160, it's actually closer to the original price (the one that included the charger) and they've disguised this.  They dropped the price and then failed to reasonably advertise that it doesn't come with a charger.That's underhanded.  The 40% factory charge is intended to placate you and your child when you first turn on the device.  What's amazing to me is how many consumers accept this as normal.

Reviews.Title: Loved it until well known charging port/ battery issue!!!
Reviews.Author: Locolola
Reviews.Content: I purchased 2 Kindle Fires for Christmas a year and a half ago.  Within the last few months, both started having trouble charging or turning on.  I searched Google for Kindle Fire issues and found complaint after complaint listing the same issue as ours!  I called customer service after reading how many customers were receiving replacement units.  I was nothing but courteous, explained I had two units with the same issue.  The only solution I was offered, even after speaking to a "supervisor" was to purchase the new HD version at a slightly reduced cost.  No thank you!!!  I had to dispose of two defective, non-working Kindles and I am out over $300!!  I have been a loyal Amazon customer for years and will continue to be but I will never recommend the Kindle!  As a matter of fact, I'm writing this review on my iPad.  Shame on you, Amazon customer service!

Reviews.Title: Problems, problems, problems!
Reviews.Author: Kraken
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire seemed great for the first week I had it, then came the problems. Started with a keyboard issue where I would press one letter and it would generate the letter next to it. (e.x. L would be K, I wouldn't be able to access L at all.) Next came the keyboard wouldn't and still won't press some letters. My sound broke on it and the chargers keep messing up, I doubt I'm abusing them. It was originally linked to a account with everyone else's in my family, but I had to factory reset it, I think about 7-8 times. Videos will play sound but not play the video, when I enter sleep mode or go to another tab, it still play the sound, this happened up until late when the sound just broke. Another problem is when I try to select something, it selects elsewhere. And it keeps freezing. I can't return it but I assure you I WOULD if I could, I'd even pay amazon to take it. I am 14 of age, but I know a bad decision when I see it. Save yourself the money and trouble and get a Nexus.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy unless you consider less than 2 years a value
Reviews.Author: K. Soloki "Former Kindle customer"
Reviews.Content: My ports stopped charging on my kindle fire, I am out of warranty and all they will offer me is $20.00 off this model, which I can basically get a cheaper deal at staples for the same one. I have apple products that have lasted over 10 years, Now I think I know why ipads cost 300$ more because they dont break in less than 2 years, I have hundreds of dollars in content held hostage unless I buy another fire, which will probably die in less than 2 years, in the end I will have paid much more than the ipad, I cant believe that amazon would support this known defect and do nothing about it. Buy a nook or something else.

Reviews.Title: NOT A HAPPY CAMPER
Reviews.Author: CSBIS4ME
Reviews.Content: Well, my replacement is on the way! I am soooo P.O.'d at Amazon. I ordered my Kindle last year for my birthday compliments of my dear hubby. 6-months later, it stopped charging. I was very, and I mean VERY impressed with how quickly and easily Amazon got me a replacement Kindle. 6-months later, it stops charging... SAME FREAKING ISSUE!!!! I call them and tell them that the same thing is happening with the second one they sent me. They say sorry, you are outside of your warranty, but we can give you a discount to buy a new one!! Now, I am not easily angered, but I flew hot when I was told that!!!! I mean really, if my Kindle was defective, shouldn't the replacement also come with a year warranty?? I mean the AMAZON rep even admitted to me they were aware of the charging issues!!! If I had had the one kindle for a full year and then it crapped out, while I wouldn't be happy, I would have at least understood, "DEMS DA BREAKS." and I chose not to buy the extended warranty. They offered me the model that sells for $269 with a discount, so they made it so I had to SPEND $169 to get a $100 discount. The kindle I had (and would be plugging right along with happy as a lark to this day if it didn't break!!!) only cost $199. They wouldn't discount the one that was comparable to mine by $100, because I would have only had to pay $99 to get it. Found out today, that the updated Kindle Fire 7 HD is on sale for $159 (normally $199). If I didn't want it so freaking bad, I'd tell AMAZON to go jump!!! Although the upgrade would be nice, and for a mere $10 more I could have gotten it, but then I would have had to spend even more for the cover, and the one I have HOPEFULLY will fit the Kindle I just ordered. My mom let me borrow her SAMSUNG while I have been without my kindle. I would have not been able to read without it. And since I have become a Kindle owner, I have discovered, it isn't that I didn't like to read, it was the problems I had with my eyes that made it difficult to enjoy reading. The Kindle Fire has resolved that for me and has brought a new joy of reading to me. AMAZON YOU ARE ON MY BAD LIST RIGHT NOW!!! LOL! LIKE YOU REALLY CARE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Did not meet my basic expectations
Reviews.Author: Erick
Reviews.Content: I was hoping for a smarter tablet. This one just didn't make the cut. The screen display resolution is not good at all.

Reviews.Title: great tool
Reviews.Author: By A kid
Reviews.Content: this thing can do it all you can go on youtube,play games,take pics and read books. i am a 11 year old child and love this thing my favorite part is that i can go on my school web and compete in math competitions.

Reviews.Title: Be prepared
Reviews.Author: Marguerite
Reviews.Content: I think the kindle fire is great and very easy to use. One major downfall of it, is after about a year, your kindle charging port will become lose and it won't charge anymore. After a year your are not covered anymore and have to buy a whole new kindle. This has happened to my kindle, my mothers, and my aunts. While on the phone with the support team the guy even admitted it's a problem they have been having with the kindle fire. So upgrade if you can, or you'll just be spending the money a year from now for a whole new kindle.

Reviews.Title: Not what I Expected
Reviews.Author: Troopsgirl
Reviews.Content: I am sad to have to write this review, I purchased my Kindle Fire a little over a year ago and have loved it up until last week. The charging port came loose and it will not hold a charge. I will also add that it was very gently used and I was the only user.  Called Amazon and all they can is give a slight discount on a new one.  I don't think I want to buy a new Kindle product if they break after just one year of use. Thinking of buying an I-Pad.

Reviews.Title: Nice while it works
Reviews.Author: Cubicle Warrior
Reviews.Content: Update: 7/26/13 5:00pm  (Read below for the original post)Just got an email from customer support telling me they were sorry for my experience and again offered to sell me another Kindle.Dear support, you're not getting it.  If you search (Google or Bing) for "Kindle Fire not charging" you get endless hits form users that have experienced the same issue, which is the bad design and implementation of your micro USB port.  Period.  It isn't abuse, it isn't excessive use, it's a bad design.Let's make one thing clear.  You, Amazon, are in a war for market share when it comes to e-readers and tablets.  You have a LOT of competition that can do everything your tablet can...and more.  When you make a faulty product you don't tell the customer to buy another one, even at half price (which they didn't even get close to).  You stand behind your product like a car manufacturer for an additional period of time.  Ask me to send it in.  See that it wasn't rooted, dropped, damaged or abused, but don't say sorry buy another one from us.To anyone reading the review, I love Amazon.  It's my go to spot to shop.  It's our go to spot for Christmas shopping.  Until this experience I've never had anything bad to say about them...I think.  So I'm seriously bummed that they put out a product that they aren't willing to stand behind.  Give me a refurb unit.  Give a $100 off.  Give me online credit.  Look at the tablet and tell me it was abused...really, seriously.  But don't ask me to buy another tablet like the one I'm complaining about.You've lost me in the tablet/reader war.  in an age where there's a lot of flavors to choose from, don't be a crappy one buy choice.  That's just poor form and a bad recipe for success.7/26/13  @1:30pmI have three kindle the readers with the Kindle Fire being the newest, and in my opinion the worst as far as reliability.My experience with this device over the past 18 months has been frequent lock ups and now the charge port is bad.  Amazon was nice enough to trouble shoot with me and then proceed to tell me that I should have bought the extended warranty.  The only thing they were willing to do is offer to sell me a new kindle device for $20 off the regular price.Now I'm not saying I expect things to last forever, I'm not even expecting electronics to last more than 3 years (even though most of mine have).  But really, 18 months and the thing is a brick?!?  It hasn't been abused, dropped, or gotten wet.  It's been charged when needed and that's what broke it.  Charging the device broke it!Thanks for the offer for me to by another one of your devices Amazon, but I think I'll take my business elsewhere.  We have an iPad that's had rougher use...still going strong.  Three smart phones, Android and Apple, over 2 years old and abused...still working great.  I also happen to have a Samsung tablet that's 2 years old...no problems.You know it's an issue, there's more than enough posts about other users having the same problem and this is your answer, sell them another future brick.  Awesome.I appreciate the offer to buy another one of your products but I don't see how that would be a wise choice on my part.  I think I'll apply that same money towards a new Nexus 7.  Thanks anyway.

Reviews.Title: 1st generation was better
Reviews.Author: Pink Floyd
Reviews.Content: I got a kindle fire for Christmas and it was really good. About a year later, I had to get it replaced at best buy, and they gave me the 2nd generation. At first I thought it had the potential to be a much better tablet, considering the newer android version and other features. But the first thing I noticed is that THERE'S an ad on the wallpaper. What the heck amazon. I I read later that you made a kindle fire without ads that cost more than the one with ads, but really, why would you even make one with ads in the first place? I'd rather pay a few more bucks so I don't have to see some crappy ad for some kids toy on my screen.On my older kindle, it had a different picture each time you turned it on. I was cool with that, and I liked most of the wallpapers, but there was a app you could download (from an "unknown" source) to change your wallpaper to whatever you want. I tried that, but it didn't work... and no, I'm not paying you greedy businessmen 15 bucks to get rid of those ads.Another thing that was bad about this is that on the 1st generation you could install a launcher. For those of you who do not know what this means, a launcher changes the way your home screen looks. You could make your kindle look like an android tablet or an iPad. You would have to install the launcher app from another place besides the amazon Appstore. But now, amazon put more fixes and only one launcher works, AND its very limited to what you could do on the 1st generation.I have to say there are some improvements though. This kindle is much faster than my old one, and the newer android lets me install apps from unknown sources that couldn't run on the 1st generation (suck on that amazon) I am thinking about selling it, as I have a better tablet and I am saving some money. Amazon, when are you gonna realize that people want to customize their products, and not be surrounded by your greedy advertising?

Reviews.Title: Great Buy... Bad REPAIR SERVICE
Reviews.Author: K.M.B... PAFB
Reviews.Content: I purchased my Kindle Fire for my 8 yr old daughter last May 2012.  She loved her Kindle and was able to download games and many books.  Yet, we are unable to Skype or utilze gmail.  Also, recently she has been having problems with charging her Kindle.  I contacted the rep for help and was told they are unable to repair the issue.  Then I started to check current reviews and found out this is a regular problem for the Kindles Fire models.... After a time the USB port charger is unable to hold the cable and connect to complete the necessary battery charge to use the Kindle.  I really love all Amazon products and still have my 3rd Gen Kindle and use to this day!But after learning about the problems and cost of getting a new Kindle... I think the best for my money would be the Samsung Tab 2.... At least for a soon to be 9 yr old... It does everything the Kindle Fire does... and more!Sorry... Amazon.. but you have to offer something more than telling the customer we can just purchase another Kindle.  Not good enough.... Especially if I am not the only parent that wants to keep this product... but getting poor service.  Don't be like Barnes & Nobles...Plus the Samsung Tab 2 is the same price as the Kindle Fire HD (Limited Time) offer $169. I would rather have the Samsung since I can still have my Kindle APP and plus my daughter will have her games.  Best of both worlds!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Good but flawed
Reviews.Author: Knag
Reviews.Content: I have had my Kindle Fire for about a year and a half, and its media features have been satisfactory. However, I use it primarily to read -- my husband chose it for me because of its backlit screen so I could read at night -- and there are some problems with the reading experience that haven't been addressed in updates even though the device has been out for nearly two years. These issues have increasingly hindered my reading.My chief complaints are the lack of page numbers and the lack of organizational features for books. Although these may seem like petty concerns, they are real annoyances for readers. I read with book clubs and make lesson plans for my literature classes using my Kindle books, and to get a page number for something I need, I have to highlight in my Kindle Fire and then look for the highlight on my Kindle iPhone app. Also, since I read a lot, I have many books on my Kindle. With no way to organize them, finding one can be very difficult if I can't remember the title and author or if I just want to browse what I have in a particular genre. Again, these may seem like small issues, but these are features that other Kindles -- and even Kindle apps -- have. Not attending to such small but significant features even in updates doesn't speak well of Amazon's care for its customers' satisfaction.Overall, if you want the Fire primarily for media, I would say it is a good buy. If you actually want to use your Kindle for reading, though, I'd suggest you consider another product.

Reviews.Title: And I Thought I Loved The First Version
Reviews.Author: Linda K. Williams
Reviews.Content: I can honestly say I am happy the other Fire stopped charging because I wouldn't have gotten this one.  The speed is great and I love the changes I have noticed. I have the e-reader as well and find that I barely use it now.  It is great to have anyway.  The Fire has spoiled me.  The color is phenomenal and it seems  to charge quickly but doesn't seem to hold a charge as long as the first generation.  So, if you aren't using the Wi-Fi, turn it off.  Your battery will thank you.  That aside, this one is definitely worth it and the price can't be beaten.  If you are on the fence, jump on over.

Reviews.Title: Broke for no good reason just after warrenty expired.
Reviews.Author: Art Tedesco "Tablet buyer"
Reviews.Content: Stopped charging. I take very good care of my electronics and my Kindle Fire stopped working about 14 months after purchase. Customer service offered me a replacment at a 20% discount. Why would I purchase another Kindle product when my first product was so poor? Maybe a good tort lawer will get a hold of this and sue Kindle/Amazon. I am cancelling my Amazon Prime membership and my amazon credit card.

Reviews.Title: See  comments below:
Reviews.Author: Cathy Griffin-Mills
Reviews.Content: My first Kindle stayed charged for several days, this one has to be plugged in every day.  I can't figure out why it keeps getting run down.  I have less on this one than I did on my first one.  Help!

Reviews.Title: refurbished? really?
Reviews.Author: Sherie Barnes
Reviews.Content: Can't tell this is a refurbished unit at all. Looks brand new. Works as if brand new. Costs a lot less than brand new. No complaints here!

Reviews.Title: Beware - You cannot organize books into "Collections"!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased the Kindle Fire after my Kindle Keyboard bit the dust.  It is fine in every aspect except one big one - there is no way to organize all your books into different collections, i.e. genre's or whatever groupings you want to create in order to find what you're looking for quickly.  If you know the book's title, wonderful. You can hit the "search" icon and type in the title or scroll through your entire library to get to it.  However, if you are in the mood to read something from your "classics" collection but not sure exactly what you want, or can't recall an exact title, you have to scroll through your entire library rather than simply going to "classics", as you're able to do in the older versions of the Kindle.  Heck, even my little old Keyboard was able to do that.  If I had known this about the Kindle Fire, I would probably have made a different choice.  The only saving grace is that the Kindle for PC app DOES maintain the collections I previously created on my Keyboard, and I can refer to that - IF I'm home or have my laptop handy.  But really, with all the advanced technology available, should we have to do that??  Also be aware that it sucks up battery power more quickly than the older Kindles, which I suppose is to be expected, considering it's upgraded capabilities.So, bottom line, if it's essential that you have the capability to organize your library into categories, you're going to be a bit disappointed with the Kindle Fire - unless they come up with an upgrade to fix it.

Reviews.Title: Could be a lot of fun... if you like reading next to your computer......
Reviews.Author: Hilda Rose
Reviews.Content: Because the battery truly is nothing to shout about. If you, like me, like to curl up in a big chair or in your bed and read a good book on a rainy day, forget about that! You will be reading next to your computer because this thing must be plugged in to your USB port to get juice. Yes, you can charge it all day and yet it's only good for a couple of hours before it's turning off with no juice left.I thought one would be able to read a book with a charge, but even a short book, that's not going to happen unless you are a speed reader. And games? Forget about that too, because games just chew the battery up and you will be playing games next to your computer.What a shame this kindle doesn't come with a wall plug that charges the unit. Sure you can buy one, but it might or it might not work on your kindle. And if you buy it from Amazon, it's pricey to buy the plug that the usb cord plugs into. Why on earth doesn't it come with this plug? What a pity.I will probably not buy another kindle until the price either comes WAY down or the battery gets a LOT better. Or if it came with extra battery and a battery charger that isn't dependent on being inside the kindle to charge.... kind of like my digital camera, I can take the battery out and charge it and put a fresh one in while the other one is charging.Moving on. The kindle is much heavier than I thought it would be. It's hard to hold it up with your hands for any length of time.Also the kindle is hard to hold because the "frame" around the screen is so narrow. I am constantly having to lay it down to "flip" back to the page I was reading because my thumb got too close to the screen and flipped the book back 4 or 5 pages or forward 4 or 5 pages. This is irritating.On the good side, the kindle is easy to use and it's very easy to buy books for it. It's also pretty easy to down load books.One thing I haven't figured out is how to get books that I've already read off the screen on the kindle. They need to just stay in the cloud and not show on my kindle proper. Of course, there's no manual to help with this and that is a shame. I would think eventually I will run out of storage space on my kindle and then what do I do? Buy another one and fill it up? I'm sure there's a way to delete things, but darned if I can figure it out.All in all I love my kindle. BUT I would suggest if you don't need one yet, I'd wait another generation before I bought. I kind of wish I had.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: tete
Reviews.Content: Dear Amazon,My kindle fire stopped charging in Dec.  I initially thought that I needed a new charger so I proceeded to buy at least 2 or 3 different new ones thinking that would fix it.  My kindle still wouldn't charge but my phones and other electronics would with the same chargers.  I finally realize after researching to see if anyone else has this problem that it is due to a defect with a loose port.  I called in to your customer service tonight and am told that I can buy a new one.  What! So that I can experience the same issue. I already have one device that I hardly got to use and you want me to invest in another one.  Why not fix the one that I have as I am sure that you are aware of the problem.  Due to the fact that I bought this device that same day that you made it available to everyone.  My co-workers saw mine and also purchased theirs after admiring mine.  I had only glowing reports about it.  I still believe that it is an amazing product. I'm just disappointed that you don't stand behind it when there is an issue that you are aware of.  I am just one customer who is not at the top of your list. Thanks anyway.

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your money!
Reviews.Author: EmmeCCRN
Reviews.Content: I have had an iPad for three years and absolutely love it.  It has a crazy long battery life, terrific picture, intuitive design, and has been completely stable since the day I purchased it.  Fast forward to last month.  My household "needed" a second tablet for simple Internet/Netflix use.  I decided to "save some money" by buying a Kindle instead of another iPad.  The thing arrives and works fine for the first week or so.  The battery life sucks but I was willing to deal with that.  I mean, plug it in and watch a movie close to an outlet, right?  And then the thing starts randomly "not waking up" when I opened the cover for it.  Not every time, but just once in a while.  Fine.  A little quirky, but I can restart it and go about my day.  Fast forward to this week.  Not only does the thing randomly "not wake up", but it won't turn on at all.  I did a quick search and found that these problems are alarmingly common with this device.  I did a hard reboot by holding down the power button for 30 seconds and then pressing the button again.  The thing turns back on.  I start watching a show on Netflix and then it powers off after just a few minutes.  The battery was at 89% when this happened.  I hard reboot it again, get back into Netflix, start watching the show and the device suddenly powers off again within a few seconds.  And then I went straight to Amazon (on my laptop--no point in trying to reboot this thing again) to return the device since I bought it last month.  I'm off to Apple's website to buy another iPad now.  Good riddance, Kindle!

Reviews.Title: Ignored by Amazon - UPDATED
Reviews.Author: Bamazon!
Reviews.Content: I bought this Kindle to try out before investing in the 8.9" version. It was great, until it died. I contacted Amazon, and was sent a replacement Kindle. That level of customer service is why I never considered any other brand of tablet. The replacement was great, until I realized it wouldn't hold a charge for a fraction of the time the first one did.I contacted Amazon, and was on the telephone with Ellen P. for almost an hour and a half. At first, I assumed it was just a defective battery. It turns out the automatic updates weren't happening, and my e-mails weren't syncing a lot of the time. I was confident that Amazon is going to make sure my problem was taken care of.I was wrong.Ellen thanked me several times for being so patient, and assured me that she would follow up with me by May 6th. She sent an e-mail to document that. May 6th comes and goes. On May 7th, I almost called again, but I thought I would give it one more day. Nothing. I called Amazon again and spoke with Shanique. Worst customer service person I've ever spoken to at Amazon. All she wanted to do was get me off the phone. I asked to speak to a supervisor and she told me there were none available. I continued to request a supervisor, she obviously just wanted me off the phone. Finally, I pushed a little more, and was eventually transferred to a person named Marvin, who said he was a manager.I explained to Marvin what had transpired, and he told me that I was supposed to be contacted by May 10th, not May 6th. I told him that not only had I taken notes, but that Ellen had sent me an e-mail with that same information. He told me that the problem had been sent to engineers, and that they were to get back with me by May 10th. Again, I told him what Ellen had told me, and that in her e-mail she indicated she was setting a reminder for herself to contact me on the 6th. I wanted her to do what she said she would do. I explained to him that regardless of what happened, if she told me she was going to call me, I wanted her to call me. He finally told me that she would call me back, guaranteed. I asked him how he knew that, and he told me he that he would make sure she did.Today is the 11th. No word from Ellen. No word from Marvin. No word from engineers. No response from anyone at Amazon.Perhaps my expectations were just too high.____________________________________________Here's an update: Very shortly after leaving this feedback, I received a call from Ellen! She explained that she had been off, etc., and was sorry she had not gotten back to me. I understand that life happens. Other than not contacting me when she said she would, I have no problems with her job performance.My problem is with this Kindle. Ellen said the event logs from our initial call didn't have all of the information the engineers needed. Today, she was apparently unable to get the event logs to transfer at all. Again, something is wrong with this Kindle. She wanted me to again attempt to do that manually by connecting to my computer.That defeats the purpose of having this device. I told her that I felt like I had been extremely patient and understanding, but I'm past that. I am not willing to spend another hour on the phone, and wait another 9 days. This Kindle is NOT working the way it should.My problem is absolutely not with Ellen. During the course of our conversation, there were a few language barrier issues. I would let her know I didn't understand, and she would try again. No problems there for me. I speak Southern, and that was probably difficult for her.I have a bigger problem with Amazon's problem resolution process.When you place an order with Amazon, the order is assigned an order number, which you can use as a reference for any number of reasons. I think that when you have a problem with Amazon, there should be an incident number assigned to the problem which should be accessible from your account page, and it should remain open until the problem is resolved. In my situation, the only recourse I had was to start from scratch with Amazon's call center. That didn't work for me.Ellen is attempting to get my problem solved, so nothing has changed. If she doesn't succeed, and doesn't contact me, I've got to start all over again. I don't expect that will happen, but...When technology works, it's great. When it doesn't work, it's a hassle. I can deal with that, if the problem gets solved. The bottom line at this point is that I HATE this Kindle and the time I'm spending on dealing with this. I still love Amazon. I'm confident I'm going to love my next Kindle. I just hope it's soon.____________________________________________May 18 - haven't heard a word from Amazon. Getting disgusted. Called back at 7:00 PM, spoke to Bill. He put me on hold, and after 7 minutes I was disconnected.____________________________________________May 18 - 10:38 PM - Called Amazon again. Spoke to Ginger. I gave her a very brief review of the problems with this Kindle. I told her I either wanted a new Kindle or a refund. She looked at my account and said since my Kindle is still under warranty, she would have a new one sent out. I should receive it no later than Tuesday, May 21. She gave me an order number that I can refer to until the tracking information is sent to me. How hard was that?This is the way the first phone call should have been handled. The experience was so NOT what I expected from Amazon. Ginger helped get that bad taste out of my mouth. I'm happy, and looking forward to getting another Kindle that I can enjoy. I've had a Kindle Paperwhite and the related accessories in my shopping cart that I've wanted to get as a gift for a friend, but wasn't going to place the order until this was dealt with. I'm going to place the order tonight.I'm back to loving Amazon, and look forward to loving my replacement Kindle in a few days. That being said, I've changed my rating to 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: I really like it
Reviews.Author: Darin Page
Reviews.Content: i use this thing all the time... it's with me nearly everywhere I go.  The only thing I've ever had a problem with is that it won't charge that easily.  Now it won't charge at all and I'm gonna have to send it back to em to fix it..  I would suggest this for ANYONE...  It's not an IPAD but for reading books... light web surfing, checking e-mail and watching movies... it's great.  I'm having troubles with it charging so I have to return it but i've been using it nearly non stop for 9 months... LOVE IT

Reviews.Title: Great product and great customer service!
Reviews.Author: grace
Reviews.Content: This is my second Kindle purchase.  Both have been for my children ages 7 and 8.  I had some problems with my first Kindle and within 5 mins of my call to customer support, a new Kindle was shipped out express delivery to me.  That's what I call good customer service.

Reviews.Title: 2nd Kindle Fire Charge Problems
Reviews.Author: Nathan "Captain" Nunley
Reviews.Content: Right now i'm just not sure about the Kindle fire. I'm on my second one under warranty. The battery or charging systems have a problem. My first warranty exchange came quickly. Thank you Amazon! My second seems to be a hassle. Amazon admits there is a problem with the charging system, but would like to try something as a test. They will put money in my account (haven't seen that yet) so i can purchase a quick charger. This kindle is broke and doing what my first one did. It will turn on for 6 seconds and then shut down. Not enough battery power. Tried other charges that I know work and nothing. Went through all their trouble shooting and Nothing. Now they want to experiment with my device. If it doesn't work properly and with the proper charging cable then why do i want it???

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire 7 makes the reading experience a memorable one!
Reviews.Author: Jackson "Kindlejam"
Reviews.Content: I have not been able to explore all options from my Kindle, but so far, is a nice tablet to have and a nice present for any one. Kindle Fire 7 makes the reading experience a "memorable one for the clear screen setup and the option of a " sound reader". The presentation of the carrousel, the wonderful screen, make it a competitive tablet.  Exploring free Apps is fantastic and having an open door for potential purchases in the future is also good (cause you have to register with Amazon). However, I think that a camera would have added a lot of "spice' to Kindle Fire 7 same as the possibility to expand the storage space. Considerations may be given to the weight of the tablet. Kindle has a superb support system.

Reviews.Title: Battery Problem
Reviews.Author: David L. Granteer
Reviews.Content: I already had an older Kindle, but gave myself this one as a Christmas present.  I use it all the time, but I don't like the fact that it has to spend almost as much time on the charger as the time it is being used.  I didn't buy their fancy fast charger, but I don't think I should have to.  Otherwise it works as advertised.

Reviews.Title: battery
Reviews.Author: Lyle Norrbom
Reviews.Content: The battery Runs out to cwick It takes to long to charge. Otherwise it"s ok The regular Kindle is much better.

Reviews.Title: kindle fire
Reviews.Author: Liz Hutchins
Reviews.Content: I really like the fire.  The only thing that annoys me about it is the battery life.  I use it every evening and after a few hours I have to plug the charger in.

Reviews.Title: Love my Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Katherine Naughton
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd kindle in just under a year. Previous two had USB port issues.I use the Kindle Fire mostly for reading, and a few game apps.It does exactly what I need it to do.One thing I was not happy about is the USB charging cable. Charging via computer is excruciatingly slow. Why Amazon decided to forgo a proper wall charger is beyond me, and I think it was a poor idea that they are now charging you separately for it. Amazon include a proper wall charger please.All in all I am quite happy with the Kindle Fire, hopefully they will make the USB charging ports more durable.

Reviews.Title: ok
Reviews.Author: cepratt
Reviews.Content: I liked my old version better--I had a kindle on order before they came out.  I had to get a new kindle because I could no longer charge my old one due to a manufacturing error.  This new version has too many ads and is very focused on selling stuff.  To be truthful, I don't use my new kindle as much as my old one and if it could have been fixed I would still be using it.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire is great - but beware.
Reviews.Author: DW
Reviews.Content: My new Kindle Fire works great and is a great product.  However, it is not a "stand alone" product.  You have to buy books.  I believe the books are, for the most part, over priced.  For example, "Gone Girl: A Novel" sells on Kindle for $12.99.  That compares well with list price of $25.00.  BUT, Amazon sells hard cover (free two day shipping with Prime memberships, which I have) for $13.75.  That is less than $1.00 difference.  Honestly, come on.  It is an electronic version that flies through the air, no printing costs and no shipping costs.  I realize there is some effort in preparing books for Kindle but new books should be less than $10, max, most should be $7.00 or $8.00.  Older books should be really cheap.  I was going to reread Gregory McDonald's "Fletch" series, but they are $9.99 each.  Really, the first Fletch book is about 35 years old.  Sure, they are great books but they should be at bargin bin prices.  There are exceptions.  Laurence Shames Key West series is available at $2.99 a book.  These are great books (you should read them if you haven't, fans of Carl Hiaasen will love them) at a fair price.  More books should follow suit.  I do have Amazon Prime which allows you a once a month borrow from the "lending library."  Note, the books available to borrow are very limited.

Reviews.Title: WARNING! CHARGING ISSUES
Reviews.Author: J. Alfonso "chunkybunny"
Reviews.Content: I would have given this a 5 star rating, but it falls short due to the EXTREMELY FRUSTRATING charging problem!!!!!!!!! If you look on Google, or really any search engine and type "problem charging kindle fire," you'll see its REALLY common, TOOOOO common. So I realize now it's not my charger having issues, it's the darn charge port!!! if I hold the cord in at a certain angle, or make some kind of makeshift dock with old books and jenga bricks, it charges fine! But It still makes me want to drop-kick the s*** out of it into oblivion when it won't charge in class or the night before >:( I love that it has the feature that can let you drag your finger across the letters and knows what you're typing. (Lol I'm not too tech savvy, so idk what that's called) Also, I LOVE it because as a student, I don't have to lug around heavy textbooks on campus and am able to have it all in one device in a badass hello kitty case LOL. Other than this ridiculously annoying charging situation, I love my kindle. Others in my family have iPads and in my opinion, the kindle is way more legit.main point: all is great, but when it comes to charging it, you may just turn into the hulk.

Reviews.Title: Great and the best value Kindle!
Reviews.Author: Caryn Johnson
Reviews.Content: I purchased it on Black Friday and have to say for the money, this is a great little tablet.  I can't justify spending the price of the HD models, but as an expensive tablet, Kindle truly has the advantage.As a note, if you are purchasing a tablet and want an inexpensive one... wait for this one to go on sale.  You can't beat it for the price... and, it works... unlike most of the other tablets.A+++ - the best Kindle for the price.

Reviews.Title: Not great for reading
Reviews.Author: kristen grannell
Reviews.Content: Not great for reading. It's much heavier than I expected and difficult to hold with one hand without turning a page or bringing up the tool bars by accident. It's much better got browsing for books than the original kindle though.

Reviews.Title: very sloppy pkg and incomplete Kindle info
Reviews.Author: jahone
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to say there was no info about needing to purchase a separate charger for it, so now I have to wait till I buy one to use it.Also, despite my sign asking for all delivery services to leave a notice for pickup at their site, the pkg was thrown in my yard by UPS and got rained on, dissolving the black box around the product which luckily was enclosed in a plastic wrapper so may be ok - but since I can't charge it right away, I don't know if it was damaged.Negligence by all involved - Kindle, Amazon, UPS

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire Gen2
Reviews.Author: kilroy
Reviews.Content: Not a full-blown Android tablet but acceptable.  It won't run Flash even though the reviews that I read stated that *all* Kindle Fires did.  There seems to be no work-around so the Fire will not perform the job for which I  bought it but it will be a nice toy for the kids. When they get tired of it, I will jailbreak it and have some fun.  The speed is good and it does connect with wifi very easily. It would be good if you don't want to go to Flash enabled websites.

Reviews.Title: Great Item
Reviews.Author: Deann
Reviews.Content: I had put off buying the Kindle since I read so much and trade books, I gave in and bought it and to my surprise there are several free book as well as the prime to borrow books and the price of the books are much cheaper. Now I won't have books stacked everywhere. Very happy with my Kindle..

Reviews.Title: kindle fire
Reviews.Author: determination
Reviews.Content: Love this product...u will not b disappointed. I have a 9 year old son and a 13 old both who this is the best thing i could have bought for thier birthdays. From books to utube download videos and tons of games that are free I love it! Amazon has so much to offer and the books and games that get discounted are incredible.

Reviews.Title: Love it.
Reviews.Author: Tam
Reviews.Content: Love it.  Purchased it for my child.  It has the parent controls on it so he is not able to purchase a single item without my secret code.  Love to read my books off of it.  The lighting allows me to read in no light or in Bright daylight.  Fast searches and the picture on it is wonderful.  Just purchased my 2nd one.  Big family so I am sure I will not stop at 2.  You can not beat the price!!!

Reviews.Title: Kindle problems charging
Reviews.Author: Tonia
Reviews.Content: Just bought kindle fire today & already having problems with it charging,Very frustrating because its really nice for the price but this is a big problem!!!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire Rules!
Reviews.Author: Coppertop
Reviews.Content: We all love the Kindle Fire. It is simple enough that both my 4 and 2 year old can use it.  My 4 year old is always have it read books to him or playing a game on it whenever we let him. We actually had to buy a second one as we wanted to be able to use it as well! The ebook function is easy to read and use. I just ebooks weren't so overpriced!

Reviews.Title: great device
Reviews.Author: D. Stephens
Reviews.Content: I will update this review at a later time as its a gift for my gf. I did however test it out. Overall this is a great device.  The screen is almost as good as the HD. Nice and bright. Of course the speakers arent as good as the hd but still better than most tablets

Reviews.Title: On the fence
Reviews.Author: p.haliwell
Reviews.Content: I have had the kindle fire since july of this summer. I bought it mainly to read sind Im an avid reader, but I also liked that its a media player as well. As technology advanced alot of the the things about the fire that werent as bothersome to me originally are becoming more irritating and are seriously making me consider to getting the kindle fire hd or even.. gasp .. an ipad. Here is a list of what bothers me:Touch screen responsiveness is bad at times where ill keep pressing the tablet to get to another page to no avail.At times browsing websites are slow.For some reason my kindle wont allow me to access my schools website saying that it doenst have java software i believe. Im not sure im not an expert on these things. Downloading books are quick but magazines are horrible.I cants seem to find any keyboards for this  kindle generationThese problems dont bother me as much if i used the tablet solely for media, but since im a student and want to use my tablet as a aiding tool for school, the issues are making me not like the product as much.

Reviews.Title: Works really well especially for our kids, long battery life for planes.
Reviews.Author: T. Phi "Working Momma"
Reviews.Content: I'm going to keep this simple as there are plenty of other in-depth reviews -- and I don't do in-depth.  The original Kindle Fire has been unexpectedly awesome for us.  We've had it since Xmas 2011 and have been using it extensively.  We chose Kindle Fire because it was an Amazon product and the iPad was just out of our budget for an entertainment tablet.The most awesome thing about this, the kids (under age 8) are all able to use it on their own.  I purchase digital content from Amazon and sync it to the Kindle.  When used on long plane trips to play movies/shows has never ever run out of juice.  I estimate the battery life to be about 10 hours.  Prior to Kindle fire, we used our laptop to play DVD (might last through 1 movie, about 90 minutes) or our portable DVD player (might last through 1.5 movies, about 2.5 hours).Concerned about your child buying content through 1-click?  Don't.  Well, it did happen to me but Amazon support immediately refunded me for the charges incurred by our child and walked me through how to enable Parental Controls.

Reviews.Title: Just what I wanted
Reviews.Author: AJC
Reviews.Content: I liked my Kindle reader but I needed some access to the internet and couldn't afford a computer.  The Fire lets me do everything I want to do and the price was affordable for me.  Im not a technical person.  But I found this product easy to use.  I love the color and the 7 in screen serves me just fine.  I stuck with then Kindle  because I had used Amazon with my first Kindle.  I have been very inpressed with the customer service Amazon has and didn't want to change companies.

Reviews.Title: I don't have time to read - excuse
Reviews.Author: Mary Trecost
Reviews.Content: I didn't want a Kindle because I just never had time to read a book.  That is... until I got a Kindle!!  I now "devour" books, stay up late reading, and check-out numerous books from the library for my Kindle. Our local library allows Kindle owners to borrow up to 10 books at a time.  I also purchase many ebooks from Amazon; always in stock and for immediate use!Great for all readers, even reluctant ones.

Reviews.Title: Great device!
Reviews.Author: D. E. Taylor
Reviews.Content: When my Kindle Keyboard hit the computer chair base, cracking the screen, my husband gifted me with a Kindle Fire. We have an Ipad which does similar things but I prefer this Kindle Fire. The screen is strong and the picture is crisp and bright. It does everything my Kindle Keyboard did and quite a bit that my laptop can, so I find this is the device I use most. I can read and write email on it, order groceries online, browse websites, renew my library books, buy and read books, watch movies, and much more! Recently I found myself ill and bedridden for half a week and this device helped me keep my sanity. I do wish it had a longer battery life. And the power button on the bottom is located in an inconvenient place for me so that I occassionally turn the device off unintentionally when I use it. I have no other complaints and feel this is a great device and well worth the cost.

Reviews.Title: aomost perfect
Reviews.Author: lora peckens
Reviews.Content: I was really excited to get my Kindle Fire! I loved my old Kindle and was constantly using it. I love this one even more. graphics are really good! wireless downloading is a breeze. and love watching netflix on this device,while kids watch thier shows. The only downside so far is that the battery does not last as long as I wish it would. I have to recharge at least once a day. No fun when I am the middle of a movie or in a really good part of the book. As a matter of  fact I am recharging as I write this.

Reviews.Title: Happy Customer!!
Reviews.Author: Janice
Reviews.Content: We bought the Kindle Fire for our Granson's birthday. After learning about all the things that the Kindle can do and after reading the reviews, I had to have one for myself. Love it!! Watching movies while traveling, reading on the treadmill, my uses go on and on. The screen is so sharp, not sure why I would want HD.The Amazon Prime is sooooo worth it! The number of videos is unbelievable, plus I can watch on our smart TV too, a plus! I only use my IPad for work now, my Kindle is perfect for my purse. I'm writing this review as I am logged in and just ordered my 3rd Kindle Fire for my other granson for Christmas. Well done Amazon!!!

Reviews.Title: I'm slowly growing to love it.
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Hampton "Hampton Reviews"
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of things that I love and hate about the kindle fire. I purchased the kindle fire from best buy about a month ago and I've been playing with it for a while now. I'll start with the things I love about it.Firstly, I love how personal it is and I don't have to necessary download all of my books to my device. I can download them whenever I want and the books I can't read stay in the cloud. Another thing that I love about it is the internet browser. I can browse websites seamlessly and view my favorite youtube videos from my kindle fire. Another thing I love love love is that I can watch HBO GO and Netflix right from my kindle fire with no problems. This is my third tablet and I've never been able to enjoy it as much as I have. I was able to purchase some great games for my kindle fire, phase 10, the game of life, collapse, and this car racing game that I got for .99 from the kindle games store.A couple of things I hate about the kindle fire.Space!!!!!!! I sure wish to god that I could add more space to my kindle fire. It makes me feel soooooooo limited and the only way I can get more space is to pay extra for the cloud for both the files and the music. That really rubs me the wrong way. I also hate that you can't add flash to the kindle fire so some pages don't even load properly in the browser. Another thing I hate about it is the limited apps in their apps market. It totally sucks that many of the best apps in Google play you can't add here. Oh, and another thing. You can add apps from google play, you just have to turn on a special feature in your kindle fire, however; if something happens from the app you upload, you're on your own. Kindle won't support your warranty if you do that. The final thing I hate about my Kindle Fire is that when I bought it, it game with a usb cord and I realized once I got home that I had to purchase a charge base to plug up my kindle fire. Thank god I have a samsung phone! I just plugged that baby into my cell phone charging device and it charges quickly. If you plug it into your pc, it sucks! It won't charge until your fire falls asleep or your turn it off and it charges slow as crap from your pc.Other than that and for the price, I have to say that I'm happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: My Kindle is Perfect
Reviews.Author: MEG
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research on the two major e-readers and settled for the Kindle.  It is easy to use and suits my reading, internet browsing and email needs.  Very happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire 2nd Generation
Reviews.Author: Allan R. Erickson
Reviews.Content: Kindle Fire 7", LCD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB - Includes Special OffersI got this version of the Kindle Fire because I liked the size better than the newer 7 inch Fire HD. I am very satisfied with it as it does all that I want it to. Download and read my Books and E-mail. I occasionally use it to go on the web and when I do it works fine for what I am doing. I have not tried to watch a video or movie with the Fire as when I want to do that I use my ACER laptop. I enjoy using the touch screen which is responsive and quick. The only down side to my Fire compared to my old Kindle is the need to recharge it more often than the Kindle. Using the recharger that came with my old Kindle it recharges in a few hours even when I am using it. I would buy this again.

Reviews.Title: Terrific Technology!
Reviews.Author: DB
Reviews.Content: We are delighted with our new Kindle!  My son uses it for his schooling and keeping track of his responsibilities in special education.  It's very easy for him to use for class notes, flashcards, scheduling, etc.  There are so many apps that help him!  The Kindle is compact and light so it's easy for him to carry around and function during his day at school.  He would not be successful in his program without it.  It's perfect!!

Reviews.Title: e-Reader in Color
Reviews.Author: Tiny65
Reviews.Content: We have 3 of the Kindle Touch in our house and we love them. The ease of use, weight and portability make these a great item. I would like to make a suggestion. It would be cool to have an e-reader in color or one that could switch between BW and color with none of the extras like what are included in the Fire models. I would love to get magazines on my Kindle but I am not interested in surfing, email, FB, games, or watching videos on a 7" screen. I have a computer for that and a 32" monitor. But to read books I have my Kindle now if I can only get my magazines on there I would be set......just a thought!

Reviews.Title: Great Device
Reviews.Author: Bennie Holtsclaw "gentle ben"
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with Kindle Fire (New).  It has surpassed even my greatest expectations.  I especially like the ability to have the display in either portrait or landscape position.  Most all features are very easy to operate with just a small amount of experience.  My only critisizm I have of the device is that the battery does not last as long as I expected before recharge, but I understand that the light, graphics, and video capability do take more "juice" than all Kindle readers before Fire.

Reviews.Title: no adobe flash don't be fooled!!!!!
Reviews.Author: john
Reviews.Content: this is a great tablet but it is not like the first generation of kindle there is no adobe flash witch means it is hard to watch videos posted to websites and you have to watch videos in mobile mode and not desktop mode which I thought was very upsetting but the tablets speed is not lacking at all and fits very well in your had and is quite light so I think I'm being generous in giving it a three out of five but if you don't need flash then this thing would be perfect.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: gina royeca
Reviews.Content: I love the Kindle, from the 1st generation to the Kindle Fire.  I bought my Kindle Fire last December.  Its a great tool if one likes to read alot which I do.  I have had my Kindle Fire for about 10 months to date.  Just the last few weeks, my Kindle Fire has been acting strange.  I was beginning to have a difficult time charging.  First, I would have to angle the cord a certain way to charge.  I called Amazon and they sent me a replacement charger.  It worked a few times, and one night, it refused to charge.  I thought maybe it was the outlet, so I went to different outlets at home to charge and still it wont charge; I left it plugged in even though the light was not turning on and was not charging.  The next morning, I unplugged it and checked to see if by chance it got charged, and IT DID!!!  So, bottomline, it's been acting up.  There are days it will charge and there are days it wont charge; the battery is beginning to run out faster now than before.  So, I called Amazon again, and they indicated it was a port problem, were you connect the charger to the Kindle.  It is good my Kindle is still under warranty and they are sending me a replacement.

Reviews.Title: best buy at Best Buy!
Reviews.Author: dpar
Reviews.Content: I was going to invest in an I-phone, but the monthly cost was prohibitive....so I kept my backberry and I have my Kindle Fire!!!  I can save money and have all the features I wanted!! I feel that "I can have my cake and can eat it too".  I am saving so much money and am soooo happy with my Kindle.  I bought it at Best Buy for $159.99, you can't beat that, great customer service too!

Reviews.Title: Full of surprises - Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Bruno F. Smid
Reviews.Content: I thought Kindle was just a book reader, until my savvy granddaughter who owns and uses Kindle Fire started extolling its virtues and demonstrated them. I ordered one from Amazon to find out for myself. My first problem was wireless connection - not Kindle's problem - a more updated router fixed that. Next step - to see what it can do: a good basic manual would have helped. My familiarity  with my now retired I-phone (due to high cost of phone service) helped some, my hands-on familiarity with desktops, laptops and notebooks also helped. But, for the first few weeks, Kindle Fire was just a satisfactory experiment with an excellent book reader.I have since taken time to explore its potential - music downloads, apps of all sorts - utility, educational, fun types like many Hangman versions, email, contact lists, photos and more. I am delighted with its versatility - one just has to work with it to learn its functions, how to maneuver within its menu options etc. After downloading several music selections and connecting my high-fi Bose ear phones, I was amazed at the quality sound coming from this small unit! When traveling, I first used a standard size, comparatively heavy laptop - replaced it with a much smaller and lighter notebook, and am now considering to replace that with the even smaller and lighter Kindle Fire on my next trip. I  am not a smart phone whiz, am content with a basic cellphone and therefore prefer something resembling the functionality of a computer - and Kindle Fire seems to fit that bill. One thing I have found lacking that all my computers have - Kindle has a certain memory capacity and limitation - I have found no way to see its memory properties to avoid a showdown with overload.This is not a very technical review  - having had Kindle Fire 7 for several few weeks only, and perhaps not tapped its full pootential, I am very pleased with what it has delivered, aside from its functions as a book reader - and what discoveries may still lie ahead. I repeat, a good basic user manual of its functions and potentials might have made it much easier. Kindle's price point and light weight, combined with its versatility, wireless connection  makes it a super-bargain!

Reviews.Title: LOVE my new Kindle Fire.
Reviews.Author: Antoinette F. Sopocko "dogwoman"
Reviews.Content: Got my new Kindle Fire a few weeks ago and I LOVE it.  Let me start by saying it's taken me a little time to learn to use it because I'm old and the browser is different from what I'm used to, as well as Kindle being my first experience with a touch screen.  But the guide is VERY good, and I was able to start reading books right away.  Internet use is what took a little time, but once I realized all it could access, I started working at it a little more and got it pretty quickly.  No more carrying my laptop around on vacations!  It actually has a much better battery life too!

Reviews.Title: 2nd Kindle
Reviews.Author: SRH of Illinois
Reviews.Content: I started out with Kindle Touch 12/11, I bought a kindle Fire at $ 159, before the newest one came out, Love both of them. Reading is much more relaxing. It's easier to hold than a book.

Reviews.Title: newbie with a kindle
Reviews.Author: michelle
Reviews.Content: this is my first tablet. i did alot of research and review reading on many different tablets. i decided to go with an established product & i love it! easy to navigate, no glitches and im enjoying the wide range of apps, games, music and the rest of it's options. im actually enjoying how to learn to use it.

Reviews.Title: Love my kindle
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Ok this is my second kindle. I have the original kindle, so when I saw this 2nd generation on sale I  decided to get one before the Christmas rush. I so far love it. Yes it would be nice to have a flash player, but I don't need it. I  like the set up of the kindle fire.  The ads aren't very bother some. Just at the unlock screen. It doesn't bother me. And honestly some of the offers (ads)  are pretty good like a 5 dollar discount for a movie. But hey some people don't  like them. I like that I cruise the Internent. Watch movies, and of course read. That's ones upside of the fire you don't have to have a light for it and its back lite.  If the light get bother some I turn down the brightness. I say this is an awesome little tablet and its worth the buy!

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: TK "technical knockout"
Reviews.Content: I have had my Fire for about 6 months and I am pretty happy. I had an ipad that was pretty good but not friendly when trying to move files to the device. It was also too heavy to use as a reader. The Fire fixed both issues. It is also much cheaper and I don't have to worry about loosing or breaking an expensive item. It excels as an e-reader,  surfing the web, checking emails, photo album and watching movies. I have found apps on third party websites since Amazon has locked me out (I am not in the US). It works well on wifi but the memory 5GB is limiting. I hope it lasts until the price of more powerful devices falls to around $200.

Reviews.Title: KINDLE FIRE
Reviews.Author: Thomas O. Sheffield "msubulldog67"
Reviews.Content: Excellent product in quality and price.  Use my Kindle Fire more than my laptop.  Will be buying the updated $159 Kindle Fire this week.The rating system out of order.  Kindle Fire gets 5 stars in every category.

Reviews.Title: battery charge problem
Reviews.Author: mary
Reviews.Content: After reading books for 2-3 hours, I find I have to recharge the battery.  This is ridiculous.  Plus it does not have MP3. When I had the simple kindle, I had long battery life and MP3.  I paid more for the kindle fire and got a cheaper product.  What happened to quality here?

Reviews.Title: Ridiculous Hoops
Reviews.Author: LaSteph602
Reviews.Content: I hate my Kindle Fire, and if I hadn't blown the money on this I would get a completely different device, like a Nexus or a Galaxy or a Surface.Kindle's sole purpose is to set you up to buy things from Amazon and that's pretty much it.  It features an ads slider along the bottom of your front page as soon as you open it.  "Recommendations" of course.I have tried to upload some workout videos that I own, so I can use this at the gym.  I've spent hours trying to get it formatted to the correct files and they won't even play.  You can't keep them in the cloud, but have to use the Personal Videos app which is separate.For books outside of Amazon's unique format requirements, download other readers.  I can actually access library books through the web and can actually read them with the help of the apps.If you like to shop internationally, go through the web because Amazon only provides US stuff for Americans, Canadian for Canadians, etc.  God forbid you're Hispanic and want to buy something from Amazon.me or Brazil or elsewhere.I hate this thing.  I spend more time fiddling with it than using it.  It's limited and requires you to jump through so many hoops, I just want to throw it at the wall.  However, if you buy solely from Amazon and you only want to hit the "Purchase" button to view something, this might be the device for you.One great thing Amazon has going for them is their customer service.  Frankly, they need it.

Reviews.Title: Fun while they last...which isn't very long!
Reviews.Author: Jodi Areviewer
Reviews.Content: I bought 3 kindle fires, and only 1 is working after a year. The one that is working gives us constant problems.  Buyer beware!

Reviews.Title: Good While it lasted = Please Check IInternet for Rash of Charger Issues
Reviews.Author: Scott Andrew Smith
Reviews.Content: Very happy in general. After 18 months - stopped taking charge.  Only option was to buy a new one [or refurbished].  This appears to be a manufacturing known issue and Amazon is not doing anything after warranty expires.

Reviews.Title: After 14 months, won't charge
Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: I have two Kindle Fires and I love mine. I have used it several hours a day for the last 14 months.But now the charging socket doesn't work. I've tried several replacement chargers. It's just dead.For a while, wiggling the cord worked, but not any more. I simply can't afford to buy a new one every year, just after the warranty expires.I'm afraid I will not be replacing it until several years have gone by and I can read that the problem has been solved.UPDATE:I bought the current charger, which is a two piece unit with a plug and USB adapter. It reliably charges my Kindle (for a month now) but takes about six hours. No problem with the connector, except the USB connection to the computer is not reliable. I suspect there is still something wrong with the connector, but It doesn't interfere with the way I use the Kindle.This is a nuisance, but not a big problem.I use a full charge every day -- that's about five hundred charge cycles -- and the battery is still good.

Reviews.Title: Great for the kids - Kindle vs. Nook
Reviews.Author: Robert Collins "DonkeySmell"
Reviews.Content: I purchased two fires from Best Buy since they were running a deal on them.  One is for my 4 year old son, and the other for my 2 year old daughter.  Both have used iPads and always play with my iPhone, so I decided to get them a less expensive version of just that.Initially I purchased Nook Tablets for them but returned them.  The interface of the Nook is jumpy and not nearly as smooth as the fire.Free Time is a life saver.  I love being able to lock the kindle down and regulate time.Reviews that complain about the Ads and lack of accessories are BS.  You know what you are getting when you buy it.  There is no room to complain.  If you're not satisfied, its 100% returnable. I do like the fact that I can pay to remove the ads if I want to.  I do agree that the inclusion of a wall plug would give it 5 stars, but im not about to complain.

Reviews.Title: Third Kindle and Still Having Problems
Reviews.Author: L. Hicken
Reviews.Content: At first I was madly in love with the Kindle Fire. It was easy to use, had a great picture, and was small enough to take somewhere in my purse. But after a couple of weeks it stopped charging or turning on. We called Amazon and they sent out a replacement. It was great... for almost a month! Then the same problem. Wouldn't charge or turn on. We tried everything, including the hard restart. Finally Amazon sent another replacement. The third one seemed great and is still working after several months, but it crashes frequently and occasionally the touch screen stops working for no reason. I just can't believe that Amazon sells such a buggy product. The good news is that Amazon has THE BEST customer service. If you're considering the Kindle Fire, do your homework. Check out the forum posts here on Amazon regarding the issue that causes them to stop charging or turning on.

Reviews.Title: Refurbished and working perfectly
Reviews.Author: Charlotte Saul
Reviews.Content: I saw this and had to get it because it was such a good price. I have a refurbished Macbook Air as well and it has had its fair share of problems, but I have not run into any issues with my refurbished Kindle Fire. It has completely changed my reading experience.My only advice is to always shut it down when you are not using it, instead of simply clicking the power button and turning off the screen. There are times when I thought I turned it off but really only turned off the screen and it completely drains the battery.Would definitely recommend saving money and getting a refurbished kindle! I had no scratches, dents, issues.

Reviews.Title: does not hold a charge
Reviews.Author: beni
Reviews.Content: The refurbished kindle does not hold a charge and it takes almost 24 hours to charge it each time to charge

Reviews.Title: LOVE it!!!
Reviews.Author: Shamo
Reviews.Content: Love my kindle!!! It isnjust what I need for travel. Lightweight and can carry in my purse! Great item for the price.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire 7"
Reviews.Author: Darlene Riley
Reviews.Content: I love it. I just wish it had more space!! This was a replacement from the original Fire purchased in 2011--buy the warranties-and it has many more bells and whistles than the original!! I really do love it I just wish it had more space.

Reviews.Title: Product error, lines across the screen! And only after a month.
Reviews.Author: Nuhippie
Reviews.Content: I have the app for my iPhone, I love it! but I wanted to read on a larger screen. I was super excited about ordering this Kindle Fire, with all the hype I thought this was a great product that has the same great features as an iPad or a Samsung Tablet. I had it for a month before it started having lines shoot across the screen. I thought oh no big deal I'll do a system recovery, and then the whole thing had lines vertical and horizontal streaming through it with big black dots! That makes it impossible to read, or do anything with it.
