I looked up solutions, and there's really nothing I can do outside of rooting it to another OS, which for me is a little intimidating since the whole thing may short out, or go blank if I try. Amazon ought to product test their devices for a longer period of time before mass releasing them to the public. Work out the kinks guys. For me I will never purchase another one. I'll be far more satisfied with a product that last like Apple, even one thats refurbished and 4 generations old.

Reviews.Title: Has Ads
Reviews.Author: Meemee
Reviews.Content: This one advertises on your device. I thought it was so annoying that I paid to have it taken off which was unsuccessful so I returned it. I would recommend the one that does not include special offers.

Reviews.Title: GREAT IMPORVEMENT
Reviews.Author: Pierre J. Jacques "pjj"
Reviews.Content: Have had a kindle for a few years and thoroughly enjoyed it.  The Fire gets on the internet fast and the colour is excellent on visuals and videos.  Well done Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Great Product, Poor Battery Life
Reviews.Author: Justin Thorp
Reviews.Content: This Kindle Fire is absolutely amazing. The one thing that I cannot say is amazing about it however, is the battery's lifespan. The description states 7-9 hours but you are lucky to get 2-3 hours off of a full charge. Then there is the charging of the battery. If you don't buy the "Speed Charger" then you are looking at 10-12 hours of charge time. Even wth the "Speed Charger" it is a 4-6 hour charge time. All-in-all I'm very satisfied with the product, they just need to adjust their stated battery life.

Reviews.Title: new Kindle
Reviews.Author: Dori J
Reviews.Content: I am an Amazon customer for life.  They replaced my Kindle after three years.  The new Kindle is a better one then I had.  Thank you so much for your effort with this matter.

Reviews.Title: Amazing at an affordable price!
Reviews.Author: Cesar Sanchez
Reviews.Content: First tablet and e-reader after a lot of research and found this for just under $80, I bought it and I am very happy with my purchase, I am reading books again thanks to my Kindle Fire. I highly recommend this product as it is very affordable, has a beautiful screen, long battery life, arrived in perfect condition with cables and box even though it is refurbished, and is built very sturdy-has a good weight to it and feels like it can take drops. I am effeminately going to buy another Kindle, probably the Fire HD as this product does not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire is More than A Book Reader
Reviews.Author: Sally Cohen Swift
Reviews.Content: When I travel I depend on my Kindle Fire, and NOT just for books.  I am increasingly downloading my travel guides from Rick Steves, Frommer and MobileReference.  I create, in Word format, personal daily itineraries with information about the towns we are visiting, including maps and visiting hours, and then I send them to my Kindle for use on the trip.  I also create a personal diary on the road using the cheap word processing application that I downloaded and when I return I move it back to my computer and use it to help me remember what we did (and to sort the pictures).  I can't live without it so when I had a breakdown, I was grateful that Amazon helped me to replace it.

Reviews.Title: FREE TIME CAUTION
Reviews.Author: J. Baird
Reviews.Content: We purchased a Kindle Fire for our kids to play within Free Time because we liked the parental controls available.  We LOVE the Kindle Fire... it has been a great device and has lived up to our expectations, except in one pretty MAJOR way.Many of the apps we allowed within FreeTime link back to the Amazon store - which takes our children out of FreeTime and gives them access to any and all content (including adult content in apps and videos.)  We have contacted Amazon about this and they put it back on the app developers.  There is currently no way to ensure that these particular apps (which are appropriate for our kids and they love them) keep them within FreeTime.Some kids apps have an option to use the Silk Web browser OR the Amazon store as options for in-app purchases.  These will restrict access if the web browser is disabled.  However, that option is not available on all apps and many just link to the amazon store - which is unrestrictedWe have removed all of these apps from our children's kindles - because of course, we are ultimately responsible for what they have access to.  It is just a shame that the confidence we had when purchasing the kindle FOR FREETIME has been shaken.  We will not be using many apps until they can guarantee that our Parental Controls options are adhered to.

Reviews.Title: Amazing!! Some problems but other than that I LOVE IT!!
Reviews.Author: hard to control
Reviews.Content: I had a kindle fire 1st generation for over 2 years now. I use it everyday for everything. Once you have connected it to the internet and  you have set up a amazon account on it your perfectly fine. As you know not everything is perfect so I did have problems with my kindle. My original kindle worked perfectly fine for about 6-8 months then it started taking forever to charge sometimes it wouldn't charge unless the wire is a certain way so I called amazon and they shipped a new one to my house free of charge and I returned my original one.  About a year later the same problem happened..... I was mad because its the second time this happened so I called amazon and they said they could ship a new one in 2 days so I returned that one and got a new one. Its working perfectly fine but there are some things you need to know before hand if you are thinking about purchasing a kindle fire....  1) Use the charger they give you and if it breaks buy a new charger from amazon if you use any other charger you kindle's battery is most likely to die faster and take forever to charge and you will end up having to get a replacement kindle.  2) If you can, get a warranty! This is very important I didn't think much about it until my kindle started having problems thank god I had a warranty! In the case that you need a replacement kindle the warranty will give you a brand new kindle compared to the refurbished kindle your going to get if you don't have a warranty.  3) Buy a case and a screen protector. I had a screen protector for my original kindle and I paid over $60.00 for it. I know there are cheaper screen protectors in the market but if I was willing to pay $200.00 for a kindle (the price when it first came out) why would I pay $7.00 for a screen protector that I know will not protect my device as much as a $60.00 screen protector.  When i needed to get a replacement kindle i basically lost $60.00 because i couldn't reuse the screen protector. Its up to you weather you want to get a screen protector or case but i highly recommend a case. You can easily drop your kindle anywhere you are, just for protection I recommend a case vs a screen protector. <3

Reviews.Title: Very Poor Product
Reviews.Author: cheeka
Reviews.Content: I originally sarted with a Kindle fire.  My first one had to be replaced because it quit charging after 1 year.  The replacement (2nd kindle fire) didnt even last 10 months, that one also quit charging.  So a 3rd replacement was sent.  This time they sent a Kindle Fire, the 2nd generation.  the touch screen didnt work.  Sent that one back. a replacement Kindle Fire 2nd generation was sent (remember this is the 4th Kindle fire). Well now this one wont even turn on, I havent even had it 2 weeks yet.  I am now in the process of calling them to have that one replaced.  Very frustrated.  So my question is am i getting fixed kindle fires as replacements? or Are all these Kindle Fires not made properly/

Reviews.Title: Kindle is King
Reviews.Author: chigar2
Reviews.Content: I like the improved screen over the one that I had previously.  This one has a little different layout and it threw me at first, but after using it for a few days I found that I actually liked it better.  Also has other little differences that I liked more than my previous one.  You can't hardly go wrong if you get any of the Kindles.  They do what Amazon says they will do.

Reviews.Title: Misinformed by Kindle customer service rep
Reviews.Author: Georgia
Reviews.Content: My Kindle fire with an inoperable charging port could not be used, so I called customer service to address the issue which is a well-documented problem with the product. The rep offered to send me a newer model for $80 or so on exchange for the faulty one. I took the offer, which ended up costing me around $100 with shipping costs, plus I had to go out and buy a charger!I did not know and had not been informed,that I would be getting a  refurbished model rather than a new one.  I was appalled that the employee did not tell me this.  I paid basically market price for that model, plus Amazon got my old one to refurbish for another customer.My experience reflects unethical practices by Amazon/ Kindle.

Reviews.Title: charging issue's
Reviews.Author: Rue A Castaneda Sanchez
Reviews.Content: The kindle you sent has been having charging issue's and does not hold a charge for more then 30 min of play time.

Reviews.Title: Purchased the Kindle Fire (2nd generation) in Nov 2012 and it died Dec 2013.
Reviews.Author: mblaine
Reviews.Content: My daughter saved all her money to buy this Kindle Fire (second generation) back in Nov 2012.  This kindle was perfect until a few days before Christmas. It started acting weird and not charging. We thought she wasn't charging it correctly, so we made sure it was plugged in to the correct charger. Now the kindle will not even turn on.The Kindle is connected to the charger and the orange light is on the power button, but it will not charge or turn on.Amazon states that it's out of warranty & we can purchase a refurbished replacement.I would have done this, but we also have another Kindle (First edition Kindle Fire HD 7") and after a year, it stopped working as well.We love the Kindles & I even purchased one for my husband this year, but I don't expect it to last more than a year.They need to make them where you can purchase a replacement battery... But then, they wouldn't make $100 for each replacement Kindle they sell you... I think I'm done with Kindles & going to the IPad. I've had a Ipod first generation for several years without any problems.

Reviews.Title: died 4 days after my warranty ended,  do not recommend it!
Reviews.Author: richard swift
Reviews.Content: My daughter got a Kindle fire for Christmas last year, she activated it on 12/24/12.  The screen froze on 12/28/13 (4 days after the warranty expired), when I called costumer service to see how to fix it they had me try to re-boot it and that did not work.  They then told me I would have to send it back along with a $100 and they would send me a new one (since the warranty was expired).  I asked if there was anything else I could try or if there was somewhere I could take it to get it fixed and he said no, they don't fix them they just replace them.  I am bothered that I have to take his word for it and I have no where to take it to talk to someone in person.  It has been working fine until just now, and my daughter really enjoyed it for the year that it worked.  Seems like there is more things I should be able to try before just giving up and sending it back!  Very frustrating!

Reviews.Title: recieved it and it wont turn on....... and no one will help me get a new one!!!
Reviews.Author: mkapplesauce
Reviews.Content: Received this for x-mas and it will not turn on or charge and then I find out its not covered at all!!!!! I bought my whole family Kindles and now I will just order ipads because at least they will help when their product is received and doesn't work.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointing and cheaply made
Reviews.Author: Bob Anthonyr
Reviews.Content: I had 4 kindles for 4 different children.  All of them at some point would not longer charge due to the poor design and cheaply made charging port.  I was able to return 3 of them under warranty but again, all of them stopped taking a charge.  Amazon were complete jerks about standing behind the products they sell and would not do anything for the devices. I have switched all the kids to microsoft surfaces which has a higher quality and better designed charging port.  Would not recommend anyone to purchase this item as I am finished with Amazon and will take my business elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware - Will loose Charging capabilities
Reviews.Author: Terrey Watson
Reviews.Content: I have had this one year and now I can get it to charge due to the bad connectors, which I have learned from others that this is a very common occurrence So although it works when plugged into a charging station it doesn't charge.  Worthless!!!!  Bad Deal from Amazon  It just went out of warranty this month.

Reviews.Title: Unsatisfactory Customer Service
Reviews.Author: Antwan Cole
Reviews.Content: I purchased 2 kindles and within the year it starts to have charging problems on one kindle and the other kindle died on me. These kindle's have been in a case the whole time and are in great condition. I had gone through the customer service department to let them know the defect it is having. Initial conversasion with a rep name Ellis Pearl was great, he was very helpful and tried to walk me through troubleshooting the kindles. However, the 2nd rep I had a chat with was sarcastic and gave me a hard time.Me:problem with my kindle, charging still takes a long time.Amazon:Hello AntwanThis is SandeshI'll be happy to help youMe:okAmazon:Which Kindle are you facing problem with ?Me:I logged on a couple of days ago to report charging issue with my kindle therefore a representative sent a charger to my home to see if it was the charger that was defective. i'm still having the same problemAmazon:Okay! Let me take a look at your previous conversation.Please be on hold.Me:okAmazon:Thanks for being on hold AntwanI see that your Kindle was replaced right ?Me:no not that kindle, its the initial convo before thatthis is antwan's 2nd kindlethats having a charging issueAmazon:Alright, so even after using the charger that was sent to you the Kindle did not charge well right ?Me:correctAmazon:How much time is it taking to charge ?Me:about a full day some times a day and a halfthe same EXACT problem persist from before. I've done my research on tablets and bought these kindles because the have the best rating and reviews. I dont understand why they are malfunctioning within a year of purchase.Amazon:Well Antwan It usually takes 4-6 hours to charge the Kindle.Me:okey, a full day does not consist of 4-6 hours.Amazon:Well Antwan have you tried using other chargers ?Me:If you reviewed the initial conversation yes, I informed him that I have several chargers that I have tried using.My family has been using amazon for years. We have the best opinions for Amazon. This instance however I was very dissapointed. Will think on purchasing anything else with amazon.

Reviews.Title: completely let down
Reviews.Author: Veronicac
Reviews.Content: I am completely disappointed with the product. In the advertising it boasts a "durable product that can with stand accidental bumps etc..." and that "you can let your child play with no worries" (no age suggestions). The most recent TV ad also states "great for kids" again stating no age suggestions. Well when I let my child play, while I was in the room with him I might ad, and the product was in it's "protective covering", my son comes to me with a broken screen! When I call the customer service I am basically told there is nothing they can do to fix it. Why is that I wonder??? (I think we all know the answer) Sure enough I am offered a "discount" replacement for $159! which is not only more than I paid for my current device but also $20 more than I just paid for the more updated Fire HD! seriously I was insulted. What's worse is the disappointment in my son's face when mommy was unable to do anything to help. I know for a fact that Apple has a repair service that customers can get device screens repaired/replace for a fee. I wonder why Kindle can't. I guess this is why the Ipad might be more popular???

Reviews.Title: not happy..purchased a new one
Reviews.Author: pqu13
Reviews.Content: The first one I received had the tiniest of chips in the which turned into a crack across the entire screen in a few weeks. I returned that and received a second one which worked find for again a few weeks and then the sound stopped working. So I returned that , said I wanted no more and was charged a $25 "restocking fee" because the merchandise I received was defective....not happy.

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware
Reviews.Author: G. Hernandez "Gher"
Reviews.Content: This product is a complete waste of your money, It works for the first 2-3 months then the battery starts acting up., the chargers used to charge Kindle are not functional, I got mine replaced by Kindle and 3 months later the new one had the same exact issue.  I was told that there is no Kindle repair support , and they could only offer me a new Kindle at a "discounted" price, the options were unreasonable and ridiculously overpriced .....buyer beware!!!! I normally don't review but this product completely upset me

Reviews.Title: issues with it
Reviews.Author: jerry f hebert
Reviews.Content: stop charging after a few months, know other people have the same problem. there is an issue with these and amazon needs to find a fix or bite the bullet and make it rite and refund people

Reviews.Title: Same problems over and over
Reviews.Author: brooke
Reviews.Content: This is my 7th one. Keep having same issues with not charging so I bought the kindle fire hd and I love it no issues, wish they would replace the kindle fire with the hd and not have the regular kindle fires anymore.

Reviews.Title: Defective generetion won't last for long
Reviews.Author: Gezin
Reviews.Content: The charging port for this generation is defective and the tablet will be useless in no time. I had this tablet, and for about 8 months it worked fine but soon the charging started to get tricky and I had to wiggle the charger slightly to work... It wasn't a bother really until it stopped charging completely..you will only be lucky if it stops before your warranty runs out otherwise amazon knows it's defective and they hope you discover the defect when your warranty has run out. Buy at your own risk. Do a search online this issue is widespread.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY CHARGING PORT ISSUES
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "lakeplacegames suck"
Reviews.Content: I have had four kindle fires in less than two years, they are a defective product, and they WILL quit working it is just a matter of when.  Amazon really needs to fix the charging port in these devices or give 100% credit to buy another device.  I really loved the device but if I have to throw it away within a year I am wasting my money, buy something else and download the app.Google this problem, they even sell kits to fix them, and it is all over u-tube, disgraceful, this wreaks of a class action lawsuit.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: Lisa D. Ervin
Reviews.Content: I love it!  It is easy to use and it is like holding a real book! I am glad that I bought it!

Reviews.Title: Love the Kindle Idea, Not the Actual Product
Reviews.Author: R. Chadwick "zascar23"
Reviews.Content: I am on my third generation one kindle fire and I need to replace it as well as it again, will no longer charge do to a loose usb charging port.  Each time I contacted Amazon, they replaced my Kindle Fire with the same model Kindle Fire with the same issues.  I inquired about an upgrade to the kindle fire HD or another kindle device without this problem with the usb charging port no longer working. Dont get me wrong, I love Amazon (I am a Prime Customer) but I feel that after you have the same problem with four different kindles, you should finally get a model that does not have that problem, even if it is an upgrade that costs Amazon a little. I contacted customer support today to replace my kindle, again, and was told that my warranty was over and that they would offer me a discounted price on any new kindle i wanted. This was the only option that was said was possible. While the prices were good, I feel that I was wronged because I am a very loyal Amazon customer (I purchase items almost daily) and they were not going to replace or upgrade their product, which was inferior everytime they sent me one, because the warranty ran out. In the end, I commented that I was pretty upset with these options and the Amazon representative just stated that they would forward my comments to the business division. I love Kindle but to be treated this way pretty much assures me that I will not take the risk to buy another Kindle. I will probably buy a Samsung product now as I have a Galaxy S III phone and have no complaints about it.  It is over a year old now and has never had an issue.  I have heard nothing but awesome reviews about Samsung.  Maybe Amazon should contract with them to build Kindles.  This was a big negative in my book for Amazon who is normally pretty good about customer issues. I dont feel I was trying to take advantage of Amazon; I was just trying to be treated fairly. Every time I rent an movie, buy music, and soon, shop for Christmas on Amazon, I am going to have this experience in my head which may cause me to take some business elsewhere. It just left a bad taste in my mouth. I will think this way everytime I look at this Amazon Kindle "paperweight" on which I have spent hundreds of dollars on content. Not good Amazon.Update 2/1/14:I have recently purchased a Samsung Galaxy Note 8.0.  I find this to be a superior product especially compared to the first Geration Kindle.  It is probably the best purchase I have made in a while.  It has much of the features of my Galaxy SIII phone and when you set it up with your Google account, you can basically make it a larger copy of your phone, if you want.  It comes with an inside-the-unit stored stylus for drawing and taking notes.  Kindle does not have that feature.  The display is great, it has yet to crash, and I have all my kindle books on the kindle app.  I use it with chromecast, bluetooth headphones, and teather it to my SIII's data plan.  I know this generation Kindle can do none of this and a dont believe the new one can do much of that as well.  In short, do not regret not caving in on amazon's offer of a discounted price on a new or refurbished Kindle Fire HD.  I hope amazon learns a little about its business practices from all the people that agree with me that the way they handled their customers who they gave an inferior product was completely wrong.

Reviews.Title: 4th Kindle
Reviews.Author: Michael Lenk
Reviews.Content: Can get enough!  Just when I think it's as good as it gets I find something else this thing can do.As you can clearly tell I'm not a "techno" guy.  I bought this as I travel extensively and love my books and movies, but a camera?Wow!!

Reviews.Title: charger malfunction!!
Reviews.Author: Christine
Reviews.Content: I owned my first kindle fire 13 months when the charger began to fit loosely in the port -so it could not charge.  Amazon replaced it. Now exactly 6 months later, the EXACT problem.  Customer service (with very frustrating language barrier)  offered a solution.....I can buy another one!  Seriously??  Now that I've invested an obscene. amount of money buying books,  now what do I do???? .  Do NOT buy this product.

Reviews.Title: wont stay connected to wi-fi
Reviews.Author: gina johnson
Reviews.Content: My grandbaby gave me a kindle fire 7" for a Christmas present and I loved it after about 7 months it wouldn't charge so amazon replaced it with a used kindle which had lines on the screen so the replaced that one and it wouldn't stay connected to the Wi-Fi so the sent me another one and I am still having the same problem the have sent me 4 replacements and they all do the same thing wont stay connected I have gotten in touch with my internet provider sent amazon information they requested several times I keep sending them the same information over and over and I am still having the same problem no matter where I go or what internet provider I use I still have the same problem but my granddaughter has a kindle and she is not having this problem we live in the same house and I didn't have it with the first kindle I had only the used ones and amazon keeps telling me the same thing over and over and I am so upset with amazon right now and they thought a $15 promo was going to satisfy me I now hate amazon and will never recommend amazon to anyone I know my little money dosent matter to amazon and they have sure proved that to me I really loved my first kindle but I guess I am up the creek without a paddle. thanks amazon for not caring!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Sue
Reviews.Content: This was given to me as a birthday gift. A year and a half later the port will not charge from the USB cord. I charged this once a week and I am an adult that used it  every other day about half an hour. Very disappointed because now it will not charge at all. Have used three different cords so I know it is the port that is messed up. The one year limited warranty is terrible and the only thing Amazon will do is try and sell me a refurbished one. I really expected the product to last much longer than this and it is frustrating that through no fault of my own (meaning I didn't drop it, spill coffee on it, etc) it just wore out.

Reviews.Title: Lovely and quite handy
Reviews.Author: Amazoner
Reviews.Content: This was a gift to my wife as she enjoys reading books and it is very convenient to purchase ebooks these days.  I was initially debating over buying the simplistic version of Kindle or the one with HD.  However, I settled down in the middle since I preferred a device with Wi-Fi capabilities which these days has become very essential for any device and second of all being 7" display I thought HD wasn't necessary saving atleast 40-50 dollars.  Anyways, it is a personal preference I guess and just sharing my opinion.  From functionality standpoint, it does everything well as advertised like other prominent tablets in the industry.

Reviews.Title: I really do love it.
Reviews.Author: Dorothy Rowden
Reviews.Content: I am still learning how to do everything on it.  I bought the .99 manual and that has helped so much.  I am 66 and this modern technology is so awesome.  I love having a tablet computer that I can take anywhere and use anytime so easily.

Reviews.Title: great first tablet
Reviews.Author: Henry Domke
Reviews.Content: This is the first mobile device I've ever had, and I'm very happy with it. Great as an ereader, which is what I got it for mainly, and also lets me chat as long as I have wifi. :) Tons of games and apps, plus the movies and shows available just add to the value.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire 7"
Reviews.Author: Anna Bennett
Reviews.Content: My only suprise was how quickly the battery needs charging and how long it takes to be fully charged as my Generation 2 Kindle did not take as long.  Of course, it cannot even begin to do what my new Fire does.  :)

Reviews.Title: Review
Reviews.Author: Linda Daniels
Reviews.Content: Overall all, the unit is great.  The only problem I have with it is, what I feel is the relatively short battery life.  It just seems as though I have to recharge it every other night and I am using it only for reading purposes!  Other than that, I really like it.

Reviews.Title: Don't order the refurbished Kindle
Reviews.Author: cyndi parratt twigg
Reviews.Content: My kindle crashed after a little over two years.  I called amazon and they offered a refurbished kindle for 101$  i ordered it and in a week it came.  it came with no charger just the kindle and it was locked and did not work.  So i sent it back  and they sent another one again no charger and again it did not work!!!!  I  had at this point sent them my kindle , the "new" kindle and now this one did not work. all my books were unaccessable.  The solution was to send that one back and cancel .  It is too bad that they have so little faith in the product.  The  deal was no deal  you can buy a new kindle with a charger for a few dollars more.  As they could not send a working kindle I would assume that they are very aware that the kindle has a problem!.  The  customer service left much to be desired..

Reviews.Title: Happy Buyer
Reviews.Author: samantha swisher
Reviews.Content: My Mother bought  2 kindle fire's for my boys (ages 6 and 4) for a early birthday present. They both love it so much!!!!! Very easy to use and navigate for there ages. Lots of free games to download, we have not had a problem with them at all  since we got them. The only down fall is they come with a USB cord but you need to buy the box that that goes into the wall to charge it. Very pleased with this product and would recommed it for sure

Reviews.Title: doesnt keep a good charge
Reviews.Author: Teri K. Glaze
Reviews.Content: it doesnt stay charged very good after charging it overnight.  i barely use it and buy afternoon it is only half charged up.

Reviews.Title: Ok.....
Reviews.Author: camerageeksquad
Reviews.Content: It's ok.. there are way less apps then any other appstore :/ I do like the size. Much slower then other devices and also very annoying thing  is that the lock screen i s always a ad.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Gift
Reviews.Author: FELICITA RIVERA
Reviews.Content: She loved her birthday gift. She loves it and takes it everywhere with her. I love to buy from amazon.

Reviews.Title: Love it!!
Reviews.Author: A. S. Driscoll
Reviews.Content: Everything that I was looking for in a 'tablet' I love that I have my ebooks, social media and Netflix all on one device.  And not needing to spend the money to get an apple iPad or the numerous other tablet out there.  This is definitely the most bang for your buck.

Reviews.Title: Great... if you want to throw it away in a year.
Reviews.Author: Sebastian "speelbergo"
Reviews.Content: This device had issues from the get-go. No other chargers other than the one it came with would charge the device, even if it appeared to be the same specs of Micro USB type B. Over time that original charger became more and more loose and would get more and more finicky as to the position of the device and the cord if it were to continue charging. FInally after nearly a year and a half the original cord stopped working altogether. After contacting customer support and trying out a new cable that merely served to DRAIN my device, their only option was to throw away my Kindle and buy a new one. REALLY? I know that a warranty period is typical, but Amazon KNEW that they had a whole host of defective devices out there, and did nothing to try to alert me to the issue or try to resolve it for me before the warranty expired. They apparently hoped that i wouldn't care. Well now i have a $200 paperweight on my nightstand. No Thanks, Amazon, I will NEVER buy another piece of hardware from you again. And you can FORGET me purchasing apps and media from you as well.I AM DONE WITH THIS SHODDY DEVICE AND THE SHADY COMPANY THAT BUILT IT!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Ok product, very bad service
Reviews.Author: Stephanie
Reviews.Content: I got my Kindle Fire about a year and a half ago and it suddenly stopped charging. I noticed the USB terminal was loose so I contacted Amazon to see what could be done. The only thing they offered were a couple of troubleshooting steps then said 'ok that's it, time to buy a new one!' I was totally shocked, I have been a prime member for years and I have never experienced something like this. When I bought this, it was between an ipad and the kindle fire. I chose the kindle fire because I wanted it just for books (it quickly became about much more that books though!). I think I chose wrong.The apps you get are second rate. That a huge minus for me. BUT it has been the best alarm clock I have ever owned!! The browser is very finicky.I think I'll be going back to apple and saying good bye to all my books :(

Reviews.Title: I has a mind of its own.
Reviews.Author: Doris Stanicki
Reviews.Content: The Kindle for some reason will only do some things, it will not stay on any one thing for any length of time.  I start a game and its closes down. Very frustrating

Reviews.Title: Nice Price for a tablet but..
Reviews.Author: Gravyman1965 "fly off a mesa"
Reviews.Content: The first thing that drew me to the Fire was the features you get for the price. I bought one for my daughter and all was good. Good display. Good sound. Good availability of apps. The responsiveness of the touchscreen vs. our Ipad mini is a bit less but not bad overall. The only one problem started about one month after the warranty expired. The micro USB port began to have issues. It seemed to be loose as we had to insert the plug "just right" in order for it to charge. The problem got worse until it got to the point that you could not get it to charge. A little research showed that this is a very common problem with the Kindle Fire. All quotes for repair were around $100 to $125. Bad money after good if you ask me. I will look for replacement.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy a Nexus 7 from Google!!!!!
Reviews.Author: J. Prefontaine "Chico Mom"
Reviews.Content: Last Christmas I bought 2 Nexus 7's and a Kindle Fire for my 3 kids. In April the first Nexus' screen cracked and this morning the second one did. Could be a fluke, but I believe Kindle's are a much stronger product!! I realize this is a review for Kindle, but one more thing- I went to write a negative review for the Nexus 7's on the Google Play site and there is no such access to do so. Just a lot of fancy advertising. No democracy or voices from consumers. Merely ads and updates for more recent products like the newest Nexus 7. The 2 products (Kindle & Nexus) are VERY similar so it is really too bad; the Nexus 7 was light and easy to carry and handle. Apparently, for that very same reason, it was the cause of it's (their) demise!! Hope that helps y'all if you were on the fence. Both great products though! FYI - my boys owned the Nexus and my girl owned the Kindle, so if you are extra careful with your device then you may want to choose the cheaper product as other than it cracking it had everything we needed that the Kindle had as far as assessability to apps, books, games, wifi etc for ages 5-15 and myself (middle aged). Personally, I would only go for Kindles from now on because of the great way Amaxon deals with it's Kindle customers (never thought I'd praise Amazon) but seriously it's got a number you call and you get amazing service ASAP and their are many apps, you can connect to the library etc. Because it's a wee bit thicker and slightly heavier (the fire) only by an once I think, it fits much better in the cover it was made for, and you actually don't use your finger muscles as much as the Nexus because you use the case more (when put in the tent position) Strange fact. Bottom line: Buy a Kindle. (Or don't have pre-teen boys).

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Product
Reviews.Author: Wendy L. Lynn
Reviews.Content: I had the Black and white one before and this is soooo much better.  I love reading, reading and more reading and also love playing words with friends and other games.  I take it everywhere I go.  I would recommend it to EVERYONE and I do.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire 7" exceeded expectations!
Reviews.Author: FlyRobin
Reviews.Content: I was "wowed!" This was my first purchase from Amazon and I was leery, anxious, and  excited. I was pleasantly surprised that the refurbished Kindle Fire carried the same warranty as the "brand new" Kindle Fire. That says that "we stand behind our products". The Kindle was as advertised. Beautiful in form and function, and it  arrived weeks before the announced arrival date. I bought this Kindle Fire for my wife as a surprise, I "bought" the "free" fire place app, opened it and laid it burning on her pillow in a dark room. My wife's happy, I'm happy, I got a great price. I am very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Good product with one major annoyance.
Reviews.Author: Kevin
Reviews.Content: I purchased two of these for 4 year old daughters so they could take advantage of the Freetime app. Overall the devices have been great. I got cases for them and they have held up well against the abuse 4 year old's can put on electronics. My biggest gripe about the device is the storage space. I went into it thinking 5.5gb would be sufficient for a mostly online device. However, I did not realize that the wi-fi on the device will deactivate if the storage limit is reached. This means I am constantly having to delete content from the devices so they can stream new content. All in all, it's a great device, but if I was able to do it over again, I would purchase a Kindle with more storage space.

Reviews.Title: Superb shipping
Reviews.Author: bookworm
Reviews.Content: I did not have to pay for ANY of the shipping/handling. But I wish the same problems would stop reappearing in both my Kindle Fire 7 & Kindle Fire HD.

Reviews.Title: Mostly good as Kindle, but not much else.
Reviews.Author: HIBigIsle
Reviews.Content: It's quite disappointing that you cannot use this device with decent web browsing(flash cancelled since the last update) or Android apps.  Great for Kindle viewing or Amazon Prime videos, but not much else.I should have returned it.

Reviews.Title: EXPLODES
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: I have had my kindle since 2/2011 loved it up till this point used it almost daily. Went to bed last night after reading went to use it today and it looks like it has exploded@ The screen is literally popping off and it is twice the thickness it should be! Read on the amazon forums that it is a known issue of the battery exploding! Called customer service and been told I am out of warranty so I am just out of luck! Not impressed witht heir customer service at all which is sad because I loved my kindle up to this point but to be out $200 due to something not done on my part and for it to be a known mechanical issue I can not put up with. There have also been 3 reports within the last month on the CPSC website so obviously its not just mine! [...]

Reviews.Title: Great little device, but I hope Kindle developers read this.
Reviews.Author: S. Belmont "Simon B."
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire 8GB is really great it's just small enough to fit snugly into the pocket of cargo pants (even with protective casing on) this is the reason I opted for 8GB version instead of 16GB or 32GB HD version, (the 16 and 32GB versions are 1 inch wider). Hopefully the next version of Kindle comes in same dimensions as Kindle 8GB but with more memory or an SD card slot so people can upgrade memory themselves.That being said, I really do like Kindle Fire, you can watch movies on it, browse web, read books, comics, listen to the music, play games and emulation.Here are some of my recommendations for Kindle Apps.Video Game Of Choice: Fruit NinjaDrawing Program Of Choice: Sketch GuruComic Book Reader Of Choice: ComiCatFile Manager Of Choice: ES File ExplorerDivx Movie Player Of Choice: BSPlayer (A note about BSPlayer, before you load any videos, open the player, go to "settings menu" (the one that looks like half square and 3 lines inside it) then click "More" (triangle inside circle) then "Preferences" and "Playback Preferences" then "Decoding mode" and select "System decoding mode" This way you will also be able to play-back videos encoded in very high resolution without lag).

Reviews.Title: Great product!
Reviews.Author: Josie BB
Reviews.Content: I enjoy using my Kindle Fire. My only wish is there was a microphone. Some of the games for children require you to speak and then your words are repeated.

Reviews.Title: 4th one
Reviews.Author: Sheri R. Konieczki
Reviews.Content: I have purchased four of these for different family members.  Each one loved it.  Great to have while taking long distance trips.

Reviews.Title: I Love my Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Ari
Reviews.Content: i love that is slim and it fits in my bag and it is not heavy I love that my books are at my fingertips.

Reviews.Title: Short battery life
Reviews.Author: highlandlas
Reviews.Content: I like the kindle fire, but the battery life is too short. I have to charge it everyday if I use it at all. Maybe I play too many games on it, but I could read books and play games on my original  kindle for a week or more if the Wi-Fi was turned off. Turning off the Wi-Fi  doesn't seem to help the battery life on the fire. Amazon, I know you can make the battery life better -- get to it!!

Reviews.Title: Kindle gire
Reviews.Author: Victory
Reviews.Content: Had my kindle fire 15 months then it stopped charging. They said no battery replacements. I bought the the e reader. My husband looked and looked on Internet for the battery amazon said couldn't be replaced, found one. I received it today but my old Kindle won't charge, it is the charging thing IN the kindle itself not the battery or my charger cause it would for my e reader. The Kindle Fire just doesn't last long and I'm very disappointed with Amazon. Loved it but hate it. A rip off....

Reviews.Title: Love it & Hate it!!
Reviews.Author: KRAINHA "Kathy"
Reviews.Content: Love my kinde fire but HATE that the stupid won't charge! It is only 2 months old and I use only the KINDLE charger still won't charge!!! This is the second one I bought that is doing the same thing. WTH!! The other one was 18 months old so I figured it was broken. I figured wrong. I think this is a design flaw. IT NEEDS TO BE FIXED!

Reviews.Title: Not Happy
Reviews.Author: D.O'Day
Reviews.Content: I bought my kindle fire just 14 months ago(note, that's 2 months past the 1 yr warranty period). I was very happy with it, till yesterday, when I couldn't get it to charge. Called tech support, and my only option is to trade it in for a new one. However, reading the reviews, the new kindle now has ads, no flash player, and they charge you for the wall charger. My question is, do I really want all that for a device that doesn't last much over a year? And the answer is, not really. Amazon needs to consider the customers they will lose because of their throw away technology. Not sure what to do now

Reviews.Title: 7 Months Old, Broken, Amazon says "Too Bad"
Reviews.Author: Jennifer R
Reviews.Content: My first Kindle Fire 7" broke within a year -- in the warranty time period. The micro USB port where the charger plugs into the Kindle became loose and stopped charging. A quick Google search told me this was a very common problem with this product. So I called, the warranty kicked in, and a new one arrived.Seven months later, the new Kindle developed the same problem. Amazon had not fixed the malfunction they knew existed in the product. I called, was informed the warranty on the first Kindle had run out, and I was out of luck.Now I have to replace my Kindle Fire 7". I won't be replacing it with an Amazon product.

Reviews.Title: Terrific tablet with a major glitch
Reviews.Author: Peggy "roxinger"
Reviews.Content: I received a 1st generation Kindle Fire for Christmas in 2011 & fell in love with it.  My first Kindle was a Kindle keyboard, but the drawback to it was its awkwardness in surfing the Internet.  I wanted the Kindle Fire because I could do anything on it that my husband can do on his iPad except take photos & videos, & because of its very reasonable cost.  I purchased a car charger & an Otterbox cover for it, & took advantage of Amazon's prime program.  Everything was fine until late June 2012, when the device's battery wouldn't charge no matter what I tried to do.  Amazon's tech support person told me that the device would need to be replaced & since it was still under the one year warranty, it was replaced free of charge as long as I sent the defective device back to Amazon in 30 days or less.  My second Kindle Fire performed without incident until late February of this year, when the battery wouldn't charge.  Amazon's tech support person told me that the device would need to be replaced.  However, I was told that it was out of warranty & I would have to pay for a new one.  I disputed this because this second device failed after only 6 months of use.  Amazon made an "exception" in my situation & shipped my third device free of charge.  I sent the second defective device back to Amazon within 30 days.While I love the Kindle Fire, Amazon needs to go back to the drawing board with respect to the failure of the battery.  A friend of mine has had the same problem, which makes me believe that this is a problem across the board.  Amazon's tech support & customer service is first rate.  Lesson learned:  Store important stuff & photos in the cloud, or they'll be lost if the battery fails to charge.  Should my third device experience the same problem, I just might buy an iPad mini.

Reviews.Title: Love-hate kindle
Reviews.Author: eygh
Reviews.Content: My first kindle stopped charging and was replaced by amazon with a faulty replacement. I was so disappointed because I loved it when I first bought it.

Reviews.Title: Love It
Reviews.Author: Ellana
Reviews.Content: Really love the Kindle Fire. The only thing i would wish for is that they add 3G along with the wi-fi

Reviews.Title: My wife loves it
Reviews.Author: Kung
Reviews.Content: I own a Galaxy Nexus 7, and my wife went from "Why would I ever want one of those?" to "...can you do this?  You can?  Hrm...." to "...I might like to have one."So when Amazon.com offered a fire sale (pun intended) on their Kindle Fires, I swooped down to get one.It fits the bill perfectly.  I personally prefer my Google Nexus 7, as I'm an IT professional and like the idea of a more 'open' OS/infrastructure.  However, my wife is all about the content (videos, books, etc.) and it is undeniable that with one or two possible exceptions, Amazon has an excellent ecosystem in place for offering just that.  The menus, while not completely intuitive, are easy enough that after about a week she was able to navigate around with few problems; and she now understand why it is that I download the vast majority of my books, as opposed to buying them.The downsides I see are the same ones others see - lack of a slot for expandable memory and the like - but to my wife it's a nonissue; she simply wants to be able to read books, emails, watch videos, and download some games for my son, and for these things it works fantastically.

Reviews.Title: We love it!!
Reviews.Author: jody
Reviews.Content: This has all the awesome features of an iPad, but at a fraction of the cost. We love it! I'd definitely recommend this to anyone!

Reviews.Title: STILL LEARNING HOW TO USE ALL THE FEATURES
Reviews.Author: grammashouse
Reviews.Content: THIS IS MY THIRD KINDLE.  I STILL USE MY KINDLE TOUCH FOR READING. I USED TO SPEND ANYWHERE FROM $10 TO $15 A WEEK ON PAPERBACKS.  I HAVE READ SOME AUTHORS I WOULD NEVER EVEN CONSIDERED.  MY KINDLE GOES WITH ME ANYTIME I EXPECT TO HAVE TO WAIT.

Reviews.Title: Buyer beware!!! Only purchase through Best Buy!!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: After receiving the kindle fire as a gift from my husband and children for Christmas in 2011, I was delighted and DEARLY loved my kindle fire, right up to the day in late summer 2012 that I woke up to discover it would no longer charge. I thought that perhaps I was experiencing a rare event and contacted customer support...after my third kindle fire in the past 16 months, all with the same issue, I have been told by customer support that the product is no longer under factory warrenty, but that I can purchase a new model at a (slight) discount...lets see...known design flaw...100% falure rate of 3 out of 3 kindles, the longest success with 8 months of use...do I want to invest another kindle fire product for $130 - $200+ ?...hmmm...I'll let you decide for yourself...personally, I'll pass...after all, I already spent $200+ to own a faulty product with design problems that have yet to be fixed, from a company no longer concerned with customer confidence...just read all the 1 star customer reviews with this same issue that Amazon refuses to stand behind...too bad we can't write a review for each faulty kindle we have all been sent...the overall star rating would be drastically lower since most of us have had multple kindles sent to us all with the same problem... If you do decide to purchase this product through Amazon, be sure to pay for the 25% mark-up extended warrenty so that they will not charge you to keep sending you a new one, and I would also recommend getting several extra chargers so that when the problems start you can save yourself the time customer servise spends trying to problem solve whether it is the charger, the port, or the battery...sorry my sweet kindle...way to much money for such a short life...if I should ever want to risk my investment in another kidle product ,  then I would ONLY buy it through Best Buy, as Best Buy stands behind their customers' purchases as each new kindle would have a year factory warrenty from the date of reissue, rather than Amazons policy of only honoring the original purchase date to calculate warrenty...perhaps then it would be more economical for Amazon to actually fix the problem.

Reviews.Title: Died after only 16 months of sporadic use-Amazon refused to replace it
Reviews.Author: Randy Pfenninger
Reviews.Content: I've had this product for almost a year and a half when it suddenly stopped charging. The orange light would be on, implying that it was charging, but after "charging" all night, it would still be dead in the morning. I tried it with different chargers, all with the same result. I called Amazon to tell them about the issue, and I expected a replacement for a small fee. Instead, the best they could offer me was a replacement upgrade for over $100. After taking exceptionally good care of my Kindle Fire (never dropping it, keeping it in its case at all times, not allowing it near liquids of any kind,) it died after only 16 months of sporadic use. With so many other tablets on the market, I expected better customer service from Amazon. Because of their refusal to back their products, I will be looking into a different brand to replace my Kindle Fire.

Reviews.Title: A disposable gadget.
Reviews.Author: Will
Reviews.Content: I have a first generation Kindle Fire. The charging port failed after 15 months. I was very disappointed at the lack of support from Amazon on their own product. They would not fix it and told me I had to purchase a new unit. I've been a loyal Amazon customer since 1999 and I guess the loyalty is going to end now.

Reviews.Title: same problems
Reviews.Author: momio 605
Reviews.Content: I'm kind of disappointed. I have had to return 3 kindles-2 because of charging issues and 1 because the screen would go haywire. I'm on #4 and already it is showing signs of charging issues. Amazon has been great as far as replacing the kindles...but I prefer to have the problem corrected! Sad because I love my kindle but really disappointed :(ok update!! Amazon has come through for me again!! I received an email saying to try using the kindle fire charger and usb cord, they gave me a credit to allow me to purchase these items (in my opinion should be included in price of the kindle) but ever since using the charger and usb cord, no more charging issues, I could not be happier!! THANK YOU AMAZON!!!!!

Reviews.Title: KINDLE FIRE
Reviews.Author: Frances D'Auria
Reviews.Content: I am on my third Kindle beause of battery issues.  AMAZON has been great about replacements but I can tell this one has issues too.  It gets very hot and I mean hot around the battery and is very sensitive with page changes.

Reviews.Title: Surprises me
Reviews.Author: MAJ34
Reviews.Content: I have to admit that I was not sure this would give me what I wanted, but it has. I watch movies, tv, get apps, play games, search the web. I have found that for me, I had to turn auto correct off otherwise it would keep filling in things that I did not want it to. Then again, I have never liked someone or something thinking for me. Great picture, battery life is a little short, but there are many ways to watch and charge. I have a laptop, a desktop, and now a tablet. For what I want it to do, I don't need an iPad.

Reviews.Title: hate the battery and charger
Reviews.Author: anonymus
Reviews.Content: i used it for about an hour and it had less then half the battery remaining. ive been charging it for about 3 freaking hours and it gained about 20 percent battery!!! are you kidding me.if they cared about there customers they would provide us with a decent charger. not something useless so we can purchase the 20 dollar "faster and better" charger they sell on here. other then that its great. but with no battery how can you use it right. so 1 star!  >:(

Reviews.Title: Even a four-year old can do it!
Reviews.Author: Mimidia
Reviews.Content: I have a Kindle Fire HD and my 4 year old granddaughter played games on it almost non-stop whenever she came over.  So we  bought her one hoping she would take care of it as well as she had mine.  She absolutely loves it and takes wonderful care of it.  We did buy a strong case for it as we knew she would drop it.  She not only plays games but we have downloaded several movies for her from PRIME. It has been a great gift for her.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire 7" LCD
Reviews.Author: CarolE
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle Fire!  Unfortunately, I cannot give it a 5 star rating.  This is my 5th Kindle Fire-each of the previous 4 have developed issues with charging.  I only charge my device with the approved Kindle charger, but each time I receive a replacement the same problem occurs. After a short period of time, unless the mini USB plug is inserted in just the right manner, the Kindle Fire will not charge.  Shortly after this occurs, I will not be able to charge the device at all.  Amazon is great about replacing my Kindle Fire when this happens, but I received my current Kindle Fire about a month ago, and although I had high hopes, as they replaced my device with a 2nd generation Kindle Fire, this current device is starting to show the same problem.  I wish that Amazon would fix this problem, maybe by locating the charging port at a different site.I use Kindle Fire daily, either to read one of the many e-books that I have or to use one of the many apps.  I love the availability of the android apps and that the device is wi-fi enabled to allow me to play games with my daughter in Missouri.The versatility of the Kindle Fire is great! I like it so much that I gave a Kindle Fire as a gift to my nephew and to my daughter!  I have not heard if they are having issues with theirs, but I did let them know that if they do experience problems that they need to contact Amazon.I am waiting for the Kindle Fire HD to come down in price, so that I can upgrade and hopefully not have any more power issues.

Reviews.Title: Great for Books and Games!
Reviews.Author: jojo
Reviews.Content: Love the graphics for gaming- keeps up really well.  Lots of Book storage, not a lot of game storage if you are mostly a gamer.  The Kindle does allocate your memory for you on the Kindle.  Since the main use is e-reader you will have lots of storage for books.  Limited storage for Game Apps, I can have about 15 good sized games ( I love the Dash Games) and the play is Great!  The features are wonderful and this is such a convenient web browser.. can take it anywhere!  Beats lugging the laptop to bed!  Very easy to use, no technical knowledge required.  You will love it.  I will caution you -- If you are a big gamer, this will not be the product for you.  You will definitely need to get the 32GB at least or another tablet manufacturer.  As I said earlier -- your memory is pre-allocated to books (about 70%) and Apps (about 30%) on Kindles and you CANNOT change it.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Irene S. Remoaldo "Irene"
Reviews.Content: I like my kindle e-reader more than the kindle fire.  The battery stays charged longer.  I'm having a hard time with the touch screen as it goes too fast,  I'm sorry I didn't buy an IPad instead.

Reviews.Title: Bitterly dissatisfied
Reviews.Author: Deana L. Givens
Reviews.Content: My first Kindle worked wonderfully, but after I dropped it my husband "upgraded" my next one to a Fire.  We took the first one he bought back after it locked up a few times within the first couple of days.  However, when the second one started locking up too I called the company who reset it to factory settings.  It didn't help.  It still  locks up constantly.  I've spent almost a year dealing with it.  Books are nearly impossible to get through when every few pages I can't turn to the next page and have to wait while it shuts down and then restarts.  Most often it loses my place and I have to search for where it got stuck.  Then it locks up again and we go through the whole process again.  Every now and then it will smooth out but when the battery runs down and it has to be charged the problems return.  It does the same thing on the web even though I don't try to use it very much for that.  I use my husband's IPad.  I'm an avid book reader but I will never buy another KindleFire.  I will definitely try another e-reader.

Reviews.Title: Got this for my son
Reviews.Author: Molli Grove
Reviews.Content: He loves it.  Mostly uses it for gaming.  I love it because I don't have games all over the place AND if I'm lucky he will use it to read too.  Sometimes we rent movies for him to watch, but mostly only if we are driving somewhere and he will need something to do.  It's great for kids because the apps are easy, it's a good size, and it has everything he needs.  I wish there were better parental controls that would allow me to block certain accesses, but it's all or nothing on this one.

Reviews.Title: Really good product and great customer service
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I really like my Kindle Fire, it is easy to use, I like the size, not too big, but better then reading on my phone.Battery life is good, we watch video, play some games, and use the eReader primarily and the battery will last 6-8 hours before I need to recharge.  I also like to use it with Pandora, I connect the headphone jack to my home stereo Aux input, sounds very good.  I previously had a first generation Kindle Fire, i developed a charging issue almost a year after we bought it, contacted Amazon customer service and after a few online exchanges Amazon replaced my old one with a second generation model, at no cost to me.  Very pleased with the device and Amazon's customer service.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Helene Kranz
Reviews.Content: I am very satisfied with this product. i would recommend it to anyone interested in a tablet. It's a great buy!

Reviews.Title: Can't get it to charge while using the kindle.  Continues to wear down until it dies.  Have to charge when it is off.
Reviews.Author: grammamary
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd Kindle in less than a year.  The first two had issues with the connection for the charger loosening up and not charging.  Amazon has been great about replacing each time, and upgraded the one I have now to the newer model.The new one has great definition and I like the larger icons.  I use my kindle every day for reading, games, email and web use.The only issue I have is that it doesn't always charge while I have it on and will wear down to where it shuts down, even thought it is plugged in.

Reviews.Title: Mostly great, except..
Reviews.Author: Jason Andersen
Reviews.Content: My Kindle Fire is pretty cool. Wifi works well, everything has clarity, reading on it is fast, easy and awesome, and the prices and convenience linked to books (and Prime) is awesome.However, one thing sucks. The battery life. Seriously, I have to charge it basically every single day even if I'm not using it. A full day of doing nothing with the Fire off is still enough to drain over half the battery. I have to ask what exactly the Kindle is doing to drain so much power when it's supposed to be doing nothing.What this means is there's no "Oh, I feel like using my Kindle today" after a few days of not using your Kindle. If you forget about it, your battery will be gone.Now, I understand the Kindle Fire is more high tech than, say, my old Ipod. But it still miffs me that I have to charge it so often and frequently even if I'm not using it at high capacity. If I'm using it for 5 hours a day every day, sure, then I should probably need to charge it daily. But if I'm using it for an hour, or two, or I don't use it for a day? There's no excuse for it to need to charge it every day.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for some stuff
Reviews.Author: pinkdog87
Reviews.Content: I have read alot of reviews on here and and some seem very unfair. One u do need to buy a charger...it comes with a usb.Charger. that's great if you  keep a laptop around or have a computer. Two  about the books music and apps games costing...some do cost but there is also alot  of free stuff such as books music games and other apps the screen does freeze at times.so just being honest..and this is the only tablet I have have or have had. I have had a touch screen phone and they seem to  freeze also

Reviews.Title: Underwhelmed by battery and general use
Reviews.Author: S Starr
Reviews.Content: I purchased this device to read print replica textbooks. To that end I have been disappointed, even though this is a good device value wise. However, it seems when I leave it in standby the battery is nearly dead just when I need it after a couple days. The print replica support is less than complete in my opinion. I grit my teeth when I see how much power has been stripped from these titles going from the PC to the tablet, particularly in intra-book links.On top of that I find this poorly setup for "serious" use out of the box. For buying videos an  such it is grand. However, I think it should come with at least some basic apps for note taking, a calculator, and a clock app out of the box. I can always choose to use different ones if I wish, but my philosophy is to not get too far from default on a device, particularly a post PC device like a tablet.Other things crop up as well. For instance, I finally gave up trying to write this review on the app and went to the browser because the built in shopping app had really glitchy text input. Diving into settings feels more intimidating than it should, it feels like there is a middle ground view between novice and hacker that is missing.Overall, I would say this is not a bad device. However, if you want an all purpose tablet and not just a "consumption" device I think you will be happier with a different platform, both hardware and software wise.

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: robert m summers
Reviews.Content: i love it . so easy to use. if they could reinforce charging port i would give it a 5

Reviews.Title: Amazon has great customer service
Reviews.Author: J. Rusek
Reviews.Content: Previously purchased generation 1 Kindle Fire.  Had a year and then was unable to charge.  Amazon sent me new fast charge plug free but still would not charge.  They sent me a replacement Kindle Fire 1st gen which worked for about 2weeks and then malfunctioned.  Called Amazon and they said would send me another one.  This time they sent 2nd generation and has been working great.  Very fast, love it.  I just want to compliment Amazon on great customer service and standing behind their product

Reviews.Title: OMG this is awesome
Reviews.Author: claudette
Reviews.Content: I liked my original Kindle, have had it for 4 years, used the poor thing so much it was falling apart! I recently purchased a Kindle fire and I am very impressed! I love that I could keep all my previously purchased books and can read them at night with the back lighting, and can now play games. I would recommend this to anyone who loves to read. I know you will come to love it as much as I do!

Reviews.Title: where are my e-reader functions
Reviews.Author: Ann and Judi
Reviews.Content: Wish it had the ability to put my books in collections like my kindle touch.Disappointed thought I was getting an e-reader with added capabilities but this lacks one of the best features of the e-reader.Great for a tablet. Unbeatable price!

Reviews.Title: Best Christmas Gift Ever!
Reviews.Author: myshanna berry
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my 8 year old son, he is Autistic and ever since a family Friend showed him angry birds he has been addicted to the game! I figured i would use this to my advantage and limit App time and encourage reading time! This has worked beautifully, with the Kindle Freetime which is already on the kindle when you receive it, i can limit how much time he has to play and give him unlimited reading time, so when game time is over all he is allowed to access is books! We also made a deal that with every gift card he got for birthdays or christmas he has to purchase at LEAST two books! he has had his kindle for about 3 months and already has over 20 books! LOVE IT!!! the only thing thats a slight drawback is im not a fan of the carosel. Other then that 5 star here!

Reviews.Title: Love my Kindle fire!
Reviews.Author: Owley
Reviews.Content: I bought my Kindle Fire as a part of a promotion that Amazon ran before Christmas.  It was an early gift from my husband and I had been considering replacing my Kindle 2 for awhile but had originally been leaning towards a Paperwhite.  I couldn't really pass up the deal so I bought the Fire instead and hoped for the best.I am so glad that I bought the Fire because I love it!  I thought that reading on it would hurt my eyes or give me a headache but so far I have not had any issues with this at all.  I know that many complain about the free offers but honestly I barely even notice them as they are only on the swipe page when you start up the Fire.  I actually do like the ones that show movies or books and how they link to more information about them.  Another thing that people complain about is the "recommended for you" section at the bottom of the home screen, but I actually like this a lot.  I have discovered several good books this way.  I guess you could turn this off, but I wouldn't if you read a lot and are looking for book suggestions.I only gave the Fire four stars because I do feel like it could be easier to use.  For example, who knew it could be so dang difficult to figure out how to turn the volume down?  I don't really listen to music or watch videos on it much at this point in time so when my daughter was playing her Umi Zoomi app, it was insanely loud and I actually had to turn to Google to figure out the volume.  I also feel like the touch keyboard could be a little better as typing on it isn't very easy and I am constantly hitting the wrong keys.Overall, I love the Fire, but maybe the user interface could be tweaked a bit.  It is great for reading and my children love playing games on it!  If you are looking for a cheaper tablet, this one is pretty great and I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great present!
Reviews.Author: Lisa L. Pagan
Reviews.Content: My husband loved his birthday gift.  He uses it everyday and enjoys using this product.  I would recommend this to my friends to purchase.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Alternative
Reviews.Author: Pat
Reviews.Content: I wanted an IPAD, I admit it. But I'm retired and on a fixed income so I found the price very appealing. It was a good choice. I really don't feel like I'm missing a thing, and I love that I'm still connected to the world. I use the Cloud, so I can access everything easily on my Kindle. Wish it had a camera, but I can take photos with my phone, so that's not really a huge deal.

Reviews.Title: what special offers????
Reviews.Author: Jane Valois
Reviews.Content: I would have giving the 5 stars if i would have received a simple charging chord that went into an electrical socket, but nooooo all i got was one that connects to my PC. Is that what you call a special offer.

Reviews.Title: Love the device  - love the service even more
Reviews.Author: Andrew Pohlman
Reviews.Content: I recently wrote a not so nice review of the Kindle Fire's ad platform. A couple days after the post, a representative from Amazon called me and helped resolve the issue. This was totally unexpected and greatly appreciated. Great service experience and an especially great example of using these ratings to help customers. I feel compelled to keep my original post listed below, but rest assured, Amazon deserved this modification of my original rating from 2 to 5 stars.We owned another Fire so we decided to buy one for our 6-year-old daughter as well. The device itself works great but the home page with ads is very annoying and even has ads (like movie promotions) that are not appropriate for young children. If this had been disclosed I would have probably purchase a different version.

Reviews.Title: Everything I thought it would be
Reviews.Author: ladytex
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd Kindle.  I have a keyboard e-ink Kindle and another Kindle Fire.  I bought this one as a gift for my daughter.  She loves it.  I love my original Kindle Fire just as much.  It's so handy for reading, checking my email and a little internet browsing.  Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Kindle fire
Reviews.Author: Tab
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome tablet. My whole family has enjoyed these so much. I tell everybody they are loads of fun and great for college.

Reviews.Title: USB Charger Connection is AWFUL!!!
Reviews.Author: Scriptor "jigsaw1999"
Reviews.Content: The device itself is great, until you need to charge it.  The USB port connector isn't tight and is rather difficult to get a solid connection on for a good overnight charge.  I'm actually quite disappointed in this gift for my wife.  She has been unable to use the device several times after leaving it charging overnight, only to learn the connection didn't stay put.  C'MON AMAZON - FIX YOUR GADGETS.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire 7"
Reviews.Author: Joan W. Jones
Reviews.Content: I have had 3 Kindle Fire 7 (the 1st I bought from Amazon and exchanged for another Kindle from Amazon and I bought the 3rd from Best Buy but took back) and all 3 do the same thing!!!!  When I'm scanning through books I want to review before I purchase, it gets to a point where I tap on a book but it won't open for me to review.  I'm just going to "put up" with the inconvenience!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire w/ Freetime
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Arrived on schedule.  It was a gift, and the recipients (bought 2, for grandsons) really like it.Pros:  Kindle Freetime easy to set up for kids ot use.  Many apps and lots of kid-friendly content available (books, movies, TV shows, etc.)Also usable by adults for their content.Cons:  cannot buy Freetimne unlimited for each of two devices/profiles if they are linked to the same account, have to buy the "family plan, which is slightly more expensive than 2 individual Freetime Unlimited subscriptions.Uses a *ton* of bandwidth, all games appear to only play if actively connected online, making it difficult for the kids to load a preferred game at home and then play it where there is no WiFi hotspot.

Reviews.Title: just the ticket for book lovers
Reviews.Author: dimendog
Reviews.Content: I received the Kindle for Christmas even though it wasn't on my list. I never thought I'd want one; I love the feel of books, the smell of them, being able to close it at the end and keep my favorites in my bookcase. Well, having thousands of books at my fingertips may prove dangerous. I gobbled up my first free loan that comes with my Amazon Prime membership, along with all the great things I can do on my computer, like watch episodes of shows whose channels I can't afford but that's about prime. There were many negative reviews about not having a charger to plug into the wall and I admit mine is in there, I think that was an error on Amazon's part but once I had the plug, which I got on ebay for less than $5, I forgot my distress and dove in. The only negative I can say is I don't like not seeing how many pages are in a book but it's a small negative since you can see how far you've gone (50%, 95%) I love that I can read it up and down or side to side, once it's powered up the battery last a long time, and it plays well with my computer; I can order a book online while checking my email and when I turn to my Kindle it's there waiting for me. I love that you can highlight parts and make notes on them, I can't tell you how many times I've searched for that one line that moved me.This is pretty new so I haven't figured out all the bells and whistles yet but I think this is going to be trouble in a good way. For all those book lovers who think they don't want one, try it, you may just love it!!

Reviews.Title: Amazing what it does!
Reviews.Author: Momtchr
Reviews.Content: The only thing I don't like is how long the battery lasts, seems like I have to charge it everyday.  Other than that...it's great.  Easy to use, lots of apps,most are free.

Reviews.Title: WAS great until it stopped working
Reviews.Author: lquat
Reviews.Content: I asked for this as a gift for Christmas in 2011.  I got it all set up and one weird thing happened within the first few weeks.  The screen was having "issues" - it wasn't responding to where I was pressing. It wasn't frozen.  Just wouldn't open what I wanted it to - would open something on the other side of the screen.  Apparently others have had issues with this so I did what was suggested: the hard shut down and boot back up. It worked!The kindle fire was great for the next year! I've gotten books, game apps, internet (so I don't have to bring my computer home from work!!:)), etc.Over Christmas break 2012, the same problem started occuring again. It's not that it's not working...but not working how it's supposed to.  I can't use the keyboard because when I press on one letter, several pop up (frustrating!) I keep the Kindle in a safe spot, it wasn't dropped and didn't get spilled on. In fact, it had a protective case on it!I tried shutting down and turning back on LOTS of times.  Custumer service told me to restore it to factory settings. But that didn't help either.  Now I can't even connect to the internet because I can't type my password in.I contacted customer service AGAIN and they said they couldn't help me, that they could give me about $30 off the purchase of a new one.  ??  The 1-year warranty ended 5 DAYS before it started acting up.  Do they expect that they are only supposed to last one year and that customers are supposed to buy new ones every year.What a rip-off!!!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Kathryn I. Montgomery
Reviews.Content: I ordered my Kindle Fire as a christmas present to myself. It came within 2-3 days. I was really impressed how fast it came. I can do almost anything on my Kindle. It has so many free books,games and apps to download. The price was really reasonable. I didn't have to purchase a charger, it actually fit into my phone charger. I have no problem recommended this Kindle to others.

Reviews.Title: Awsome
Reviews.Author: sunnybeachesgirl
Reviews.Content: Got it as a christmas present for my husband. He has already read a book and is on book number two. Also loved the versatility to see movies and play games. Was an absolute hit!

Reviews.Title: GREAT BUT .....
Reviews.Author: Prettysmartideas
Reviews.Content: I keep my Kindle Fire with me at all times (I even sleep with it when the allows)  I've given it only 4 stars though because there are a lot of issues that I think need to be resolved (and, for which, unfortunately, I'll probably have to pay ,when they come out with the better Kindle Fire (couldn't they just update the software and send it to our Kindle Fires?)I got my Kindle Fire (the $159 version with ads) as a Christmas present from someone who really believes I should have a Kindle (I'll elaborate: I had 3 of the first kind of Kindle: the first one died after about 10 months, and was replaced by Amazon; the second one died after about 3 months, and was replaced by Amazon; the third one died not too long after I got it, and I gave up on Kindle). The same person who gave me the first Kindle believes enough in Kindle to have given me a Kindle Fire this Christmas.SYNOPSIS OF MY REVIEW  (here you read the basics - for the details, continue reading):*I LOVE my Kindle Fire.*I find Amazon customer service (telephone and on-line chat) severely lacking (READ: I would rather bite my tongue off than talk to Amazon customer service again)*I find it unfair that current books cost the same as books in bookstores (and even more, sometimes,  than new books  purchased on Amazon).*I am very unhappy that I cannot access my favorite Kindle games on this new Kindle.*I wish the Kindle Fire had the same book-managing (filing) aspects that the original Kindle had.*I resent that Kindle Fire comes only with a USB cable hook-up to recharge it from a computer (what if you don't have a computer?)  I think that the electrical adapter, which allows you to re-charge your Kindle from an electrical outlet, and which Amazon sells separately for $19.95, should be included with the Kindle.THE FULL REVIEW*I love having a Kindle. I missed having a Kindle after my last Kindle died.  With the Kindle, it is so easy to get a book when you finish the book you were reading (I am a reader - you won't see me without a book unless some terrible disaster has suddenly occurred - even on September 11th, I had a book with me. I always have a book with me, and sometimes two, if I think I am going to finish the book I am reading before the day is out).*It is so nice to be able to read a sample of a book, and then, if you get to the end of it, and want more, order up the book even in the middle of the night, so you can continue reading virtually seamlessly.I've enjoyed reading a huge number of free books and inexpensively priced books on Kindle (although I still find books cheaper at Salvation Army).  You can go for a long time reading just the free books on Kindle.*For all of this convenience, though, you do pay a price: If you want a current book, you are going to pay pretty much what you would pay in a bookstore, minus the tax.  (many times, you can order a book on Amazon and pay less for it than you would pay on your Kindle, so I always do check on Amazon before I go the easy Kindle way).*I thought it was not very nice of Kindle to sell the Kindle Fire with only a USB cable to recharge it from a computer (what if you are not near a computer?).  The USB connection takes about 10 hours to recharge the Kindle Fire.  You can, of course, buy a converter from Kindle, for $19.95 - that will recharge your Kindle in less than 3 hours.  (and, if you are a bit more savvy, you might find a converter from another manufacturer for a lower price - Amazon says they will not work as fast as the Kindle converter, but, at this point, I don't know how much of that is hype.  I am thinking of getting one that can accept two USB cables at once, so that I can charge my phone and my Kindle off the same adapter. I'll have to wait and see how well that works).*My first Kindles were very light-weight.  This Kindle Fire is quite a bit heavier (if you're holding it with one hand, you might develop carpal tunnel syndrome after a while).
