No big deal.*Book managing is non-existent on this version of Kindle (With my earlier Kindles, I could put my books in different categories - the most important being "already read".  There is no way to do this with the Kindle Fire, so I am stuck with an amazingly long list of books that I have to scroll through to find the next one I want to read, unless, of course, I want to uninstall read books, which I am not ready to do at this point).*It is impossible to access the games I really liked (most importantly, "Every Word") on my earlier Kindles. They are simply not available.  Contacting Amazon/Kindle on this point leads to a time-consuming run-around in a connection with someone from a country where English is not the native language (don't get me wrong - I have no problem with foreigners, but, when I have a problem with something I own, I don't want to have to explain something 60 ways before I can get another wrong answer out of the "customer support" agent, and I do get royally tired of people re-wording my requests or complaints into something that is not even similar to what I have said - I talked to Amazon/Kindle so many times that I eventually resorted to doing the "on-line chat" just so I could have a record of what I had actually said, to refer to, when the "customer support" agent started rewording what I had said into something that was not even remotely related to what I had actually said.)*I have given up on contacting Amazon for support (see above)  I teach English to foreigners for a living.  I don't think I should have to be doing it when I am on my own time, and I find it extremely annoying when I finally figure out what someone is saying when they say "goo to da scream", and I say "oh, you mean "go to the screen", and they correct me with, "no, goo to da scream" - uh, I should probably mention that I am a native speaker of American English, and I can also speak British.  I am American - no hypnenations, and I am First Family in North Carolina, through my mother.  I have no problem with people whose native language is not English, but it does irk me when they become irritated when I do not understand what they are saying and scream at me, or when they rephrase what I am saying into something that has nothing to do with what I am talking about.

Reviews.Title: Amazon not clear about internet needs
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth Mason
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my 76 year old mother who has internet, but NOT wireless.  I was assured by an Amazon "Chat" worker that there would be no problem.  The Kindle could be used by plugging in USB cord.  This WAS NOT the case.  She could not register her Kindle without wireless internet, therefore she could not use it.  I found out last night a friend of mine has the SAME  PROBLEM when purchasing one for her mother.With the help of her grandchildren, she has purchased a "hotspot" device and is now operational.  I think she will now enjoy it but, had I know this, I may not have purchased one, or would have at least purchased one of the older models that she didn't need the wireless internet for.Kindle/Amazon should be more clear about the  internet needs.

Reviews.Title: Love it BUT...
Reviews.Author: Dana
Reviews.Content: We bought Kindle Fires for both my kids for Christmas and we're really happy with the purchase!  I know with over 4,000 reviews, my review will get burried but I just wanted to put in my two-cents!  I didn't give five stars because of the folders issue if they fix that, I'd be willing to change!I have a Kindle 3G Keyboard, went to the Nook tablet the next year, this year, I've gone to the iPad Retina display.  I think I like the Kindle Fire the best (if I'm doing more than just reading).Here are the reasons I like the Fire:-It is manageable.  I love the size of the Kindle Fire.  Anything bigger and it's just too bulky.  It's the perfect size for packing in a purse or a carry-on bag.  I find my iPad gets way too heavy when playing games or reading.-Lots of Apps.  I know it doesn't compare with Apple's apps but it has plenty of apps for me and they're getting more all the time.  I have the samsung Galaxy S II phone, so I'm used to the android apps, so are my kids, so they don't miss all the Apple apps.-Has enough to keep us connected.  This has plenty of features for me and my kids.  I love the Free Time settings, to be able to lock my kids out of the games, movies, etc if I want them to read.  I really like all the parental controls and use of passwords for purchasing anything.  It keeps my 5 and 7 year olds from buying anything they don't need to be buying.Here are the reasons I don't like the Kindle Fire:-Folders.  WHY?  How long it takes to go through every app when looking for a single one.  My phone can build folders, why can't the Kindle Fire?  I do NOT like the format of the Fire.  I know the Kindle was originally built for reading, that's fine but if they're going to make it more like a tablet, make it more user friendly.  We didn't buy these Kindle Fires just for my kids to read.  We bought them more for a 'tablet' because the iPad is overkill and the iPod Touch is too small.-Accounts.  I know you have to manage Kindles under 1 account but I would like to be able to manage my kids' Kindles through my account too, instead of having to log into my husband's account.-Password Block.  Every time we purchase an app, we have to put in the password, which is fine, we chose to do that, but why isn't the password just automatically hidden?  Every time we put the password in, we have to click on the box to hide the password.  My 7 year old is already leaning over my shoulder to see what I'm typing in.  Make it a *little* harder for her to figure it out!I'm not going to review all the technical stuff for the Kindle because I'm sure that has been sufficiently covered.  I am partial to the Kindle, I really like the Android OS and I feel the Kindle Fire is sufficient for my needs...I'm tempted to sell my iPad and trade it in for a Fire HD.  Although, I still prefer my Kindle Keyboard for reading only!

Reviews.Title: awesome deal
Reviews.Author: terri norris
Reviews.Content: great buy, fast shipping awesome deal for the money. This item to me is better than any ipad.  Very easy to use.

Reviews.Title: I don't know what I'd do without my Fire!
Reviews.Author: Torii Ireson
Reviews.Content: I absolutely LOVE my Kindle Fire! This is my first e-reader, and I was originally looking at the Kindle Paperwhite because I figured if I was going to get an e-reader, why not get one with that singular function? I have a desktop computer, why bother getting a Fire that does things my computer does as well? I couldn't have been more wrong!It was the end of November and Amazon ran a special on the Kindle Fire 7" LCD so out of curiosity, I clicked it to find out more. Like everyone else, I read through the spiel and became intrigued by all that it could do.The more I thought about it, I decided why settle for a simple e-reader when I could have also have movies, apps, and games as well? Sure, my desktop offers quite a bit in that department as well, but not from the comfort of my couch, or bed, or while waiting at the doctor's office!I didn't get the warranty because I figured the price isn't horrible should I need a new one, and by that time I'll probably want to upgrade anyway. I did however buy this case http://www.amazon.com/Defender-Series-Standing-Kindle-Built-/dp/B007Q3YIW0/ref=sr_1_1?s=digital-text&ie;=UTF8&qid;=1356958793&sr;=1-1&keywords;=otterbox+for+kindle+fire which is amazing might I add!When ordering, definitely go with the special offers option! I considered paying the extra because I absolutely HATE ads, but this just shows essentially a picture when you first turn on the Kindle and punch in your lock code. Then it's gone! Really, that's it! Save a few bucks and go with the special offers, you won't regret it. Even if you do, you can always have it taken off later.The design is very sleek and although most people complain about weight, it really isn't that bad. Sure, it's a bit heavy, but I'm not the lay on my back with my arms in the air holding my e-reader type. How do people do that anyway? Doesn't the blood rush out of your arms? Anyway, if you're that type of reader you should probably consider a hockey mask as well because otherwise you're asking for a trip to the hospital.Navigation is a bit confusing (at least it was for me) at initial start up. I saw an icon that said Silk and had no idea that was the internet browser and was scared to click something I didn't know what it was for fear of some download starting up. Once I got past the initial unfamiliarity, I was clicking everything I could find to see what it did!Something cool I've found is that you can store all your apps, books, etc on your Amazon Cloud, the device itself, or both. The cloud can be managed from your Amazon account should you decide you want something removed completely which is nice.The biggest negatives...The fact that you have to have WiFi to do just about anything. I have wireless internet here at the house of course, but I don't always have access when I'm out and about which was annoying at first. I had a television series I had been streaming on Amazon Prime (amazing by the way) and wanted to continue when I got to work early, but couldn't because there was no WiFi! I essentially felt forced to buy the series so that it could be stored on my device and I could watch anywhere. At this point, it no longer bothers me because I've just plain accepted it. That, and the prices really aren't terrible. Especially if you have Amazon Prime. Which you should.What's the deal with the lending library?! I was excited because I'm an Amazon Prime member and thought that I could get as many free books as I wanted on my Kindle Fire. Was I ever wrong. Come to find out, the lending library works like this, you can pick one of their "free" books and keep it for as long as you'd like, however you can one have ONE per calendar month! I read The Hunger Games in a matter of days, returned it eager to get the next book, but no. Not until next month. Again, they're making me feel forced to buy things.The biggest positives...I'd like to end this review on a positive note so here it goes. If you have young children at home that you know will want to get their little hands on your Fire, a subscription to Kindle Free Time Unlimited is an absolute MUST!! I can't rave about this enough. I opted for the $2.99 one child subscription with my Prime and my girls (two and six) share an account. It's perfect for little ones who like to press everything and you don't want to worry about what they're downloading or what their viewing. You set a parental password and it locks the Kindle into "Free Time" mode so you can put your mind at ease that they can't get into anything they aren't supposed to.There's a lot of variety too! It isn't all little kid shows, there's something for all ages. The books, games, and videos offer hours and hours of entertainment and that's just what comes preloaded! You can always add whatever extra content you'd like and there's no WiFi required! Perfect for trips or when you just need some time to yourself, "Just take the Kindle and go!"I very highly recommend this product. One day when I'm rich, or perhaps next holiday season, I may consider upgrading to the Kindle Fire HD strictly for the 4G. Until then, I'm completely satisfied with what I have and I'm glad I made this my first e-reader!

Reviews.Title: Happy owner of the Kindle Fire!
Reviews.Author: Carol Schmidt
Reviews.Content: I made the decision to purchase the Kindle Fire after asking friends who currently have products like this.  My final decision to purchase this was because of the special offer I had from my company.  I like every feature about it.  I use the calendar/schedule app all the time.  It has come in useful to hand my elderly father to play games on as we wait for his appointments.  I like the feature of either using ear buds or not for audio books.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet!
Reviews.Author: Brian Delfosse
Reviews.Content: Bought for the kids.  They love it.  For the most part it is very easy to download apps and other items for them.  Only thing we dont like is if you dont turn off the Wi-Fi connection the battery life lasts 3-4 hours tops.  With WI-Fi off it goes a good 5 hrs of game play.  This special offer did not come with a wall charger which is definately needed.  The USB charger took 8-11 hrs to fully charge kindle.  The wall charger takes 4-5 tops.  Wish it was easier to have multiple users on it so kids can play single player game apps and be able to have there own saved games.  Otherwise very pleased with quality and screen resolution.  No need to have the HD version since the screen size is too small to really appreciate HD (they look almost exactly the same) and the speakers really aren't big enough to warrarnt needing the HD version.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire using Free Time
Reviews.Author: S. Siepel
Reviews.Content: This review is less about the technical aspects of the Kindle Fire and more about using the new Free Time App on the Kindle Fire. I purchased the Kindle Fire as a Christmas gift for my son and after a few days of him using it with the Free Time App this is what we found:Pros:1. Setting up the Free Time App and individual profiles is very easy.  With each profile you create you can set time limits for time spent on reading books, watching videos  and playing on apps.2. Once the child's profile is set up, it is easy to add books, apps and videos that you have in your Kindle library or from Amazon. There is one HUGE exception to this, which I will mention in the con section.3. Once you sign into a profile you must use a password to sign out of Free Time, even if the Kindle is turned off and turned on again.  This is a wonderful feature, as I don't have to worry about my son getting out of the Free Time app and having access to my other Kindle books, the web, etc.4. You don't have to worry about your child making unwanted purchases, as there is no ability to shop or purchase from Amazon when logged into the Free Time App.Cons:1. At this time you cannot add any of the Harry Potter books to a Free Time profile, even if you have downloaded them onto your Fire. This was a HUGE disappointment. It has to do something with the agreement Amazon has with JK Rowling and I hope they fix it soon.2. The Free Time app does not allow you to add music or audiobooks to your child's profile. Again, this was very disappointing. One of the selling points Amazon has made about the Fire is the ability to sync a Kindle book you are reading with the Audible Audiobook of the same title. Amazon even highlights the ability to read and listen to a book at the same as a feature that helps with reading comprehension. Unfortunately, you can not use this feature when using Free Time.3. You cannot view books checked out from the library using the Free Time app.4. We have found the battery life to only be about 4 hours.Note: If you are not logged into the Free Time App, your child has the ability to see and download anything in your Kindle library and make purchases from Amazon, including movies. This is very easy to fix using the Parental Controls:1. Touch the top of the screen of your Kindle Fire and a menu will drop down.2. Touch the "More" link, which will take you to the Settings menu.3. Scroll down settings menu to Parental Controls. Touch to go to next screen.4. Turn on Parental Controls. It will ask you to set a password.5. Once a password is set, the next screen will give you options of what you want controlled.6. Click on each option that you want, for example you can block web access, require a password be entered before any purchases are made, etc.This does not prevent them from downloading any books, apps or movies you have already purchased.  You can, however, turn off the Wi-Fi, which would prevent them from downloading items.All that being said, I have to say that my son has been totally enjoying his Kindle Fire and overall I feel good about the purchase, even with being disappointed in some of the features in is lacking.  I am hoping that Amazon will be addressing some of these issues in the very near future.

Reviews.Title: Gave as a Gift
Reviews.Author: itismedia
Reviews.Content: We gave this to my daughter for Christmas and it was a huge hit. It was easy to learn to use. I will say there are things that are easier to do on a computer than on the Kindle. Some things...such as the Amazon site, has such small tabs that even with a stylist it is hard to click on the right thing.Other than that one tiny thing....Awesome so far! I would recommend it to anyone as a first or low cost tablet choice. It does everything the "big guys" do.

Reviews.Title: Older Generation activities
Reviews.Author: Joyce Williams
Reviews.Content: I bought the kindle fire for my mother. the color, the sharpness and easiblity of use is great for her. she had improved her memory as well as her hand to eye coordinaton by playing the games (especially Angry Birds). She has told all her friends and they are ordering kindle fires also. To hear her talk to her friends about the fun she is having is worth any price. We really do back to our childhood-full circle. Thank you for that.

Reviews.Title: Kindle is great except...
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: We bought a Kindle Fire for our daughter at Best Buy.  It was the same price as on Amazon, but we didn't have to pay for shipping.  Anyways, the gift was a success and we were able to set her up with her own Amazon account and link the Kindle Fire to it.  So, after a few hours of use the battery was in need of a re-charge.  We plugged it into the computer and it wouldn't charge.  We used my Blackberry USB adapter and plugged it into the wall, and it was charging, but it wouldn't work (the Kindle Fire device itself).  I figured that I would let it charge and then it would be fine come morning.  Well, I was mistaken.  I tried to turn it on in the morning and it wouldn't boot up at all.  I took it to Best Buy and had their Geek Squad look at it.  They said that I was at least the 30th person TODAY with the same EXACT issue.  What was explained to me is that for some reason, the Kindle Fire will not take a charge from a computer via the USB cable or through a wall outlet with a USB adapter.  It has to be charged with a USB adapter while using a surge protector.  They proved it to me on the spot.  I asked why it wouldn't turn on even while not plugged in while I was at my house and they said that it probably had "too much" of a charge.  Regardless, it works now and things are just fine.  One other significant item to note is that the Kindle Fire is not provided with a USB adapter to charge, so you have to buy one separately.  It would be nice if one came with it.

Reviews.Title: There is a lot here in such a small tablet.
Reviews.Author: Johnny Rudick
Reviews.Content: This is the greatest little tool for the money.I would not waste my money on the more expensive competition.This just about does it all.No, it does not take pictures and you cannot make a phone call.But Who needs that when you have a cell phone in your pocket.:-)

Reviews.Title: No power adapter included, really,... REALLY?
Reviews.Author: Kendall
Reviews.Content: The only major complaint I have is there isn't a power adapter included just a USB cable (at least it is slightly longer than tiny one included with the iPad). I bought this as a Xmas present and was shocked to see it didn't include a power adapter. Luckily I realized it before wrapping it and was able to use the one for my iPad to charge it before wrapping it up. The speakers are a little weak and there arent any external controls for audio. It's fairly quick but is a little laggy occasionally. Overall it's a decent little tablet for the price.

Reviews.Title: ads and lack of charger are not really a problem
Reviews.Author: afisher29349
Reviews.Content: I don't know why people keep complaining about this kindle. It's wonderful and you can't beat the price. I got mine during cyber Monday deals and it was $129 but the regular price is great too. The only ads I get are on my lock screen. If you are getting ads on apps people it's probably the app. Also, a little tip before buying the wall charger. Try your cell phone charger first. I have an android phone and it works perfectly for charging my kindle and I didn't have to pay the extra money. Regardless, I still would have used the usb and let it charge overnight rather than spend the extra money but this works too. I don't think people should expect to get the same exact deal with no ads and wall charger if the price is cheaper. I think it's nice that Amazon made a more affordable kindle and the only other money I've spent is on my case which I would have purchased no matter which kindle I bought. My only complaint is the battery life could be better but all in all a great product.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Kevin
Reviews.Content: I got this so that I can always have a book to read all while saving me money. So far I'm not disappointed. I've found places to download thousands of free and new books. All I wish it would do is simulated page turning, and allow me to run certain apps requiring an “android device."

Reviews.Title: Good for kiddo.
Reviews.Author: Traci
Reviews.Content: Just bought for my 6 year old, so maybe working out the kinks. A little disappointed with charging hardware. Kindle comes w/ USB only & doesn't charge on our laptop. Luckily we can use ipad plug. Otherwise, extra expense. Also, the free apps& games are okay but I see some major spending in the future. Seems like everything costs extra. Overall I am happy w/ purchase but if you have the$$ ipad is better for grown ups. Buy the plug for charging!!

Reviews.Title: Very Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I got the kindle fire as a tool to use for classes and courses I'm taking online. Unfortunately I'm returning and going to ask for a refund. None of the kindle fire tablets support flash players. That means I can't watch mpeg/youtube videos that requires a flash player, meaning almost all of them. So I can't see my instructional videos from  my classes and/or other mini clips. If you are considering getting a kindle and you need flash player capability, kindles Will not be any good for you.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: smyers
Reviews.Content: I got my first Kindle (Kindle Fire) as an early Christmas present this year, and I absolutely love this e-reader!I love that its nice and light compared to fumbling with an actual book.  I feel that I read a lot more pages-per-sitting sessions with my kindle than I do a normal book too.  I like that I can quickly swipe to get to the next page, and it feels like it doesn't interfere with the story, and I can be fully emersed into what I'm reading.  The toggle-lock is a great feature too, so I can hold it any way I want to.I was hesitant at first about getting yet another screen to look at, since my job has me at a computer all day.  I was considering getting the Kindle Keyboard... but with the brightness settings and the different view features (sepia, white on black, etc), it's not as harsh as I thought it would be.  I also don't have eye fatigue that I thought I would get.  AND with the backlighting, I can read in bed without having a light on.For the price, and if you are new to e-readers and just want a simple, no-fuss one without too many bells and whistles - the Kindle Fire is definitely the way to go.Basically - you turn it on, easy set-up, download a book, and away you go!

Reviews.Title: I love my Kindle!
Reviews.Author: Susan G. Dale
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle Fire!  It's convenient for books and photos.  I don't use it view my email but I could.  My only gripe is that it's heftier than my old Kindle and tires my hands when reading.  It can do a lot more than my old one, though.  I give it 4 Stars because of it's added weight.

Reviews.Title: Not enough apps in Kindle Appstore, plus dislike how Amazon blocks other apps
Reviews.Author: A. Chen
Reviews.Content: About me:  this is my first Android device -- I have an iPhone 4, and my hubby has an iPad which I occasionally use.  I bought the Kindle Fire to have my own low-priced tablet (didn't want to spring $329 for an iPad mini), mostly for watching online videos.When I first got the KF, honestly I hated it.  Although there's an Android app available for my videos (dramafever), as well as for YouTube and several other apps I wanted, the Kindle Appstore did not have them, nor could I load apps from the Google Play appstore!  It was extremely frustrating and I almost returned the Kindle, but ended up spending two days doing searches & learning to sideload and work around Amazon's built-in disabling of certain really useful apps like GetJar and Go Launcher EX.  Now that I've finally figured out most of the issues, I'm okay with the Kindle but really wish Amazon had made it a more standard Android tablet, or at least be upfront that wasn't the case.PROS:- Price.  I got the "With Offers" version and honestly they don't bother me at all, so save your $30- Good choice if you only want to do very simple things with it with apps available through the Kindle appstoreCONS:- Disabling of being able to access non-Kindle apps unless you workaround via sideloading or rooting!!- Not enough apps in Kindle Appstore (if this was fixed, the above wouldn't be an issue)- The carousel is extremely annoying and I wish a choice of different interfaces would be offeredOverall, I'd say the kindle fire is a good choice if you only need apps from the Kindle Appstore, so check that out first before you buy!  Otherwise, you either need to be a little technical to sideload/root, or spend the extra bucks and get an iPad mini.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for the e-reader enthusiast with the extras
Reviews.Author: UrbanRedTag
Reviews.Content: This is a second purchase of the Kindle Fire. This was for a young pre-teen reading enthusiast who already owns a MacBook Air and iPhone. However, for reading purposes, this is the way to go, while having the vivid colors and having the capability to do online activities (NO facebook allowed for this young gal!). And, with the perfectly-sized 7" screen, it's mobile enough to fit in a bag and tote on trips (even in the car).

Reviews.Title: So Far so Goooooood!!!!
Reviews.Author: Roland
Reviews.Content: Like i wrote earlier about editing my reviews based on the performance of the Kindle fire, its been 2 weeks since i got this kindle for my wife, she's still overwhelmed and happy with her Kindle, she has not made any complaints except those written earlier and she says those are not enough to keep her Kindle away from her.My review/ ratings for this product would change as the weeks progress, it would either progress or retrogress.Before i bought the Kindle fire for my wife, i read lots and lots of reviews and my God, i wonder which other device has gotten more attention/ critic on amazon other than the kindle fire and HD, the reviews helped me make a decision between going for the Kindle fire rather than the HD, after all the camera on the HD functions only with Skype.its been a week since she started using this device and i must say, its been an awesome experience for her, even though i wish the packaging could have been better, opening the box, the device looked cute, not too sleek and also light, so far everything is functioning as expected, i wonder why Amazon refuses to include a wall charger to the device, it beats my imagination, we ended up connecting the head of a HTC charger with the USB cord and its been effective and efficient, the kindle stay without a charge for about 6 hrs.The internet has been stable and pretty fast compared to some reviews i have been reading, the one problem i have noticed is, the touch screen is about 1-2 seconds behind, you sometimes have to touch several times before an action is initiated, but its minimal, i love the layouts and also its very easy to use cos navigating around is quite simple.The video and sound quality is quite impressive if you consider the cost, the kindle has matured over the years and has become more than just a reading device she's happy with the kindle so far.

Reviews.Title: fastreader
Reviews.Author: fastreader
Reviews.Content: I was so happy when I got the kindle fire - I am an avid reader and won it in our church raffle.  The first thing I tried was the library - with >180K books I felt this was a great deal.  HOWEVER - when I got near the end of the book (99%), you must write your opinion and send it to facebook or one of the many other websites.  Well, I DONT HAVE FACEBOOK NOR DO I WANT FACEBOOK or any other popular sites.  I think there should be a way to opt out of giving your opinion. WHO CARES what I think about a book. The book is for me ONLY.  I don't know when I can return the book to the library and try another but I think this is a very bad flaw in the system.  Also, I tried buying books.  The same thing happens - they stick you at 99% unless you give an opinion.  BOO HISS!!!!!

Reviews.Title: It's solid and quick, but be certain that you are just looking to be entertained...
Reviews.Author: N. Martin
Reviews.Content: Ok, I didn't buy this from Amazon, but I did own one...for two days.  I got it as a replacement for the 7" Zeki that took an unfortunate fall that cracked the screen.  I checked around online, looking for a tablet that had a decent amount of memory and would be pretty durable.  I will admit that I can be rough on my things, which is why I usually buy the accidental coverage on purchases like this.Anyway, I will clear something up real quick before I continue.  I was looking for a tablet to be a cheap, ultra-portable word processor.  I managed to get my Mini USB Keyboard to work with my Zeki tablet before it broke.  I assumed (shame on me) that the Kindle Fire, being a mainstream tablet, would be able to accept a USB Keyboard just as easily.  No.  It can't.  The Kindle Fire can NOT be used to write documents, take notes, or anything that involves a keyboard.  Not with the factory settings out of the box, anyway.  There is a way to change some of the software of the Kindle, but unless you know what you are doing, I would not recommend this.While it wasn't going to work as far as the note-taking was concerned, it worked well for just about everything else.  YouTube videos streamed almost instantly and  keyboard was very accurate.  The unit was a bit on the heavy side, considering how small it was, but I felt it was more of durability thing than anything else.Some of the things I did not like was the ads that smack you the moment the tablet loads up.  It sort of knocks the message home that the Fire is a mode of marketing for Amazon rather than a mini computer you own.  There was also no background to personalize or modify.  Maybe I didn't tinker with it enough, but once loaded up, the Kindle has your apps in your face.  And the icons are HUGE, as if they didn't trust their touch hardware to be entirely spot on.  Finally, the one update I got ended up locking up the Kindle.  I had to check on the Fire Forums to find out that I had to hold the power button for 20 seconds to get it to reboot.Hopefully, this will wave off a handful of people looking for a PDA in this.  It is a entertainment tool, first and foremost.  If you are looking for something to play games or stream movies on, this is one of the better budget tablets on the market.

Reviews.Title: New Kindle Fire v2 has screen bleed problem
Reviews.Author: midus
Reviews.Content: Own all the kindles except for HD series. Just received the new v2. The OS is newer than the v1 (when is amazon, if ever, going to upgrade this OS?).Gone is the shiny front bezel, replaced with matt. The power button feel is different compared to v1. In v1, it was a soft press feeling. In v2, you have to press a little harder. Frankly I prefer v1's feel.Now here comes the part that's a bit disappointing. The screen bleeds are the bottom. On turning on the kindle fire v2 for the first time, I noticed two "headlights" at the bottom of the screen. This is very noticeable in a darkened room when the tablet is booting up. After booting up, the bleed cannot be seen unless the background is a dark color.Also the bleed is not noticeable in direct sunlight.The does not happen with the v1. Looks like corners were cut or QC from the factory is not as good as the v1.That may have made me feel this v2 product feel cheap. Although hyped about faster processor, new UI features etc.The UI now. I liked the ADs. But I didn't like the fact that my main screen bottom row where I could formerly see my other items in Fire v1 is now replaced by "other customers also bought these items"*Edit after using it for one day*The fonts are much better than v1 kindle. Seems to have lost the ability to pinch and zoom pictures from within kindle books.*Edit after using for another few days*Pinch and zoom problem seems to be book related. Another book I'm reading, pinch and zoom works fine.Battery life seems to run out faster than Fire v1

Reviews.Title: Charger Problems
Reviews.Author: VictoryaZwerk
Reviews.Content: I got this Kindle yesterday and when I plug it in to my computer to charge it will not charge. So I plugged it into the wall and it is charging fine. Disappointed that is it not charging with my computer.Everything else is working properly. There should be a better tutorial. The one that it starts with is very simple. It took me forever to find my wishlist to buy a new book.I was under the impression that it was supposed to come registered. It did not, when I got it I had to enter my account information for it to be registered.Other than that I love it. I have had no other problems. Will be back later to update!

Reviews.Title: Christmas gift for child? Set up Wi-Fi and allow a few hours for FreeTime update to download
Reviews.Author: murtrayden
Reviews.Content: I ordered this Kindle during the Cyber Monday sale and it arrived the next day (Amazon Prime shipping). I bought this because of the FreeTime parental controls and was disappointed to not find the app pre-installed. After a frustrating phone conversation with Kindle 'experts' and finally just leaving it (connected to wi-fi) for several hours while I went to school, the system updated itself. When I got home, FreeTime was in the Apps library and I was able to set up my daughter's profile, videos, apps and time limits. FreeTime looks like a good tool, but I wish it included music. My advice: use "settings" to set lock screen pass code and parental control passwords prior to setting up FreeTime.The settings and store were easy to navigate. The touch screen was responsive. I used the charger from a phone and it worked, but connection was a little loose. I will try out other cords to see if this can be resolved. The video quality was reasonable for the price ($129) and a weather app that I tried out looked great. Netflix worked with no issues.I own both a Kindle e-ink 6" and an iPad, but I think this Kindle Fire was worth the cost (for an additional device), especially for a family that doesn't use cable tv, but has digital video subscriptions/content. Don't expect an iPad, but for the price, you can't beat being able to easily watch or read your Amazon content (and set separate child content settings), listen to music, listen to your Audible content, use a web browser, calendar, email, popular games, Netflix and have Kindle books read to you with the screen reader. Don't get it if you want HD content/screen, want to connect to a TV, or want the speakers that the HD model has (this Fire has both speakers on the top of the unit).*Please realize that you will not fit many video downloads onto this device. It only has about 5GB available for additional apps, videos, books etc. so will be best suited for someone that mainly uses the device on wi-fi with cloud content or subscriptions.*This Kindle Fire will be a Christmas gift, so I plan to update this review at a later time.

Reviews.Title: Kindle fire
Reviews.Author: marli dias
Reviews.Content: The screen is simply amazing, extremely sharp.It's a bit complicated download apps.this does not have the Portuguese languageMovies and series in English only

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Dee
Reviews.Content: It was a birthday present for my teenager. She loves it! Very easy to use and keeps the charge really well.

Reviews.Title: Good for indoor reading and games
Reviews.Author: Linda Hood
Reviews.Content: I like the Kindle Fire but it has to be charged after about 4 hours of use and I can't use it outside unless I am in the shade but it is much better than my other one (Kindle Touch)

Reviews.Title: Loved!
Reviews.Author: Ross Williams
Reviews.Content: I am super happy with this product and It was delivered on time.  Very happy with the fire! Highly recommend the fire.

Reviews.Title: learning the ropes
Reviews.Author: Sandra Smith
Reviews.Content: I've had the Kindle for 72 hours.  So far I'm pleased with it and with Amazon Prime.  Son-in-law was trying to suggest I wanted another tablet, but I like what I have so far.One question:  will I be able to use it for email in Europe?

Reviews.Title: Its great
Reviews.Author: S. Thompson "movie girl"
Reviews.Content: I loved my kindle. But I absolutely love my k. fire!!! Best ever. My sister got a nook, my hubby got a ipad and they both love my kindle. Hahaha

Reviews.Title: Love it !
Reviews.Author: knokey
Reviews.Content: This is my second Kindle.  Love them both.  This was a gift for my daughter. I only wished they emphasized that the charger is separate, and perhaps offered it with the Kindle.

Reviews.Title: I love my kindle
Reviews.Author: Zanobia
Reviews.Content: The only problem I had was that if you are not careful with plugging and unplugging the Kindle it may become loose and not charge properly, the good thing is you can call customer service and they'll send you a new one because it's covered under your manufactured warranty. I had my kindle replaced 5 times because of charging issues because my son would always yank the plug out of my Kindle when I wasn't looking and it made it loose.

Reviews.Title: better than my HP laptop
Reviews.Author: Ms Chie Vious
Reviews.Content: I like my HP laptop, but I can't live without my Kindle Fire!I take it everywhere: in the car, college campus, in the S&M; shed, the kitchen, in bed - everywhere.  I set up playlists on Youtube and watch British TV shows just about all day and listen to music all night.Once charged, the Fire lasts around 8 hours before it dies. It's very light and inconspicuous in your backpack - safer than carrying a laptop in the city at night.  I barely use my smartphone; I use the Fire unless I need to phone someone.My nieces are 12 and 8 and they are addicted to this.  I got my Fire as a gift but I'm buying one for the girls for xmas.  There are so many free apps/games available that the two girls arrived at an agreement: they take turns playing with it after one "dies" or loses the game they just played. Then they pass the fire.  It's a real pleasure having Fire in the car on long trips as it keeps the girls QUIET and content for hours - nothing else has ever been this successful at shutting them up.If you have kids and you're thinking about getting a PC or laptop for them, go to Best Buy and test out some Fire and consider getting them Fire first because kids LOVE playing with Fire.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire 7'', LED display is so muh fun!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: jeepstang65
Reviews.Content: It was easy to use, the screan is very clear. The games are very much like the arcade's,the touch screan is so sencitive to the touch.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Toti
Reviews.Content: For the price this is great!  Reading books and connecting to the internet with the WiFi is is easy!  Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Love, Love, Love, Our Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: The Wooleys
Reviews.Content: We have owned it since December 2011.(So almost a year now) We use our Kindle Fire everyday.  For the internet, playing games, reading books, listening to music. Never want a day without it! Highly recomend.

Reviews.Title: It wont charge....
Reviews.Author: h.buckingham
Reviews.Content: I love my kindle fire!! I have a few books and i get the free app of the day everyday. I got mine in march of 2012 and then around September it stopped charging. I had to put it in a certain angle and it took a long time to set that up. So I returned it and got a new one. It is November now and its doing the same thing!!! I put it on the charger around midnight then looked at it at 9:38a.m.-11%, 12:16p.m. 21%, 5:14p.m.- 26%, and this one made me super mad 8:00- 21% and then 8:50 it was 20% it lost 6 percent!!! And I charged with the orange light on and the screen light off for about 9 hours and it only charged 20%......I am going to return it tomorrow and hopefully get a new one because I love the kindle. I am hopeing to try and use the HD one cause the original fire let me down big time. My 2 friends, 2 cousins, aunt, and grandma  have one and that has never happened to them!!

Reviews.Title: Great buy!! I love it.
Reviews.Author: Robert Glazier
Reviews.Content: I mostly use my Kindle Fire for reading books, but I also like to play games.  I am VERY pleased with it.  It is a great buy!!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: younggramof6
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised on how good the Kindle Fire works!! I honestly had expected to not be able to navigate since I currently have an IPhone and was going to get the IPad, but when I saw the price of the Kindle Fire I figured if I didn't like it I would give it to my husband or one of my grandkids, but, I really love it and now am considering purchasing another one for my husband as he and I play tug of war with the one we have now, lol!!! I do recommend this product if you love to read or play games, with the exception of Bingo Bash, I have been able to play scrabble (one of my favs) and Words with Friends!!! Thank You for making a tablet that is affordable yet very functional!!!

Reviews.Title: Gets the job done!!
Reviews.Author: illy514l
Reviews.Content: I love the kindle fire, it works like a mini computer. No need to have a big system. Travel everywhere with it.Thank you for a great product!!!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Sylvia
Reviews.Content: I really like my Kindle Fire. It's easy to use and very handy,I got a cover for it that folds,so it's so easy!! I would reccomend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: canadian point of view
Reviews.Author: boyd 2
Reviews.Content: I own a kindle touch and loved it enough to upgrade to a kindle fire. Had i known about the hd modle i would have purchaced it. The fire is a great upgrade but because i have an address in canada and one in Bellingham i cannot access the apps and other options that a US person can. I hope they open up this maket to Canadian customers so i can fully use my fire.

Reviews.Title: Kinddle Fire 7"
Reviews.Author: CMR11
Reviews.Content: I Was one of those person that thought could not loose the book, but gave in and purchase Kindle Fire..I am very pleased with it, still learning all the features it has but love it.. Very please with purchase easy to take with me on the go, and purchase a pen to help with navigating thru it.. Four Stars well made.

Reviews.Title: kindle fire
Reviews.Author: Norman Moss
Reviews.Content: I really like the E-reader capability but should have opted for the more expensive one with 3G and maybe GPS. Apps are limited and when browsing the Apps, there are no details as to what they do or how they work. Maybe if your a high tech geek you would know, but the everyday citizen does not. Overall, I'm disappointed.

Reviews.Title: I truly love my kindle fire.
Reviews.Author: linn
Reviews.Content: I received my fire last Christmas, and I truly love it.  I really wasn't certain if I would like a kindle instead of a book, but I do.  It fits perfectly in my purse to take anywhere.  I can access the internet to purchase books, watch netflix, check facebook.....You get the picture. It has a larger screen than my cellphone for these activities.  I just change the font size, so I do not even need my glasses when reading. It keeps my place in the book, without hassle.I rarely go anywhere without it.

Reviews.Title: does all you could want it to do
Reviews.Author: frisky
Reviews.Content: Great for travel. Beats carrying a lot paperbacks.Games are a great distraction when waiting for flights. Keeps the kids entertained and allows you to keep up with your e-mails. For the price it is an excellent buy.

Reviews.Title: reading books again .
Reviews.Author: Francine Scott
Reviews.Content: My is everything I hoped it would be. It makes reading books easier than ever .The size is just right. My games are handy if I'm stuck somewhere waiting for who or what ever . I love it .

Reviews.Title: ON FIRE!
Reviews.Author: Wendy Gerber
Reviews.Content: Love the new KINDLE FIRE! The only thing I could possibly ask for is a 'real' instruction manual. Finding information already loaded into the Kindle can be a bit perplexing for someone NOT as tech savvy as most of the world.The FIRE constantly amazes me what it can do...and what can be done with it. I bought it specifically so I wouldn't have to drag my laptop when I went visiting out of state...it works wonderfully for that purpose. Battery lasts longer than I anticipated.Love it!

Reviews.Title: Broke after 6 months - would NOT recommend
Reviews.Author: Hayley
Reviews.Content: I loved my Kindle Fire until a few days ago when it quit out of the blue after 6 months. It got hot one day and never turned on again. I took it to Best Buy yesterday and they said that there was nothing that I could except throw it away. They said Kindle Fire's were going down hill fast and they have seen a lot of these fried hard drives recently. I will be buying an IPAD Mini next and would not recommend anyone buying a Kindle Fire.

Reviews.Title: An inexpensive, limited tablet device
Reviews.Author: Martine
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire is a great tablet for the price, but only if you're going to use it in a limited capacity. I used the device mainly for browsing the internet, playing simple card games, and sometimes reading books. The touch response is a little slow and sometimes inaccurate, so if you're going to play intense games, I don't think this is the right device for you. I also noticed after a few weeks use, the device would freeze intermittently and I would need to reboot the device. I ended up getting an iPad because I wanted a bigger screen to browse the internet with and I wanted a more responsive device. But I think if you need an inexpensive tablet option that you're going to use in a limited capacity, then this is a great option.

Reviews.Title: Great item. No instructions
Reviews.Author: Darlyn
Reviews.Content: My biggest hangup with buying this brand new is that there is no form of any kind of instructions included.  You are left to fumble around and figure out where all the buttons are and what they do.  Then no place to archive books, can't have wallpaper as it nulls the special price.  Couldn't figure how to load pictures except on caro7sel, etc.  I prefer my NOOK as I can easily download music and pics, bought the 16gb plus added another 32 in removable SD card.  Came with instructions, easy to navigate, for virtually same price brand new sealed box.

Reviews.Title: No charger, booklet, or screenprotector; works well, easy on the eyes
Reviews.Author: S. Taylor "dionaea"
Reviews.Content: Took advantage of the Cyber Monday sale to buy the version without ads, and it arrived on Friday by regular mail. I was startled to see only a USB cable, no separate plug-in charger, no instructon booklet, and not even a simple protective sleeve. It doesn't even have a thin piece of plastic wrap over the screen as a temporary protection against fingerprints. A small black card gave very brief info so I could at least locate the turn-on button. It had about 1/5 battery charge, enough to enable it to promptly connect to my Wi-Fi. For those having trouble connecting.....is your Wi-Fi password protected?  I had to enter my Belkin Router password before it would connect, and then it set itself up fast and smoothly.Delightedly, all the eBooks I've gotten from Amazon for free and downloaded to my desktop computer through their "Kindle for PC" option were there waiting for me in the "Cloud", and I merely clicked on each book shown, selected "Download", and put each one on the Kindle itself.  Since I got this mostly to use as an eReader whenever and wherever I might be, my preference was to have them on the Kindle itself.As for the lack of an instruction booklet, I'm scrambling now to check out help sites (CNet has a good one with walkthrough videos from basic to advanced). That's how I learned about how to access some menus, including the one to see my System info with Serial Number and the place to add a security code. Right now, the thing is turning itself off as soon as I put it down, so I need to find how to set it to stay on until I want it off - and how to turn it off other than pressing the power button (if there is another option for that).  The Help and Feedback area preloaded on the Kindle are less than useless, IMHO.The touch required seems a bit variable, from fairly firm to very light, depending on what area you're in and what you're trying to access, but with practice I'm getting better at applying the right amount of pressure.The screen loves fingerprints! I'll be visiting a local B&M; store to buy a plug-in charger and a screen protector tomorrow - don't want to wait to get those! I bought the Targus Vuscape Protective Case for Kindle Fire, which fits perfectly.

Reviews.Title: Charger
Reviews.Author: Maureen Mone
Reviews.Content: Very suprised that this device did not come with a charger and that is additional.  Was not advised when purchasing, so needed to scramble when I did not receive the adapter!

Reviews.Title: CHEAP COMPUTER!
Reviews.Author: Timmie Wayne
Reviews.Content: Love the Kindle Fire as an easy way to play games, Facebook, do stuff online and general computing without having to get to the "computer room". Now if the batteries only lasted longer!

Reviews.Title: my view on the new kindle vs the 1st and 2nd gen
Reviews.Author: Psycho Chick
Reviews.Content: There are things i like and things that i dont. i dont like the constant "what other bought" on the bottom of my screen. what do i care what others bought? i do like that it hasnt over heated like the 1st and 2nd. i dont like that some of my apps that worked just fine on the 1st and 2nd dont work right on this one. i do hope updates will be coming out to fix this before too long. the bigger hard drive is nice though. the lower price is also nice. the speakers still suck like the 1st and 2nd. i also dont like that i bought mine brand new and there is a mark under the screen that just wont go away. its small but still annoying. the contact list on this one i really dont like. i wish the one from the first and second was still in use. it was much more useful. dont get me wrong. i love my kindle and use it all the time. its great for entertainment and gaming. watching videos is wonderful. i let both of my kids play with it and they just love it. i love how i can turn off wifi and not have to worry about what my kids might buy without my knowing. it allows me to be able to had them it without always watching what they touch. my youngest has learned so much from the preschool apps that i can get from amazon. doctor appts are much easier now since they dont have to be bored. some places even have wifi so if they want they can even watch something on netflix or off my cloud. all the kindles are easy to use and understand. ive even managed to talk family and friends into buying one. some strangers too. i will be getting the kindle hd after christmas. im looking forward to the camera. :) i do believe the kindles should have an hdmi out though. it would be nice to put stuff on the big tv when i wanted to share it or on a friend or familys tv to share with them or watch something with them. better yet, a hdmi and a wireless signal for the smart tvs. yes, that would make the kindles much more handy. im sure one day amazon will get there. giving the costumers what they want will make them more money after all. im looking forward to that day. will i continue to recommend a kindle to others...heck yes. these things are very handy and helpful, fun and enjoying and i will continue to play with mine daily.

Reviews.Title: what a drag
Reviews.Author: Margot Ferguson
Reviews.Content: I'll just add my voice to the chorus of folks complaining about the lack of a charger. Had to spend an additional $20 to get the necessary charger. I thought at first you could just connect it to the computer via USB. Not so, as my grandson and I found out pretty quickly. Pretty cheap, Amazon. I don't think I've ever bought anything that didn't come with a charger. This was a gift so I didn't get to choose. This is my first experience with anything like this product and so will wait awhile to see if I like using it enough to say that I would have bought it for myself.Kansas City

Reviews.Title: I LOVE THIS DEVICE!
Reviews.Author: Jayson San Gabriel
Reviews.Content: Usually a computer or a laptop comes in handy whenever w have internet needs but this device is revolutionary!I just love this device from bit to bit!

Reviews.Title: Title: Kindle Fire (8 GB) 5.0 out of 5.0 stars.
Reviews.Author: sludwig
Reviews.Content: Kindle Fires are great; they have an amazing selection of apps. This item is good for all ages. If you are a 12 year old boy, there are apps where you can shoot things and be a ninja assassin. If you are a 6 year old girl, you can dress your Barbie or be a world famous cook in a restaurant. For adults you can read or even run a business in the palms of your hands. It has a connection to internet as well. Other good things about the Kindle Fire are that it is very lightweight, it has really good graphics, and the touch-screen is surprisingly accurate. Once, I downloaded an app and was extremely well done and the graphics were amazing. It's a fun thing to do by yourself, by that I mean you don't need anyone to play games with, and it's very easy to learn how to use. The quality of the product is amazing; it's definitely the best tablet out there for its price and durability. The Kindle Fire only cost $200.00, and compared to the Ipad3 which is now priced at $500.00, it's a great deal. The only downside of the Kindle Fire is the loading time of apps, but if you have patience the wait is surely worth it. I would give the kindle a 5 star rating. I love the Kindle and hope you take my review into consideration.

Reviews.Title: Like the KF2 with reservations
Reviews.Author: Cold toes
Reviews.Content: I have a regular Kindle, got the KF 2nd gen. for a gift. I like it but seems to be a tad buggy. There is also steady stream of annoying ads but the most annoying thing is the inability to take items off the carousel. They keep reappearing for some reason, even after they have been removed from carousel and not viewed. The image of some items also stays on the carousel after touching "remove from device". Maybe I'm doing something wrong but other KF users in my family can't figure it out either.

Reviews.Title: I wouldn't get the kindle Fire again
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: For my wife and I the kindle fire has been nothing but a headache, if I could return it I would.  We have a 20 month-old and we take frequent road trips so the ability to play movies from anywhere was important to us, our daughter really like Caillou.  The first issue we have with the fire is that it will frequently tell us that there is a problem with play back of videos, connect to wifi.  After taking to tech support they say the licences need to be "refreshed" ever couple of weeks.  That is a lie, because we will watch a video while connected to wifi the same day and it won't work 2hrs later.  If you do connect to wifi, and play the video it does seem to "refresh" the license, but when you are driving and don't have access to wifi you are out of luck (tech support say just stop at McDonald's and use there wifi - not always an option).  Sometimes we have had to completely wipe the video library and re-download the videos.  I have talked to customer support many times about this and all I get is 'this is a known issues, sorry.  We can try trouble shooting.' Tech support hasn't provided any timeline for when it will be fixed.  The second issue the we have with the fire is the native email app will at time send multiple version of the same email while the email is being composed.  The recipient will see an email a few sentences, then another email with a few more sentences, and then the whole email.Bottom line - If you are look for a stable platform for video watching avoid Amazon hardware, which is sad because they have the best digital selection.  My wife and I are thinking about buying a portable DVD player and a Caillou DVD because the fire is just not reliable.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD, The tablet/e-reader meant for everyone!
Reviews.Author: Lana Ford
Reviews.Content: I was wanting a tablet but I'm a really big book reader. I decided to get the Kindle Fire HD and I love it. It is very user friendly and I am able to have all my same apps (some I did have to pay $.99 for, so not all the same apps have the same price, you may have to pay depending) that on my Android phone on my Kindle. Its slim and light design allows it to fit right in my purse and makes it easy to travel with. It has an outstanding battery life also. Charge it up once and it will last you all week (well, depending on your own personal usage). The WiFi capabilities allow me to get online anywhere there is a WiFi connection. I am also able to sync my other Android devices through the Kindle App! Forget your Kindle at home? No problem! The Kindle App gives you instant access to everything in your Kindle including your books, magazines, and so much more. Shop titles from your phone and access them later on ur Kindle! My favorite part of having the kindle though is having the Prime membership. It's absolutely worth the cost. Prime members get instant access to thousands of book titles (including 'renting' titles from other members... FREE), movies, (current movies that are out, not titles that we've never heard of), TV shows, 2nd day shipping on all items on Amazon, plus so much more!!! I happen to have several magazine subscriptions that now get delivered wirelessly right to my Kindle each month. The Kindle helps me in my life to stay Eco Friendly. Have your morning newspaper delivered right to ur fingertips! No more going outside in ur bathrobe having to momentarily endure the hot & cold temperatures or the conditions of rain & snow anymore! I recommend this tablet/e-reader for anyone, especially those who travel often! Send an email, shop online, read a book, watch a movie or catch up on ur favorite tv show! No matter what you're in the mood for, the Kindle Fire HD is the best tablet/e-reader out on the market! Whether you like to read, shop, watch movies or TV, the Kindle Fire HD is the tablet/e-reader for you!

Reviews.Title: For the price and no-worry Android feel, it's a no brainer
Reviews.Author: DP07
Reviews.Content: About me:  - Technically savvy  - Wanted a tablet for mainly email and web research  - First tablet  - Smartphone owner (WP7)Let's get right into it...CONS:#1 The power button is hard to find in the dark, small, hard to press, and could not me more closely located to the plug! The only more inconvenient place to put the power button would be inside the unit.#2 A little on the heavy side, but if that gives it better battery life, then so be it. A unit where the battery detaches would be cool, so one can, say as a passenger in a car, break a heavy battery off and put it next to you and enjoy a very light tablet.#3 Could use more plain edging. It's hard to hold for long periods without getting your hand into the interactive area. It's just not comfortable to hold.#4 UI mistakes that take up room for no apparent reason. Like I constantly need to know the battery life? This is not a 24" desktop LED screen, so design smarter.#5 The built in email client is lacking. Apparently, if I am not mistaken, there is no way to bring up an email full screen. This seems odd given that we are knowingly using a smaller screen. See #4 above.#6 Carousel seems unwieldy. Stuff just wants to reclaim it's presence there for no reason.PROS:#6 Sufficiently fast for browsing web and email.#7 Standard plug - microUSB.#8 Inexpensive#9 Less worry than your typical Android tablet because presumably Amazon is more careful with what it puts/allows on there. If you only want it for email and surfing, why add the worry?#10 Decent build qualityFor $160 you should not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: I like it well enough.
Reviews.Author: justsomeguy
Reviews.Content: I needed another toy for the plane.  I also really want to read those Harry Potter books, but don't want anyone on the subway to know what I'm reading (I'm a grown male!).  So, I am on a business trip and decide to pick up one of these things.  Really, I just need something to pass the time on planes.I was gonna buy one of those black and white book-only deals, the Nook, one of the other versions of the Kindle - but settled on this one.  Really cause it was the best that Best Buy had in stock, and also cause I didn't care what I got.I do love Amazon.  I am an Amazon prime member, so knowing that influenced my decision.  Being a prime member allows you access to some books for free - such as the Harry Potter ones.So what do I like about this thing?  It's cool.  It has a mainly touch-screen thing.  It allows you to download books and read them even in dim light.  It has access to apps and games similar to what you have on your iPhone.  You can watch movies either via Netflix or Amazon (being a Prime member helps here too).So what DON'T I like?  There's no camera, not that I need it.  It's not HD.  And hey - this thing is already near $200 so what the heck.  Why not?  Yah it plays music, but it's not like you can copy music onto it from itunes (yah I know - buy an ipad). The speed is ok but I've found some lag here and there.---Overall?  It's ok.  I don't think it's particularly good for web-stuff.  Downloading books is all right - but as a Prime member - you can download/rent them for free, but only "one book a month" which is garbage.  Otherwise you have to pay for them.  I think it's overpriced for what it can do.  Really that's the long and short of it.

Reviews.Title: A great device !!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Kindle Fire 7", LCD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GBI purchases the Kindle Fire2 no HD for 159.00 at BestBuy the first day it came out. I wanted a tablet to read my kindle books,watch movies,surf internet.and facebook and some other things.This is a good device. Responsive screen and good graphics even without hd. I am amazed at some of the things it does and it is very quick when hooked up to wifi.To me its a quality media device. I have a few Apple Products and think they are great too but this is Kindle Fire is a great gamer and movie watcher. The speakers and sound are excellent as far as I am concerned. Facebook caster app is quick. The display is good. For me this works and is fun. I feel like i got more than my moneys worth. i like the control of the keyboard and it feels durable not flimsy. All my books are on Kindle and i love the option of talk to speak on books thats a nice touch and to be able to adjust the speed of talk to speak is sweet. Theres still alot to explore its not just and ereader its decent and way worth the money for what I want it for Netflix works great . if you use Amazon apps this is a great tablet not cheap! but costs little!Update: Battery is very good too! I really like the keyboard control. Honestly for all it does quite competitive and amazing for 159.00 Apple and Google now have a sales competitor. How many Apple users have kindle app and netflix and amazon cloud on ipad well this stacks up if your an amazon user ..food for thought!Update: you are able to have multiple email accounts and the wifi sensor connects to wifi signal strongly more than any other device in my house. I watched movies today off Netflix and even without the hd fire just the fire it was,an excellent picture without hiccups.Also I love the design and the size the battery was great about 9-10 hours on line videos and music plus reading and games. I am impressed with this device.!I can't say enuf about this Kindle fire and I recently decided for Xmas I will purchase Amazon Prime and it is way worth it with all that you get . some of theupgrades on this gen 2 is amazing. the ease of use and the screen definition is awesome considering the 159...price jus incredible.I read lots book  and I use Amazon Mp3 store app. the quality sound on a tablet makes a difference. Enjoyable tablet! movies play nicely...no brainer screen definition and angles and text stay true not all tablets can say that . Standard operating system with a silky smooth polished feel .I love the portability and texts are awesome on web on kindle books documents this is first class . The keyboard is very responsive..even though many would consider this .  low-end Kindle Fire because of the price but honestly you will be very very surprised especially after looking around and trying other devices!!Update: The more I use this device the more I love it. I just think it's a no brainer . The display still amazes me and the quality and user friendliness. I am surprised of all the negative adds. The 360 News app is great better than any Iv used because its programmed to headline the topics you are interested in and it has great features.The thing with this Kindle Fire is that it works easily and very well for the price! I actually would of paid more because it is that good!UPDATE: I updated to the Fire Hd model but I still think the Regular Kindel Fire is better than good the HD is great too!!

Reviews.Title: Amazon, dont tell me one thing and then give me something diferent
Reviews.Author: Raul "Raul"
Reviews.Content: I just bought a regular Kindle Fire and I got the 2nd generation.  Two days ago I called Amazon to ensure that it does not have the advertisements and suggestions which prompted me to return my Kindle Fire HD.  I was assured that it does not.I got the Kindle today and to my disappointment it does have suggestions and advertisements.I don't know how else to voice my disappointment and frustration.  It is not what I paid for.  It is not what I asked Amazon.  It is not what I was assured over the phone.  It is the reason why I preferred the original Kindle Fire and I returned the Kindle Fire HD.It appears this is a hard thing for such a company to get done.I am going to sit on this for 2 days.  Please remove all the suggestions and advertisements from my system.  I am ok with the suggestions and advertisement on the website, but not on a machine I paid for.When I send this Kindle Fire (third one), I will never ever go for such tablet, nor for my family.  I will seek technology somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: This was a gift for my birthday and can't even charge it quick
Reviews.Author: tara
Reviews.Content: So I was so excited about getting this Kindle Fire for my birthday from my step-dad and brother. Not so excited now, actually, a bit bummed for the fact it didn't come with a wall charger. So I get to read a little and watch a little and then it has to stay on the charger connected to my laptop most of the day. Times are hard right now so I can't afford to purchase this $20 wall adapter for my kindle. I even tried using my android charger with the same Amps and it doesn't even work.  So honestly, what's the point of having it if I can do the same thing with my laptop and not having to worry about the darn thing charging all day. Amazon sure had to find a way to get their money some how especially since they are letting these machines go for cheap prices starting at $159. If I would have known this I would have just asked to get the money towards buying a tablet from the store.

Reviews.Title: Listen to you customers
Reviews.Author: Un-Kindle
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a vacation where I was exposed to a Kindle. Being an iPad user in the 3rd generation I was very much impressed especially with the weight, size and non-clare of the screen. Since I read a lot I was ready for a Fire as primary reading device.Now, looking at the reviews I will stay away from a purchase until Amazon comes to senses and provides a complete product package that includes a charger - c'mon guys a charger costs you maybe 2 bugs and what's up with the ad's? That alone drives me away. Why would I want to have a product that does the most annoying in the world! But this being not enough the company that annoys you charges you 10% of the device cost for removing this "feature". These are the cheapest sales tricks one usually finds when buying $10 knock-off watches at oriental or asian street market. Do you really believe you get that much return from your ads? I am done and will look for other sources for products like electronics, books I (used to) buy through Amazon. I will unsubscribe from Amazon ads immediately.I have been a loyal Amazon customer for years. Its good to know there are alternatives.

Reviews.Title: Tired of compromising
Reviews.Author: carrie
Reviews.Content: We already had 2 Kindles in the house when, after replacing 3 other tablets, we just gave up the mayhem of trying to keep sufficient warranty coverage on them and bought the Kindle.Yup, some of the apps are different.  This second one attached to my account belongs to my 13 year old son.  I like having the ability to see exactly what's D/L without having to irk him in the process.  He knows they're linked, he whines about my library books showing up on his carousel. I hadn't thought of that as a plus when I went for tried and true quality, but hey, you take 'em where you get 'em.I always held the ultimate standard as being, "Would you buy another?" and the answer is an unequivocal, "Yes."

Reviews.Title: Feeling Lucky?
Reviews.Author: Angela Hanson
Reviews.Content: My Kindle Fire lasted 18 months.  When it was functional, it was fine.  During the 18 months of ownership, I actually used it very little, and there were many months of nonuse.  18 months after purchasing it, I pulled it out of a drawer and charged it because my kids wanted to play some games.  It is charged, but it is not functional.  It goes to the "Kindle Fire" screen and looks like it is starting up and stays there for about 30 seconds then it goes to the unlock screen. I can unlock it. It stays unlocked for a few seconds (I can briefly navigate) and then it goes back to the "Kindle Fire" screen and the process repeats itself all over again.  There is no way to even accomplish a hard reset with it behaving this way.  Powering it on and off does nothing to change this sequence of events.I spoke to Amazon's customer service about this and they could do nothing.  I was told it is a hardware failure on the device and since I am out of the 1 year warranty there was nothing they could do but give me a discount at getting another one (a discount of about 20%).  I expected more from this product and certainly expected it to last longer than it did.  I thought the 20% discount was piddly and I don't feel like playing roulette with another Kindle considering that mine failed after so little use.  On a bright note, customer service did tell me that "some" people have had theirs for 4-5 years and "few" customers report any issues.  I must be an anomaly.  At any rate, I was very disappointed in the Kindle Fire and equally disappointed that nothing could be done to fix it.  If you have the cash and feel that luck is on your side, take a gamble.  Hopefully it will work out for you; hopefully you will be a part of those "some" and "few" categories the customer service associate referenced.

Reviews.Title: Warranty and Replacement
Reviews.Author: Susan R Lasher
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift for my mother-in-law and she really liked it, her not being really computer savvy, BUT as soon as the warranty ran out the Kindle stopped working and Amazon does not seem to care they just want me to buy another Kindle.  I feel like I have been scammed and am not eager to give Amazon more money for another device that mysteriously stops working right after the warranty has expired.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Anastasia Guerrero
Reviews.Content: I would love to rate five stars because I love it for reading but I also bought it so I can watch netflix when i need to be quiet. Since netflix isn't compatible with my kindle fire I'm completely disappointed. I'm really considering going back to the nook if there isn't an update with kindle for netflix.

Reviews.Title: Can't use the Kindle Fire ordered without purchasing attachment
Reviews.Author: Nyra M. Richardson
Reviews.Content: I received just the Kindle Fire. No battery charger attachment was included.  Can't use the Kindle until I purchasethis component.

Reviews.Title: Refurbished kindle fire
Reviews.Author: mommyof1
Reviews.Content: Has not been really holding it's charge, kind of disappointed seeing as i spent $80 for this...i thought it would be a little better, had i known that it would be acting up like this i would have spent the extra $20 for the other one which was "New"..Lesson learned

Reviews.Title: Battery life
Reviews.Author: Judy Berryhill
Reviews.Content: The size, color display, and legibility are fine.  The problem is it will not hold a charge even when it is off!  If I unplug it after charging it fully it loses 40% overnight while off.  That is one of the reasons I return the original one. I planned  to contact you about this Kindle when I return home and have all the pertinent information at hand.  I'm currently out of state and will return in a few weeks.  Overall I think the Kindle is the best thing since sliced bread!!  The amount  I have been reading as increased increased dramatically, plus my wife uses the account and reads on an I-pad..

Reviews.Title: Completely useless
Reviews.Author: Andres Timoteo Jorge Mulcahy
Reviews.Content: Obviously made a mistake in choice . No skype!!Am trying to find some innocent person (beginner) to give it to, as not practical to return from my location.I thought I was buying for reduced price a fire hd (previous generation) as the one I already own, with which am very happy.

Reviews.Title: Mother's Day 2014
Reviews.Author: Joseph L. Campbell "mrjoecampbell"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife for Mother's Day. She said:"This tablet is a great size, it is very fast, and has an excellent screen. I was able to pick up on how to use this very quickly, and I am not a tech-savvy person. I'd only consider giving it 4.5 stars because it does get a little warm, but not uncomfortably so."

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: DCHAK
Reviews.Content: Kindles offer an amazing amount of bang for the buck!  I still can't believe all the stuff I can do on this machine and how little it costs.  I only wish I would have put more thought into it an a paperwhite would have been a better fit because 95 percent of what I do is read books on it but I do play the occasional solitare on it and sometimes surf the web and it is amazing at both those things as well!

Reviews.Title: good gifts kindle fire
Reviews.Author: sassygrandma
Reviews.Content: I gave them as gifts on Easter and they loved them love all the free booksAnd games and were easy to set up. They keep commenting on how muchThey are enjoying them. Great bargain also. I'm happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing & frustrating
Reviews.Author: Lyn Boone
Reviews.Content: The refurbished Kindle does not hold a charge.  I will plug it in the charger overnight and in the morning will have 100% battery power.  Within 4-5 hours the Kindle will suddenly turn off, even though it shows 50% power remaining. Then I will have to plug it in again, to get the power up to even turn on.  I take the Kindle when I travel but if I only get 4-5 hours of battery, I will spend more time charging the battery than using the Kindle.  I would rather buy a brand new one and transfer my data through the Cloud but I would have to purchase an updated version that has too many bells & whistles for my taste.

Reviews.Title: This didnt last very long. The Motherboard blew up
Reviews.Author: marcola
Reviews.Content: This didnt last very long. The Motherboard blew up and could not be fixed. You get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: refurbished Kindle
Reviews.Author: Barbara Jowett
Reviews.Content: I have wanted a Kindle for along time and I thought I would take the chance on a refurbished one.  I'm so glad that I did.  My Kindle is awesome.  I have been browsing the internet, playing games, set up my 2 grandkids a space for their stuff, and reading so many books.  I am so glad I got it.

Reviews.Title: Refurbished Kindle
Reviews.Author: jackie spencer
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with the Kindle I received for a birthday gift two years ago. It worked excellent and I had no complaints. Eventually it quit charging and wouldn't power up. This was to be expected. I replaced it with a new to me, refurbished kindle from Amazon. I had to return the second one for so many problems, freezing up, powering down, locking me out... Customer service was great and exchanged it for a third refurbished Kindle in its place at no additional cost to me. However, the problem was not resolved. I still have nothing but problems with my 3rd Kindle. Such a disappointment considering the first one was such a terrific product. I am tired of dealing with costumer service and the tech support. Wish I wouldn't have gone the refurbished route. So frustrating to continuously be kicked out of any program or app I am in.

Reviews.Title: Refurbished Kindle Fire 7"
Reviews.Author: Nicole Scipione
Reviews.Content: I love my new Kindle Fire!  I had one of the old ones with the keyboard so this was really a step up for me.  It's really quick and the display is beautiful.  I love watching tv on it in bed.  I actually haven't read a book on it yet - too many other features to check out.  It's great for downloading apps and surfing the web.I was nervous about getting a refurbished device, but I have had zero issues - and the one year warranty is a nice safety net, too.

Reviews.Title: Tired of charging problems. Two out of three do not work.
Reviews.Author: victor rivas
Reviews.Content: I have tried very hard to be a customer of amazons products, but when three of two kindles have a charging problem, it is a hard hit to take to keep things working. not fair at all. Not much help with customer service other then  a small discount. They should just fix them instead of having customers complain about the product. It just is not the amazon way of doing business. Sorry and tired.

Reviews.Title: a hit
Reviews.Author: Mills W
