I enjoyed the fact that I could use the kindle for all those things I didn't want to clutter my cell phone with- namely music and games, and it worked very well.. very quickly and almost never a problem.until I bought one for my sister- some of my 5 games had updates installed, which made them basically slow and unplayable...at least not as enjoyable as before. Why they couldn't just leave well enough alone? I don't know, but since then I've only used it a couple times and given up after a brief time. Now, this does NOT directly involve Kindle itself, but some of the outside software so its not REALLY Kindle's problem, .. BUT if you plan on playing "words with friends," or something like that, you'll see a new "format", less options, and a LOT longer upload time to begin play.  If you've never played these games you may not care...but if you were used to a certain speed & playability it is definitely a let down and not as fast as it was. There is a lag whenever you do anything, and I've often had to exit and go back in since by the time it reacts, Ive hit it again 2-3 times, since I thought it didn't "get" the command...sometimes it even needs a restart now as it will freeze.One day I will uninstall all apps, and try to add them in one at a time to see if I can get anything back as it was.So, while this is great as an e-reader, as it was intended to be, it does NOT work very well anymore as a game center. Many people will not care in the least about this minor inconvenience, but I found that I used it several times a day in the past, just to make a scrabble move, or check a music video...whenever I had 10 minutes to spare and now only about once every couple months since by the time its operational, I am out of time.... I can usually wait til I am at a real computer to do these other tasks.I would have given it a 5 star rating last year, but now- unless the software can work better in general, I wouldn't get another.Again, its basically what games/apps you want to use, but beware that most apps don't work as well as they used to.

Reviews.Title: Not impressed
Reviews.Author: Carol
Reviews.Content: Doesn't hold a charge.  Bought a home travel charger and that wouldn't work at all.  Had to buy the $19.99 power charger for it so I wouldn't tie up my computer and it took forever that way anyway.  Every thing I try on it is not satisfactory compared to for instance spider solitair on my pc.  User guide didn't help much at all.  But I have to say the Amazon chat people are helpful and I think they really want to help.

Reviews.Title: very poor power port
Reviews.Author: M. Agresta
Reviews.Content: Although the kindle fire is great while it is working, the power charging port is very fragile and will fail quite easily.  I have had the same problem twice within two years.  Coincidentally, at a family gathering I spoke with 3 others who have had the same issue.  There is nothing to do but replace the unit because it will no longer recharge.  I'm very disappointed in Amazon for not addressing this issue for its consumers. If you check online you will find it is a common problem with this device.

Reviews.Title: Easily accessable
Reviews.Author: Jessie g
Reviews.Content: Convenient and quick. Screen could be bigger. Games and books are fun. However...its easier to grab a laptop for other things,

Reviews.Title: My Second Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Luella E. Cole
Reviews.Content: My first Kindle Fire was 18 months old when it refused to charge. After several chats with customer service, the verdict was that I needed a new Kindle. The old one was out of warranty, so I had to pay for this one, but the customer service agent gave me a deal on it. I'm hoping that this second generation KF will not have the same problem.One of the features I like on this KF is FreeTime. It is a parental control app that allows me to hand the KF to my 3 and 8 year old grandchildren without having to worry that they're charging something to my Amazon credit card, answering ads, or trying to read one of my books. Each of them has a partition in FreeTime just for them, with the books or games appropriate for their age.I use my KF mostly for reading, although I have some word games on it too. This one is small enough to put in my purse, so I can take reading material with me wherever I go. It's also like having a little computer in my purse--I can check email, find the location of a store or restaurant, check the weather forecast, type a grocery list--almost anything I can do on my computer. On my last transcontinental flight, the airline offered free TV via Dish. Alas, my KF couldn't receive that free signal, but I have used it to stream TV shows and movies through Amazon Prime. I love my Kindle Fire!

Reviews.Title: I already owned a Nexus 7 when I bought this.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I especially love the way it will read the story aloud to you!  I keep it charged and by the back door so I can take it with me to Doctor's appointments etc.  Love it.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Granny
Reviews.Content: lived up to all the expectations of the kids, not to mention the adults that use this product. It's wonderful.

Reviews.Title: I like it BUT...
Reviews.Author: J. Wright "not the mama"
Reviews.Content: I really need to call customer service because the battery does not seem to be holding a charge very long...other than that so far it seems to be working fine.

Reviews.Title: 4th Kindle
Reviews.Author: cherie brittain
Reviews.Content: We bought a kindle in April 2012 and this is the 3rd time we had to replace it, due to the battery not charging. Amazon upgraded to the 2nd generation. Hopefully this one will not have the same issue.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely love my Kindle!
Reviews.Author: Andrea
Reviews.Content: The picture is great - so excited that I can watch Netflix on it - and all the cool things it can do - games, books, email, etc.  A couple of drawbacks - the battery life is too short - I have to charge it constantly it seems like - even when I don't turn it on for a few days and it has been charged in full, it is dead when I do turn it on.  Also the sound is not loud enough - but with headphones in that's not a problem.

Reviews.Title: Reliable
Reviews.Author: True
Reviews.Content: We love the kindle everyone uses it the service is fast and reliable.. I'm so glad that the customer service were friendly and fast.. So hard to come by now a days.

Reviews.Title: Worth It!!! Buy it you won't regret it.
Reviews.Author: Shiki
Reviews.Content: I love the kindles interface i like the carousel idea although it could have been done better i wish there was a less irritating way to organize books on the carousel. This device is awesome especially for reading books not the fastest tablet but decent. The only problem i have is the no sd card slot i did not realize this when i bought it like a few others im sure but besides that it's a great device and well worth the money if you root this thing you can do alot more with it like install the google play store so i suggest that you do that amazons app store is ok and everything but they don't have all the apps that i want/like. I forgot to mention that you can root this device even if you have the latest 10.4.6 update just do some research google is your friend i should probably shut up now.....

Reviews.Title: Kindl Fire 7"
Reviews.Author: Maralyn Kimmins
Reviews.Content: Thanks for replacing my older Kindle Fire & giving me a reasonable price so I was able to do that. I use it everyday, either to read a book, pickup e-mail, search the Web, or play games.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Kaye Sanford
Reviews.Content: This product worked for about 1 month and then it quit.  I called and complained and I am supposed to receive a new one.  If this one does not work I will send it back as well.....

Reviews.Title: wifi
Reviews.Author: Katrina Newell
Reviews.Content: I can't get on wifi with it. The customer service is no help. He kept asking me the same questions over and over. I don't think he was even listening to me. I wasted a lot of money on this product.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Replacement
Reviews.Author: Linda B Jones
Reviews.Content: When the port my Kindle Fire broke I was very upset but the replacement is even better.  I love using it!!

Reviews.Title: Kindle upgrade
Reviews.Author: Joyce ringer
Reviews.Content: I think it is hard to navigate, I know there are lots of features that I have not had time to figure out. I don't want to have to spend hours figuring out how to use an enertainment.  Also the battery life is very short.

Reviews.Title: great buy!
Reviews.Author: Olga Zubko
Reviews.Content: I purchased a used device because I did not want to pay full price for a new one. I've had it for about a month now and it has been working beautifully. I'm very happy with the purchase!

Reviews.Title: replacement kindle
Reviews.Author: rissa992
Reviews.Content: So I got a kindle fire for christmas 2012 the kindle was very fun and efficient but mid febuary the kindle refused to charge by july it wouldn't charge at all. So I contacted Amazon customer serivce and they offered me a new one sent by wednesday . They were very nice and helpful I called sunday and staying true to their word they sent me a new kindle and I got it wednesday and it has worked perfectly and has enough space for all my pictures and apps. My family and I enjoy this kindle very much I would def reccomend this to anyone 4 and up

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire 7
Reviews.Author: William Richards
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Kindle about a month ago since it was on sale for $159 and I used a $30 coupon from Amazon. The price was right. Before purchasing this, I was using the basic Kindle reader. The Kindle fire has significant functionality including web access if you have Wi-Fi, works with Android apps and games and has improved graphics.  You can connect with Facebook and I am able to receive e-mail after using a free app.On the downside, the battery life may only last 4-6 hours if you are using it for games and apps. It comes with a recharging cord that connects with a USB port. I had to purchase a plug attachment to recharge it in an outlet.The Kindle uses touch screen technology, so you can clean off greasy fingerprints or buy a stylus which works for me.Still haven't figured out all of the features, but its been fun learning as I go. Overall, I am glad I made the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Love Kindles
Reviews.Author: Jeri
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th Kindle and I'd never go back to reading a hardback. Last year my home computer died, and with this Kindle I still haven't found the need to replace it.  I use my Kindle to read, do my banking and pay bills, access social networks, keep up with email, watch movies (I highly recommend Amazon Prime) and play games.The only drawback is the battery life.  I read on my breaks and lunch at work, and most days when I get home it already needs charging, this is hard to do often on vacations. But don't you dare even try to take my Kindle away, and hope to get the newest version soon.

Reviews.Title: Great price for Kindle Fire that's not HD. Great service from Amazon/Kindle.
Reviews.Author: Rosie
Reviews.Content: This Kindle Fire was a promotional offer that I couldn't pass up. I received a $30 coupon and had some Amazon credit card money so I saved over $70. My Kindle did not arrive in time for my vacation trip. Delivery got fouled up. I talked with Kindle Support and they immediately shipped my Kindle Fire to my vacation destination at no extra charge. All my Kindle books from my Kindle e-reader automatically synced with my Fire. Now hubby can have the e-reader and I have my Fire. Of course I can surf the web and watch my Amazon Prime Movies. The only problem during travel is finding a free Wi-Fi hotspot but that is what I expect from not purchasing a 3G model.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire is one tough device
Reviews.Author: Bill Nissen
Reviews.Content: I had the most amazing experience with my Kindle Fire.  I pulled the classic bonehead move the other day.  I was helping someone into my car so I placed my Kindle Fire on top of my car.  You guessed it.  I drove away with the device still on top of my car.  It stayed there until I pulled into I-40.  At 70 mph, it finally blew off onto the road.  Fortunately, a passenger in my car noticed something and it was then that I figured out the whereabouts of my Kindle Fire.  I returned to the scene and found the device lying along side the interstate.  One corner of the Marware cover was a scraped but the device still worked!!!!!!  Amazing.

Reviews.Title: Replacement Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Mark Molina
Reviews.Content: Amazon did an excellent job of getting me the replacement Kindle FIre due to the fact our previous device had a bad connection port.  Although we received the refurbished device and it to has a hard time connecting to the power cord.  We have to gently wiggle this in order for a good connection and a charge.

Reviews.Title: Restricted access to Amazon store selected apps
Reviews.Author: Jason Burke
Reviews.Content: I read the Kindle Fire uses Android, but you can only get apps through the Amazon store (which is very limited).  I have tried to download apps directly from the Andriod apps store, but the device blocks me from doing it.  I wish I had bought a different off brand tablet with access to all available apps.  Sometimes the screen resizes websites in the midst of browsing or when you are clicking on a link - this can be really annoying.  Not bad for the price compared with other more expensive and trendy options, but there are better tablets out there.

Reviews.Title: I love this product
Reviews.Author: Jerry
Reviews.Content: I love everything about the kindle fire, except for the battery life. If I didn't use it every day for multiple hours at a time the battery life would be great. However, I find I need to charge it every day.

Reviews.Title: Looks & Functions Like Brand New
Reviews.Author: Virginia Malone
Reviews.Content: For the price I was happy to get a really nice e-reader but with the Wi-Fi, some great apps, email & more, I think the refurbished Kindle Fire is a great bargain.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Annamarie Potalivo Cohen
Reviews.Content: My kindle is great so much better then my nook since the books I have are kindle. They offer so many free books and sampling books is wonderful too. The only thing is the battery life doesn't seem to last as long as the nook but I can live with that.

Reviews.Title: Kindle fire
Reviews.Author: Chichi
Reviews.Content: The battery of the kindle dies every 30 mins unless its on the charger. I sent my them my first generation kindle, now am receiving emails saying they never got it and that I will be billed for it if they dont recieve it. Am very irritated and starting to get annoyed with amazon when it comes to this kindle. I dont even feel like talking to tgrm right now. I spent too much money on this refurbished kindle to have it die constantly. Aside from my kindle I have been making purchases on amazon lately and really like how the system works. But I don't know if I plan to buy any more products by amazon.

Reviews.Title: Skip the Kindle Invest in an iPad
Reviews.Author: Carolyn Woody Graham
Reviews.Content: I love Amazon! I don't love the Kindle! I have had 3 Kindles (ranging from the first generation to the Kindle-Fire)and these have all died -- will not work. I took the Kindle Fire on vacation to the beach and it refuses to turn on half of the time. My husband generously let me download the Kindle app and the book I was reading on his iPad. We have iPads with one being the first generation and a third generation and both are working. When we return home, I will be downloading my books to our old iPad and taking my Kindles to the recycling center!

Reviews.Title: False / Misleading Labeling
Reviews.Author: Al
Reviews.Content: The box my Fire came in said it included a USB charging cable. I assumed that meant I would have everything I neeeded to charge my Kendle Fire.  Boy was I wrong. You have to buy the charger separately unless you have another device that uses a USB charger.  Not everyone has a device with a USB charger so Amazon can make more money by selling you more stuff. If you don't spend more than $25 they charge for shippping.  This is to get you to get to buy stuff you did not intend on buying to get free shipping.  If they don't want to charge enough for the charger, then say on the box that charger ia not included.  The problem is that someone may not buy their product if they were completely honest or upfront!!!!

Reviews.Title: DISAPPOINTING!
Reviews.Author: C. E. Henderson
Reviews.Content: The first Kindle I ordered was fine until it stopped charging.  I thought it was so great when they send me a replacement at no charge...it lasted for two months before it stopped charging.  Then they sent me a third one that never worked right from the moment I got it.  Now they're sending me a fourth one - I don't even want it!  I've come to realize they're sending me either refurbished ones or ones that have been returned without even being looked at.  They're pieces of junk!!!

Reviews.Title: Horrible Customer Service
Reviews.Author: TxMOM08
Reviews.Content: I received my Kindle Fire as a gift; when I registered the product I was not given any options regarding warranty, etc.  I have used my Kindle very little, primarily for web browing and some reading (I have less than 10 books downloaded if that gives you any idea of how often it is used).  I contacted Amazon after my device stopped working only to be told that my warranty was up and they would not replace it.  They even admitted it was obviously a hardware problem (not from damage) but that there was nothing they could do. Make sure you check on the warranty and if they offer you anything you better purchase it because otherwise you'll be buying a whole NEW device.

Reviews.Title: Kindle fire 7" LOCD Display
Reviews.Author: Lois Thompson
Reviews.Content: Was told they didn't make the kindle like I had that was having charge problems.  I paid $140.00 for what I thought would be an upgrade but was surprised to receive the exact same kindle that I had.  Still with charging and shud down problems.  When I recalled was told that I had received the latest version with no more help available.  Would have loved to have had one of the new Kindles and even would have paid more. I feel I was mislead and now I have decided to take some advice from other prople and purchase an I-Pad.  Have been advised I will be just as happy with that. Your product should last more than 16 months.

Reviews.Title: my Kindle
Reviews.Author: jodybkat
Reviews.Content: this is one of many I have owned and it is certainly the very best. The color is better, and all the newer features are excellent and I have no complaints at all.. Thanks for all the improvements and being a true joy to own. Joann Barry

Reviews.Title: I love the kindle 7 because it is compact and I am able to do as much as Is done on my desktop computerIlove reading purchasing
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline  Y.White
Reviews.Content: I love the kindle 7 because it is compact and I am able to do as much as Is done on my desktop computer I love reading ,purchasing items,the apps store,online banking  music creating a photo album etc.

Reviews.Title: I love everything about it! It has so much space and endless everything.
Reviews.Author: Brianna
Reviews.Content: I love everything about my new Kindle and am having alot of fun. It has so much space and endless everything.

Reviews.Title: Great Product & Great Price
Reviews.Author: Steph
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle Fire. You can do so much with it and it's so easy to take along in my purse. I found reading books on here to be great since it holds your place and you don't have a big stack of books sitting around. Internet and games work well on here also.

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: yvvivi
Reviews.Content: Its a good device expecially for a kid that loves games. My son enjoyed it all the time.Really good . No complains.

Reviews.Title: Awesome birthday gift!
Reviews.Author: CeCe Wilson
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tablet for my son's 10th birthday. I was trying to decide whether to get the HD version or just the regular Kindle Fire. I settled on the Kindle Fire when I looked at what my son was going to do with the tablet and I have absolutely no regrets. My son loves his Kindle and uses it everyday for games, reading, videos over Wi-Fi, etc. I highly recommend the Kindle Fire for anyone who is looking for a less expensive alternative to an iPad or iPad mini and I definitely recommend the Kindle Fire for those who are looking for a high functioning tablet with beautiful and vibrant color. The interface is easy and it did not take long to get familiar with how to use it. The Amazon store for books, music,  and games/programs is also easy to use. I ordered an inexpensive  protective case for the Kindle (totally recommended), and even after a couple of drops (totally unintentional and not at all recommended) the Kindle took them like a champ. I also purchased the wall charger block and I think that it was well worth the money spent. My son charges his Kindle, at night and once a day is usually enough. Using the mini usb cable with any other power source takes twice as long as the wall charger. The time saved is priceless.  I give this product 5 stars and I'll post a review on the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 soon as I plan to get one for myself.

Reviews.Title: kindle fire
Reviews.Author: Terrie
Reviews.Content: i have now had my kindle fire for 2 yrs and im still extremely happy with it .... so much so that i am looking to purchase a kindle for my granddaughter who loves to read more than i do .... it is light easy to carry.... access to lots of books.... upload time is seconds ..... easy to read... not much glare depending on where you sit.... can make text larger which is a plus for older people....surf the web if you so choose... all in all well worth the money....

Reviews.Title: great little tablet!
Reviews.Author: P. Campbell
Reviews.Content: Easy to use!  I love it!  Easy to read boos, and find my place with the bookmarks.  I do wish some games not available for this tablet right now were available, but that is my only complaint!

Reviews.Title: What's not to like?
Reviews.Author: LouL
Reviews.Content: For $160.00 bucks what's not to like about this little gem.I check all email,facebook,surf the web plus movies and any video. For someone who doesn't own a smart phone this thing is awesome.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: mary davis
Reviews.Content: I'm 70 and still learning how to use everything. What I have learned is lots of fun & enjoyable. Never to old to try new things.

Reviews.Title: very pleased!!
Reviews.Author: char
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my 10 year old grandson last Christmas and it couldn't have been a better gift.  Here it is going on August and fast approaching the next Christmas and he still loves it.  Plays the wide variety of games to choose from (many of which are free) and he loves to read so it makes it more enjoyable.  I also have one and i love it as well.  Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: needs improvements
Reviews.Author: Ana E maidesil
Reviews.Content: Swipe and tab have problem with it on my kindle Fire. I don't know why the company don't putthe volume button on the side, which I think is important, easy and fast to access when on the side of the kindle. Why the company don't  include a wall charger on kindle Fire. It doesn't come with a wall charger when you order it.  One of my kids kindle Fire got freeze. was looking at the help forum, got the help I need.  Still have problem with swipe and tab.

Reviews.Title: I am never without my kindle
Reviews.Author: me
Reviews.Content: My husband bought me a kindle three years and since then I never leave the house without my kindle fire

Reviews.Title: Perfect gift for Father-in-law
Reviews.Author: Richard V. Mullen
Reviews.Content: He was able to set this up on his own and play with it no problem.  This guy has very little tech skills and he was all over this writing emails and reading them with a smile on his face.  My wife and I are very pleased and so is he.  He even went out and bought a nice case for it and takes it with him everywhere.

Reviews.Title: NICE PRODUCT
Reviews.Author: kelkels
Reviews.Content: Got it for my 6 year old.  I purchased to utilize the Free Time control to prevent my son from going online or spending too much time playing games.

Reviews.Title: not happy
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Merrill "armywife2002"
Reviews.Content: First off I do not have this kindle fire I had the gen 1.  After having it for 15 months it died when I called customer service they mentioned that the kindles seem to have this problem but they do not know why.  So they admitted to a bug but won't fix it because they don't have a clue to what is going on.  They offered to sell me a new one at a discounted price like $50 off discounted price since mine was not in warranty anymore.  However they could not guarantee me that it would work past 15 months again.  So instead I am downloading the app on my smart phone and saving $200.  Let me tell you I am very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: learner
Reviews.Author: Learner
Reviews.Content: This is my second Kindle and I was surprised at how much I missed it when I had to send it in to be replaced.

Reviews.Title: Not good for Canadian
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Canadians cannot download any free card games. A message immidiatly appears saying that you must have a "American Credit Card" in order to download this game. A quick phone to Amazon and the answer was: Its the manufaturer of the game!!! NOT TRUE.I downloaded the same free card game from my Galaxy Tab 2 on the Amazon web site and trasfered it, with my account to my Kindle Fire.Imagine! Having to use my Galaxy Tab tablet to get a Free game for my Kindle Fire !!!Now my wife can play her card games on the Kindle Fire....

Reviews.Title: Excellent clarity for reading.
Reviews.Author: vsmith
Reviews.Content: Picture is excellent. Shortcomings: rapid battery discharge on video; takes too long to recharge. It would  be nice to have a brightness adjustment for the reader without downloading an app. It is also nice to be able to access the net from the reader and, unlike my first two Kindle Readers, you can actually read the info on the visited site. Overall, it's great for reading but will continue to use my iPad for the web.

Reviews.Title: Very nice!!!
Reviews.Author: Apol Dupamle
Reviews.Content: This product is amazing,  simple and versatile, i just wish it can have flash player installed. . .Other than that it is enough for my needs

Reviews.Title: Great for kids!
Reviews.Author: 6Poindexters
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift for my daughters 5th birthday. I looked at EVERY tablet/reader/ kid's tablet on the market. And I mean every. The kids tablets often used batteries so that added a lot to the overall cost. Plus having to have a bajillion batteries on hand at all times. Not only did they need batteries the games were sold separately sometimes at 20$ a pop! I have four kids, if I buy them each 100$ tablet, and one game I am out nearly 500$ plus batteries. The other tablets were either way too much money, or lacked parental controls or both. I am a Nook user, have had one since they first came out and love it. Someone suggested that I look into the Kindles and I was like but but but... I am NOOK person!! Then I heard about kindle free time, and the holy grail... kindle free time unlimited. I could hand my daughter her Kindle after a brief set up and tell her to go nuts. No worries that she was downloading Sons of Anarchy, or 48$ in books, or 300$ in aps. She can download all the kids content that she wishes! She can have unlimited books, games, aps, shows etc for about 24$ a year (I am a prime member). So for the cost of ONE game she can have it all. And I don't have to worry. I love this thing. She loves it. And I am buying two more for her soon to be 7 year old twin brothers! I will be purchasing a 4th for her younger brother when he turns 5. The only thing I don't like is that I can not share one free time account between the kindles. It does mean I pay more, but I still think it's totally worth it. Especially when I paid just a bit more than those kids tablets. And a lot of the same characters on those tablets have content on the Kindle.

Reviews.Title: Battery life
Reviews.Author: John Cook
Reviews.Content: I am not happy over the battery power does not last - this is my new replacement from the first one that lasted even less time. This one may last 5 hours if I an lucky - I guess that is normal, but my friend says hers will last for weeks

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire, is flickering in my opinion
Reviews.Author: J.C.Stierheim
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my mother for Christmas 2012. First let me say, it's durable. My 4 year old cousin washed it off for some reason. We let it dry and all was well. Thank goodness I bought a cover for it. It runs well on a single charge, but seems slow to recharge. My main concern/complaint is two fold. 1st, the interface is poorly designed and clunky. Compared to other Android systems it is light years behind in ease of use. It is usable but only just. I hope a future upgrade will see a total revamp of the user interface. 2nd is availability of popular apps. Amazon has cut itself off from google play, and either charges for popular free games or they only have a few levels and you need to pay for more, or it simply does not offer them. For these 2 reasons I'm  really disappointed and wish I'd bought a brand name tablet for her instead of the Kindle. I'm a computer tech with over 25 years of experience in and around computers. Perhaps someone with less knowledge of how things should work would be happy with it, I'm not.

Reviews.Title: disappointed
Reviews.Author: Kitty
Reviews.Content: it works pretty well, but i am very disappointed by the shortness of the battery life  it also seems to switch orientation at whim, and then refuses to all allw me to switch it back.

Reviews.Title: Locks up all the time
Reviews.Author: Duckman
Reviews.Content: I bought a kindle for my daughter and an ipad mini for my son.  The kindle locks up all the time....when I worked at Motorola, we called these "panics" and sometimes you had to pull the battery.  Since you can't pull the battery on these things, you have to try charging them for a while, then do a hard reset, then charge again and sometimes that works to recover it.  Sometimes you just have to wait 12-24 hours for some reason...like some kind of task is stuck.  No problems at all with the ipad...you get what you pay for!!

Reviews.Title: No Complaints Here
Reviews.Author: kschimmelwriter "Kimberly L. Schimmel, MLS"
Reviews.Content: I have a wi-fi network in my home and most places I frequent, so this was the perfect Kindle for me.  I am daily blown away by the sheer number of free and inexpensive book and apps available.  I use a pdf reader and regularly use the Send to Kindle function to move documents from my PC to my Kindle instead of printing out long pdfs and carrying piles of paper around with me.I have watched a few movies.  The screen is small, but that's perfect if one of the kids has to wait in the doctor's office.  I have rented movies for days when I know I'll need a distraction while away from home.I also use an app to keep track of my email, several apps for knitting, and even a metronome and pitch pipe.  Best of all, no annoying phone calls interrupt me on this device.  I like keeping my phone separate.I made a case and bought a charger and a stylus.  I would recommend anyone buying a Kindle get at least a case and charger.  The stylus is great if, like me, you have fat fingertips that sometimes don't hit the right spot on the touch screen.

Reviews.Title: love/disappointed
Reviews.Author: Carola Thompson
Reviews.Content: The responses and replacement of my broken Kindle was wonderful.  No pain, no fuss, and even someone like myself who is seriously technologically challenged was able to transfer my content without a problem.  I love my Kindle. My only question is if they sent a new or refurbished one since this one tends to seize up on me occasionally.  I'm not as happy with my second Kindle as I was with the first.

Reviews.Title: My Husband loves it!
Reviews.Author: floresfamilynic
Reviews.Content: I have tried it out a little. My husband loved it for Father's Day. Very simple set up instructions and has very neat apps you can get and battery lasts a good time.  Very nice graphics.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: toni
Reviews.Content: It's a little heavy but color is great.  Easy to use. No confusing instructions.  My 90 yr. old mother uses it to play games.  Her fingers don't work too well but with a stylus,she does just fine.

Reviews.Title: My Kindle
Reviews.Author: Carlene B. Staton "dramamom"
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this Kindle.  It works perfectly and I feel connected everywhere I go without having to carry my laptop.

Reviews.Title: It's worth the money
Reviews.Author: MrsY
Reviews.Content: I bought the kindle fire for my 7 year old daughter; she enjoys it and loves it. It was worth buying it

Reviews.Title: Like it, but has charging problems!!
Reviews.Author: GLH
Reviews.Content: We're on our second Kindle Fire - we had to return our first one and now we need to return our second one because eventually it just stops charging and won't turn on anymore. It's nothing we've done wrong, I've heard of several other people having the same experience. I'm not sure why it stops charging after awhile - we tried plugging it in different outlets, putting the cord at different angles, everything and nothing works. Obviously something is wrong/defective with the actual product.

Reviews.Title: Great, but buy the accelerated charger right away (you'll need it)
Reviews.Author: Jeremiah
Reviews.Content: Very nice. Great lcd display and as always, great Amazon customer service. Very intuitive interface and the price is very reasonable.However, you'll probably need to spend another $20 on an accelerated charger because the USB charger that they send you will take about a half day to charge this device. The fact that we don't know this beforehand and we need to make an additional purchase in order to make using this device worth it is the only reason I gave it four stars instead of five.

Reviews.Title: kindle fire
Reviews.Author: trax
Reviews.Content: It is so amazing, does it all! Easy to read and use. Adjustments are easy to make, and you can even change the size of the letters youYou're reading.

Reviews.Title: 3rd Kindle in a year and a half
Reviews.Author: Stephen A. "Stephen"
Reviews.Content: Kindle Fire is fun to play games and listen to music. However, the speakers are not loud at all and we'll had to return two devices since we first got it because the charging port stops working.

Reviews.Title: It OK
Reviews.Author: A listner
Reviews.Content: The product is OK. I like the fact that you can turn the pages easily, has color and can be read in the dark. But I find that the battery goes down quickly and generally at the point where I have lots of time for reading.

Reviews.Title: Charger Not Included
Reviews.Author: D. Kerr
Reviews.Content: Very nice tablet, but it seems like they should include the wall plug to charge it with.  We gave it as a group gift to our parents, and they don't have a PC to charge it with.

Reviews.Title: battery
Reviews.Author: vanessa
Reviews.Content: The battery lasts about an hour.  They lied.And this is my second kindle.  If it be different if I played a lot of games, but no.  Don't believe the hype.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing
Reviews.Author: Jacki Gansch
Reviews.Content: I just started using the Kindle Fire, which I believe is a second generation, yesterday. So I do not know if I am just not used to the quirks yet or if the quirks are maddening flaws. Pages load slowly and sometimes not at all. I often have to shut it down and reset it. The auto correct is infuriating but I hate to have to turn it off. This is my third Kindle. The first one was a first gen Fire and it worked well for several months until it stopped charging. The replacement did the same thing plus had other problems. So they replaced it with  second generation. Jury is still out on this one.

Reviews.Title: Not satisfied
Reviews.Author: marie333
Reviews.Content: I got the Gen 1 Kindle Fire the first Christmas it came out as a gift. Within a week the charger wasn't working right. I had to shove a pen under the charger to hold it in the exact spot for the kindle to charge. I didn't do anything about it because I had found a solution and I didn't want to go through the process of getting it replaced. Big mistake. Recently I have to fight with the charger to get it in the exact right spot to charge. Sometimes it takes me 20 minutes to get it in the right spot. Then after it starts "charging" it doesn't charge over 20% (that is if i can even get it to charge). The wifi connectivity is not good on it. I have to be within 10 feet of where my internet is to download a book. Also, on my mothers iPad it shows how many pages you are into a book and how many pages are left in a chapter. The kindle does not do this. It shows weird numbers that do now make any sense, all that makes sense is the percentages; but I would rather have it tell me the pages. Overall I am not impressed with this product. I am researching other tablets to replace my kindle fire.

Reviews.Title: Awesome product!
Reviews.Author: NoahsMommy
Reviews.Content: The kindle fire is perfect for people who want a tablet but find the "bells and whistles" of the iPad to be too much (as well as the high prices). I love it!

Reviews.Title: Short shelf life
Reviews.Author: bob
Reviews.Content: Kindle fire purchased December 2011 and used moderately mainly for reading. Product no longer charging with original adapter and connector. Customer support offered an " upgraded" power fast charger which did not resolve the issue. Customer service also informed me that the original port was designed to be a loose connection. But have since re designed the charger to improve "loose " port connection. Customer also stated that kindle fire has a 2 year life expectancy. Funny, that was not mentioned during the sale nor anywhere in the fine print.Their final offer to resolve my kindle fires poor faulty design....a new kindle fire at a discount. NO thank you Amazon, APPLE will be getting my future business!

Reviews.Title: Horrible, absolutely hate it.
Reviews.Author: Jbri9210 "Jordan Sullivan"
Reviews.Content: Thought buying the kindle was a good idea since it was only $159, compared to a $500 iPad.Well, I was very very wrong. Device constantly crashes,  & theres not very many good apps/games to choose from.I finally gave up and did what I swore I wouldn't do.. Long story short, my kindle is now my two yr olds favorite toy.Downside is apps have a ton of adds, and has a horrible parental control setting.Should have saved up for a few months to get an iPad.You definitely get what you pay for I guess.

Reviews.Title: Not what I expected....
Reviews.Author: MichelleFoley
Reviews.Content: If I had a chance to really play with this before I decided I wanted one, I would have NEVER gotten it!  I have had to replace it twice, only to have my 3rd one come in and the touch screen does not work properly.  I never sent the one I needed replaced back and am instead sending the current replacement back.  I can deal with the problem with the 2nd Kindle I received. I will NEVER get another Kindle!

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: bobbie
Reviews.Content: Love it!I have iPhone that my husband is always using for businesses ,and I take this to work so I can read my books

Reviews.Title: Love my Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: r grove
Reviews.Content: I have had some problems with charging one Kindle and then with the on/off switch on two others.  I have been disappointed that I have had to replace them but customer service is terrific  I use my Kindle every day for reading, emails, games, cookbooks...can't imagine not having it.

Reviews.Title: Not impressed for a fourth time.
Reviews.Author: Csl Plasma "ams"
Reviews.Content: Doesn't hold a charge. Turns off periodically, same problems I had with the 1st edition. Hard to save pictures. Can't download a flash player.

Reviews.Title: Dead and Unsupported
Reviews.Author: Michael R. Fine
Reviews.Content: I bought three Kindle Fire tablets for Christmas in 2011. It has been 1.5 years and two can no longer charge. A search on the Internet reveals this is a well known defect. In addition, the sales staff and Best Buy note that many people come in and complain about this same issue. If you call Amazon, their response is for you to purchase a new unit for a slight discount. They don't even have inventory on the identical units. Only refurbished can be purchased to replace the original Kindle Fire. In other words, a part dies (that tablet works fine) and you are expected to buy an entirely new product.When speaking to customer service, they tried to augment the offer by adding additional funds toward the new tablet purchase. However, in the end, it means starting from scratch with a new Kindle. In addition, the support staff refused to help any further and escalated the call to a manager who hasn't responded to our inquiry. Unprofessional and definitely not what I would expect from Amazon.I am sorry but this is ridiculous. One and a half years is not an acceptable amount of time for a hardware failure. I am a big fan of Amazon but I will not be purchasing another Kindle and recommend you steer clear of this product. It is ludicrous to consider that there isn't a repair option. I understand software obsolescence but a critical part failure like charging the battery is unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: Needs adobe player
Reviews.Author: Misha Byers
Reviews.Content: I like my Kindle but I cannot do my on line classes because I cannot run adobe. This is really disappointing.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Tom Ringe
Reviews.Content: I really like it, but it only has a micro USB port, so you can't connect it to your TV. The USB port won't transmit A/V through to the TV. If anyone knows different, PLEASE feel free to correct me since I would LOVE to know how! Thanks!

Reviews.Title: Charging Issues
Reviews.Author: carsena
Reviews.Content: After replacing 5 Kindle Fires I finally give up. Amazon just kept sending me defective Kindle Fires that were returned for the same reason.  This last replacement didn't last one week!

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Sharon L. Belteau
Reviews.Content: Excellent gift for my grandchildren.  They had always wanted to play on my Kindle when we visited.  I decided to get them one to share.  They were so excited.  Thus far, I have heard of no problems.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Samantha Smith
Reviews.Content: Perfect give for my 9 yr old and she LOVES it, definitely recommend to other parents and plan on getting on for my autistic 5 year old too!

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I wanted!
Reviews.Author: Eliza
Reviews.Content: This is my third Kindle Fire purchase but probably not my last.  I believe it is the best tablet deal out there!

Reviews.Title: gift
Reviews.Author: Shari K.
Reviews.Content: We bought this for a family member for Christmas. She really likes it. I am thinking about getting me one of these.

Reviews.Title: Handy tool
Reviews.Author: Doona
Reviews.Content: It is easy to use and I can take any where. I can heck e-mail or play games while I wait

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: Alia K. White
Reviews.Content: I purchased the kindle for my 3 year nephew. I know he's only a child but I really like this tablet for him. I'm sure we're not using it to it's full potential, but so far we haven't had any issues with it and he's able to navigate it successfully on his own. He loves to play games (kid friendly of course) and we recently started downloading books to read to him. I like that the tablet offers different games and books geared to specific age groups so it makes me feel like it can really "grow" with him. We have a netflix subscription so I like knowing that when we need him to calm down, we can find his favorite kids show and let him watch all on his own. He hasn't learned to read yet so for now we don't have to worry about him going to unsafe sites or downloading explicit gaming apps. My only issue so far with the kindle is that it takes forever to charge! I know you can buy a separate faster charger but who wants to spend MORE money on accessories? I love the kindle for him and I think it's a great alternative buying the overprices iPad.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire - Refurbished
Reviews.Author: Valdese
Reviews.Content: Ordered a Kindle Fire.  Already had one but needed a second one for my son.  It looks great and have had no problems out of it.  It's looks and performs as if it was brand new!!  Love it!

Reviews.Title: I love my fire but...
Reviews.Author: Tonya Yoder
Reviews.Content: there is too much pushing of commercial products. I would like to be able to use it without all of the ads for yet one more thing I can see or get or buy.  I also really miss the background screens that would show up on the e-ink reader (pictures of authors).  What I see now? More commercials - for movies, cars, products.  Other than that I do still love my kindle.

Reviews.Title: like not love
Reviews.Author: jocko
Reviews.Content: I gave it 3 stars because I didn't realize I needed to buy the charger separate.After that small problem was solved I'm enjoying it.

Reviews.Title: My New (refurbished) Kindlefire.
Reviews.Author: Janice Schneider
Reviews.Content: If you already have a charger cord,do not waste your money buying another,as your present one will work on the Kindle. I have used a Droid,so the Kindle works , similarly. I use it to access my email,Facebook,the news,and . Weather. One feature I dislike is the way it adds words or punctuation unexpectedly. I wish I knew how to turn this feature off!! I also wish my Kindle-fire had come with an instruction booklet. This would have proved to be very helpful,as this is my first Kindle. My son had to tell me where the power switch was,as I was unable to find it,As it is very miniscule,and almost invisible. An instruction book would have been so helpful!!

Reviews.Title: For my husband on Fathers Day
Reviews.Author: louise w.
Reviews.Content: Still getting to know it.  It did not come with any instructions.  We are having to use my ipad in order to get directions for the kindle

Reviews.Title: Be aware: If you buy a Kindle, you better also buy the protected warranty!!!!
Reviews.Author: Disney
Reviews.Content: I bought my son a Kindle Fire for Christmas in December 2011. As of April 2013, the Kindle Fire no longer works. Something is wrong with the USB port for these Kindles. I called Amazon to see if they could replace the Kindle and was told that since I didn't purchase the warranty, they couldn't do anything. They did send me a new USB plug, but if the stupid USB port is not working, what good does that do? Anyway, I will never buy a Kindle Fire again.

Reviews.Title: Amazon turned a bad experience into an excellent experience
Reviews.Author: Yinzer Grrl
Reviews.Content: Kindle Fire 7" Second GenerationAs others have stated, no power adapter included with the Kindle Fire Gen 2. I bought an adapter and used an existing USB cable.I tried charging via USB cable with my computer. After several hours the charge percentage increased by 10%.When I charged it via power adapter, it wasn't much better. My battery ran down to 16% so I put it on the charger (power adapter) one day last week. It sat there for 24 hours. The charge was then at 29%. I thought, "Wow, so maybe if I leave it plugged in for a week and spend how much extra via my electric bill, the Kindle will charge 100% so I can use it for a few hours."  I was spending more time charging my Kindle than using it.Amazon staff, upon hearing of this experience, went above and beyond to help me remedy this problem.  I now have a different USB cable and am using the (Amazon Recommended) Kindle PowerFast adapter.  Today, I turned my Kindle on for the first time in a week (I just simply stopped using it -- because of the power issues).  The battery was at 16%.  I plugged in the new USB cable and adapter and figured I'd check it in a few hours to see if it had gone any higher. I expected it to be at about 40% or so.  To my surprise, it was at 100%.  That's the first time I've seen the battery at 100% in WEEKS.OMGosh -- THANK YOU, AMAZON! :)

Reviews.Title: Device is decent but the support is horrible. Yet another charging port issue.
Reviews.Author: Gabe
Reviews.Content: We got the Fire and were happy with it for the most part but I payed 200 dollars to be able to use it for just a year. The charging port broke shortly after warranty expires and now I am being told they do not have any repair options available. They want me to purchase another one instead. I will never buy another Amazon product again. I just went and purchased a similar device that has Android support for 80 dollars which I am sure will last longer than this product. They may even be willing to support there product on top of that.

Reviews.Title: Very disapointed with Amazon service
Reviews.Author: rose
Reviews.Content: I received a defective Kindle Fire 7" and have been very frustrated with; 1st trying to make it work, 2nd the trouble-shooting service that Amazon provides, 3rd Amazon has set up barriers that insulate it from having to deal directly with customers; 4th quality control is severly lacking with Kindle products, I never even got a chance to see if their hyped adds are true. At least at Walmart or Best-Buy a customer can talk to a service representative, and show them what doesn't work.

Reviews.Title: it was ok the screen was broken
Reviews.Author: Anna dew
Reviews.Content: it did not get to the kid i order it for xmas until two to three mo after xmas  I had to keep calling and calling and when she got it the face was crack

Reviews.Title: its okay
Reviews.Author: skip
Reviews.Content: this device works ok has the features wanted for my child problem is the charging it won't take charge most of the time and it won't stay charged very long after it says it is charged had to hard reset it multiple times

Reviews.Title: For my son's 5th Birthday
Reviews.Author: BellasMomma "miamahler"
Reviews.Content: We bought this for my son's 5th birthday because he has outgrown the Leapster products. We pay for the monthly FreeTime app and as a parent I love it. My son is very happy with the content. My only complaint is that if he tried to queue too many books, apps, and videos the Wi-Fi shuts down. DS has never complained when the 30 minute time limit per day I set for videos and games is up. He goes right to the books. Perfect! Thank you Amazon for a wonderful product!

Reviews.Title: Short Battery Life Diminishes Usefulness
Reviews.Author: Susan A Adler
Reviews.Content: I was surprised to find that my Kindle Fire had a battery life of only about 5 hours - if I stayed off WiFi and dimmed the brightness.  After several conversations with the very nice people at Amazon support, I exchanged my device.  But the second is not significantly better.  This would not be a device for a long trip or when away from recharging capability for more than a few hours.  Otherwise, the device is OK - although heavier than I had realized.

Reviews.Title: break every 6 months. don't buy
Reviews.Author: BROWNCOW21
Reviews.Content: I have had 3 and all suddenly quit working and charging. 1st 2 times amazon quickly replaced but 3rd I was told it had  been longer than 90 days and I could buy another at a discounted rate. I would never pay for one of these again.  When they work they are great but major problem with the devices and no fix.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire is nice
Reviews.Author: HSL
Reviews.Content: The battery does not last as long as I expected, but it works well.  It is nice to be able to read without carrying lots of books around when I travel.

Reviews.Title: unhappy that had it less then a year and already have issues with it. very happy with the way amazon took care of the issue
Reviews.Author: Isabella Force
Reviews.Content: It is rarely used by my 8 year old to read book and play game and watch movies on down times

Reviews.Title: very happy with my new kindle fire!
Reviews.Author: Shylee
Reviews.Content: Before I purchased my Kindle Fire, I owned a Sony ereader.  It was like one of the first ereaders...so this thing literally did nothing! No Wi-Fi, no touch...nothing.  What I loved most about my Sony ereader was how the screen was a e-ink display and I could read it without hurting my eyes or having a glare.When I was deciding on which Kindle I wanted I was stuck between choosing a Fire or paperwhite.  After much consideration and reading reviews I went with the Kindle Fire.  I wanted something new and something that didn't have as much limitations.  I get a lot of my ebooks at my local library's website. I wanted a device that I could use a search engine and find the books I wanted at good prices or free online.  With the paperwhite... I would have to use a computer to find the books I want online (unless I was using the kindle store) and I felt like I already do that with my old Sony ereader.  I wanted a device that uses wifi and also is equipped to use a search browser... no computer! Which the paperwhite as wifi but not a good functioning web browser. I also can purchase some of my college text books on amazon that only work for kindle fires... not paperwhite. It was with the adds and I got it for $159.  I am very happy with my decision. The adds only show up on the screen saver and homepage.  They are in the bottom corner and don't bother me at all. I signed up for free 5-8 business day shipping and I received my Kindle fire in 3 business days!I purchased an anti-glare screen saver on amazon for a package of 3 for under $4.  With this screen protector on the screen you don't have a glare and it literally looks almost like how e-ink looks.  You can even adjust the brightness and color contrast.Another bonus to purchasing a fire is that all the books have text-to-read so all your books can read out loud to you. So if you're reading a book and want to cook dinner...just push play and listen! The paperwhite doesn't have sound.I am very happy! I would recommend this product to someone that loves to read a lot but also wants a device to use facebook, watch movies, or check emails! It does it all.

Reviews.Title: NOT WHAT I REALLY WANTED
Reviews.Author: Bucky
Reviews.Content: My fault not the products.  I did not want a heavy tablet with a small screen.  I wanted an e-book .  I don't even have a use for the rest of the tablet.  The screen switching from upright to sideways in the middle of a sentence because I move it is annoying.and it is heavy.

Reviews.Title: My Kindle
Reviews.Author: Lmoody1
Reviews.Content: A friend told me that once I had everything set up on it, that I would love it, and he was not lying. I love it, I can play games while in bed, I can read. It is one of the best  gifts that I purchased.

Reviews.Title: SAVE MONEY AND NEVER BUY THIS TABLET
Reviews.Author: Debera Everett
Reviews.Content: WORST TABLET EVEERRRRR! i hate it! every single one oftthe apps always just exit out. camera stinks.shuts down randomly. freezes and doesnt let me use it for days. screen calibration problems. speakers act up. the apps you cnn get stink. i cant use the inter net or watch videos with our it freezing and exiting out in the middle if the video.and many other little problems. SAVE YOUR SELF SOME MONEY AND DONT BUY THIS KINDLE FIRE/ KINDLE FIRE HD. IF YOU ARE GOING TI BUY A TABLET BUY AN IPAD. THEY ARE TEN TIMES BETTER. OVER ALL I GIVE THIS TABLET -3 STARS. sorry for any grammer mistakes. it is also hard ti type on here

Reviews.Title: Beware: KNOW which Kindle Fire you're purchasing!
Reviews.Author: Foodie "Deaf At Heart"
Reviews.Content: All of the Kindle Fires are wonderful. WONDERFUL!I can't say a single bad thing about them. They run Android which means that there are lots of workarounds and a million ways to do everything. They're fantastic!HOWEVER: Some sellers here are listing Kindle Fire 1st Generations under this product page.This is the product page for the 2nd Generation Kindle Fire.The hardware is so very different, that any Kindle 1st Generations should be listed ELSEWHERE.If you are a seller, and you need to be able to tell the difference:1. No USB cable, just a big blocky wall charger? First generation.2. A gear in the upper right hand corner of the Home screen on the kindle? First Generation.3. Under 'Settings', in the 'Device' section, is the kindle running version 6.x.x? First Generation.The First Generation only has 512mb of RAM, which is very different than the Second Generation's 1GB.Please check to make sure that you are not selling a First Generation Kindle Fire on the Second Generation's product page. This is the product page for the Second Generation Kindle Fire.Please learn the difference and list accordingly~. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: kindle fire
Reviews.Author: LOLA ADAMS
Reviews.Content: I like th at I can take it with me anywhere . Just slip it into my purse with charger and go. I have access to thousands of books my email and Facebook.

Reviews.Title: Awesome device
Reviews.Author: Sandra Bachman
Reviews.Content: I love this device because I can do almost anything with it, such as read books, play games, access the internet. It is so nice to have when traveling as it takes up so little space.

Reviews.Title: I think its exclent
Reviews.Author: happy mother of two
Reviews.Content: I found that it works great and would recommend it to anyone.I gave it as a brithday gife to my child and she loved it.The kindle fire was in perfect condion just like new!!!! i'm very happy.

Reviews.Title: New kindle fire, my 4th
Reviews.Author: karyn page
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th kindle . Love the screen crystal clear. Movies show great on it . My only complaint is that it no longer comes with a charging cord - USB that you have to go purchase a plug end for . The controls take alittle getting use to a "double " pull down . But as far as picture quality it's great!! And I must give a shout out to Kindle Support , they are always very helpful!! No problems when my old Kindle died , they sent a new one right out!

Reviews.Title: Do not buy!
Reviews.Author: Carlos The Dog
Reviews.Content: We are on our second kindle fire in less than 18 months due to charging port becoming loose. There is a defect in this product. If you look many people have had the exact same problem. Our kindle sat in one spot to charge so it was not treated roughly.

Reviews.Title: Great!Great!Great!
Reviews.Author: Megan Mertz
Reviews.Content: I have had another e-reader (kobo) and decided that it was time to upgrade to one that has FAR more titles available to buy. While the kobo was good, this is just that much more awesome for everything! Not only can i read books, but I can look things up, get on facebook, check email and much more! I'm glad I took the plunge and got this little machine!

Reviews.Title: AWESOME
Reviews.Author: Darcy Smith
Reviews.Content: I got this Kindle for a Mother's Day gift. I just love it. Not only do I use it, but my 5 year old daughter uses it as well. I am trying to talk my mother into getting one, so that she can read the books that she is looking for. I would HIGHLY recommend this Kindle.

Reviews.Title: doesn't hold charge
Reviews.Author: Bev Clune
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd Kindle since Christmas. They don't hold a charge. I get new ones in hope the next one will work, and they are all the same. Very disappointed in it. I am going to try to get my money back.

Reviews.Title: Can't live without it..
Reviews.Author: teresa pancheri
Reviews.Content: I love Amazon, and love my new kindle fire Gen 2. Amazon has the best customer service in the world.I had some issues with battery life and Amazon customer service called me and explained how I could save some battery life. What a great company!!

Reviews.Title: Trouble charging
Reviews.Author: Robert F. Carney
Reviews.Content: I love the unit but after 2 years we have a problem charging it.  I know we are a year out of warranty, but come on.  Two years into using this we have a problem.  Amozon sent me a new charger saying it fits better so there must be others out there with the same issue.  They offered to sell me a certified used one.  Why would I want to pay for another unit.  This is planned obsolescence at it's worst.

Reviews.Title: going on 5 kindles in 1 year
Reviews.Author: Mary von
Reviews.Content: I am so careful with my kindle, and never moved it when plugged in- but still I have had to replace 5 kindles in less than a year. All for the same reason- they stop charging. I don't even want to call support again they are always very nice but I'm just sick of this. I love my kindle but the last one lasted less than 2 months!

Reviews.Title: good but bad storage
Reviews.Author: SO COOL
Reviews.Content: everything is awsome but the storage. There is only 5.5 GB in the thing. Other takes up 2.7 GB of it. I think it is worth the money. KEEP IN MIND YOU WILL NOT BE ABLE TO GET MUCH THINGS!

Reviews.Title: How I feel about my new Kindle
Reviews.Author: Cindy
Reviews.Content: It is not what I was expecting.  I requested the one that did not have the ads or extras and got it anyway.  You have to sit through all these stupid ads.  And you have all this crap on your screen you dont want or need.  Still have not figured out how to get rid of it.  Stupid  The First one I had was so much more superiior because it didnt have all the stupid stuff to fight through just to do something on it.  The ads are killing you.

Reviews.Title: Not what I hoped for
Reviews.Author: Kayla
Reviews.Content: I was happy with the outward condition of the this product as well as the extra cables. However, after having it for a couple of weeks it began shutting itself down in the middle of playing a game or watching a movie. After looking up how to fix the problem I realized it seemed to be quite common among other users. A hard restart did not fix the problem and I sent it back. The customer service from itembazzar was excellent however. They were prompt in answering my questions and helping in whatever way they could. If the shutting down is something you are able to get over then the rest of the product was great, however, I will be looking for something different.

Reviews.Title: EH
Reviews.Author: SISTERS OF MERCY
Reviews.Content: nice size. too many ads.  not always responsive when you need controls. wish they were displayed all the time because it is sometimes difficult to get them to display

Reviews.Title: love kindle
Reviews.Author: Connie Oots
Reviews.Content: I read a lot more since I have a kindle. It's so easy to take a book with me anywhere I go.

Reviews.Title: Stopped working in less than six months!
Reviews.Author: Raquel Clark
Reviews.Content: I purchased my Kindle Fire on 2/28 and received it the first week of March. I rarely use my Kindle, however, when I do, I expect for it to work. My Kindle in is excellent condition because I use it no more than five times a month. I tried to turn on my Kindle Fire yesterday and it just keeps rebooting itself. I tried the hard reset. It didn't work. I charged it up completely. I didn't work. I contacted Amazon Support. They asked if I did a hard reset and charged my device. I explained yes. Then they said I will be receiving a replacement. Seriously? That's it?! I haven't had this thing for a full four months and I already need a replacement, which will most likely be a refurbished one. I'm so upset.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: LoveReading
Reviews.Content: Great when it works.  However, the port keeps loosening up and it won't charge anymore.  Have been through 2 Kindle Fires and 4 new chargers in 18 months.  I have been extra careful about handling the Kindle when plugged in to decrease the chance of recurrence.  It won't hold a charge longer than 2 hours, even with the Wi-Fi off, and since I read more than that each day it has to be plugged in while in use.  I was told by a rep once that it was a design flaw in the Kindle.  This time I was not offered any replacement, only a discount on a new one, but will not take the chance that the problem has not been fixed.  I do not recommend buying the Kindle Fire.

Reviews.Title: Mistake
Reviews.Author: Matthew P Lettau
Reviews.Content: I regret the purchase. Its too heavy and the screen has glare. I wish i had of purchased the regular one.Its no better than my kindle app. I wanted an ereader.

Reviews.Title: Gave away my iPad...
Reviews.Author: J. Summer "Mahalo from the Polynesian Islands...
Reviews.Content: No mandatory "Apple I'D" to do anything you want.  No paid support at Apple Store for simple issues.  Light weight.  Great quality screen viewing.  No Apple button to do anything.  More free apps.  Fun little device so much better than my iPad 2.  And the price?  AWESOME!!

Reviews.Title: Everything my wife thought it would be and more!
Reviews.Author: Dan Morgan
Reviews.Content: Equal to or better than my I-Pad mini and more aps and books to buy from your store. Great as usual!

Reviews.Title: Power problems
Reviews.Author: BillT
Reviews.Content: from time to time, it fails to charge. I will be going to Nook soon. This is ridiculous.See yas!

Reviews.Title: great upgrade
Reviews.Author: Anthony Bartolotta
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from the Kindle keyboard when something fishy happened to the screen.  I was perfectly willing to get another keyboard as I only used it for reading.  At $120, the refurbished Fire allowed me another opportunity to go wireless (in addition to my phone) so I took a gamble and so far it has operated with perfection.  All my books are accessible, and the apps (including games) the family uses are all accessible.  It was also far cheaper than a new apple product, but I didn't look into refurbed apple products.  The only drwback is that I didn't get the 3g option, so we have to be at a hotspot for updates, but other than that, the first month has been very positive.

Reviews.Title: love
Reviews.Author: Debra Childers
Reviews.Content: I love my kindle fire, although this is my fourth one due to the charging issues Amazon has always replace the kindle or sent a replacement cords to help me out.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Barb Lyon
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle and don't see how I ever survived without it. I wasn't sure I wanted one but got it as a birthday gift. It is so much more than reading. I use mine for books, e-mail, facebook, games and I even watch movies and T V programs through Netflex and Hula Plus. If you are in doubt, I would say go for it. I have mine with me all the time.

Reviews.Title: refuebished kindle fire
Reviews.Author: Pat
Reviews.Content: easy to use, as well as a new one ,easy transfer from my old one, would recommend to  everyone  thanks

Reviews.Title: first kindle
Reviews.Author: Susan Isbell "fan"
Reviews.Content: The only complaint I have with the Kindle Fire "7" is that I am constanly having to recharge it, and it is sometimes slow to load

Reviews.Title: kindle fire
Reviews.Author: lynnann
Reviews.Content: just what I was looking for - love reading books on it (except for outside reading - too much glare, so I just use my first kindle for reading outside) like that I can use it as a mini computer, without the expense of an Ipad.

Reviews.Title: Battery life
Reviews.Author: Sally
Reviews.Content: It is great for reading, but battery life could be better as it seems to lose it fast.Easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't hold charge for more than ~ 30 minutes.  Have original Kindle and it works great; just wanted Kindle Fire for additional
Reviews.Author: S. Warner
Reviews.Content: perks, but it didn't produce.  Will have to look for a product that meets my needs more adequately.  ):  So long.

Reviews.Title: Love it BUT a little disappointed
Reviews.Author: MrsC525
Reviews.Content: I really love my new Kindle Fire, but it does not hold a charge well and it takes FOREVER for it to recharge. I received this less than 24 hours ago and have had to charge it 2 times already. It was fully charged when it arrived and after maybe an hour and a half to two hours of play, it was already dead. So, I charged it, which took VERY long. My husband played it for maybe an hour last night and then this morning I played it for about 45 minutes and it was dead again. It has been on the charger for almost 5 hours now and it still isn't fully charged. Before we bought this I had the Nook Color and I liked it okay. The Fire is far better as far as graphics go and the apps that are available, but this not holding a charge and taking so long to recharge makes me disappointed. I had several apps on my Nook and we all would play it for several hours each day and I would read on it and it would last a good 3 or more days without having to be charged. It took my Nook a little while to recharge as well, but not nearly as long as the Fire. I am not sure if I got a defective one, or if they just aren't great at holding a charge. It makes me nervous because I was anticipating taking my Fire with us on vacation to keep my children busy on long car trips, but I am not sure if that is going to work out given the short battery life and recharge time. My son has an iPad that his school issued him and he uses it all day for school and we all play on it in the evenings and by bed time, when he finally puts it on the charger, it's usually at 20%. If not for this battery problem, I would have given it 5 stars but this is a big issue for me.

Reviews.Title: Much nicer than previous model
Reviews.Author: Thomsa Kirkland
Reviews.Content: system is different than last but easy to learngreat screen and easier to readsize is nice except to transport

Reviews.Title: Excellent reader  a good fill in for the iPad
Reviews.Author: Steven B. Western "Curious"
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a step up from the Paper white which for.me was unacceptable. I was very pleased with the reader capability and the screen quality. In a pinch I have used it to as a web browser. Don't think you can pick up the Fire and use it as s a cheap iPad sub. But as a reader and to organize your media files purchased from Amazon it's fine. There are times I just want to read or listen to music on a flight and leave my laptop and iPad home, the Fire gets 5  stars for doing that job, if you want more you will be unhappy with the small screen size, weak OS limited battery life. Typing for very long makes you crazy, I won't use it for email. In summary a great value, excellent for reading and storing media files

Reviews.Title: great until it wasnt
Reviews.Author: K. Janssen
Reviews.Content: My kindle was great until it stopped charging one day. I called technical support after making sure it was plugged in and rebooting they sent me to a "specialist" who told me my only option was to buy a new one but I could get it for $30 off. So basically the second you have a problem you are on your own, not even on your own because if you "tamper" with it you don't even get the $30 off! Never again will I go with a product that has no support.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: EOB
Reviews.Content: I use it for reading, surfing the net, playing games from apps.  Sometimes it does not respond to my touch as quickly as a Fire HD; however, the videos and games look just the same--great!  The operating system is easy to use and I like how I can adjust the volume, brightness, and get to the wireless settings so easily.  With a couple apps, I even watch U-Tube videos on it :)  Really, the Fire is a great toy.  I put on my headphones and can watch any movie I want through Prime or my Netflix Account or any other free video place like Crunchyroll. Angry Brids runs marvelously.  It is fun to tilt the Fire to get the marbles rolling on other games, or tilt it to steer while racing.  Had no idea I would end up using this Kindle Fire for doing so many things and having an excellent time doing it all.  Even have a couple radio station apps, IHeartRadio and Pandora work lovely.  I read my book and listen to classical music at the same time!  This toy is a definite 5 Star!!!

Reviews.Title: Charging Port Issues
Reviews.Author: atergo
Reviews.Content: I have had the Kindle Fire for approximately 17 months and use it primarily to read and play solitaire. I have only had problems with trying to charge the device. Since it is no longer covered by warranty, I have to get it repaired at my own expense. Amazon attempted to resolve this problem by sending me, at no cost, a new power cord which did not work either. There seems to be a problem with the charging port itself. There does not appear to be any damage to the port. Therefore, this is a poorly made part of the device. This should not be occurring after minimal usage for less than two years. I hope their technicians take note of this problem and get it fixed. I was considering buying one for relatives, but this is a show stopper for me and I do not recommend it be purchased because of this problem. If one cannot charge the device, it is worthless.

Reviews.Title: Bought two, both bit the dust within 18 months
Reviews.Author: Dawn
Reviews.Content: We bought two kindle fires for our daughters for Christmas. They are not used a ton since we restrict use to weekends only. One of them started having problems charging because the port started getting loose ( just like everyone else's complaint) but then the other one started to swell from the inside out. Apparently the battery.  (no exposure to heat or water!) I noticed some other reviewers had the same problem. I have one of the first iPads and to even compare it to a kindle fire is hilarious. Just save a little longer and get an iPad!!

Reviews.Title: great product for the price
Reviews.Author: Isabel
Reviews.Content: great product for the price. very user friendly. sound could be better byt has improved since the first kindle fire. still have problems charging sometimes but the wall charger works better.

Reviews.Title: My second kindle
Reviews.Author: jackie pinder
Reviews.Content: I just love my kindle.The second time around is Awesome.Thanks so much.I couldn't imagine something  so special that even my grandchildren can also I and  enjoy.Thanks a million.

Reviews.Title: Refurbished Kindle Fire 7"
Reviews.Author: Mel2011
Reviews.Content: I'm very happy with this tablet. Although it was built primarily as an e-book reading device, it also performs greatly as an Android tablet. As a matter of fact, I use it mainly as an indispensable tool for my job.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: Jo L. Lyttle
Reviews.Content: This is the second Kindle Fire I've purchased. The first I bought on sale at Christmas for my granddaughter. I paid he same price for this one in April for my grandson's birthday. The Kindle Fires are awesome for them. I will be purchasing one more in June for my other grandson's birthday!

Reviews.Title: It's ok
Reviews.Author: luv2read
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to love my Kindle.  My biggest complaint is that is does not have a long battery life.  I have read that it is suppose to have an 8 to 9 hours of running time.  I am lucky to get 4 hours on a good day.  I love that it is easy to download books and games but it is so frustrating that it dies too quickly.  I also had charging issues but that was solved with the getting the extra Kindle quick charger.

Reviews.Title: Great Product with One Flaw
Reviews.Author: Stephanie L. Ritchey
Reviews.Content: I love the Kindle Fire. I use it daily to study and do research. The apps are great. It does have one flaw that drives me absolutely crazy! The Kindle Fire does not have a copy feature for the books you have purchased for it! This is crazy! The PC Kindle reading app allows you to copy from the books loaded into that reader, Amazon needs to fix this flaw and make available to every Kindle Fire owner an update, not fix the problem by adding the feature to a new generation.

Reviews.Title: A feature-packed little gadget!
Reviews.Author: David Lampe
Reviews.Content: With nothing to compare the Kindle Fire to but a notebook computer (I don't use a smart phone, and I'm not facile with touch screens), I have found the Kindle platform and user interface remarkably easy to use and versatile.  I use the device mainly for streaming live audio, plugged into either a loudspeaker or wireless headphones, a role to which it adapts superbly, running for many hours on a charge (with screen darkened, of course).  I'm also using it increasingly to listen to stored music.  Paper books with covers, empatically, remain my preferred reading medium, so I'm not using the Kindle for anything but sight, sound and shopping, for which is it extraordinarily well suited.

Reviews.Title: Works so much better than the generic tablet we had
Reviews.Author: Mainemom
Reviews.Content: My son got this for his birthday.  I love Kindle Free Time. Right now he uses it for games (he's 6), but it will be great when he gets older and has to do book reports and research.His only complaint is that the battery doesn't last long enough.

Reviews.Title: BEWARE OF WARRANTY POLICY
Reviews.Author: Kimberlyn A Fauson
Reviews.Content: My first Kindle Fire had to have a factory reset a few months after I received it for Christmas in 2011. In October of 2012, two months before the warranty expired, the Kindle quit charging. The portal to plug in the adapter was not even reading that the adapter was plugged in. At that time, Amazon replaced the Kindle free of charge, and I was happy with their customer service. They sent me a brand new Kindle Fire.This past month, my Kindle started crashing back to the Home screen. It mostly does it when I am using the browser, although it also does it when I am using certain apps. It also crashes when I am trying to download a new app or book from the Kindle Store. I contacted customer service and they asked me to do another factory reset. This did not solve the problem, so I called again.Imagine my dismay when they told me that even though the Kindle they sent me in October was brand new, the old warranty dates apply. The warranty on the second Kindle expired in December or January, even though I had only had the device for a couple of months. I spoke with a supervisor, and the best they could offer me was a reduced price on a Kindle Fire HD. They kept calling this their "best replacement option." I told them that they have a really messed up idea of what the word "replacement" means, and the very definition of insanity would be for me to give them more money when both Kindle Fires I've owned have had problems. I also told them that I know they make a lot of their money from the content we buy rather than the devices themselves, so it seems like a really bad business idea not to replace the device because then I won't buy more Kindle content from them.I'm pretty ticked off, needless to say.
