I've had great customer service from Amazon, until now. And it makes me even angrier when I think about them not applying their warranty policies evenly. A few people I know have had their devices replaced after the warranty expired.

Reviews.Title: Who sells electronics without a charger? Really
Reviews.Author: Andrew West
Reviews.Content: Why would you not send a charger with this item? That's like a cell phone or any other electronic device that needs to be charged. This is my sons birthday present and I am furious.. Now I have to go out and buy a charger. What an inconvenience...

Reviews.Title: It's ok
Reviews.Author: yabadabadoozy
Reviews.Content: This Kindle met my expectations only because they weren't very high to begin with. It's a 2nd gen product that really isn't a very big step over the 1st gen product I had previously. In some ways it is easier to navigate on the old Kindle. I think wifi ability may be slightly better than the original but nowhere near enough to make any real difference. As far as I'm concerned this is the original product that has been dubbed 2nd generation simply because it was a sales ploy to boost sales of the Kindle. It's an OK product' not a great one. I'll definitely look at other makers wen the time comes.

Reviews.Title: Very poor quality
Reviews.Author: joe
Reviews.Content: I purchased 2 Kindle Fire's for each of my daughters a couple of years ago.  We have been VERY disappointed.  We purchased Kindle's instead of iPad's due to cost. My kids loved them, but soon after we purchased them, they started locking up and freezing. Later, they stopped charging unless you held the charger in the perfect angle.  We called a few times, only to be given temporary solutions like reboot it, etc.  These issues are happening to BOTH Kindle's. One has stopped charging all together.  My wife called, but they refuse to replace it because the warranty has expired, even though they have documented calls about the same issue before the warranty expired. Now, I'm going to have to replace both Kimdle's with iPads or new Kindle's.  I should have just paid the extra and purchased IPad's to begin with.

Reviews.Title: Non-existant library management
Reviews.Author: Clydella M Birkholz
Reviews.Content: I own several Nooks & just set up a Kindle Fire for my mom, that my sister bought her for Mother's Day (she bought the Kindle, & I spent even more than that in Amazon e-gift cards to load it up with several of her favorite book series by her favorite author) so I'm familiar with both lines of e-readers. I have to say that the Nook line is far superior as an ereader, as the Kindle Fire does not have a method of letting you organize your collection of ebooks, other than sorting the entire collection by title or author, or read vs, unread, whereas, all of my Nooks allow me to create as many bookshelves as I want, so I can have each series on it's own shelf. However, although I have word search apps on both my iPhone 5 and my Nook Tablet, I have to say that I prefer, and grew very attached to, to the word search app on the Kindle Fire, so, although I have no plans to switch my e-reading to the Kindle format, I am considering looking for a used Kindle Fire, just so I can use it for that word search app(but only if I can find one for really cheap, which doesn't seem likely, as the only ones under $100 on Ebay are non-working parts only units, due to the charger ports failing). I've read that the HD Kindles allow you to create "Collections" (but only 4 Collections!), so that's a rather poor method of organizing a large library of ebooks, and...., it's rather stupid that Amazon is excluding most of the Kindle line from having even that pitiful excuse of an organization method. I can create unlimited shelves on all of my Nooks, even the first generation, non-tough screen unit. My final verdict: If you want an e-reader, get the Nook Simpletouch Glowlight, and if you want a tablet, get an actual tablet, like an iPad, and put the free Kindle & Nook apps on it. It's also ridiculous that the Kindles don't come with an A/C charger included. You get a USB cord, so you can charge it via your computer's USB port, but if you want a wall charger, you need to buy it separately.

Reviews.Title: I used to love my Kindle Fire, but the touch screen stopped working after just over a year.
Reviews.Author: Jose Diaz
Reviews.Content: I've had my Kindle Fire for just over a year now.  It was a birthday present.  First I loved it!  About 2 months ago the touch screen started having problems.  It looked like it lost sensitivity in some areas.  First it was just annoying, but the lack of sensitivity started spreading to a point that it rendered the device useless.  Now I cannot even access it since I cannot slide the lock screen.  A friend suggested calling Amazon Customer Support.  Since my Kindle Fire was over one year old and not under warranty, they offer to give me a discount on a new one!  Unfortunately I will decline since I no longer trust the quality of this product.  I have decided to buy an iPad or a Samsung Note.

Reviews.Title: Bought for my Son
Reviews.Author: Karen Hopson
Reviews.Content: Love Amazon Prime.The Kindle Fire is great.I am somewhat disappointed as I bought it for my son due to the Free Time feature.  I set it up and gave it to him and he promptly charged a game to my prime account.  I just spent 1.5 hours online with amazon chat and there seems to be confusion on their end as well between parental controls and free time.Finally figured it out on my own and the only content available to him on free time is well below his age category.  I sold him the transfer to the Kindle Fire from the IPAD because I thought he would have autonomy over his choices within an age appropriate selection.  (I have hidden away his IPAD b/c too much time was spend on gaming.)Set up frustrations aside - he is now reading Sherlock Holmes.  Love you guys!

Reviews.Title: My Kindle
Reviews.Author: Ruth Wright
Reviews.Content: I am 67 years old and I live in a nursing home because I have Multiple Sclerosis I do not have dementia so it can seem like the days are very long. A very dear friend and her husband gave me my Kindle for Christmas and it has opened up a whole new world to me.  Amazon is one of the things that I am that going to enjoy using because it makes it so much easier.  You don't have to type anything you just have to tap the item.  I have only .ordered one item and needed help and got it with customer service who could not have been nicer or more helpful.  I love the free apps they are WONDERFUL!!! You get an idea how the game is played before you buy it.  When you are on a fixed income it helps.  Amazon is the best thing that has happened to me in the 8 years plus I have been in here. THANK YOU AMAZON!!!

Reviews.Title: Still having issues
Reviews.Author: C. Vivar
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd kindle fire and I still have issues with the charger. The inside of the kindle where you plug it in to charge always gets loose whats up with that?? Does anyone else have this issue?

Reviews.Title: Had mine for awhile now, wanted to give my review and clear up some misconceptions
Reviews.Author: Nathan Healey
Reviews.Content: 1) The Kindle Fire does not force you to look at recommendations on your home screen. This is an option you can turn off or turn on.2) The "time left" feature is switched off and on by tapping. The other option shows you the location of the screen you are on in the book.3) The battery life mostly depends on the brightness and whether or not you are reading. If you are reading with wifi turned off and brightness set halfway, you'll get many hours of battery life. If you crank up the brightness and surf videos, you will get less.4) If you don't use a 1 amp charger or above, you will experience slow charge times, and if you have the brightness up all the way with a low power charger, your Kindle might not even charge at all.5) There are plenty of apps you can install outside of the Amazon Marketplace. Pretty much any apk file will work with the Kindle Fire (without rooting, etc) Not all, but most. If you stumble upon strange files, just hide them.6) You can use Flash. Just look for the old version on Adobe's website and use a browser that supports Flash, but be aware you will not get any official support from Adobe if you do, because Flash is considered a dying platform (replaced by HTML5)7) The Kindle Fire will play HD videos with hardware acceleration, but your screen is limited to 1024x600 resolution, so you won't be seeing any more pixels than your screen actually has, so while the Kindle Fire is technically capable of playing those HD videos, even 1080p (with hardware acceleration), the reason for doing so (other than lack of available lower def versions) is pretty insignificant.8) The screen rotates, so the power button does not have to be any particular place, nor does the charge port. If you can't sit comfortably, unlock the screen, flip your Kindle, then lock it again. Everything works in any orientation you choose.9) The Kindle Fire is capable of playing pretty awesome games like Need for Speed Most Wanted (really, it is!).10) There is no webcam or microphone unless you buy the HD one, but I don't think this was confusing anyone.11) The advertisements can be turned off if you pay Amazon through your Kindle management pages on Amazon.com. Otherwise, there will be an ad on the lock screen of the less expensive model. It's not a big deal to me.Personally, I love my Kindle. I keep it safe in a nice squishy zip-up case and take it everywhere. I've had it in my backpack at college and don't think anything of bringing it along to all of my classes. It has been reliable and durable for everything I've wanted to do, including enjoy all the Amazon Prime content available. I'm sure the screen can get scratched, but if you keep your Kindle Fire in a case, and try not to contact the surface with anything but your fingers, you shouldn't have a problem with scratches.Lastly, there are closed captions on Amazon Prime content. If the content has captions, there will be an option to turn them on. Not all videos have captions, but they are technically supported by the Kindle Fire and work just fine.

Reviews.Title: LOVE MY Kindle Fire!!
Reviews.Author: maria angelica lamotte
Reviews.Content: Great item to own.  If you love to read and like to have a book ready for your next read then get a Kindle.  No problems with mine.  Plus, Amazon offers specials and recommendations based on the types of books you read!

Reviews.Title: Reaaly easy to use
Reviews.Author: deedee
Reviews.Content: I really like my kindle it is easy to use. I take it everywher with me it is nice to have the options of playing games or reading or looking thing up online.

Reviews.Title: its just ok
Reviews.Author: Tedmund Smith
Reviews.Content: i use this a lot but there is one thing that sucks and that i can read for about 2 hours and play games for about 30 min then you have to wait 12 to 13 hours to charge that sucks that you have to wait that long befor you can use this great item again

Reviews.Title: Open up the play store
Reviews.Author: S. Howe "Blarndon"
Reviews.Content: This product is well made and it is very good to use as an e-reader.  BUT, Amazon should take a cue from B+N and open up the play store to Kindle users just as B+N has done for the NOOK.  It is tooooo limiting to have to get all the apps from Amazon.  Many, many, many times I find that friends can put apps on thier Nexus 7 and I have no way to do that with my Kindle.  It sucks.  Let us have more access and you would get a 5 star rating.  Until then, this is a 2 star product.

Reviews.Title: Poor choice
Reviews.Author: Dale
Reviews.Content: I hate to break the news to you but Kindle Fire is not worth it at any price. We've had ours just slightly over a year and it no longer boots up.  It will not get past the logo window.  Called support.  Tried the "hard" reboot multiple times.  Support says.... it's past warantee.  We'll give you a deal on a rebuilt one.  But no real deal was offered.  So, in my opinion two hundred bucks for a product that works for 13 months is a bad bad choice.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful!!!
Reviews.Author: Betty Holmes
Reviews.Content: This the replacement Amazon sent when my original Kindle was malfunctioning. (It was hard to get it to charge back up.  They sent the new one the day I reported the problem.)  The new Kindle has larger graphics and is easier to use.  All my books, et al, were waiting for me in the cloud so I didn't have any problem getting them on the new Kindle. Needless to say I am pleased with the service I received from Amazon and the product they sent.  Thank you.

Reviews.Title: non-functional!
Reviews.Author: Gudrid
Reviews.Content: I received a 're-conditioned' Kindle Fire three weeks ago, and despite daily efforts using every trick I know (I've had computers since early 1983), it STILL refuses to allow a connection with my network. Nothing. Nada.My local UPS person says that they send A LOT of Kindles back to Amazon. Obviously, there seem to be some nasty software glitches in the current models.I'm tired of the frustration--mine will be going back tomorrow!Another family member was about to purchase one but I told them not to waste their money....

Reviews.Title: Good Value for Price
Reviews.Author: CKB
Reviews.Content: This is great for reading book, playing games, and for me - organizing my recipes.  Nice, portable size...not too heavy, but decent size for my needs.  There is an app for keeping up with my emails (gmail).  The browser is easy to use...I have brought this on trips a few times and find it very handy when using hotel wifi connections.  Ipads are nice, but they come with a price - this provides all that I need and I am very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: great device--wish I could buy the extended warranty now
Reviews.Author: Mary Butler "Ring Rider"
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd Kindle fire I've bought in the past 4 months.  The last 2 have been for my parents.  My father is a game junkie now!Only regret is that I didn't buy the extended warranty.  We didn't know how much we would be using these Kindles.  I hope I get a personal  email from Amazonto add the warranty--I'd buy it for all 3 if you offered it.  And you might want to amend your offers on the ads--I keep getting them about the warranty--but you only can buy it when you order the Kindle so why advertise it?.Wish I could watch my DirecTV on the Kindle--that's the only thing to add to make it better.That and let you use it on the 3G like the old ones--I can't always sign on to WiFi at work--they lock it up, but I have a great 3G signal.Mary B

Reviews.Title: Trying to get it right
Reviews.Author: The spice lady
Reviews.Content: I like this tablet and it's easy to use, but only lasts for about an hour and a half after it's been charged and takes 3 hours to charge.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: i love my kindle.  i read so much more then i ever did. very user friendly.  the only  thing that i have been disappointed in is all the chargers i use, i have to really jiggle and wiggle to get it to take the charge. i am sure it is not the charger as i have used several. thats my only complaint

Reviews.Title: Smitten
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have never been so impressed with a technological item. The Kindle is sleek and fast. The layout is perfect, and I am blown away by the multitude of tasks both my children and I use the Kindle for everyday. Someday soon, I'd like to have one for each member of the family, and I sort of consider myself a simple, hippie sort of girl. The device rocks and Amazon's customer service is something I didn't know existed in this day and age. Hip, hip hooray for the Kindle fire!

Reviews.Title: Headlines should be optional!
Reviews.Author: Jennifer L. Monek
Reviews.Content: Bought it as a gift for my technophobe 60 year old mother. She loves it, especially now that she can Facebook stalk the family from her recliner.

Reviews.Title: Perfect starter tablet
Reviews.Author: pnhawaii
Reviews.Content: My son has wanted his own tablet ever since I got my ipad 1. Sorry, but there's just no way that I feel comfortable giving a 5-year old a $500 tablet to play games on. When amazon had special on this before christmas, I could justify the cost, and the $3/mo kindle free time is something I can handle as well. My son is very happy with his own tablet, as are my wife and I. The size is better for his hands, and although the ipad mini was available at the time, it was more than double the cost.

Reviews.Title: awesome device
Reviews.Author: zgoodfella75
Reviews.Content: kids love it, jeeps them quiet with fun games and educational ones as well...screen resolution is superb....would recommend for all ages

Reviews.Title: kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: grammyjane
Reviews.Content: So much nicer than the first one I bought. Faster charging also. Grandsons love them. Glad I bought the 2nd one

Reviews.Title: recent Kindle purchase
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I was dissappointed that what I purchased was the 1st edition Kindle and not the 2nd.  It didn't state which it was.  I purchased it mainly for my 85 yr father who can no longer read.  My daughter has the 2nd edition and had been telling me how hers converts any book bought into audio.  I was able to download an app to pick up free audio books from the library however. He also uses it to listen to Christian radio online.

Reviews.Title: Several Problems with the Kindle
Reviews.Author: Latisha K Grimes
Reviews.Content: I had to return my Kindle twice due to glitches with the equipment (no volume and not charging). I will hate to see what happens when my warrently runs out.

Reviews.Title: My daughter hit her first homerun to get this!
Reviews.Author: Ronald Willis
Reviews.Content: She asked for one, but I told her it wouldn't be fair to her brother and sister.  She then asked if she hit a homerun, could she get one.  She has struggled for two seasons with batting and I thought that might be motivation enough to get her bat swinging.  Well, her first at-bat in the first game of the season, she belts one out to right field and doesn't stop running until she hits the dugout.  A well-deserved gift!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire 7"
Reviews.Author: Herb Reed
Reviews.Content: Ireally like the Kindle Fire, but do not like all the ads that keep showing up when you are playing games, you need to get rid of them

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Steven J. Martinez "Big Daddy"
Reviews.Content: I received this 2nd Gen Kindle Fire as a gift at work. Let me say, I was not expecting it to be this useful. I only have two things that I don't like. First is how heavy it is and second but most annoying is how low the volume of the sound is. It's loud enough for music but terrible at movies (can barely hear it) but hey it was free! Lol

Reviews.Title: my son loves it!!!
Reviews.Author: Jacobs
Reviews.Content: My son loves the kindle fire he likes playing  the learning games and for the price i love it too!!

Reviews.Title: A reliable tablet with room to improve
Reviews.Author: Essex
Reviews.Content: First time tablet user. This one took no time to understand and use. I've had it for about a year, and in that time I've acquired an iPad. It's probably no real surprise that I prefer the iPad for just about everything. This is primarily because using the Kindle is tedious at times. For example, the carousel interface becomes a chore if you have a lot of apps. Also, there's no easy way to fully delete apps from the device. Even seemingly simple tasks like fully quitting out of an app requires too many clicks to justify.On the positive side: I can say that I've never had a problem running the Kindle. No crashes, no lag. The display is as bright and sharp as I could want it. The actual device is very durable (it's deceptively heavy for its size but not enough to bother me; I kind of like how substantial it looks and feels actually).Basically, it's been a problem-free, reliable way for me to play games, check my email, listen to music, read, and browse the internet--but I wouldn't try to do any heavy lifting. If you're looking for a budget-friendly device for leisure activities, this is a perfectly good option.

Reviews.Title: The box with no smile on it......!
Reviews.Author: sandy merry
Reviews.Content: While the KIndle Fire is just as expected.....it arrived with NO PACKAGING.  The black kindle box was slapped with labels and shipped. It was not put in any additional cover, package, box or anything.  My husband--the recipient--is the one who obtained the package from shipping------BLEW THE SUPRISE!  Shame on amazon.  Really???

Reviews.Title: THE BEST OF THE BEST
Reviews.Author: Brenda Shermer
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with my Kindle. It is quicker, cleared than the other. I'm still learning all it can do. It's a dream come true. Now if I can just get it to wash dishes.

Reviews.Title: Kindle fire 7" review
Reviews.Author: CheetoGirl89
Reviews.Content: I've owned  the kindle keyboard, and I had no problems with it, so I bought a kindle fire. It's fun while it actually works, but half the time it won't even turn on. You also can't get certain apps that you can get on the iPod. Whenever you search the internet it always freezes, and it automatically turns on, and ends up having no battery left. My kindle keyboards battery lasted for months, and this kindles battery lasted for an hour. It Isn't worth $200. I would definitely recommend an iPod over this kindle.

Reviews.Title: cool
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Its different from the first kindle I had. I really enjoy the look of the kindle but still trying to work it and learn the new features.

Reviews.Title: kindle Fire second generation,exchange for kindke fire that wouldn,t charge.
Reviews.Author: joan w pike
Reviews.Content: This kindle Fire second generation just first work well. Things don't down loan. The news videos play for a second or two and stop and restart. I can't get the free game of the day only once in awhile. A book on its functions might help with some of this but not everything. I don't know what to do. I'm discouraged!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: What I think about the updated Kindle I recently received.
Reviews.Author: Gerri harkin
Reviews.Content: The updated kindle is OK but it does not always hold my page.  When I am playing word search it shuts down the game. This did not happen to my other kindle. It is very annoying. Other than that it's OKAmazon customer service is excellent.

Reviews.Title: Kindle x 7
Reviews.Author: Sandy Mallory
Reviews.Content: We purchased 7 kindle fires for Christmas gifts for our 7 grandchildren from age 3 to 11. We had them all set up and ready to go on Christmas morning. They were a hit, the kids loved them, they take them everywhere they go.

Reviews.Title: Rating my Kindle...
Reviews.Author: Cindy Lee
Reviews.Content: This has been the best purchase I've recently made.  I had been debating between the Kindle & books.  I love the smell & feel of books but not the prices.  Then there's the problem of storage after you've read a book(s).  Money & storage problems won out!  I LOVE my Kindle Fire & couldn't be happier with it.  Thank you, Amazon!Cindy B.Riverbank CA

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Diamond
Reviews.Content: The best thing for my 9yr old ever!!She has been able to do any and everything on it. It keeps her so occupied after she gets home from school. Its Like shes not even there.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Judith Temperle
Reviews.Content: I love it. I've waited a long time to buy mine, and love how Amazon's customer service is available 24/7

Reviews.Title: Seems to have internal problem with charging mechanism
Reviews.Author: SMBofTexas
Reviews.Content: I have just ordered a 2nd Kindle Fire, replacing the first after only 16 months, due to a malfunction of the charging capability,I love my Kindle, so I will replace it, and not go to another reader, but this is the second issue I have had with Kindle Fire like this.I bought my granddaughter one 10 months ago, and it developed the same issue, would not charge with a wall charger, by USB or any charger. So I bought another,,,,

Reviews.Title: Ok
Reviews.Author: Colton Ritchie
Reviews.Content: Well first off let me talk about the design. It's kinda thick, but it has a nice feel to it, and it has a comfortable design. It's a little weighty but that doesn't really make it strenuous or unenjoyable to read for long periods of time. So I'd say an 8 out of 10.SCREEN:It's not the best picture but it does just fine for what it's made to do and sometimes when your watching apps the graphics suckWeb-Browser:At times it can be really laggy and annoying. So 6 out of 10Keyboard:The keyboard can be uncomfortable and sometimes lags and on reviews it will keep going back to the beginning.I'd give it an 5 out of 10Apps:Um it doesn't have an extensive app selection but it's ok it has some things like Facebook,Netflex and a few others.Battery Life:You can get about 4hours of straight usage so it's not that good.Overall it has a lot of problems but their fixable and I think they will do a lot better next time  This is your report from Colton Ritchie

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire is junk
Reviews.Author: Helen Glock
Reviews.Content: I received my Kindle Fire as a gift. I would have NEVER purchased one. Period. After frustratingly using this torture device for over three years; here is my honest review: first; why is every punctuation except the comma on the keyboard? (I am frustratedly trying to type this review on my Kindle now). I have to press the space/insert key just to use the second-most commonly used punctuation mark in the English language)!!! Next - Over 50% of the apps written specifically FOR the Kindle,  don't work, don't appear in apps, and if by chance they do, they refuse to work...AND if they begin to open,  I am immediately presented with the most common feature of this piece of junk: "...(paraphrase) I don't work,  but from now on I will post this annoying error message every time you turn this device on AND whenever you transition to any other UNRELATED book,  app,  photo,  or whatever...Force Close.The only things this piece of crap does,  it does well and those are reading a book and playing solitaire.  For $200.00 I can buy a lot of books and decks of cards. After writing this review I am restoring this crap to factory default,  and getting rid of it. Frustration over. Give me an ASUS tablet any day.Oh, and don't forget that, you can't use ANY of the apps from Google Play! Give me a break!

Reviews.Title: Great device and SUPER customer service
Reviews.Author: Halterhorse
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough positive about Amazon's customer service.  I had bought the Kindle for my 4 year old son for Christmas.  It worked fine for 10 months then suffered a critical battery failure for whatever reason.  Amazon was superb - customer service took less that 10 minutes to diagnose issue and set up shipment of replacement Kindle.  Reloading all of my sons programs was super easy because everything we had downloaded was in the cloud and I didn't have to remember what was on it.  My son loves his Kindle!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: best2137
Reviews.Content: I bought the Kindle Fire to replace my old Kindle that was lost.  The new Kindle is awful, it loses it charge after 90 minutes.  You cannot read the Kindle outside as it has a glass screen and the sun reflects off of it- the screen looks black.  My old Kindle was great, the charge lasted for hours and you could sit in the sun with sunglasses on and read it.

Reviews.Title: Too much to digest
Reviews.Author: ted desnica
Reviews.Content: No instruction book supplied with product.Batteries don't hold charge for a decent length of time.Not for older generation.

Reviews.Title: Helpful customer service
Reviews.Author: M. Siu
Reviews.Content: I have had my Kindle Fire for awhile now (back when it was more expensive). My first one was a dud and would shut off on its own without turning on again. I called customer service and she had me reset my whole system and load everything back on it. After two months, it did the same thing. This time, the customer service rep heard my whole story and replaced it. It has been working well since then. If you are a prime member, the Kindle Fire has a lot of benefits with the video streaming option. I also like that more and more books are becoming more affordable. However, I do think that Kindle could make a more stable platform with its apps and that it would come with a wider range of apps (such as dropbox which is even on Blackberry's less used tablet).

Reviews.Title: Kindle
Reviews.Author: Amparo
Reviews.Content: I love my kindle I just wish that it would have come with instructions I'm a senior citizen and not that experience on looking things up on the web. but otherwise I love it

Reviews.Title: Very Nice for the price.
Reviews.Author: Luis
Reviews.Content: I use this tablet for is my spare time. Its fun and it gets the job done. It does freeze every once in a while.

Reviews.Title: No Manual.
Reviews.Author: joy l jewell
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my Mother who lives very far away. Shes 73 - I was sure with the manual she would be able to set this up herself. She was so excited. No manual comes with. She got so frustrated she offered to return it. I found a manual online and someone in her are who could assist her in setting up for use. Had I known this before hand, I would not have gotten it for her. A week later and she has gotten zero use out of it.

Reviews.Title: SWEEET!!!
Reviews.Author: IdahoMom
Reviews.Content: I love my kindle! I didn't realize all the neat things that it can do. It's better than an iPad! Does practically all the same things.I love,love, love this thing!

Reviews.Title: So worth it!
Reviews.Author: shansharpe "Shannon"
Reviews.Content: I was one of those die hard, I will never get rid of my "books" people...Well I am so happy with the Kindle Fire! I did not need the HD as I do not watch movies or anything. I love the fact that I can go on FB or any of the apps. So Happy I decided to "follow the masses". Great Price and fast shipping!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Wanda Conner
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my partner who is not very tech oriented.  He had the original Kindle and loved it, but made the transition to theFire easily.  He likes that he, while traveling, can access web sites and read his books without taking a computer with him.

Reviews.Title: charging port trouble... who cares with amazons great customer service!
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: I revived the kindle fire first gen as a Christmas present in 2012... I lobed it from day one although my husband would report I cannot set it down and it has been the cause of a few fights ;) it worked great for 6 months, then the charging got funny. I would have to prop it just right... wiggle the charger... it would take me 20 min sometimes to get the darn thing to charge... and God help anyone who bumped if while charging. I contacted customer care after it stopped charging all together. They told me I had about a month left on my warrenty and shipped me another free of cost in my hot little hands two days later. I was determined to baby this charging port as I was not sure if I still had a warrenty. But even with my ocdabout the port my kindle started acting up again :( I was segregated when it too would not charge. This time it only took a few months, but they were so nice the first time I called to see my options. WOULD YOU BELIEVE I was under warrenty and because it was a second replacement I was upgraded to the second gen!!! AMAZON knows how yo provide great customer care... as a customer care Rep tor a major phone company I am impressed and actually recomend Amazon to my customers... thank you again for listening to my issues and solving the problem. BRAVO

Reviews.Title: Kindle fire
Reviews.Author: julie  beckford
Reviews.Content: I totally love my kindle fire I'm on it all the time for reading as well as internet,don't know how I lived without it,they call me julie kindle at work because every break I get i'm on it.lol

Reviews.Title: Happy except for battery life
Reviews.Author: Marcia
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle fire. The only problem I have is the battery life. My husband has one from the first generation and his battery seems to last longer than mine. The difference is he watches alot of video and I play more games like solitaire etc. I would have thought that the video would take up more battery but guess I was wrong. Other than that it came one time and I'm very happy with it

Reviews.Title: Very nice tablet...
Reviews.Author: Dale La France
Reviews.Content: My wife uses this as I use an ipad. But I do still use this at times and it works great. My wife watches movies on this Kindle every single day and it just plays well.

Reviews.Title: Broken.
Reviews.Author: Alexandra Owen
Reviews.Content: I tapped the screen with my stylus no more than I tap it normally and the screen broke. This was my second Kindle.I do not believe I will be getting another.

Reviews.Title: Mother loved it
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: I am one of 5 and for months our mother talked about getting one. So for Christmas we all went together and bought he one. Can I just say she was stoked and beyond thrilled with the product. She takes it everywhere and she is not real computer Savvy but has this under control. Doesn't have to ask many questions when using or downloading anything. Not to mention my father is against technology big time and he also loves this product. My mom ended up buying him one for their anniversary bc he took hers to work. Ha ha needless to say both my mom and dad are beyond ecstatic about the product.

Reviews.Title: general review of new Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: one tew
Reviews.Content: Won't display videos posted on one of my favorite websites.Text size on many websites way too small for my old eyes, and the feature that pulls up a larger text size version will only pull up a part of it, such as Wikipedia. So I can't read the whole thing. It's really frustrating.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: Karrot
Reviews.Content: This version of the Kindle is so much better than my original version (generation one?)  The quality is superior, I can now imagine how the HD would be.

Reviews.Title: She Loves It...
Reviews.Author: Barely Legal Tattoo "Eric Ruff"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my 70 year old mother, she didn't want the HD, She just wanted the regular Kindle fire, She absolutely loves it. It got to us 2 days early which was awesome!! She has not put it down sense she opened the box. She is on her trial of the Amazon prime, which she loves, She said when her trail is over she is going to buy the subscription. She has been listening to music, reading books and watching movies. She is really getting the hang of it, she is not to techy, but the kindle fire is so easy to use, she hasn't really had to many questions about it. She really loves her kindle.

Reviews.Title: Very convenient device
Reviews.Author: Jesse
Reviews.Content: i would rate it '4 stars' because:Pros-Storage space is abundant-It's already mentioned convenience-Ease of use-Picture is sharp and crispCons-Battery life was disappointing. If it remains on 'airplane mode' though, you can get about 18 hours out of it by just simply reading

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Kimberly Deal
Reviews.Content: I had a 1st generation kindle Fire, and LOVED it. It started to not hold a charge, and Amazon took care of me and sent me a kindle Fire 2nd generation. It is different from the 1st but once I got used to it, man I love it more than the 1st! I read on it everyday, and use it for mulitple things through out the day. I don't know if I could live without it!

Reviews.Title: Love the Kindle Fire 7"
Reviews.Author: Kari L B Coyle
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Kindle Fire 7" as a gift for my husband who likes to surf the internet, facebook, check work emails, etc.  It is absolutely perfect for him.  It is fast, there is no delay and he gets on and gets off.  His laptop now sits on the corner of the desk collecting dust.  Althought the price was good, I do wish it was a little larger.  I also now find myself having to purchase a second one to keep the peace in the family.  The kids love the games, streaming videos, and reading books.  Great purchase.

Reviews.Title: kindle fire
Reviews.Author: chantilly59
Reviews.Content: I really Love my kindle I use it all the time but for some reason I can't get the flash player to work on it and downloaded all versions and NONE can be opened =( It is my one main bad point and there is to be a camera on it and I can not find it at all so that disappoints me also all in all .. would recommend it to friends matter a fact I have only I tell them to get the kindle fire HD instead

Reviews.Title: Upgraded from original Kindle reader
Reviews.Author: raeve
Reviews.Content: I bought my mother hers since she absolutely loved her Kindle reader, thinking why wouldn't she enjoy the touchscreen digital and she never looked back. She could probably write a book on all the uses of this Kindle Fire and the apps, so of course she bought one for me to enjoy. I do use it everyday and don't really use my old Kindle reader at all. I haven't used to full potential but for now it does everything and more than I need so I'm very happy with my Fire. We both became Prime members to enjoy all the perks and will probably upgrade to the bigger Fire next! I quite enjoy the small size of this one as it's easy to hold/carry with me. Getting around on it takes time and patience but overall it's pretty easy. Oh and my man friend bought the bigger HD Fire for his first tablet and absolutely loves it, carries it everywhere. Thanks Amazon!

Reviews.Title: one of my best investments
Reviews.Author: Beverly Barnes
Reviews.Content: I totally recommend this product.  I purchased it for my 12 year old and she loves it.  She isn't one for reading much but since she got the Kindle I can't keep her head out of a book! She thinks it is the coolest thing ever to read electronically.  The screen is clear and crisp.  Most of all the price is just right!!!

Reviews.Title: Perfect!
Reviews.Author: Maggie May
Reviews.Content: I purchased a Kindle fire when they first came out.  The original lasted a little over a year when I started having issues with the charging port and occasional freezing.  I contacted Amazon and they did not hesitate to offer to replace the Kindle.  The second one (also a generation 1) began exhibiting freezing problems almost immediately and subsequently developed the same issue with the loose charging port.This time it was replaced with a generation 2 Kindle Fire and I couldn't be happier.  It hasn't frozen once and when I plug in the charger it fits in much more securely than on the previous models.  Download speed is far superior as well.  I often ran into problems downloading on the first two, would have to go the Library to try again and eventually had to turn them off, then back on, to complete the download.In closing, I am thrilled with my latest Kindle Fire.  Amazon customer service, in my opinion, is second to none, so thank you Amazon!.Update:  May 31.  Unlike the first two, the charging port on the Gen 2 is still secure.  It just quit charging today.  So I'm on my way to my fourth Kindle Fire.  Honestly, I'm getting so discouraged I'm about ready to check out the Nook, but I have a ton of books that I'll lose if I do that, and I do occasionally go back and read them again.  At least with the old hardcovers, you had them forever.  With these readers, you only have the books as long as you have the device and all that money spent is gone.  As usual, Amazon customer service was helpful and agreed to replace (yet again!) this Kindle, and this time assured me I would not run into this problem again.  Considering my experience so far, I have no idea how they can promise that!Don't get me wrong -  I love the Kindle.  I use it constantly and maybe that's the problem.  Maybe they're meant to be used only occasionally.  When they work, there's nothing better, but this is starting to feel like some strange version of Groundhog Day.  I'm a quarter of the way into a new book and now have to wait until next week to continue reading.  It would seem that the Kindle's been around long enough for the bugs to be worked out, but obviously they still have some work to do.Disappointed and discouraged, but too much invested to quit now.

Reviews.Title: Good but not great
Reviews.Author: mtjames
Reviews.Content: I sought to write this review because I wanted to share how crippling not supporting flash video is to my web experience. 95% of what I use my kindle for is internet-related, and very few websites actually display properly on this device. Simply because flash is not supported. I am sick and tired of not being able to use my kindle for even the most basic of my internet needs. I have to use a damn desktop to watch a stupid video. I find I am more often than not disappointed in the kindle fire, and not just because of Amazon's utter failure to negotiate a way to display anything adobe, which is a major facet of today's web design still. GET WITH IT AND COME OUT WITH A WAY TO DISPLAY FLASH CONTENT,YA BUMS!

Reviews.Title: Battery Life is Terrible!
Reviews.Author: Morning Joy
Reviews.Content: A few days ago I went to Best Buy to purchase the Kindle Paperwhite, but as usually happens with me, I ended up being persuaded to upgrade my choice of device. I simply wanted a no frills e-reader...okay, maybe a few frills but strictly confined to more convenience in e-reading, no gaming or music capabilities or even web browsing. Our household has many gadgets, more than enough to do everything--Wii and Xbox gaming console, a couple laptops, a desktop, smartphones, mp3 players, etc. My primary purpose in looking into the Kindle Paperwhite was to get my children to reading more and increase their reading level. So it was with mixed feelings that I ended up buying the Kindle Fire, but did resist the saleswoman's urging to upgrade even more to the Kindle Fire HD. I stopped her in her tracks and said I don't want a camera, I don't want more space for games...or this or that--I want an e-reader only!Fast forward a few days of owning the Kindle Fire. Keep in mind, that though I am inexperienced with e-readers, I have much experience with computers, smartphones and many technical gadgets which accounts for my disappointment with the Kindle Fire. Initially, I did my research--on the Paperwhite because that is what I intended to buy so in some respects I have to own up to some fault in my final choice of purchase. After my Kindle Fire purchase, I familiarized myself with the specs and reviews. One spec I'm having a very big issue with is the supposed battery life. Okay, it's based on an android platform--I get that--and for that reason battery life won't be the greatest, but can be improved by turning off Wi-Fi when not in use and getting rid of unnecessary battery draining apps. Yes, I get all that. But, even doing all that my battery drains quickly, even more so than my smartphone. Really, the battery drains frightfully fast--within a few hours. Amazon needs to advertise the Kindle Fire's battery life more truthfully, especially as it is designed to be more than an e-reader.The second thing that bothers me greatly about the Kindle Fire is once again related to the battery and this is the USB cord included in the Kindle package. It sounds trivial, but it is not. Low power charging the Kindle is frustratingly slow and a day later when it had finally fully charged, the battery drained within a few hours. I found that my smartphone wall charger fit into my Kindle Fire and within a few hours I had a full battery again, but once again the battery drained quickly like it just won't hold its charge. This is NOT acceptable. I have done everything recommended to preserving battery life, but the bottom line is that Amazon seems to have stretched the truth about battery life of the Kindle Fire. It is much less than advertised.I don't normally write mostly negative reviews, but after hearing all the hype about the Kindle and then subsequently being disappointed with its performance, I think it's important to let people know about problems such as this in products. By the way, I have researched it and I am not by far the only one unhappy with the battery life of the Kindle Fire. Look it up, Google it, Bing it, whatever research engine you use, the battery life IS a problem with the Kindle Fire.

Reviews.Title: I bought my Fire from Best Buy
Reviews.Author: Adrian
Reviews.Content: about a month ago.  I have a first generation iPad and previously I have done all my reading on that via the Kindle app.  For reading books though, I think the Fire is a much better choice.  It's smaller and lighter and obviously easier to pack around, to say nothing of being less expensive than most tablets.  I love the ability to make purchases on the Fire which you are no longer able to do in the Kindle app on the iPad.The screen is bright and clear and very responsive.  I haven't done any official testing but I'm quite sure my Fire is faster than the iPad.  The text is very crisp on the Fire.  It's good on the iPad but better on the Fire I think.  The one area where the iPad is probably better is reading magazines, the screen on the 7" Fire is just too small to do that well.  I expected that going in and so it's not a major disappointment to me, but if you do a lot of magazine reading and don't have a tablet alternative, you might consider one of the 8.9" models instead.The only reason I don't give the Fire 5 stars is the battery life is, in my opinion, very poor.  I charge it more than I read it I think.  Not a huge issue around the house or hotel, but something that definitely needs to be worked on I think.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: MustangSally350
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy my Kindle Fire.  This is my second Kindle purchase and I will likely purchase another one down the road.  The only complaint that I have about my Kindle is that I cannot make folders for book categories.  I would like to sort books by genre but cannot.  It seems like this would be a simple fix but for now I just need to keep scrolling through every book I have purchased to see what I am looking for.

Reviews.Title: Charging Accessory
Reviews.Author: J. M. Ruff
Reviews.Content: Be sure to purchase the AC/DC charging accessory for $9.99 when purchasing the Kindle.  You can charge it by plugging it into your laptop/PC, but it made my laptop crash as it then "detected an unbootable hard drive" when I restarted my laptop.  It took an entire day to get my laptop up and detecting it's own hard drive.  If you choose the buy the accessory later, it changes the price to $19.99 at checkout when not purchased as a bundle. Customer service did honor the price, but it was an additional hassle "explaining" everything to the foreign customer service reps.  Save yourself some time and frustration.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: Chris M
Reviews.Content: I love being able to get magazines and books on my kindle and have them at my-ready  wherever I am. Goodie!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire and accessories for start-up
Reviews.Author: Karen Lueken
Reviews.Content: After an unfortunate experience with the Paperwhite and accessories that I had originally purchased for a gift, I re-ordered the Kindle Fire and the accessories. I am so pleased with the Kindle Fire and its accessories and I wish that I would have ordered it to begin with. This gift is for a parent that has never received anything like this in her life and it will provide years of entertainment, reading, growth and fun for her. Since I wanted to make sure that it is the perfect gift for her, so in order to do that, I have had to spend some time playing with it. So far, I have been extremely impressed with the Kindle Fire and the accessories and I know that she will be too.

Reviews.Title: Review
Reviews.Author: Leanora Williams
Reviews.Content: It was a birthday gift for my 9 year old grandson and he loves it. He hardly puts it down.

Reviews.Title: Review
Reviews.Author: Nicole
Reviews.Content: Very happy with the product and price.  I love to read and there are always good deal on books!! Aweome

Reviews.Title: The Best Electronic Device I've Purchased In Years!
Reviews.Author: texicanwife "Texicanwife"
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love my Kindle Fire! Perfect size for reading books. Great for viewing television shows on movies when alone. Excellent for surfing the web. Love the brilliance of the colors when looking at periodicals. Keeps me up to date on all of my favorite news sites, business periodicals, and latest books are available immediately! Love, love, love the portability of the Kindle Fire. Anywhere there is a Wi-Fi connection, I can check out all the info I need! Love, love, love it! I can't say it enough! I highly recommend this tablet to everyone!

Reviews.Title: Kids love it!
Reviews.Author: SandnSable
Reviews.Content: I was given this for xmas. Unfortunately my kids hijacked it and I rarely get to use it. Its very fast compared to other tablets and cell phones. After 2 months of wear and tear, no doubt from kids the screen got a crack in it. Amazon sent me a brand new one! Excellent customer service

Reviews.Title: LOVE
Reviews.Author: PuppyLover
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle Fire.  It is small and lightweight and easy to take with me.  The charge doesn't stay that long, but it charges quickly.

Reviews.Title: Excellent item and well packaged too
Reviews.Author: Beverly Curley
Reviews.Content: The item is excellent.  It is just what I expected and I use it every day and would encourage others to purchase this too.

Reviews.Title: Love love love
Reviews.Author: J. Schau
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle Fire.  I debated on this one or the HD and I opted for this.  I don't regret it a bit.

Reviews.Title: Hubby loves it and uses it everyday
Reviews.Author: Butterbug's Mom "Adam & Eric's Mommy"
Reviews.Content: I had initially purchase this for myself but then my hubby convinced me to trade this for his old one which I really didn't mind because I have an iPad. He reads on this everyday.

Reviews.Title: I like it, but its no ipad....
Reviews.Author: Brigid Mangen
Reviews.Content: I had borrowed my sisters iPad for several months, and I am an avid Apple user for the most part, but I still had high hopes for the kindle. We had bought our Mom one for Christmas (the iPad was too expensive we felt) and as far as I know, she loves it. I bought one around the same time since it was cheaper (also cheaper than iPad, but bought on Cyber Monday, so a much better deal than normal). It is definitely nice for books, nicer than the Ipad, however, I am still a fan of traditional books and have only downloaded two books on my kindle thus far. I like to play on the kindle before bed since my boyfriend is averse to any extra light at night. It works fine for internet surfing, however I did prefer the Ipad for this since it had a bigger screen. I sometimes watch Hulu or Netflix on it, however my one main annoyance is that the speaker is on the top (standing up like a book) and when you watch a show or movie, you will most likely tilt it and then the speaker comes out one side. It would have been nice if the speaker went on the side that was the long way, or both on top and bottom. So overall, it is nice enough, but I honestly prefer the iPad for mostly everything less for reading books (which is why most people get it I'm sure). Pros: Small, compact size, great if you use mainly for books, cheaper than iPad. Cons: Small screen size for internet browsing (i know size is both a pro and con), speaker placement, typing on it is not as easy as an ipad since letters are placed closer than normal keyboard (I don't know, this might just be me here). That pretty much wraps it up. Like I said, i mainly use for internet browsing and email, if you want for books it's a go!

Reviews.Title: Awesome!!!
Reviews.Author: rodney teel
Reviews.Content: OMG! this is wonderful my husband bought it for me and now he hates it! :)it is his new replacement should have bought one years ago.:)

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Judith Lackey
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for my husband.  He absolutey loves it.  I am considering getting one for myself.  It arrived on time and in good condition.

Reviews.Title: delighted purchase!!!
Reviews.Author: Cmking
Reviews.Content: I am delighted to have my kindle.it arrived on time and in perfect condition.I couldn't have been happier with this transaction.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT! should I have bought the kindle fire HD?
Reviews.Author: Erin Halvorson
Reviews.Content: I love this product. I have the kindle app for my laptop and loved it and finally decided to purchase a kindle fire.. after a lot of thought and research. I decided the kindle fire was it. I read a LOT and have enjoyed not having to tote my laptop everywhere. I am now wondering if I should have spent the extra cash and bought the fireHD as the screen is a bit small to watch movies and checking email takes a little practice. Hmmm? guess I could give the fire to my husband and buy the fireHD for myself as he is thinking about getting one as well. Keep in mind when using the wifi mode it does use the battery rather quickly.

Reviews.Title: Support on this item is awesome!
Reviews.Author: ShannonBarnes
Reviews.Content: We bought this for our 7 year old son for Christmas last year.It is easy to use and perfect size for him. He has lots of fun but also educational apps.So many to choose from! After about a year of use we had a few issues with the power on the Kindle.Amazon replaced it the same day I called them!This is another reason why we love their products and the website!

Reviews.Title: I Love It!!!
Reviews.Author: Brian Sherman
Reviews.Content: I felt that it would be easier for my wife to enjoy a tablet that she could read a book, check her emails, play her games and not have to lug around a laptop computer.  This fit the bill!

Reviews.Title: disappointing
Reviews.Author: cruncher
Reviews.Content: Do not like the main screen set-up first kindle was better.  No Adobe flash player most videos I watch are Adobe format.  Can not download needlework patterns from several web sites because new kindle no longer supports them.  Could download from these sites on first generation kindle.  Do not like screen set for applications or deals of the day.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire 7"
Reviews.Author: Fikrat Gadjiev "Bookish"
Reviews.Content: This one is fine, but the battery dies out so quickly even when Wi-Fi and all the applications are off. The ad said 8 weeks when you are reading books and do nothing else. I probably compare it with my second Kindle Keyboard. That one was a genius! Die hard!

Reviews.Title: Nice Device
Reviews.Author: Bajamonster
Reviews.Content: This is a great buy. I use it all the time. I red about 1 book a week. Just depends on how long the book is. I only have to charge the battery every 2 weeks if i just read. Sometimes when i watch some youtube videos i have to charge it more often, but nonetheless it has great battery life. Also it is a fast and fluid design. I like the android operating system.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Product
Reviews.Author: Jordan
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this product. It absolutely exceeds all expectations. If you've been thinking of buying an ebook reader, then this is the one.

Reviews.Title: grandma
Reviews.Author: grandma
Reviews.Content: Love the kindle fire. Great for reading and playing games.Love being able to change font size. Great purchase.good for kids too.

Reviews.Title: All around excellent product
Reviews.Author: James Bangert
Reviews.Content: I completely amazed at the video quality on the Kindle fire, and also impressed at how many different things it does so well. I'm still just getting into it, but after having it for only a few days, and considering the price, I would highly recommend Kindle Fire to anyone looking for an easy to use high quality tablet.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire- love IT
Reviews.Author: Kerry c "Kerry C"
Reviews.Content: Terrific purchase. Would highly recommend :) also took advantage of the free month of Prime. It's already paid for itself in shipping costs alone... Watching two seasons of Downton Abbey was just a great bonus. Screen is on par with my IPad. It's a great size.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire 7 HD
Reviews.Author: Sharon Aguilar
Reviews.Content: I bought the Kindle Fire HD for my husband, which means I have to listen to him complain when he is having problems with it.  Currently he is having difficulty with it turning on/off at will.  When it begins to do that, you can't get it turn on and stay on.  I am really regretting buying it, especially since I did not keep the receipt.  I have bought 4 Kindle Fires previously (one for myself, 3 for gifts) and have not had one single problem with any of them.  Not really happy at all with this product.  :(

Reviews.Title: I Love It!
Reviews.Author: Amanda Hawkins
Reviews.Content: I love my new Kindle Fire.  I got it to replace the first generation Kindle Fire, and like it even better than the first one.  Thanks for a great product.

Reviews.Title: Update August 2013
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: (UPDATE) I have owned my kindle for 5 months now and have read many books on it. The biggest advantage that I have found to owning the kindle is being able to access the public library with it. I have downloaded and read at least 25 books through the public library system. I have found that the kindle is quite easy to put public library books on versus the nook(my Aunt owns a nook and I recently spent 2 days trying to figure out how to put library books on it- it was a big pain to do.) I have saved over $200 just using the public library to put books on my kindle. I still am quite happy with the kindle fire, however if you mainly want to read I would purchase the kindle e-reader instead because the battery life is longer.  (Original review)I am now an owner of the Kindle Fire 8GB. After a few days of using it, I have decided that I am quite happy that I chose the Kindle Fire over the Kindle e reader. Even though it cost more I feel that I will be able to do a lot more things with it, such as watch movies, listen to music, audio books and play games that I can download from the app store. I was a little bit worried about the ads that would display, but I have found that the ads are not bothersome at all and hardly noticeable. It downloads books quite fast and I have found that I am enjoying reading on the kindle fire much more than on my tablet. For one it is much lighter than the tablet that I was using. I have also found that the kindle reader works much better on the kindle fire than what it had worked on my tablet. Another thing that I found was that my BHG digital magazine subscription is easily read on the kindle fire whereas I was having problems trying to read it on my tablet. All in all I am very satisfied and I would recommend it. However if you really cannot spare the extra money for the fire and just really want to read than purchase the kindle e reader because you will not regret reading e books from Amazon. They have an amazing assortment of free books and are easily compatible with the library system to receive free e books from the library too. They also do not require a credit card like the nook does.Since I have now owned my kindle fire for a few weeks I would like to add that I am still enjoying it. I have found many free apps in the store that I can use. Amazon also offers a different free app each day. I have also been able to purchase a few books for free that also had the free audio to go with it. I have been able to view movies on it and the picture quality is excellent. I have also been able to use the silk browser which I am satisfied with, but would probably use my laptop to do major searching,ect. For $159.00 I have been able to get an ereader, a browser to surf the internet, games from the app. store and the use of the audio for books. No this is not an ipad, however it does not cost over $300 also. I had debated whether to purchase an ipad mini or the kindle fire for a long time prior to making my purchase and I am very happy that I saved at least $200 with the purchase of the kindle fire. Also only about 5Gb can be used for storing stuff, however that is more than enough space for books and apps, and whatever more space is needed is available through cloud for free. I think that the KINDLE FIRE  IS A GOOD VALUE FOR THE MONEY SPENT.

Reviews.Title: Thoughts on New Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: I started with a Kindle DX, then bought my wife a 6 in Kindle, before moving up to a Kindle Fire recently.  It took a little getting used to with the screen format, but was similar in navigation to my i-phone, so i got used to it quickly.  Colors are vibrant and navigation is easy to use.  So far, my only complaint, and it is big one, is that I have not found a way to use my Kindle Fire outside.  While on a back patio on a sunny day yesterday, I found i could not read anything on my screen.  All i could see was my own reflection.  I increased the brilliance setting, but was uable to read anything on the screen.  If there is a setting for outdoors or bright su, I haven't found it.  I can see no way i can use my new Kindle Fire at a pool, beach or even a back yard patio.  My son-in-law also has a Kindle Fire and reports the same shortcoming.  This is why I have given such a mediocre rating to an otherwise great product.  If anyone has a solution, I would love to hear it.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Mr. K
Reviews.Content: Bought it for the kid and spend more time using it myself. LOL. No need for special HD version as this one is just fine

Reviews.Title: I didn't like it that it did not come with a complete charger, I didn't realize you had to order that.
Reviews.Author: Paulette
Reviews.Content: Because I had to wait for my charger to come.  I don't think you should have to order your charger by its self that should come with it.  I think you pay for it.My Kindle Fire 7 does not seem to stay  charged very long I'd say 4 hours, my regular kindle stay charged for a long time.I do like the special features to be longed onto internet etc.

Reviews.Title: Would be better if the screen didn't crack so easily
Reviews.Author: Enamn Ep "Chell"
Reviews.Content: My husband bought me a Kindle Fire for Mother's Day. He made the grievous error of not buying the extended warranty. I let my 7 year old play on it, if she was sitting down. Since it was in a case, I thought it would be okay. Amazon states on their website,"Kindle Fire is designed to stand up to accidental bumps and scrapes. Our state-of-the art display is 20 times stiffer and 30 times harder than plastic, so you can let your child play, without worry." This is NOT true. My daughter dropped it between the seat and the door in the car. The corner of the display shattered in a spiderweb pattern. Now, I am without my beloved Kindle. So, if you're going to buy the Kindle and let your kids play on it, buy the warranty.

Reviews.Title: kindle fire
Reviews.Author: herman
Reviews.Content: Still trying to figure it out. Need WI FI to down load stuff.  could use a stylus to do some things, my fingers are too big for tapping on small things. other wise i like it verry well. Reccommed maybe after I figure it all out.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Nicole DiSalvo
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my fiance' for his birthday last year and he loves it.  This is a guy who never thought he'd give up reading a "real live paper book"---after his first book on his Kindle Fire--he's never gone back.  Fast shipping and great quality.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic gift for the two of us!
Reviews.Author: booksalive "tuna"
Reviews.Content: I got the fire because my wife likes to read before she falls asleep. I however go right out. The kindle gives her the ability to read without the lights on, she downloads what she likes and I get to zzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzz

Reviews.Title: Worth every penny.
Reviews.Author: W. R. G. DMD
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased indeed with my Kindle Fire. I purchased it with the intent to use it for reading e-books, Kindle books or whatever else i could find online through Amazon. Since receiving it, I have found an entire world of publis libaries to borrow from. And as an unexpected plus, if I am in a Wifi location, I can use it as a mini-computer to look for sanything that i might fancy.A great buy. Did not believe that I needed the HD version and that has been entirely true in my case.

Reviews.Title: Great deal
Reviews.Author: Shawnta
Reviews.Content: I really like its easy to use the only thing I would change,is it should come with a wall charger other then that its a dream

Reviews.Title: cant live without it!!!
Reviews.Author: Michael philhower
Reviews.Content: I love my kindle fire!!!!! It is perfect for myself and great for our 7 year old to use in lieu of a tablet!

Reviews.Title: It's my new hip attachment <3
Reviews.Author: vnh101
Reviews.Content: The kindle not only is an endless supply of books but I downloaded an app that lets me take notes in class then e-mail them to myself. By far one of my best buys ever. Let's just say I would be more upset if it broke than if my phone broke.

Reviews.Title: Gift for someone
Reviews.Author: April
Reviews.Content: Great item, I think it's good rival to the iPad, but I've not actually used it for we used it for a giveaway/raffle.  However the person who won it was VERY excited.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire 7" Wi-Fi
Reviews.Author: Sharon Geimer
Reviews.Content: Love my Kindle Fire. I enjoy to read in bed. With the Kindle Fire you do not have to have a light on in the room. My husband likes that part. I have download some games and playing has been fun. Amazon has been  wonderful helping me with information about  this Kindle. I just wish I could get Adobe on the Kindle Fire so I could play one of the games in Facebook.

Reviews.Title: love it cant be with out it
Reviews.Author: kimba200
Reviews.Content: love this i love to read and this is the best!!! it is never more than 2 feet from me I take it to work and every where I go I like that i can get books in a few seconds, the game I get are fun and relaxing to me every thing is at my finger tips. It was a gift, and it was the best thing they could have got for me.it is easy to use I love that it lights up. you can read in the dark.the batter life is good too, I am on it 24seven so I charge it every day but it is on all day.I am sure I could get more out of it but I dont want to be with out it for a second, I an extremely addicted to this.my family makes fun of me and tries to hide from me,because i love it so much.if you get one and you love to read I am sure you will love it. the only ting that I am worried about is running out of manga to read.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Sara Ornelas
Reviews.Content: Love this kindle. Love that I can set my book fonts and my son loves the games and all the apps. Like all the wifi access and the picture on it.

Reviews.Title: Awesome and quick reader...
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: Nice design...  Quick response time for books, games, apps...  I can't complain...  Wife and kids keep it hostage from me so I don't get to read on it often...  However, my children use the free time feature like crazy and have been doing their school reading on it...  It has an Android based OS but it's proprietary design limits you from going onto google store and such...  It has it's own proprietary home screen which is only slightly different from a standard android layout...  Once you get used to how to maneuver thru this kindle you realize it's not hard...  Once again...  It is really quick...  Even with games and apps...  Awesome unit...

Reviews.Title: Great Unit
Reviews.Author: Kevin Laitinen
Reviews.Content: Wife absolutely adores her Kindle. Big upgrade from the old one.Great deal for a great price! She would totally recommend this to all Kindle users.

Reviews.Title: I love it!!!
Reviews.Author: nicole pollard
Reviews.Content: this kindle is awesome im in love i cant put it down, i highly recommend it for everyone thanks again

Reviews.Title: Fun for the whole family!
Reviews.Author: Holly A. McClure
Reviews.Content: We love our kindle! Our entire family (including the 8 month old baby) love to use the kindle! It's great for books, games, and apps.

Reviews.Title: Kindle cover
Reviews.Author: Diane Kenney
Reviews.Content: The cover was an excellent value.  Has same features as more expensive ones and comes in same variety of colors.

Reviews.Title: Kindle
Reviews.Author: megan
Reviews.Content: I love the kindle! I can download any of the games and it is also great to have when you have kids!!

Reviews.Title: Xmas Gift
Reviews.Author: Pennie Thomas
Reviews.Content: I was glad to find this during Xmas time with fast delivery and savings.  Will always go to Amazon to find fulfill my needs.

Reviews.Title: A gift for my 8 year old twin Sons..
Reviews.Author: ZeccaZoo
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Free app is a must have for kids. This has way better controls then my tablet. I know the boys will love it, I even found a free movie and books to get them started.

Reviews.Title: down loading on kindle
Reviews.Author: Janice hirschey
Reviews.Content: I like my kindle fire, but sometimes I have a problem with down loading  apps.  And I wish I had a book to see all the features that I can do with my kindle.  Like if I should down load adobe for see game and such on the internet.  wish I could get a book rather than us what is on the instruction on the kindle.

Reviews.Title: my 2nd one
Reviews.Author: Jean
Reviews.Content: it's heavier than a paperback/hardcover but it's so convenient. i use it mostly as an e-reader. I like that I can also surf online.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Maureen Warren
Reviews.Content: The kindle is user friendly. I love the features. My books are easy to read the resolution is great. I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: loved the kindle
Reviews.Author: Ben
Reviews.Content: This was my first tablet. I am impressed with it. Didn't know if I would like reading books on this but it it was awesome.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: YOLMARTAY
Reviews.Content: It took me a little while to maneuver it but all in all i love the item...I mainly use it for books anyway...the turnaround time in using any web service (wi-Fi) is slow.

Reviews.Title: Amazon customer service
Reviews.Author: fenian65
Reviews.Content: This is just a thank you for the awesome service that we have recieved over the course of a few years. My wife and i have worked in customer service for many years and are mindful of good or bad service anywhere we shop.We had a problem wwith our kindle fire and called Amazon's customer service chat spoke with a rep. and had a new Kindle in a couple of days.We did not ask for a new one we were just trying to get the damaged one repaired the customer service rep was amazing and the follow up was prompt and professional..We will never buy anything online unless we cant get it from Amazon first..kudos to you Amazon as a company...

Reviews.Title: Love Kindle
Reviews.Author: Debbe Swafford
Reviews.Content: My mothers previous kindle finally bit the dust and I was able to get this for her the next day.  She didn't have a kindle fire and it was a surprise for her.  She loves it.  I have one of my own and would not be without it.  It does everything a tablet should do.

Reviews.Title: kindle
Reviews.Author: Joan Phillips
Reviews.Content: Love amazon and my kindle, I had some problems with the kindle, but amazon was right on the ball and helped me get through the process of getting a new one and sending back the old one.

Reviews.Title: Great unit, without paying for HD
Reviews.Author: Barbara Lyke
Reviews.Content: The display is clear, both indoors and outdoors, with more than adequate speed to apps.  Movies come through great, especially using headphones.  Lots of free apps available.  echarge time is reasonable and battery life meets my needs.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Anita Kay Kitchen
Reviews.Content: Not as good as my original Kindle. It is harder to use and some apps do not work. Sorry, but not satisfied

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire is good!
Reviews.Author: Kelly Beutler
Reviews.Content: I love the Kindle fire...shopping for books online tickles me, along with the chance to read some before buying. My only reservation: This color version has a rather short battery life, even when Wi-Fi is off. After several hours of reading, it needs a recharge if you want juice for tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Mama to six
Reviews.Content: This Kindle was sent to me by Amazon when my older model Kindle Fire would not take a charge any longer.

Reviews.Title: Perfect gift for my kids
Reviews.Author: Kati Mendez "Kati"
Reviews.Content: After purchasing an off-brand tablet for my son and having to return it due to it not even turning on the first day we had it, we decided to go with what we knew was great and bought him this Kindle Fire 7".  It was the perfect decision for him and he absolutely loves his kindle.  He has the ability to play education and fun games, watch movies and tv shows, draw, color, read books, anything really!  We put restrictions on it and he is not allowed to sit and play it 24/7, but it is a very awesome thing to stick in our bag to take on road trips, trips out of town, or even just to a big gathering where he will surely be bored most of the night.  His sister plays on my own kindle, and she's 3... they are just great devices that hold so many different tools that are great for people of all ages.  People spend so much more on iPad's these days and I honestly have no idea why, when the Kindle Fire's do the exact same things, sometimes more!  You're missing out if you don't purchase a Kindle Fire!

Reviews.Title: I received my new Kindle :)
Reviews.Author: Nancy
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with my Kindle Fire.  I received great customer service when I called in to talk with someone and then prompt delivery of my new Kindle.  Thank you very much for your quick response, knowledge of the subject and following through with what you promised.  Nancy Cairns

Reviews.Title: I love my Kindle Fire!
Reviews.Author: Sandra Gest
Reviews.Content: This little computer exceeds my expectations! I do not leave home without it! I sometimes have long periods of time between appointments. Well now I grab a cup of coffee, pull out my kindle..and enjoy my free time. I can read, play Words with Friends or other games,listen to music, watch a movie, search the web, go on Facebook, or Pinterest... How did I live without this?  This version charges faster, seems to keep the charge longer, and is very fast! I love, love, love it! Did I mention how clear the screen is? What would I change?  One small thing- You have to buy the charger!  I was not aware..so I had to run back out to get it!

Reviews.Title: I Thought I Wanted To Do More Than Just READ, But Alas...
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: Background: I own an iPhone 5 and use an iPad 2 fairly regularly. My preferred computer is a PC running Windows 7. I used a Kindle Keyboard before this and loved it. Received the Kindle Fire as a gift.I wanted to like the Kindle Fire. I really did. I was tired of the super-closed ecosystem of iOS and also just wanted to try using a new device, especially since my Kindle Keyboard had a habit of freezing up or dropping dramatically in battery level for no reason. In short, it was time for a new reading device. I wanted something that was more of a tablet that I could still read on, so the Fire seemed perfect for me. However, for me personally, there really isn't much good that I can say about this device. It turns out that I would prefer a device solely for reading, so I'm planning on getting the regular Kindle.1) Weight: It's HEAVY. Okay, so it's not like carrying a cement block, but coming from the Kindle Keyboard it's a clunker. I knew it was going to be significantly heavier than the devices I'm used to since I read reviews and watched commentary, but it was still a surprise. I'm a slender guy with not much arm strength...while I could hold this one-handed and read it, it got tiring for me very fast. If you're the kind of person who props tablets up or has them lying on a table then this is irrelevant, but I'm a daily subway commuter and need something to read one-handed when I can't get a seat on the train. The Kindle Fire is not good for this purpose for me.2) Responsiveness: Coming from iOS devices, the Kindle Fire is rather sluggish in terms of the interface. I've found myself tapping icons and menus several times before it would open, and scrolling was always hiccuped. Navigating the device was just a slow process in general.3) Speed: This kind of goes with the above, but you can tell the Kindle is getting to be an old device. Things just aren't snappy, which may have to do with the processor and memory on the device. Wifi is also slow compared to the other devices I've used. If you think you might be downloading a lot of stuff or streaming a lot, you may want to reconsider getting this because it just doesn't seem to be built for heavy media.4) Lack of some key buttons: I knew the Fire didn't have buttons for page turning, but as many point out it also doesn't have physical volume buttons. Which is fine, but having to swipe the menu down each time you want to adjust the volume is a little annoying...especially since pretty much every other device out there has physical buttons. I also found that for me, I preferred having physical page-turning buttons as the page turning via touchscreen was a little TOO responsive. Even a gently tap on the screen would pop up the menu or turn the page, which got annoying very fast for me. The touchscreen volume control is also not very fine-tuned--I found that I had to put it quite high to hear notification sounds, but shrink it back down for other things.5) Display: The Kindle Fire doesn't seem to have auto-brightness...which makes manually adjusting the brightness depending on where you are quite annoying. I found that even at a relatively low setting it was just too bright for my eyes. Even switching the text to white-on-black didn't make much of a difference.6) Battery: Obviously, compared to a regular Kindle the Fire is going to have shorter battery life as it's a tablet. But it's shorter than the iPad, shorter than any other device I've used. I would prefer a device that can last me a few days, so I'm choosing to go back to the regular Kindle.7) Interface: If you're coming from an iOS device, specifically an iPad (even one that isn't current, like the iPhone 4), you will notice that the Kindle Fire is just...meh. I personally found the carousel on the home screen very annoying, and there's no way to change it or remove it.
