There is no real concept of a "home screen" as the carousel simply populates your most-recently used apps or books, based on time. You can add things to the Favorites Menu but it doesn't really replace the carousel as it's still there on the screen. The textual icons on the top can be a little hard to press sometimes, and I found myself hitting someone else next to it because they are so close together.8) That awkward middle ground: This is kind of a summation of all my points. I think the Kindle Fire is not quite a tablet but a little more than just an e-reader, so for me it lies in that awkward middle ground. It's not good enough for me to use it as a full-fledged tablet, but it's too much bells and whistles for me to just read on it. And I'm really just looking for a device to READ on. I found myself getting too distracted by other things on this device while I was reading--fiddling with the brightness because it was too bright, opening and closing Twitter, going into Settings again, etc. I'm sure this contributes to the shorter battery life, but that's just the thing...I thought I wanted to do more than just read on a device, but after using the Fire it turns out I'd rather just have a device solely for reading. The extras on the Kindle Fire are nice but they aren't good enough for me to justify using them, and the reading experience is just not as pleasant. If you're looking for more of a tablet experience I would advise you to stay away from the Kindle Fire and pay a little more for something like the Galaxy Tab 2. If you're looking more to just read, like me, then go for a regular Kindle. The Kindle Fire just doesn't do that great of a job trying to combine the two.

Reviews.Title: Frustrated with charging port!!
Reviews.Author: Abbey
Reviews.Content: I am on my second Kindle Fire, and about to get another.  Each time I receive a new one, within the first day, the charging port is so loose, it will not charge consistantly.  It is so frustrating, and obviously it's a problem with all of the Kindle Fires.  I checked online and found LOTS of other people with the same problem.  I LOVE my Kindle when it's charged and working, but I'm starting to regret the purchase since Amazon cannot seem to get the problem resolved on this device.

Reviews.Title: Charging port has problems - No repair options
Reviews.Author: Ann "Wallet Lady"
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these in November 2011. One of them had to be returned within 30 days due to problems with the port that the charger plugs into. It was an easy exchange. Fast forward 14 months and now the other one will not charge at all due to problems with the same port. Amazon will not replace as it is not under warranty any longer, which I understand, but they have no options for repair. All we need is this port replaced. Nope.So if you don't mind spending $200 for a years worth of use, this is a nice gadget. However, I paid $200 for my Samsung Galaxy two years ago and have never had one problem with it. I don't think Amazon builds the Kindles to last because they want people to buy the new one that comes out each year. It is also a shame that these devices can't be repaired - just another tech device in the landfills. Amazon is always trying to act like a "green" company - if they are so green, why don't they have recycling, or trade in program for their Kindles?

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Faith
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle Fire!  It is a good size and has so many apps.  It has a variety of uses that I really enjoy.  It hasespecially come in handy when I am away from home for my kids to watch a movie or read a book.Can't believe I waited this long to get one.  It is a great product!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire 7"
Reviews.Author: Joanne Engisch
Reviews.Content: I first purchased the Kindle Fire last winter 2012.  Around New Year's, it stopped charging.  I called Amazon to question if my warranty was still valid.  I received a brand new Kindle to replace my old Kindle within 5 days!  And, that was after being told there would be a delay due to high holiday sales.  I love my Kindle.  I love the service provided by Amazon.com!

Reviews.Title: Great Purchase!
Reviews.Author: D. Marquez "D Marquez"
Reviews.Content: We love it!  Best purchase!  Our 6 yrs old our 3 yrs old and two adults use this thing and it's great!  The girls read books on it, watch movies and play games and we mostly read books.  We think it's better for kids then a Gameboy or Nintendo DS.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Mrs Ram
Reviews.Content: My husband purchased me a kindle fire almost a year go. We loved it so much we turned around and purchased him one pretty much right away. Even though I am approaching my 3rd kindle fire due to the fact that 2 of them so far have just stopped charging, each time I contacted Amazon they were very helpful and immediately got me a replacement sent out. I will be getting kindle fires for my older kids soon, and I have no desire to have an ipad because there is nothing wrong with my kindle fire and the price we paid is not even close to the cost of an Ipad. I also get tons of free books and apps! I <3 Amazon!

Reviews.Title: First Generation Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Roy A. Kaminsky
Reviews.Content: Actually this review refers to the 1st Generation Kindle Fire purchased 11/30/11. . Two times over the past several months I tried to find an answer to my problem with my Kindle Fire. The last time by "a phone call", the Amazon representative was unable to offer a solution. He had never heard of the problem before. I only wanted to hear a suggestion for how I can adjust my settings. Although on my last call, he the repr did speak to somebody else. With that said, often, the Kindle screen is partially hidden on the sides, such as the letter/numbers of keyboard are hidden to the sides, In other words, the keyboard or web site does not fit correctly on to my Kindle device's screen. That was my line of questioning in the Fall and now last week in Feb. 2013 with Amazon. As I'm looking at this moment at my screen, the problem seems to be getting worse. And to add fuel to the fire, this past week, my Kindle Fire will not begin to charge no matter what adaptor is used or electrical outlet it is plugged into. Anytime you push the on/off button, a screen comes with a graphic of an empty battery with a note cannot be charged. Connect to an electrical outlet and wait 15 minutes." As I said, connecting the Kindle Fire will not chargeUpdate 4/2/13-After several month of trying Amazon Support came through to my satisfaction.

Reviews.Title: difficulty charging.
Reviews.Author: alex
Reviews.Content: I am on my second kindle thanks to warranty. First one wouldn't charge and even now I have problems with this one not wanting to charge.

Reviews.Title: fun
Reviews.Author: duh
Reviews.Content: I like this one a lot better than the 1st generation fire. The functions work ten times better than the first one

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire: Nothing Stops It
Reviews.Author: Steve of Virgina
Reviews.Content: Well I was given my Kindle Fire for Christmas by my kids last year. I have enjoyed it very much reading books during lunch and watching movies in my bed at night. But one day I could not find it - it was lost.The last time I remember seeing it was the day I went to the trash dump.Yes I thought I some how threw it away.So most of a month goes by and my wife happens takes a look outside next to the house and on a barrel is my KINDLE! She found it! But wait... it was outside for most of January in the Virgina mountains in freezing rain, sleet, snow with temperatures that got down to 15°F. I thought for sure it was fried. I got it and pressed the button and it started right up! My wife says you might want to let it dry out first... so I shut it down and let it sit for about 2 hours and then started it up again.My fire worked great... and it even had some 6 battery hours still on it before I had to recharge it. After a week now it is still working. I am truly amazed at how well these kindles were put together to make them water proof: Or at least I can say mine is!

Reviews.Title: Everybody should step on their old Kindle and crush it!
Reviews.Author: D Bricher "Jane of All Trades"
Reviews.Content: Not that being out of $89 is a pleasant experience.  My first Kindle fell in a bathtub and drowned, my second one was crushed by my foot.  I am resigned to losing this third Kindle to something, so I passed up the expensive case, the quick charger and the screen protector.  It might terminate its existence by being eaten by a bear, because I want something small enough to take camping. So I did buy the less expensive case, just to have something to cushion the Fire against pressure.  (It's not an Etch-A-Sketch that can be tossed into the bottom of a fully loaded toybox.)Actually, when the Kindle first came out, I purchased one as a gift for my daughter.  She doesn't get to use it much for her own pleasure, but the children love it. They use it to watch kids' movies and to play Angry Birds.  My daughter recommends watching movies with it plugged in, because video and games drain the power out quickly.  I watched a couple of videos, but had difficulty finding the volume control.  I suspect that the sound quality improves dramatically if you listen with headphones, which are usually hanging on a nail in my computer room, never with me.  I need to charge it daily, but I am reading something every day.Because I'm really only interested in using it as an e-reader, I got a couple of books from my local library and subscribed to Readers Digest.  Love the quality of the pictures, a quality that is not to be had on the original Kindle (I skipped the Paperwhite.)  The RD on the Kindle Fire is a lot more interesting than on the old Kindle and even better than the print version (50 years of reading delight with that version).  Leaving wireless on, one can click on all kinds of interactive spots and do Word Power right there - the answers erase when you leave the page. It's much easier to locate a particular chapter on the Kindle Fire, unlike its predecessors.  To find the beginning of a chapter, select the Go To option and a menu pops up, offering the various chapters by name.All in all, I am pleased.  So, after the bear devours this one, I'd be glad to buy another Fire for Kindle #4.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: subo
Reviews.Content: I asked for kindle for Xmas,did not want kindle fire as only wanted it for reading books. Was bought the kindle fire and I absolutely love it. Download music as well as books.Lots I still have not tried yet e.g.films,but I`m sure I`'ll get round to that soon.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: carolina79 "J Ho"
Reviews.Content: My mother loves this.  I like not having to deal with itunes, Ipod fits better in your pocket but, this is good for the home.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: KyMama
Reviews.Content: I received this KF (some refer to it as the second generation KF) as a replacement for the original one. I love both versions of it. I love how you have more options to chose from (like shop, games, etc) and that to get to your favorites you hit the star. I also think the speakers are a little louder than the original one.The one thing I absolutely dislike is the X-RAY feature. I am one of those people who let kids onto my kindle (my son is age 3 years old) and the x-ray feature is always there on the bottom and he thinks that means what pops up is whats on the device and its not. It sends you to amazon.com where you can buy it. This has cause many melt downs and I wish I could turn it off but so far I dont think you are able to.I am just waiting for the day when amazon puts out a kindle that compares to the nooks and ipads. I would love to have the option for different users (that way my books and apps stay separate from my sons), and want to be able to organize into folders and different categories.I recommend this to everyone I know and have persuaded several friends to buy one and they all love it. The xray feature is the only thing on here I dont like. If you want a camera and mic probably want to buy a different version of the kindle. O and if you read alot the battery dies fast lol. I charge my kindle 3 or more times a day due to me reading and being online often and my son playing his games. so if your on the go alot you may want to invest in a car charger too and maybe a spare charger to take with you.There are tons of free books for the avid reader, tons of free apps for children, and its really easy to navigate. you will love it!

Reviews.Title: Amazon Customer Service is the best!
Reviews.Author: Mom2ABoy
Reviews.Content: This Kindle Fire was sent as a replacement for one that I got 2 years ago for Christmas. The first one had a problem with not charging because the port was wiggly and loose. I don't know if that was a structural defect in mine, or if it was a common problem in the first generation Kindles. I called customer service, they ran me through some troubleshooting, and after determining the problem they sent me a BRAND NEW Kindle in the mail. I got it 2 days later and sent my broken one back. They paid for the shipping and everything. Absolutely a breeze. No problems with this one! I love my Kindle.

Reviews.Title: My Wife Loves it
Reviews.Author: Craig Garrett "Garrett"
Reviews.Content: My wife was a non tablet user.  So, we decided to jump in with a Kindle.  She absolutely loves it.  She is sometimes a little afraid to try new things and not real comfortable navigating a PC. So, we have both been pleasantly surprised how intuitive the interface is.  She love the big library of books and movies available with her Amazon Prime membership.The USB charger that came with the purchase was dreadfully slow. So, we also purchased the charger. Now it only take 2-3 hours.

Reviews.Title: Awesome....
Reviews.Author: an19bo86
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle, I use it more than my laptop.  It does everything, I can read my email, social networking and I even take it to church with my bible I downloaded.  I am still learning to use it but I highly recommend it. I have read several books so far and downloaded some movies. It is great for trips and just snuggling in bed reading.

Reviews.Title: KINDLE FIRE - GREAT ENTERTAINER
Reviews.Author: Ellen Faut
Reviews.Content: I love the Kindle Fire - you can read books or magazine; play games; go on Facebook.  The picture is amazingly clear and sharp - I can imagine what the HD version looks like.  Great entertainer for a great price.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire 7" LCD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
Reviews.Author: roberta hatcher & Fred Hudson
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Kindle Fire 7" as an early X-mas present for my husband.  We have ordered any books & are really enjoying it.The only problem was that there was really no instructions included and it took us quite a while to get everything going.Please do a better job on instructions for us old folk that aren't computer wise.

Reviews.Title: Better than earlier Kindles
Reviews.Author: Valerie B
Reviews.Content: This is a great product.  It is really a tablet as well as a Kindle because you can download all kinds of things, not just books, and you can search the internet.  I was pleasantly surprised at everything it does.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: lisa helton
Reviews.Content: most exelent service and tablet.  I will recomend it to all my friends.  It has really good aps songs and books

Reviews.Title: My Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Jane S. Melberg "old knitter"
Reviews.Content: I am 85  and am having some troubles using my Kindle, though when I call for help I always get great service.  Still use my older Kindle , as it was a gift and is connected to the giver Kindle so I can't transfer  the books in it to my new one..But the more I use my new one, the better I like it..Would be a snap for someone younger to use..

Reviews.Title: Spend the extra money and get "NO ADS"!!!
Reviews.Author: rantics
Reviews.Content: I love the kindle Fires.  My family have two of the first generations.  This Christmas (2012) I purchased another kindle, but tried to save some money and got the one with ads.  If you like commercials then you will love this model.  Lots and lots of commercials.  But, those of us that don't like commercials, especially  when you are in the middle of something, this is not the device for you.  Regarding the kindle fires, I love them and would buy another one without Ad's again and again.

Reviews.Title: great device but...
Reviews.Author: JGinter "weeding & witeing"
Reviews.Content: It's sort of annoying that it's an advertising billboard for Amazon rather than a personally owned device. There's no way I can figure out to stop the ad content in front of you regularly.

Reviews.Title: great product
Reviews.Author: shopaholic
Reviews.Content: love this Kindle..didn't think I would. I read more now than I ever did. Just have to charge more often.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Replacement a Disappointment
Reviews.Author: alesamarie
Reviews.Content: My experience with Amazon & owning a Kindle have been mostly positive until recently. Last December my battery suddenly stopped charging. I called Amazon & got prompt, courteous service from an employee who told me that if I shipped my Kindle back to Amazon they would send me a replacement free of charge, & would send a postage-paid shipping label through my email. I received a new, "better" Kindle during the hectic days before Christmas (I'll get to what "better" means in a minute), but the label never came. When I called them back I spent over 40 minutes on my cell phone - which only had about 100 minutes left on it - to be told that there was no shipping label to be sent, that they would refund me afterward & to get the package insured & tracked. He resent me the email I already had to click on a link for tracking confirmation. The link was expired requiring yet another phone call where I was told that my refund would be via Amazon gift card. I explained to the woman that I was promised my money back & after several minutes I was told I would be refunded. I waited for that much-needed $8 to get me through a few days before I was paid again, but received another email informing me that my Amazon account was credited $8. How much toilet paper can you buy on Amazon with that amount? Same day delivery? How about eggs? The salt in the wound was my new Kindle. The only real "Improvements" I've found on their recent update is in the marketing department. Instead of seeing the favorites I use everyday right there at the bottom of my screen I get purchase suggestions. Seriously?

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire 7"
Reviews.Author: Sandra Chitwood
Reviews.Content: It has become part of my world. Books, games, facebook, this little package delivers it all.  I like the size, perfect for reading.

Reviews.Title: Where to start...This is going to be long. Bad charging ports, battery issues and HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE.
Reviews.Author: Eve Moreaux
Reviews.Content: OK, I do LOVE MY KINDLE...except I'm on the 4th one in less than 1.5 years.My biggest frustration, was/is: if you read the reviews, you will notice a MAJOR FLAW PATTERN.I received mine as a Christmas gift from my DH, so I never read the reviews, because I wasn't planning on purchasing one. I only started to see the pattern when I went to the Kindle forum and the reviews, trying to find answers for the issues I was having. Mind you, I have emailed, 'chatted', called Kindle Tech support more times than I can count, trying to get my issues fixed, and everyone I talked to made me FEEL like I was the ONLY one having the issues with the Kindles charging port and quickly DYING battery situation. The responses I received were LESS than appreciated. I was told is, "IM SORRY" over and over and over...etc...etc...ect.When they replaced the 1st one~ (it had a loose charging port and jiggled inside the Kindle. I had to place a roll of coins or something equally as thick underneath the connection from the cord into the port to angle the cord just right so it would actually charge. UGGHHH)~the Female ENGLISH speaking representative was quick to respond and sent out a replacement without one iota of a hesitation. I sent back the defective one. However, 1. She never even mentioned that this was actually a KNOWN issue among the Kindles. 2. I received a RE-CONDITIONED replacement, not a NEW one as promised. I overlooked it for about a month.After a month with Kindle #2, I noticed, that the charge was lasting less and less each time it was used. Hmmm...what am I doing wrong was my thought. So I would leave it on the "Official Amazon Kindle Charger" that came with my Original Kindle...Still no change...by the end of the second month with Kindle #2, I was lucky to be able to keep a 2 hour charge, even if I left it on the charger for 10 hours. Mind you, the Kindle was supposed to have a 7-9 hour battery life and charge fully in just a couple hours. Not so with Kindle #2. So, I started to think, maybe its because it's 'RE-CONDITIONED'. I mean it was returned, and fixed/re-conditioned for whatever reason (probably the same issue with charging).So after the end of the 7th week, I CALLED Kindle Customer service again. Explained my situation. This time I was given the run around, felt like I got the 3rd degree from AMAZON..."did you drop it, did you get it wet, did you expose it to the elements, are you using an inferior 3rd party charger"...it felt like they were not trying to help me figure out what was wrong, but trying to find fault, so they didn't have to replace it. Then I got transferred...not to 1, 2 or 3 different agents, but 5...5 different people, whom I had to RE-EXPLAIN the situation to each and every single one. Every time I was told they were going to transfer me, they assured me they would explain the issue to the new person, they didn't. Finally, an agent said they would replace it. I said I wanted a NEW kindle, not a re-conditioned one, because I FIRMLY believe, that that was the problem. Not to mention, that If I wanted to purchase a re-conditioned electronic item, Best Buy sells them drastically reduced price (i.e.CHEAP) and so does Newegg... the point being... my DH paid the FULL PRICE for a NEW KINDLE...and I was being sent 'like-new' used kindles as replacements instead of a NEW replacement and I didn't think it was fair. If you go to ANY major retailer and have an issue with a product, if it's within a reasonable time they usually replace it with a NEW product, not a USED one (re-conditioned or NOT). In fact, Best Buy was ACTUALLY replacing the defective Kindles with NEW UPGRADED HD's instead of replacing with the exact same model!!!! I'm jealous!!So, finally the 5th rep says that a NEW KINDLE will be shipped to me to replace the 2nd defective Kindle. (This is getting extremely frustrating and RIDICULOUS). The 3rd kindle shows up on Christmas Eve. I was extremely excited until I opened the box and saw yet ANOTHER re-conditioned Kindle. I refused to even touch it/open it.{{Its obvious to see, if you received a new one originally, it came with an instruction book and little pamphlets/inserts and the way it was packaged screamed I'M NEW...(except for my 2nd and 3rd kindle). The generic plastic sleeve (yes there is a difference in the stupid plastic sleeves too) was crinkled and not 'perfect', no inserts, no instructions and a generic charger in a generic cardboard sleeve. (my description was for anyone who can't tell the difference between a NEW/ re-conditioned Kindle packaging)I waited a few days....furious. Waited to calm down. WHY would they send me another USED kindle, when they said they were sending me a NEW one. This time, I tried a different approach, I used the new CHAT feature on Amazon's Kindle service line. I spoke/typed to 2 reps, the 2nd rep, seemed to finally understand what I was so upset about. {{Not to mention the thousands of reviews, such as the one I'm writing (finally) and the Kindle forums that has many of the same complaints I'm voicing here.}}She agreed with me, and actually UPGRADED me to the NEWEST version of the kindle. I double and triple checked that even though she said I was getting the upgraded newest version...was it going to be a RE-CONDITIONED version!!! She promised it would be BRAND SPANKING NEW. I got the Kindle 2 in 2 days. I was afraid, for obvious reasons. I opened the new black box...and sat in silence while I stared at the BRAND SPANKING NEW KINDLE...finally.I've had no issues thus far.BTW...The 2nd generation has a thick plastic sleeve with Asian printing all over it (ALL re-conditioned Kindles come with thin PLAIN-no printing-plastic sleeves. Also, the 2nd generation does not come with an instruction manual as the Original Kindle did...because the manual is downloaded into the kindle itself. The charger is a USB plug, and DOES not come with an actual wall charger, nor does it actually charge thru the USB hub on my computer. So there is a added bonus surprise...you have to BUY an actual USB wall CHARGER, (that is if you want to charge your Kindle)...Its $20...and its the #1 accessory, I wonder WHY....FINALLY...I will NEVER CALL the customer service line again. I will ALWAYS use the CHAT feature. I will tell you why...EVIDENCE of the conversation and PROMISES in writing. I copied and pasted every conversation and kept it, in case I needed to pull it out and use it as proof, to read it WORD FOR WORD VERBATIM as PROOF...CYA. If they say they are going to send you a NEW product...I have proof, if the item does not show up as promised. A-Z CLAIMS should work for buyers with AMAZON, as they do for any other seller on AMAZON. I also was happy to have the conversation, because it had the name of the person I was speaking to, So I could COMPLIMENT them when I received my "DID WE ANSWER YOUR QUESTION" email. Which I DID. Thank you again SHEILA for my NEW UPGRADED KINDLE!I do hope this helps someone...anyone. Good Luck to ALL when dealing with customer service, because you are gonna need it.

Reviews.Title: life of kindle is short lived
Reviews.Author: luv2read
Reviews.Content: I have always loved my kindle fire and have bragged about it many times.  But now I am getting very annoyed with it (thus the 2 star rating).  I definitely would give it at least 4 stars if this problem is solved.I am now on my 3rd kindle fire in about 11 months.  The first 1 only lasted 6 months and the 2nd one only lasted about 5 1/2 months.  The problem (which I am finding out is a very common one) is that after a time, the kindle fire will quit taking a charge.Now Amazon has been great with replacing my kindle fire each time with no questions asked, but it seems ridiculous that I am on my 3rd kindle fire in just under a year because of something faulty with the charge.It would be nice if we were given a credit to upgrade or if the kindle fire was at least recalled.For those of you contemplating the kindle fire over the nook, I am now wishing I had a nook because this problem is now becoming very annoying.

Reviews.Title: Parental Controls are extremely easy to disable, no web filters at all.
Reviews.Author: CBB
Reviews.Content: I purchased Fire's for my 12 and 15 year old boys for Christmas.  The parental controls are a joke. All they do is keep the kid from purchasing paid apps. There is no way to filter web content, and no 3rd party apps you can purchase to add the feature. Searching the web with the browser easily pulls up porn sites--if a search string could even remotely hint to being related to porn, it's going to pull porn up first.As for grownups? It's wonderful. I use the tts feature a lot and the voice is much more natural on the fire than the eink versions... it only has a female voice though, and you can't adjust the pitch of the voice--it is a little too high for my taste for listening to books. The touch screen is very responsive which is good and bad. When you just want to pull the menu up when reading, it sometimes takes a couple times to JUST pull up the menu (I generally find myself flipping pages instead) but it's great when you're using apps.All in all, not something for kids (I'm not an over protective parent, I just have a special needs teenager) but for adults it's great... oh... one more thing.. it does NOT play Angry Birds (much to the teen's distress).------------After several months of trial and error I'm updating my review.  While my rating does not change I have a few things to add.  The parental controls are REALLY a joke.  After my 15 year old special needs son kept disabling the parental controls to prevent purchases, I figured out what was happening... all the child has to do is go into settings and UNCHECK the parental controls checkbox... no password, no pin number no nothing to keep the child from doing so. Also, there is no way to keep newly purchased books from appearing in another kindle's carousel, even if the purchase was sent to a specific unit (we have a Kindle Keyboard, Kindle Touch and 2 Kindle Fire's) it will still appear in the carousel of the other units--and mom and dad's purchases are driving my 12 year old crazy.  Over-all, for my reading needs, I continue to use my Kindle Keyboard.

Reviews.Title: Love my Kindle Fire 7
Reviews.Author: Unknown
Reviews.Content: I ordered this for christmas for the family to see if we would use it.  We use it so much that my husband ordered one for himself.Great product...easy to use...very user friendly.

Reviews.Title: Not Like The First
Reviews.Author: Patricia Boyd
Reviews.Content: More difficult to use than the keyboard type. Battery goes down really fast. Wish I had my old one back.

Reviews.Title: Can't Organize My Library
Reviews.Author: Sharon Peart
Reviews.Content: I loved my Kindle Fire until I realized that I cannot organize or catalog my books. Had I known this before I would have bought one of the other models that has this feature. It is a real problem as my library gets bigger.

Reviews.Title: kf7
Reviews.Author: d.boyer
Reviews.Content: I like this much better than my first 2 kindle fires.....charger problems with my 1st 2 kindle fires....the 7 works much better with charging!!!

Reviews.Title: Gift for my wife-
Reviews.Author: C. Tempro "DIY GUY"
Reviews.Content: She absolutely loves it!  She teases me about my tech addiction and doesn't think it applies to her, but she can't put the Kindle down!

Reviews.Title: Kindle fire
Reviews.Author: Branharris
Reviews.Content: Awesome product! Much more than I expected. Thought it was only for reading. Like a computer without the spam. Love it.

Reviews.Title: kindle
Reviews.Author: linda
Reviews.Content: i loved it. i love the service i get from amazon also. they are great. love them and my kindle

Reviews.Title: Kindle...
Reviews.Author: Nicole Irby
Reviews.Content: I do enjoy my Kindle Fire but I have a few grips... for instance you can only control the volume from the touch screen and it doesn't have a camera, nor does it have blue tooth capabilities and my final grip is that you cannot highlight or takes notes on the books that you purchase, these are a few things Kindle should reconsider.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Patricia A. Slaughter
Reviews.Content: I had a Kindle Fire and after nearly a year it stopped charging.  Apparently some of the 1st generation models do this, because my Daughter's did the same thing.  Anyway, Amazon replaced it under warranty with a 2nd generation model and it is even better than the 1st generation!  The screen is sharper and it seems quicker.  I highly recommend the Kindle Fire products to anyone!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire (7")
Reviews.Author: T R
Reviews.Content: This was a gift. Recipient loves it. However, in order to get an owner's manual or "This is how you do it" instructions, you have to go online, search for it and download it. System should have an Owner's Manual included.

Reviews.Title: No plug
Reviews.Author: Danielle Crissinger
Reviews.Content: My daughter loves her kindle. My only complaint is that is doesn't come with a wall charger. I don't understand why they would not put a wall charger with this device. For $159 you should be able to charge the thing.

Reviews.Title: Returned
Reviews.Author: JS
Reviews.Content: I returned this only because I thought that it had a front facing camera.  I got the HD version instead.  LOVE IT!!!  We needed another "computer" for skype calls and the HD version is perfect.

Reviews.Title: Works as expected
Reviews.Author: GIS Denney
Reviews.Content: This is our first tablet, while it is not what I wanted, it was what we could afford.  It works the way I expected it to, and is very useful as an e-reader, and media viewing device.  I am using it constantly, and enjoy the way it works.

Reviews.Title: Love the Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Steve M. Keck "Kecker"
Reviews.Content: We purchased this as a Christmas gift for my teenage daughter - I thought she'd enjoy it a bit like her earlier generation Kindle, but instead she's become attached to it.She loves the camera for skyping with friends, the games are terrific, and she loves being able to use our Netflix and Amazon Video on Demand to catch up on TV shows and movies.I have 2 Apple iPads (1st and Latest Gen models) so considered another or a mini iPad for my daughter - we went with the Kindle Fire due to the value - thumbs up on quality, value, and enjoyment factors!

Reviews.Title: kindle
Reviews.Author: Guy
Reviews.Content: This is a great notebook. I can do anything I want with it. Very user friendly and lots of apps to choose from. An instruction manual would have been nice though .

Reviews.Title: i love it
Reviews.Author: mitch279
Reviews.Content: great reader for th price buy it. it might not have eavery thing apple has but do you really need all those?

Reviews.Title: It's okay.
Reviews.Author: ES
Reviews.Content: Still playing and experimenting with it. I'm not the most techno-saavy, but I can usually figure things out. Not finding some usually common functions like "deleting" so that everything I've ever looked at doesn't just keep showing up on the screen. Not super impressed, but it'll do. I'll figure out it's systems eventually. Would have liked more Q&A; for troubleshooting.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Catherine T. East
Reviews.Content: I bought the Kindle Fire for a Christmas gift for my 70 year old Mother. She likes Facebook and email - but I wanted her to be able to use Apps too - we can't get her off of Angry Birds!!!Perfect gift. Hours of enjoyment. Thank you.Cathy Tittle East

Reviews.Title: Good product, just wont last.
Reviews.Author: Sugar
Reviews.Content: My kindle is only a year old with light use and the battery will no longer charge. I contacted Amazon and my kindle is no longer under warranty. So there us nothing that can be done for me. They stated there us no way to replace the battery and i would have to replace it at  a discounted price....  I love the device just don't want to worry about having to replace it each year.Amended review. Amazon contacted me via email to address my dissatisfaction. I was pleasantly surprised by this and will see what solutions they offer. Nice customer service do far.  I will update as i can.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME PRODUCT
Reviews.Author: August DeDual
Reviews.Content: I received this Kindle for Christmas and I have not put it down!! I use it to watch movies in bed, do my banking, play poker. You name it you can do it with this awesome kindle!!! You can even download your first 250 songs from your iphone!! This was a great addition to my I phone.. I Like the fact that I don't have to pull my computer out for everything it is right there on my Kindle!! Thank you for putting out an Awesome product! fast shipping too...

Reviews.Title: What is the best deal for a kids tablet? The Kindle Fire! Hands down winner!
Reviews.Author: Angel
Reviews.Content: UPDATE: January 13th 2013My niece LOVES her Kindle Fire. With the Kindle Free Time App, I set what apps, movies, books, etc and how long she is allowed to either be on the Kindle or specific type (app vs. books vs. movie). The ONLY thing I can say I am rather disappointed in with Amazon is that via the KFT app there is no way to allow the kids to access the Amazon Instant Video library, the only exception is if you purchase a movie and then download it to the Kindle (which i think takes up needles space).  And despite whether you download or not once in KFT the kids can't access music, even the music i want her to listen to. I can just turn it on the Kindle and open the Kindle Free Time and hand it to her and she is off with no worries on my head. And if you don't exit the KFT app before powering down, when you turn it back on again it is still logged in. So she really can't do anything unless I give it to her unlocked. I love it, she loves it. BEST decision EVER! Honestly I can't express how happy I am with her Kindle Fire or even my own Kindle Fire HD. 100% satisfied customer!This review/product opinion is from my blog. but i really wanted to share with everyone because I am just so happy with the purchase. I had posted on November 3rd, 2012.[...]What is the best deal for a kids tablet?Just thought I would share, because I know a lot of you have kids. I have been looking into getting a Kid friendly tablet for niece for a Christmas present. I have done a lot of price comparing & reading reviews, just basic research. I hope this helps.What I had wanted in a tablet was the ability for her to watch movies, play games & read books, but not have access to other apps or accidentally get into settings or something. I wanted something she can grow into as she gets older but simple enough for her to use now (age 4). Some of the key Apps I wanted were:  Netflix, Flixster/Vudu, Amazon Instant Video; Apps I didn't need but were a plus Kindle, Hulu plus, Disney Radio & Sprout.I already have subscriptions with Netflix, AIV (amazon prime) & Hulu plus; and accounts with Vudu & Kindle (with existing content). So I didn't want to get stuck having to repurchase either movies/books/tv shows that I have already bought or can access for free. Many of the "kid" tablets out there require you to buy in to their currency and then purchase these items from the special "store" for that select tablet. One of the few that I saw actually accessed the android market (google play) was the Kurio Kids Tablet ($149.00).The MEEP! ($149.00) tablet at first seemed good, but again after reading reviews it didn't seem so great. Many of the tablets had horror stories of adults (well adept in using electronics) not being able to set up the simplest of functions on some of these more expensive tablets, if the adults can't set it up how can the kids use it. I also looked into the LeepPad 2 ($99.00) & the Inno Tab 2S ($69.00), again after reading reviews or seeing that still after purchasing i have to sink lots of money in to apps only for that select tablet. Why buy a movie/tv show that can ONLY be watched on this one kids toy? I was beginning to give up, the cheaper the tablet the more you spent on apps and download content (books/movies) and the more expensive you got the more bugs seemed to be in the device. Then as I was shopping for me I found almost exactly what I wanted.The new re-vamped Kindle Fire (not the Kindle FireHD). The new version has what they call Kindle FreeTime, which allows the Kindle to have select user accounts or profiles to log in to and limit what content is available to each user. It even lets you designate the amount of time each user "Kid" has. The Kindle has access to ALL of my required apps and SOME of my wanted apps (doesn't have Disney or Sprout). But for the price $159.00, it is my clear winner. Granted its a few dollars more than the more expensive "Kid tablets" but much cheaper than some of the better quality tablets out there like the Galaxy or iPad. They have kid friendly cases for the Kindle Fire and as she gets older we can adjust the settings for her and the purchases won't be a total loss as they are useable via other devices. We can rent/buy Barbie on her Kindle and then watch on TV (via Roku or Smart TV) or on my phone or tablet. No horror story in trying to get it set up for the kid to use or having to spend money to buy fake money to use in a special store, and as she gets older it won't look like a "baby toy" as my nephew puts it.FYI I gathered most of my reviews from ToysRus.com and Amazon.com, and a few other web reviews that I failed to write down :( sorry

Reviews.Title: Difference between Fire and Fire HD?  Minimal
Reviews.Author: Dale K
Reviews.Content: I ordered the Fire over the HD as my wife has last years Fire and loves it.  I compared the Fire and HD and the only real difference in the two is the HD has better speakers and two Wifi antennas.  Other than that, identical.  The Fire has an HD display and always has.  The whole line is awesome so buy whichever you like, but if you are just looking for a good E-reader/Prime free video watcher, the Fire is just fine.UPDATE: 01/26/2012 -After using the Kindle Fire for a month, I have noticed one giant difference between the 12/2011 version and the 12/2012 version; the battery.  The battery in the older version lasts for months and months without a recharge in sleep mode with frequent use.  The new version the battery will last 1 week with sleep mode and frequent use.  It is also impossible to charge the Kindle with it shut off, it MUST be in sleep mode or on to charge the battery.  I'm still quite happy with it, but I see now why the price was dropped.

Reviews.Title: Got this for my mom, we now fight over it.
Reviews.Author: Paula Solorzano
Reviews.Content: I got this for my mom, who this account is named after, and I fell in love with it. Being cheaper than an iPad, and with a priority of books, rather than whatever apps iPad focuses on, my mom was able to use it easily. Only one problem, however, I started reading the Hobbit, Fun and Games (by Duane Swierczynski) and now I have to fight her for it, which sucks because I've been stuck at the part where Bilbo just met Gollum and started a middle earth version of dosens (Does anyone exist who both listens to rap and reads fantasy novels? No?). One problem for real though, is the screen. The glare makes it hard to read in a sunny car, by a window, but thats a minor problem, and well worth it, considering the price. Honestly, why am I even writing this? You already know you're going to buy it, my review means like, nothing. Whatever, if you're that one who is undecided, remember this; my pastimes before I bought this Kindle consisted of playing copious amounts of video games and movies, now, I just got myself Cloud Atlas, 2001: A Space Odyssey, 2010: Odyssey Two , and Don Quixote (en espanol) and I plan on reading every last one.

Reviews.Title: Haven't put it down yet. Adios iPad.
Reviews.Author: Marco Pensamiento
Reviews.Content: Before I begin this review, please let me state that I am not bashing on Apple. I own 2 macs, a macbook, an air, 2 iphones and an iPad and I lam very happy with them. My comparison is with the iPad, since it now sits on my desk due to the Kindle. I've loaded it with a ton of books and apps and feel that it is much more portable with the 7" size.But the true test was that my 3 year old daughter now prefers the Freetime Unlimited app due to all of the amazing options she has without being annoyed to purchase something or accidentally exiting out of the app. She calls it the "better iPad" and I couldn't agree more.

Reviews.Title: Easy to root, but locked bootloader
Reviews.Author: Daulet Karakhanov
Reviews.Content: This was easy to root, everything was done automatically using scripts from xda. But locked bootloader will screw you over when try to push custom on jelly bean. Locked bootloader are wrong, locked bootloaders are evil :)

Reviews.Title: Outstanding
Reviews.Author: James C.
Reviews.Content: Mother-in-law loves it. I like this new edition better as well. I own the first generation of Fire, and this one is the bomb.

Reviews.Title: kindle fire 7", lcd Display
Reviews.Author: Johnnie Lovejoy
Reviews.Content: the letters are larger and the light makes it easier to read. I like the fact that You can flip.

Reviews.Title: Best purchase I have made in very long time.............
Reviews.Author: johnericj7740
Reviews.Content: Very happy with Kindle......Bought one for my 7 year old grandaughter........I use mostly for reading and find unlimited great books..................G-Dtr's teacher says has already helped her with language arts..........

Reviews.Title: COOL!
Reviews.Author: Susan
Reviews.Content: Our 10 year old says it "is TOTALLY AWESOME and COOL!!!"  He is even dancing when I asked him how much he likes it.  This is a fantastic thing for teaching and having fun.  Thank you SO much for creating this and making it afordable.

Reviews.Title: kindle
Reviews.Author: dennis neal
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this to anyone. its perfect for us.out daughter wanted it for christmas I will always do business with amazon. :)

Reviews.Title: Great item.
Reviews.Author: WILLIAM PHIPPS
Reviews.Content: We bought this for our 10 year old daughter who loves to read and she fell in love with it. She also loves playing games and surfing the web on it as we'll.  Great product.

Reviews.Title: Great buy
Reviews.Author: Tehemton Bhagwagar
Reviews.Content: Works great. My only issue with this product is that it does not have a back button. In some cases the home button is not very visible either and its not intuitively obvious how to get back.

Reviews.Title: Love the kindle fire if I can #?@^!% figure it out
Reviews.Author: Donna E. Hume "Paige Turner"
Reviews.Content: this product comes without any manual.I think that the company thinks that anyone buying this is Techno literate. I AM NOT! not much direction or instruction on how to navigate. The company or AMAZON is assuming alot....Am happy with the quality but no direction on how to use it. HOPE YOU KNOW what you are doing with the techno part of kindle fire.

Reviews.Title: Great table but disappointed with one area 32GB not 8
Reviews.Author: Joyce A. Engle
Reviews.Content: In the past I have bought four Kindle's and was really looking fordward to receive my new Kindle Fire HD.  I did October 25, 2012.  I havd a little disable that the HD would take care of very nicely.  That is to read a book with a narrator and the words were lightlighed for me.  I have bought a lot of Wisper-to -voice books.  I bought four of Ken Follet books (the long ones) example, Pillars of the Earth.  It wouldn't download to my HD.  I didn't know it wouldn't so I bought the other three.I spent $57.00 just on the four books not counting the four audiobooks. I'm a great-grandmother and have to spend my money wisely, which I didn't.  So, Audio gave me three credits not 4 and Amazon said they would give me $14 0r $15 only.  I wanted to talk to a mamager but you can forget that.  I bought the Kindle Fire HD 32 and I had to stop downloading because I had only 2 GB left.  I'm in bed a lot and wanted to get thebookd I thought would give me enjoyment during my confindment.  But I'm so disappointed with Amazon and Audio I just don't know what to do. They are ALL so nice but could never solve my problem.  They didn't put in "buyer beware"  Buy it it is yours.  So disappointmented.  I have gotten several of my friends to join and gave three Kindles away for Kindle.  I only wanted what I paid for the books so I could buy ones that will allow me to use the proffessional narrator. They want me to use Test-to-speak.  Don't like that.  Sorry, for all the misspelled works just had an operation and can't see well.  This has put a sour taste in my mouth and I'm going to have to tell my friends to beware.  I just wanted to take with a manager to fix my problem.  God Bless

Reviews.Title: A little heavy for reading,needs better light adj.limited TV.
Reviews.Author: Jeanette R. Gerig
Reviews.Content: It came earlier than expected which was nice but I wish the packaging was a little less conspicuous as it sat near my door till I got home. There was nothing included with it. I realize the tutorial is online but when you lose it or can't access it it's a problem. Would have appreciated a booklet. Still would. I also would have appreciated knowing that the charger was not included.  I've been using it for a few weeks now and mostly love it. Somehow my book mark gets moved, again instructions as to why would be nice. It is a little heavy as my wrist gets tired of holding it up easily. I would like better light adjustment as apposed to a few choices. Also Prime TV shows are VERY limited, will continue to watch on free streaming sites and will not renew Prime. I figured out how much I spend on shipping each year and it is about the $79.00 so no gain. Overall I am Happy.

Reviews.Title: Some annoyances but overall an entertaining product
Reviews.Author: Janee00
Reviews.Content: I received my kindle fire less than a month ago. It is definitely a great product for personal entertainment.  There were some slight annoyances. When I first received it, I had to get used to the touch screen. It wasn't as receptive as some of my apple products, and I wasn't able to find a setting that adjusts the sensitivity of the screen which was surprising, but I got used to it as time went on.Another issue I had was that there are no personalization features for wallpaper or the screensaver. Instead there are advertisements in place of where that screensaver may have been. I heard there is a way to get these removed, and I plan on doing so.Despite what was said above, this product is great with games and videos. I also enjoy it for the reader, which is the main reason I bought it. I also love the amazon prime on the kindle! Although I also have Netflix, it offers some different variety in videos as well as the other perks amazon prime has to offer I like my kindle. There are some annoyances, but overall it is a great product.

Reviews.Title: waste of money
Reviews.Author: candace everhart
Reviews.Content: This product was a major disappointment.  The only thing I liked about it was the ease of returning it.  We bought this for our kids (ages 3 & 6) as an alternative to the main computer which I use for work.  We wanted something they wouldn't easily outgrow and could use independently.  If they can operate a laptop and a iphone with ease, a tablet shouldn't be a problem, right?  Wrong- with this one, at least.  There are two rows of icons on the screen.  The top one is the ones you've downloaded and the bottom one is suggested purchases / apps to download.  I cannot explain how frustrating that is to children or to parents who constantly have to get back to the home screen for them (that was a bit difficult for them as well).  This device also does not support a flash player which was disappointing as well as we had intended our oldest daughter to be able to use the kindle for school reading games.  About the only thing that worked well was netflix (very limited free games for children they are entertaining or useful) and that drained the battery within 30-45 minutes.  Recharging the battery also seemed to take an exceptionally long time.This was just a big let down as a tablet.  I do not recommend it for children or adults.

Reviews.Title: like it!
Reviews.Author: Rawan Mackie
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire 7" is light weight, portable, easy to use. I didn't like that there are no options for adjusting the screen brightness...and the battery dies quick.

Reviews.Title: Kindle fire
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: Love the kindle fire. Problems initially with battery holding charge,customer service was excellent,corrected problem. We love the device and would recommend  to anyone

Reviews.Title: No instruction booklet.
Reviews.Author: Free Spirit
Reviews.Content: I was surprised that the Fire 7" did not include an instruction booklet, but were for sale on Amazon.  It just seems to me that at a price of $149 (with ads) and $199 (without ads) that general instructions should be included or free on-line as it certainly would have saved me time. Some of it may be my fault but I needed (and still do) clearer instructions than found on the video.  Some of us have satellite Internet and the download video really soaked up my download allowance.  The Fire 7" also weighs more than my first Kindle.  A cover that  props it up for reading would be a good idea.  The four stars is due to the lack of instructions with the unit.

Reviews.Title: My new toy!
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Kiernan
Reviews.Content: I LOVE MY NEW KINDLE FIRE!!!  My husband gave it to me for Christmas and it is so awesome!!!  Easy to operate and view everything!  Compact enough to put in your purse too!

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: watchbird
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire is a great device, especially if you primarily want to use it for games and reading. (Haven't used it for internet or e-mail, so I can't comment on those functions.) It's user-friendly, and Kindle's free selections are nice. I also follow free books on Nook, and it seems there are many more free Christian books on Kindle than Nook.

Reviews.Title: Really like this so far.
Reviews.Author: Pennie Ross
Reviews.Content: I bought it for my husband but think I'll end up using it more, especially for email and web-cruising when on trips.  It was easy for me to set up, and I've already put some music on it.  I'm enjoying learning all that it can do besides being a reader with excellent light and text-enlarging capability.

Reviews.Title: Over all good product.
Reviews.Author: Alma Valeros
Reviews.Content: Got this kindle fire for christmas.  The product is good, but the charger doesnt come with it, and the headphone.

Reviews.Title: Christmas gift
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a gift for my husband. He usually carries a large laptop to have access to the web for the company he works for. Having the Fire has allowed him to do this without slugging around a laptop.  Easy to use. I have had my own Fire for over a year and I have it with me all the time. I am never bored at a doctor or dentist appointment.  I just pull out my Fire and read or listen/watch podcasts or a movie.

Reviews.Title: So easy to use
Reviews.Author: elizabeth
Reviews.Content: I bought two kindle fires one for my 4 year old and one for my 9 year old. They both love it and figured it out right away. Now if they would only put it down so I can play with it :)

Reviews.Title: my kindle
Reviews.Author: barbara rollman
Reviews.Content: love it love it love it........can not say enough about it  it is so nice to just sit back and relax with your kindle after a hard day at work

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire is AWESOME
Reviews.Author: Kevin Shipman
Reviews.Content: Without a doubt, the best purchase I have made in years. Super easy downloads and tons of free and cheap games. Very easy to order books and apps from Amazon.com. Battery lasts much longer that I expected.

Reviews.Title: Best Purchase Ever
Reviews.Author: Angel
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my daughter for Christmas, and boy was she surprised!  With out Amazon membership, she has been going crazy with all the free movies,apps, music,etc.. she can download.  I think i want one for myself now.  I knew I would get more bang for my buck buying this, than getting locked into apple & their software.  Not a big fan of itunes.  Love Amazon!!!  Battery last 9hrs. a day before recharging, the clarity is amazing.  Recommend buying the wall plug to go with it for convienience.  Great product, arrived quick, and would highly recommend seller again.

Reviews.Title: Love it!!!!
Reviews.Author: GAIL KOSIENSKI
Reviews.Content: Bought for 11 year old son...he loves it (when his dad isn't playing on it)! Skipped the HD version, because of the great Cyber Monday deal...couldn't pass it up! But I can't imagine how it's any better

Reviews.Author: M. Knight
Reviews.Content: Really enjoying my Kindle.  Does everything I need it to do and the screen is a nice size.  So much better than squinting to see my Android screen!  The price was especially nice since I got it on a lightning deal, but would have still been worth it at full price.

Reviews.Title: My new best friend
Reviews.Author: vsheffield
Reviews.Content: I got this for Christmas and I LOVE it! I feel like the world is at my fingertips  I use it for everything: games movies apps and books . I've never been a big reader, but I've already read a number of books on it  I love being able to see the top sellers and read reviews, and even try out the book before I buy it . I thought that the computer type screen would be hard to read on, but it does not bother me at all . I love the kindle store because I can get a brand new movie for a great price without driving to the Redbox . same goes for tv shows . and they are such a good sound and picture quality, even without hd . Facebook and Twitter, as well as pintrest are clear and easy to navigate. I am an Apple user, but I highly suggest buying this over an iPad and saving hundreds of dollars . games are fun to play on the big screen rather than my iPhone. this tablet is great for all ages and so far I have no complaint, other than the slow charge time, but you can get rid of that if you buy the fast charger which charges it in under 3 hrs . the battery life is impressive, even when I watch movies all day .  If you are hesitant about buying this for any reason, just do it . you will be glad you did .

Reviews.Title: My Wife loves it totally. Uses it every night.
Reviews.Author: Nornman Akin
Reviews.Content: I bought it for my wife she loves it to death. Uses it more then our personal computer. She has gone to our local Library and is now down loading books to read. It may have been the best gift ever!!!

Reviews.Title: critique from a non teckie
Reviews.Author: amazon addict
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved my Kindle Fire gen 1 then it died. I called Amazon and spoke to the nicest person who was able to determine what happened and immediately offered me a replacement. this happened on Christmas eve. They then notified me that they were "up grading" me to kindle fire 2. i read the information on Amazon and figured it would be the same just faster. It wasnt. they changed the whole way it works. I was lost. Didnt know how to do anything. Did i mention Im 76 and not technology astute in any way? I went to Amazon and started through their instructions. Not easy to do. still cant get the Overlook I down loaded to do audio books. figurng out the download took me 2 days and many tries. I can do the email but do not like the format it comes in. I finally got google and my library but not the way they wanted me to. I can read books ok but the controlls that used to be on the bottom are now all on the right and its annoying to a lefty to always have to reach across my field of vision to operate the controlls. The color is great and the sound is ok and im sure th fire 2 will do everything they say it will. im giving it a 4 star because the instructions assume that the user has some basic skills in computerese and i dont. as far as im concerned the instruction suck, if i am ever able to do movies and hear audio books i will repost. i read a book a day and get 4 hours of continuous reading from the battery. enough for my longest plane ride. i just wish i could do what it is capable of doing and cant.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Suzanne K. Downs
Reviews.Content: Haven't been able to use it, no charger came with it. Was a charger suppose to come with it. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: Love Amazon
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I really just want to rave about Amazon and the Kindle Fire and Kindle ereaders. Honestly, I have used some generic type tablets and have paid the price. I gave away my 1st generation Kindle Fire to my son back in July because I just really did not think I needed it. I have 2 Kindle ereaders, one is the touch the other is the plain one. I love them both. Use one for the beach and the touch stays in my house by my bedside. This Christmas I really wanted my Kindle Fire back, but did not want to ask my son for it. I tried to coax him into getting an Ipad, but he said he had no use for one because he was loving the Kindle Fire and watches his Netflix on it and reads his books etc. He said he couldn't live without it. So, I purchased a cheapo no name brand and it did not work, so back it went. There was no customer support and from all the reviews it seemed like everyone was having the same problems. I looked at the new Kindle Fire both the plain and HD one and honestly was ready to purchase one or the other. Something stopped me. I really wanted the first generation one. I looked online and purchased a used one. Now, I sit and wait for my Kindle Fire to arrive. I cannot wait. Lesson learned: stay away from no name brands and never stray from Amazon or their superb customer service. I will upgrade eventually, but I want to play a little longer with the model I gave away. Glad my son is enjoying his though.:)June 21, 2013I'm am editing my review. Not shortly after I received my Kindle did it have problems with the charging port. Seems to be an issue for Kindle devices. So instead of going with another Kindle ( out of warranty) I purchased the Hisense Zero 7 Pro made for Walmart which is basically a Google Nexus but with a rear 5mp camera.All for just $149.99! It is SO much better than the Kindle! Go to Walmart's site and check it out.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire 7", LCD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
Reviews.Author: Robert C
Reviews.Content: Well I dont realy know what to say but my hasent put it down since she opened it christmas day. so im guessing its a good product

Reviews.Title: Awesome gift!
Reviews.Author: S. Dinkins
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Kindle Fire as a Christmas present to my sister. She loved it! The screen is vibrant and colorful. The size is convenient enough to put in a small bag or carry it with you for traveling purposes. The color on the screen is quite vibrant and very clear. I personally don't feel the need to get the HD Kindle because the normal Kindle Fire looks sufficient enough (that all depends on your personal preference, however). You can download apps, music, photos. It can also be used to watch movies and videos which are very clear and precise via the screen. I'd definitely suggest this item, especially if you are seeking to purchase a tablet that works well and won't break your pockets.

Reviews.Title: Electrical Charger
Reviews.Author: Ms. Debbie S Oestringer
Reviews.Content: I ordered the Kindle Fire for my grandson for Christmas.  I was shocked to find out there was no electrical charger to charge the Kindle.  Instead it had a cord for you to hook it up to the computer.  So, unfortunately, we had to go out and buy an electrical charger for an additional $20.  I have had my Kindle since Jan. 2012 and mine came with a electrical charger.  You pay so much for electronics in the first place but then you have to buy a charger on top  of it.  I was very disappointed with this!

Reviews.Title: Great gift item.
Reviews.Author: Jacob D Skinner
Reviews.Content: Seems to work well. Very intuitive. Lots of apps and games available. This was a gift for my 80 year old grandmother and she is in love with it. She is picking it up faster than my mother. Other than the apps and add that scroll on the bottom I really like it.

Reviews.Title: Mom really likes it
Reviews.Author: Shannon Nowak
Reviews.Content: Bought it for my mom - so far she is really enjoying it.  This is her first experience with an e-reader/tablet but she has been able to catch on pretty decently so far.  While I was setting it up beforehand, I was a bit envious since I have the Kindle Touch :).

Reviews.Title: gift
Reviews.Author: melanie wagner
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for someone who is going to be starting chemo soon. Thought it would be nice to have books on hand as well as games. I have a kindle and a kindle fire and love them both.

Reviews.Title: A little piece of awesomeness
Reviews.Author: Charles Van Allen
Reviews.Content: First off, I'm not Charles Van Allen, I'm his son :))))  The Kindle Fire does not disappoint. If you're looking for a tablet that has music, games, books, can search the web (just to name a few of its features) and don't want to drop $400 bucks on an ipad- this is the thing to get, seriously. First I'll describe the features of the kindle, then I'll write a pro and con list for it. From top to bottom the length is 7 3/8 inches and from side to side its about 4 5/8 inches, the ACTUAL screen length though, is about 6 by 3 1/2 inches. The screen is made of some hard plastic that won't scratch or dent easily. On the back you'll see the Amazon logo and in big letters the word "KINDLE", so should you ever forget what you're using you can always turn it around. On the bottom of the Kindle you will find a charging port, earphone jack and a power on/off button. On the top are two monster stereo system speakers, perfect for listening to Evanescence or Van Halen. When I first received it, I almost couldn't suppress my excitement, the packaging had no chance. Amazon has the box so perfectly designed that when you open the lid of the package there lies the tablet, glistening. When you turn it on, it will ask for your e-mail and some other information about yourself, just to get the Kindle registered. After it's registered, the main screen will show all your apps on a carousel. There will be options above the carousel for: Shop, Games, Apps, Books, Music, Videos, Newsstand, Audiobooks, Web, Photos, Docs and offers. At the very top is a toolbar displaying the time, WIFI connection, and battery life. If you pull town the toolbar there is an immense amount of options that you can use.  There's a countless number of apps for the Kindle, most of them under 2 bucks or free. For the games I've purchased, I have no complaints, everything runs smooth. For Netflix, streaming is also smooth, as long as you have the bandwidth to support it. Let me say really quick that the screen is very bright and easy to see.  Books are very fun, and easy to use. You can purchase them from Amazon (if you have Amazon prime, some books are even free) or if you have a local library it will probably have an E-book library. Renting E-books for your Kindle is just like going to the library and renting a book, but it's swifter, easier, and you don't have to leave the comfort of your home! When your reading a book, there is an option called "text to speech," which is an automated voice that reads the book to you. And if you don't know what a word means, you just tap on that word, hold your finger there, and it will automatically bring up a definition for that word. There are many other options too, like adjusting font size, notes, adjusting margins and line spacing, just to name a few. :)  The Kindle's touch response is crisp, with no delay. It feels solid in your hands and is very durable. With the Kindle case and screen protector I have, I wouldn't be surprised if it lasts for the next millennium (really durable), But that doesn't mean go throw it on some rocks!! The "Special Offers" that show when you power it up, or the recommendations that show at the bottom of the screen don't really bother me, but if it bothers you you can get the Kindle without "Special Offers", it's $15 more, I believe. As far as any screen bleeding problems, I have experienced none. But if anything happens to your Kindle and it's not like- 2 years after you bought it, TELL AMAZON! I would trust Amazon with my life.  Lastly, the parental controls are excellent. If you don't want your child surfing the infinite web, which by the way runs great on the Kindle, just turn if off! Yes there are many parental controls on this thing. You can type in a password, and access a list of controls: Block the process of buying things, so you don't come home to a child that has racked up a nice bill for you. Block E-mails and contacts. Block any of the Books, Music, Apps, etc. You can also set time limits if you have Kindle free time. Here's that pro and con list I promised.:DPROS!!- Low, affordable price.- Many apps most under 2 bucks, or free- Easy to use, great for children- Nice parental controls- Screen is nice and bright- Can rent books from library- You can access Facebook, Twitter, and E-mails straight from device.- Durable- Can get nice cover for it- Streaming for Netflix and Amazon instant video is great- Unlimited cloud storage- Web is smooth- Stereo speakers!- Long battery life (if you're playing games the battery won't last as long)- Comes with chargerCons (I wouldn't even call these cons- more like downsides. There isn't anything seriously wrong with it)- Large (its bigger than an iphone, which is good because it has a big screen, but you can't just slip it in your pocket and be on your way)- Youtube could have a sharper picture. I guess that's where HD comes into play.- Only two point touch (can only recognize two fingers on the screen)- No cameraThat's really it, like I said, there isn't anything seriously wrong with this product, it's outstanding.SUMMARYOverall the Kindle Fire is exceptional, simply exceptional. Great for reading, playing,and listening to music. Lots of apps, affordable price, durable. It's perfect for the kiddies, and perfect for just sitting on the couch and playing around. This is an honest review conceived by the awesomeness that the Kindle displays. I'm not writing all the good things about it and no bad because I'm blinded by love for it or something. I'm just telling you how it is. If you have any questions, just leave a comment and I will answer to the best of my ability.

Reviews.Title: Battery
Reviews.Author: pjo
Reviews.Content: Love the Kindle Fire, but experiencing some difficulty with charging it.  Doesn't want to charge with the wall or car charger.

Reviews.Title: NOT HAPPY WITH KINDLE FIRE
Reviews.Author: Margaret I. Boomer
Reviews.Content: First of all, there should have been an electrical plug of some kind included with this Kindle.  The battery life is awful and I have to keep charging it thru the computer.I have had a Kindle account for quite some time. I also have an IPAD and I have my stored books there.NONE of my previously purchased books came over to my Kindle Fire.  In fact some suggested reading for me are books that I have already purchased.I do not like the ADS that pop up EACH AND EVERY TIME I play a game of Free Cell.  The ones where you have to "X" instead of Skip have volume and it lags when you try to cancel.  Wakes up my husband if I am reading or playing FreeCell at night.

Reviews.Title: love love love it!
Reviews.Author: K Landon
Reviews.Content: Very happy I made the purchase...I got  a great deal $129.00 with FREE SHIPPING too.  Just wish the accessories were a little less expensive. (Really it doesn't come with a charger of it's own????  I have to pay another $20 for one??? And a case is nearly $30??  I do LOVE the Kindle itself tho...

Reviews.Title: Great device
Reviews.Author: shannon meadows
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my mom for Christmas as she was using mine so much I never got to see it :) I love the Kindle Fire. It is a fantastic option for a tablet and the Amazon.com website is so easy to navigate to make purchases (of course!). My mom loves to read and with the option of making the text bigger, it really makes it easier for her. I love that Amazon has made this so affordable.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Laura Conary
Reviews.Content: I love it!! I enjoy reading the most on it, but before I "pick up" my book I check my facebook and email.!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: amy
Reviews.Content: I love my new Kindle Fire.  It came ready to use.  I am very pleased and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Robert T. Szalanski "Pappaz"
Reviews.Content: After a few days my wife is very pleased with the her Kindle Fire. I was going to buy her a Kindle reader but the price of the Fire was only $10 more and so far it has proven to be be well worth the additional amount. Not only can she enjoy reading from the Fire but she now has access to additional games, and the internet.

Reviews.Title: Love It!!
Reviews.Author: Kimberly Joiner
Reviews.Content: Bought for my 6 year old and it is perfect!! She had been playing on my Kindle and I could never get it so we decided that Santa would bring her one. She loves it and I love having mine back!!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire 7"
Reviews.Author: Gail
Reviews.Content: Its nice in the fact that the screen in larger than the other e reader style that I currently have, however here is the problem I have spoke to several electronic store sales people and they told me that I should be able to transfer any books that I currently have on my other one to this reader.  If you have other books from another e-reader style they will not flip over to this one because the kindle fire doesn't give you a way to transfer anything to it.  So 40 some-odd other books in my other program and can not read them on my kindle.. :(

Reviews.Title: Toddler Tested, Mother Approved!
Reviews.Author: Dracoluna
Reviews.Content: Though I own one for myself (and love it!), I decided to get one for my nephew for Christmas. He's 2 and has some social/speech delays. His therapists recommended a tablet of some form for the apps that might help him with his speech but something like an iPad felt like a little much. So far, he's using it daily for the learning apps along with Veggie Tales on Netflix and children's books. Yesterday, he said "apple" for the first time thanks to one of the learning apps that was recommended. It has thrilled him to no end (unlike seeing his therapists does) and he looks forward to 'playing his games' every day. My sister is also thrilled to see he's enjoying learning and watching the strides he's been able to make since working with the tablet.Note: This was also purchased with KlearKase for Kindle Fire - Life-Proof, Transparent Case for Family or Outdoor Use - With Screen Protection, which is a MUST if giving this to a young child. Please check my review on that item for just how well it performs.

Reviews.Title: Charging cable wont charge the Kindle.
Reviews.Author: Jenae Hebb
Reviews.Content: The kindle fire is great but the fact that I have to go purchase a different charging cable to charge the device is the reason for the low rating.

Reviews.Title: DOESN'T SUPPORT FLASH
Reviews.Author: mom of 3
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed to find out that the kindle fire doesn't support FLASH.  My kids love watching shows from Disney Channel online, but can't do it on the fire because you need FLASH support to do that.  My son has an  iPod touch and that's one of the things he enjoys doing so I thought the fire would be a good gift because the screen is larger.  The original fire supported FLASH, so it's disappointing this one doesn't.  This means, for example, you can't watch YouTube videos.  Anyway, while I don't plan on returning the fire, if I had known this I wouldn't have gotten it, and just thought I'd mention this in case this matters to someone else and they are assuming they could do something as simple as watching a YouTube video or a Disney channel show.Update:  My kindle fire recently just started going to yahoo mobile view even when I select desktop view.  All other sites show up as desktop, but yahoo shows up as mobile.  If I select mobile view, yahoo shows up in desktop view and everything else in mobile.  Amazon customer service not helpful in correcting the problem.  Is anyone else experiencing this problem?

Reviews.Title: New Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Suzanne
Reviews.Content: I found it to be not user friendly for people who are not technically adept. The prices for your books are double what I pay for my simple Kindle

Reviews.Title: For what it is, and for what I paid for it, it's an amazing piece of kit.
Reviews.Author: Patrick Deno "Lord_Jereth"
Reviews.Content: I got this little wonder from the cyber-Monday sale. I bought the non-ad driven version and paid extra for it. I still came away at less than an ad-driven model at normal price. The display is crisp and clear, the processor has enough grunt for the things I tend to do and the wi-fi means I can take it anywhere and surf the net. That's the reason why I wanted this in the first place.The only real complaint I have is that Amazon's android ecosystem is much like Apple's: It's closed - and there's no Google Play in order to make up for it. If it weren't for that little caveat, I would have given it 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Nice little tablet
Reviews.Author: Patricia G. Raikos "T'sMom"
Reviews.Content: Pretty handy. Watched a movie and worked nicely. Still getting used to using reader functions not quite as easy as my old Kindle. All my contents did not transfer so I have to find time to download to laptop and transfer to new device which is inconvenient. Not sure how much better HD version would have been but picture on this device is fine.

Reviews.Title: Battery issues that should result in a product recall and Winner of the "Most Overrated Product of 2012 Award"
Reviews.Author: Sarah NapTab
Reviews.Content: Product Update: We are now having to return the replacement along with the other Kindle.  Product Recall?I hate to say it but the Kindle Fire is "Big Money Wasted" in terms of performance and glitches that were not addressed even though Amazon said the new Kindle solved the previous e-reader issues. First off, we ordered two Kindle Fires for two of our kids, and the problems started from the get go with one of the Kindle Fires not charging properly. We did an overnight charge into a wall socket and one of the Kindle Fires did not even reach it's charging capacity. (BTW: We did all the troubleshooting so let me stop everyone in their tracks before I get a flurry of "fix-it" responses.) Also, the other Kindle Fire is not even close to the battery life that has been touted. We are getting about 3 hours of battery life instead of the "up to 9 hours" as advertised. The processor is no better than our previous Kindles and I also notice quite a bit of hanging when the kids are using any type of app. We actually have to shut down and restart the whole Kindle to get it back on track. IMO One of the absolute WORST products that has been touted as revolutionary. Save your money and stick with the older more reliable models. The Kindle Fire wins my dubious "Most Overrated Product of 2012 Award"

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Tracy Goodman
Reviews.Content: We got this for our 10 yr old for Christmas.  She has barely put it down since receiving it!  So far mostly playing games but a promise was made to Santa to read as often as she plays games so I believe it will supply many hours of enjoyment!

Reviews.Title: Kindle fire awesome
Reviews.Author: karen M
Reviews.Content: I have wanted one of these for a long time.  I have had no problems with it so far.  The only thing I have difficulty with is setting up my email on it.  Otherwise I love it.

Reviews.Title: use bookmark to get back to place
Reviews.Author: Ramski
Reviews.Content: I use the bookmark, the little blue mark at top right.  I would like the Kindle to go to the bookmark if I happen to get off the page I am reading.
