Reviews.Title: Great great great
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Had a few issues with the software but Amazon being Amazon took care of that righr away. Thanks. Love it. Small computer in my hand. Battery life not long but thats ok

Reviews.Title: For a low cost ereader it is a great device.
Reviews.Author: BamaJeep
Reviews.Content: I think everything about it was designed with simple and usable being most important. I would like to see a sd card slot and maybe a camera, but it works great and seems to be tough.

Reviews.Title: worth the money!
Reviews.Author: tasios
Reviews.Content: I bought 2 of these for my boys ages 4 & 5 for christmas. Although I've kept them hidden from them until Christmas day, I have played around with the device. I love it! 5 STARS for parental controls, quality, picture, sound. I have downloaded a few learning games and angry birds. They cannot access anything that I don't want them to nor can they make accidental purchases (with the 1 click option). I really love the fact that I can control , add and remove apps from my laptop for them. Download time is fast. Now waiting for the gumdrop cases to arrive!! I simply recommend and happy shopping!

Reviews.Title: Fire
Reviews.Author: Kim Leonard
Reviews.Content: Present for my mother in law, BEST thing I ever got her! She loves it, and I love that she leaves mine alone!

Reviews.Title: Finally print that is big enough to see
Reviews.Author: Eva S
Reviews.Content: I am so glad I bought this. The print in the paper books seems to be getting smaller and harder to see, but not in this.  Thank you for the large print.  I use the sepia back ground and turn down the background light also, so there is not so much glare in my eyes.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Product
Reviews.Author: Nan
Reviews.Content: My husband loves the ease of using his Kindle; it's so much easier for him to check his emails, google information he needs, and read when he feels like it no matter where he is.

Reviews.Title: Great gift for teenagers,  lots of apps,  a good source of entertainment! .
Reviews.Author: Ms. E. Sheley
Reviews.Content: I have this for 11 months.  This was a gift and what a great one.  I love my kindle.  I think you have to give it some time to get use to it.  I know my kindle very well, enlarging before opening another window does wonders reboot when it needs to be, etc., etc..  Please give it some time and don't freak out.  Their customer service are very helpful!.

Reviews.Title: I like  really like the Kindle Fire 7
Reviews.Author: Garrett Bonder
Reviews.Content: So far very impressed. It is very people friendly, for being a first time user I picked up on it right away. I really enjoy getting my e-mail on it. Haven't checked out a movie yet but watched a trailer. It seems OK. I'm sure there is a lot more to it but still learning. I would recommend this Kindle Fire to my friends.

Reviews.Title: for the price
Reviews.Author: dave
Reviews.Content: Good for the price allows me to use it for the basics that i needed it for. Browse light web read pdf docs and since I am a prime member my kid can watch some movies. On the other hand it does not read doc files or epub files and the touch is not always so accurate. The other thing is that I have it less than a week and it started shutting off on me and doesnt charge well unless I hold the plug the right way. The good news is they are sending me a new one even before I sent back the old one. I will wait and see if the new one is better.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Denise R. West
Reviews.Content: Received order fairly quick.  Only issue was it was not in the normal Amazon box.  Arrived in a Kindle Fire packaging, luckily I got the mail that day, so the gift was not seen by anyone.  Also would have made it very tempting for people to steal.

Reviews.Title: kindle fire
Reviews.Author: grandma ann
Reviews.Content: The color and resolution are super!  I was somewhat disappointed on the weight of the kindle fire.  It is much heavier than my regular kindle and it gets heavy after reading for a while. I have also had difficulty downloading some games.  However, I do not have a smart phone and need to get used to the apps.Overall, I am pleased with my purchase.  If you are buying a kindle strictly for reading, I would advise the smaller kindle.

Reviews.Title: favorite toy
Reviews.Author: cstine75 "stine75"
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love my Kindle Fire. I can't recommend it highly enough, and after having one myself I have purchased them for both my father and my daughter.

Reviews.Title: Unbelievable
Reviews.Author: JMAC
Reviews.Content: The clarity, function, and ease of use make this product one of the best investments I have made since purchasing my Laptop....which performs the same duties, in a larger package.Good show!

Reviews.Title: Ridiculous (-ly great)
Reviews.Author: Robert C. Mclean
Reviews.Content: Just got it. The screen is ridiculously sharp. Watching Amazon Prime videos is ridiculously great. The interface is ridiculously smart and simple. It would be ridiculously silly not to get one of these if you are in the market for a inexpensive media device.Criticisms? Maybe a tad heavy for one-handing it. That's all I can think of. It is a really beautiful device.Update (2/21/13): My son loves it. Have loaded some games (try to avoid making it game machine). Everything still great.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE it and so will my kids...
Reviews.Author: MomOfFour
Reviews.Content: I love, love, love my Kindle Fire and just bought 3 more as gifts for my children this christmas!  I was looking for a tablet for my children and wasn't impressed with reviews on many of the others.  I knew the Kindle Fire was great for me and would be great for the kids!  It has it all!  My 13, 12, and 6 year old will be so happy this Christmas morning! Thanks Amazon for your great deals!

Reviews.Title: I love this Kindle
Reviews.Author: Phyllann
Reviews.Content: I love the fact that I can read novels and texts on this. I enjoy watching movies and listening to music on it as well. Beautiful color!

Reviews.Title: I love my kendle
Reviews.Author: cwillden
Reviews.Content: I Love My Kendle,I find it very easy to use and read from. I have read many books with it and i bought a cover from onceinabluemoonleather.com WOW! it protects my kendle and makes it very easy to hold and I found it does not slip out of my hands and I can prop it up and it stays put.

Reviews.Title: kindle fire review
Reviews.Author: adam hypes
Reviews.Content: I would have to say that my wife and I enjoy the kindle fire. I was expecting more of a Android experience for applications, thus far I am not gaining that experience.

Reviews.Title: My 7 year old enjoys it.
Reviews.Author: Lisa A Lemke
Reviews.Content: I do like the new kindle fire....I find myself grabbing my other daughter's older Kindle from last year when I want to look something up.  The only reason is because the screen on the newer version takes a while to focus when enlarging the screen.  It drove me a little nuts so I choose to use the older Kindle. Also freezes up on her once in a while when playing a game. Still it is a good buy for the low cost. Atleast it avoids spending 500 on an I-pad for a 7 year old.

Reviews.Title: Kathy
Reviews.Author: K. Codianni "Kathy"
Reviews.Content: I am quite dissatisfied with the performance of this device.  I am not able to set up the email connection and tech support has not been able to help at all in the month that I've had it. I haven't read any books yet, but have downloaded a couple and believe I'll have no difficulty with that. The Help screens are somewhat lacking (I downloaded a couple of games and couldn't find them so I had to call tech for assistance...Help guide didn't say you had to go to the Cloud to bring them on to the device).  Minor issue, but still annoying. Also, I was disappointed to find that flashplayer is not supported on the device, so my grandkids can't access games on their particular learning games website using my Kindle Fire.  I have serioulsy considered returning it but believe I am going to keep it, even with the inconvenience of the email situation.

Reviews.Title: Love my Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Kirk Bailey "-Fnord?"
Reviews.Content: The good: Good clear video, reads books, books or apps purchased (including free) live on the cloud free, so the 8Gb limit is not as bad as it might seem; that's just how much you can have in the machine at the same time, which is still a lot. The speakers are amazing considering their size.The bad: The battery life could be a bit longer, although turning down brightness and turning OIFF wireless helps out. The WLAN transceiver is not very powerful or sensitive, which limits range. The screen is a fingerprint magnet- invest in a bag of cheap swipe sticks (stylus'?). To protect your investment, get a good protective case; mine is from marware and it has helped my fire survive SEVERAL trips to the tile floor of my home  nicely; it also makes up for the lack of a kickstand. Also, the USB port is not very rugged; if you wack it a nice shove UP or DOWN (as seen while looking directly at the screen from above) you will pop the lands from the socket free from the mother board and have no way to charge it.The Ugly: Fingerprints. Also, it's not rainproof; although the back and front are indeed watertight, both ends have holes for speakers and earphones and the micro-B USB cable which let water come right inside nicely, which really should be addressed.YO: Flat printed coil on the inside of the cse for magnetic coupling, and a low power VLF radio hotpad charger dock. just lay the fire on the pad, the weight clicks it on, it charges via induction. stick a rubber plug in the usb socket until soimeone needs to side load something. Stick thin flexible plastic over the speaker ports, and no more rain damage. Stick a rubber plug into the earphoine port like on my cellphone and that's the end of rain problems. AND BOOST THE BATTERY!!!The HD 7" is fine, but really, the images on this original one are peachy keen.AND FIX THE BUGS IN THE BROWSER!!!Peace.-Kirk

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire 7", LCD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB - Includes Special Offers
Reviews.Author: Marlene
Reviews.Content: This was the third Kindle Fire I got This one was for my daughter and she loves it. I have a few more to get for some special people and the kindle fire is all I will get

Reviews.Title: Pretty Nice!
Reviews.Author: Ariel Parker "Ariel"
Reviews.Content: Most of the time I'm very pleased with the Kindle Fire HD.  I'm not happy with the need to charge the battery so often, which is almost daily!  I can stand charging the battery at night when I'm sleeping.  I really would LOVE to have more instructions, or easier to find instructions, because hunting and pecking around to figure out how to find or do certain things, takes time away from enjoying the features the Kindle Fire HD or ANY Kindle product is famous for!  Amazon, I'm happy with it, and I'm learning, how do do more than use it as a reader, and I'm glad I bought it.  Thank you!

Reviews.Title: Love my Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: marvlusmazy
Reviews.Content: I had a basic Kindle and enjoyed it very much.  Then when the new faster Kindle Fire HD came outI realized it could function not only as an ereader, but there would be no need to take a tabletwhen I travel as well, because I could do it all with the one unit.  Love, love, love my Kindle Fire.

Reviews.Title: window into the world
Reviews.Author: Mr. marvel
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife and she never puts it down.  She can look at her facebook account with it and go on other internet sites without booting up our computer all the time.  She has also used it to buy books and likes how easy it is to view the books.  We also used the bright screen as a light to help us see when hurricane Sandy turned out our lights.  Keep in mind you need to buy theelectrical adapter to charge the kindle via an outlet because it does not come with it.

Reviews.Title: A Quick Review
Reviews.Author: Smorticia
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my Mom's Birthday earlier this year and she hasn't put it down.  My mom's in her 50's and while she uses glasses, due to astigmatism in her left eye, small print in books has become too difficult for her to read.  She has loved to read all her life and I knew she really missed it. Out the box it was very simple to set up.  I connected to her amazon account and she was on her way.  There was a little bit of a learning curve to it but nothing she couldn't handle.  Very impressed by it as a book reader and with it's other capabilities it makes for a really nice pad. My 84 year old grandmother is hinting heavily that she wants one herself and I think she should be able to handle most if not all of it's features without too much difficulty.

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: jman44
Reviews.Content: this is a great product. it has everything you could ever want in a hand held device. i recomend it to everyone

Reviews.Title: Kindle is Great
Reviews.Author: Laura g
Reviews.Content: I have used my Kindle for watching Netflix and reading books as well as used it in my kitchen to look up recipes.  It has worked so well and I am happy that I got it!  It has all the capabilities I needed.

Reviews.Title: Great product, bad charger!
Reviews.Author: Soehnke Schreyer
Reviews.Content: Recently received a kindle fire 7, seems like a great little machine that is well built and has lots of options for use.But frankly receiving a very cheap and cheesy charger with it that did not work well from day one was a major disappointment.Apparently I am not the only customer with that problem (ordered usb charger, hope that will take care of it).Also the advertising that is part of the standard kindle experience is very annoying as it is not as easy to skipthrough these ads as it is on a pc on the internet (maybe amazon will try rethink that approach and make it more userfriendly).

Reviews.Title: kindle fire
Reviews.Author: etvo guy
Reviews.Content: Great product. Far superior to the i pad mini and less money. I recommend this over any other tablet or e reader. Great gift for a book reader on your list. The kindle fire does more than read books. Surf the web. Facebook u tube .

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire gift
Reviews.Author: Diane M Witt
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Kindle Fire 7" for a gift and the recipient absolutely loves it.  The color is brillant and it is easy to use.  He has used the Wifi connection is happy with the internet interaction.

Reviews.Title: I should have bought it sooner
Reviews.Author: mija
Reviews.Content: I am thoroughly enjoying my kindle.  I am saving so much money since I ready 2-3 books a week.  The only thing that would make it better is if the battery life was longer.  I need to recharge it almost everyday.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely LOVE
Reviews.Author: MeSha "Mesha"
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love my Kindle Fire. I did have to return it because of charging issues & they are sending a replacement. Which is why I rated it a 4 instead of 5.I love being able to read where ever and when ever I want. I've used it numerous times to keep my toddler busy. She loves the apps & watching Netflix.I use it to browse the internet a lot. I love being able to go on Pinterest while there's a commercial. Or google something & actually being able to see the words, unlike my tiny phone.My sisters and my parents all love theirs. They haven't had any issues with their batteries & charging.

Reviews.Title: works great, only a few minor issues.
Reviews.Author: xanadu228
Reviews.Content: No major problems with the kindle, I do have to charge it a lot...when I use netflix on it the sound quality is not good so headphones have to be used...but the apps such as I heart radio and even the youtube videos have better sound quality..also got the facebook app and recently started having problems with that where only a few updates will load up and then it does not load anymore so I just use the computer for facebook. Other than that all the apps work great, books work great,no major problems.

Reviews.Title: Bought for birthday present
Reviews.Author: Christina
Reviews.Content: Totally met my expectations. Fun and easy to use without even having to read the user manual. Perfect for the price.

Reviews.Title: The Best Present Ever
Reviews.Author: Kim Tilford
Reviews.Content: I received this at the beginning of this month, as a birthday present. I love it. I can not believe the amount of free and reduced books that I can download on this device. My youngest son is even using it to read books for his homework, and his own enjoyment. I think that there will be several more being ordered during the Christmas holiday as gifts. I have never enjoyed an electronic device as much as I am this. There is so much that can be done with it.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Betty Shea
Reviews.Content: I'm still trying to learn my way around my Kindle Fire (it doesn't come with ANY instructions).  I have read one book, and was surprised at the relatively short battery life.  Seems as though I am always having to recharge it.  The Amazon description said battery life is up to 9 hours of reading or web time, but it seems shorter than that.  Also, it doesn't come with the charger plug that's necessary for charging.  That is a BIG issue!  Other than that, I'm pleased with it thus far.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Cindy Miles
Reviews.Content: I bought the Kindle Fire for my daughter instead of investing in a Nintendo DS.  She LOVES it.  However, I have to say that I was dissapointed that it won't play flash files.  I had hoped that she would be able to use it to access some of the children's websites like Nickelodeon and PBS and even though she can visit the sites, she can't do any of the activities because they require flash animation.  Also, I had hoped she could watch shows on netflix.  It also doesn't work on the Fire.  However, there are tons of free games and apps that can be downloaded for kids.

Reviews.Title: kindle fire second generation
Reviews.Author: Jett "bookworm"
Reviews.Content: If I had only known how easy it would be to use my kindle fire from the comfort of my living room chair, I think that I might have looked into the hd. I have been debating with myself over getting a laptop but I think now I would rather check into the larger screen hd fire , I read alot and love to play games but hate setting at a desk.I have been recommending the kindle fire to everyone.

Reviews.Title: Pretty Good product
Reviews.Author: R
Reviews.Content: I am thirteen years old and this is a pretty sweet product. I will go into a little more depth.Pros:It is a perfect size for me; the ipad is too bigConsidering it isn't an Apple product, it has amazing qualityI love the feeling of the back, not too slippery, not rough at allHas pretty good battery life, I haven't tested it yet, thoughCons:Sometimes the i doesn't work, which isn't a bad thing, you just have to make sure that u pressed it enoughSometimes when I'm trying to get on an app or watch a video, it says "sorry, ... can't open", which stinksU can't get as many apps as on other products I've been onSo I don't really have any complaints. I advise this product if u are looking for a high quality product besides Apple's products that u can get for a fairly decent price. This is what to get for your kids besides the ipod touch.

Reviews.Title: Brill!!!
Reviews.Author: Tamika Johnson
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle, offers so much for a great price I bought 2 as gifts for my in-laws. My only gripe is you cannot upload movies, only rent online... Work on it Amazon. Overall amazing buy!! Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: kindle fire
Reviews.Author: Deedge
Reviews.Content: Actually, I purchased a refurbished kindle fire.  It was/is in mint condition.  I am loving my "Kindle Experience."  Hey, I should coin that phrase!  Don't you big wigs get any ideas, lol!!!!

Reviews.Title: astonishing customer service!
Reviews.Author: casual camper
Reviews.Content: Friends gave me a kindle fire for Christmas last year. I've bought a couple of accessories. Having no tv I began to rely on this device daily. Read a book? Check. Listen to music at the same time? You bet! Keep up with news? Sure 1st thing everyday. Shop? It saves a lot of time & sometimes a lot of money. Certainly things not available in my town are available. With a stereo speaker charging station Saturday night movies became a convenient option.Imagine my dissappointment when kindle fire failed to function this morning!I entered my complaint on the kindle help site. Was encouraged to give a phone # so they could call me. The young lady who called asked for a detailed description of my problem then gave me detailed instructions what to do. Bottom Line: All's well! Their service people are competent and helpful. I'm impressed. God bless them.

Reviews.Title: I love it!
Reviews.Author: NPK
Reviews.Content: I never thought I would buy an e-reader because I read all the time but do not want to invest a lot of money in a book I will read only once.  I found out my state library has an e-reader lending website and I can download up to 15 books at time.  I am also enjoying the Kindle Singles (short stories)that cost as low as .99 and are by some of my favorite authors.  What problems or questions I have encountered have been quickly and efficiently solved by Amazon associates.  I also have access to my e-mail, weather, news stories, games and much much more.

Reviews.Title: An 11 year olds' favorite gaming device
Reviews.Author: Michael S. Thum
Reviews.Content: My 11 year old son loves this for playing games.  Most of the games he has installed are free. A couple games were $7 or less. Some games require internet access to play. A few do not. The battery doesn't last for more than a day, but it is nice that it uses a standard cell phone charger.  For Christmas, he will find the Percy Jackson series available to read on his Kindle.

Reviews.Title: kindle fire
Reviews.Author: Meri0625
Reviews.Content: I love my kindle fire!! It is perfect for taking anywhere.I love that I can read and not have to have a light to see the words on the pages.I carry my kindle fire in my purse so I can have it anywhere and I have no worries that it will be damaged like a book would get when placed in my purse.I highly recommend the kindle fire to those who love to read and are considering a tablet!!!

Reviews.Title: Best Ever
Reviews.Author: Elnord
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant, and waited quite awhile to get my Kindle. Fire.. Just tired of learning new devices, etc. But so glad I did, it is the Best. And I enjoy it every day, every hour, and learn something new on it every time..I play games, read e-mail, read books, and it is just the right fun new device for me.Thank You, Amazon

Reviews.Title: Almost one year later....
Reviews.Author: Chrocetti
Reviews.Content: I have been remiss writing a review for the Kindle Fire - I received as a xmas gift last year (2011)- I was amazed when, out of curiousity, I checked the user ratings and found under 4 stars...even now at 159 dollars! I absolutely love this machine ... I find I read much faster; in fact I have read more books in the past year than I have in the previous...10 years. My morning ritual consists of browsing thru WSJ and Politco, checking Gmail, and quick browse of scores on ESPN app. Once I installed Rhapsody, I now connect to both my soundbar in bedroom, stereo in bathroom, and even offload music on to my vehicles hard drive (have to love the American-made Chryslers...)! The performance of web sites and apps (I do have 25/25 Verizon Fios) is more than acceptable...some apps are faster than accessing from a laptop!I work out 4 times a week at lunch time - the Fire connects quickly to the health club's wi-fi allowing me to watch Netflix while I sweat.  I use this little tablet so much I find I am recharging the battery nightly - will be curious to see how long the battery will last at the rate I am recharging.  I just have a hard time not giving the Kindle Fire first-edition 5 stars.  AND, I am placing my order for the 4G model (the low-cost 4G and the blutooth keyboard capability was the tipping point in this purchase decision...) - anxiously awaiting the late November release!

Reviews.Title: amazon is great
Reviews.Author: oldman
Reviews.Content: my kindle is wonderful. it has great color and great features. since i am a movie freek i love amazon prime. amazon support staff is also GREAT.

Reviews.Title: I heart my Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Gungirl007
Reviews.Content: I had a Kindle Fire on my Christmas want list this year but I had ankle surgery so during my recovery my boyfriend surprised me with a Fire and I just love it! It was so easy to pull up my library, I love shopping ease, videos and music. There is so much on it but its so little and yet big enough to read or watch a movie with ease. I just purchased my first game Scrabble for my Fire and its so much fun. Thank you Amazon for such a great product. I also enjoyed the free month of prime; however I wish the lending library was more than just one book per month.

Reviews.Title: I love my Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Katwoman 1950 "kathie eastman"
Reviews.Content: I really love this Kindle. I only wanted one for the books but was talked into this one and I love it. I never go anywhere with out it. I read, play games, check out the web and lots more. Did I say that I love this thing? I really love it. I could not see any difference in the one with HD and this one. For the price it is a winner and I have already recommended it any one who asks.

Reviews.Title: good device
Reviews.Author: cassie727
Reviews.Content: I love the new kindle...just wish it had a camera like the ipod does. Also wish it would register the game Tiny Monsters...other than that I LOVE MY KINDLE

Reviews.Title: kindle fire
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have 2 of the kindle fire. My grandaughters love them and it has been a great way to get them to read more often. The can select from many books that intrest them. But what they love the most is the games. I would buy these again.

Reviews.Title: Satisfied
Reviews.Author: saved1ce
Reviews.Content: I do a lot of shopping with Amazon. I wanted a Kindle Fire, but I don't like to pay a lot for an item. This one was on sale. Its perfect. The picture is great, the sound is great, I love it. Thankyou.

Reviews.Title: kindle fire
Reviews.Author: melissa
Reviews.Content: not bad. A little heavy and a little dissapointed I can't play some apps. The charge time is a bit long and definitely does not last 11 hours as promised :(. Plus I found from day one the charger that was sent with the kindle doesn't fit correctly and you have to keep unplugging it and replugging it back it in.But all in all I like it very much.

Reviews.Title: No Power!
Reviews.Author: Daniel Burt
Reviews.Content: Nothing wrong with this tablet, but a power charger does not come with it. The supplied USB charger is useless, I've been struggling to charge this tablet for two weeks and can't get it past 10%. Amazon does sell a separate "powerfast" charger that transforms your USB cable into a wall outlet. Trouble is they sell it separately, for $19! I bought this wall outlet hookup separately, and had to pay an additional $6 for shipping and $4 in tax. Now we're up to $30, just to get this Kindle some power.So when you're comparing tablets, beware that this Kindle is at least $20-$30 more expensive than the list price. Oh, and don't pay the extra shipping... order the powerfast charger when buying this Kindle.

Reviews.Title: Very Dissapointed
Reviews.Author: Maureen Costanzo
Reviews.Content: I had to send the Kindle Fire back to Amazon 3 times.  There has been a problem with all 3, Im still waiting to see how Amazon will handle this.  Very very dissapointed

Reviews.Title: why does the fire suck so bad
Reviews.Author: swimmingit
Reviews.Content: It doesn't charge while using it, the wifi drops every few mintues, the touch sensitivity is terrible, barely has any storage. I only use it for deployments to carry a lot of books. Why are the kindle editions just as much as the paperback ones anyway? It takes nothing to make a digital book yet plenty of resources for a paperback. The whole thing is paper weight that serves a small purpose that if I had any other choice I wouldn't be using it. Alas sinceni like to read and am limited on space in my bags this serves that small purpose. Would never buy one.

Reviews.Title: Caution: Kindle Fire Charger Port Notoriously Bad
Reviews.Author: Road Warrior
Reviews.Content: Caution:  If you expect Kindle Fire to work for a long time, prepare to be disappointed.  The charging port goes bad shortly after warranty runs out.  They know this happens and have not fixed it.  Some people have been offered refurbished units for a price.  Those too go bad.  Don't take my word for it.  Go online and enter Kindle Fire charging port.

Reviews.Title: Great alt. to iPad but Disappointed with glare
Reviews.Author: tb "tb"
Reviews.Content: We bought a Kindle back in 2011 mainly for my husband to use while on vacation (the idea of our reading library in a compact item is a no brainer (at the time he was reading the Harry Potter books - try packing those in your suitcase!) Shortly after, the Kindle Fire came out and I bought that for myself due to the added bells and whistles of a mini tablet. This is a great alternative to the iPad - saves you a ton of money and I don't need the ability of taking pictures on my tablet. The CON I have is the glare on the Fire's screen! When I am outside the screen becomes a wonderful mirror to see myself in! That's not what I bought the Fire for. I literally cannot read the screen while outside because all I see is the reflection of me and everything else around me. While indoors I can adjust the tablet and seat to avoid glare but what's the point of buying this item when it doesn't live up to it's hype as a portable reader? The ads say to use this while on vacation for it's portability but what's the use if you can't use it outdoors as advertised?  I bought a 'anti-glare" screen and the problem with that is it makes the text BLURRY. WHAT????? While I would highly recommend the Kindle Fire vs the iPad, I would specify that you will be limited as to where you can actually use this item, leaving you wondering if going back to paper books isn't the better thing to do - especially since e-book prices are about the same as paper books. (Another thing I have an issue with).  Very disappointed!

Reviews.Title: KINDLE FIRE AS A REPLACEMENT FOR STRAIGHT FORWARD KINDLE.
Reviews.Author: Maxwell Jordan "Peanut"
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased a Kindle Fire as a replacement for my basic Kindle. I really only wanted the kindle as an E-reader and nothing else as i'm not very technically apt :( My first Problem was the WEIGHT difference between the two, The basic kindle is basically as light as a page in a book you might read. The Kindle Fire is like holding the Actual BOOK .My second Problem was the Battery life , the Kindle held a charge for months whereas the Kindle Fire only held it's charge for a couple of days IF Even.My advice to anyone thinking of upgrading and you're actually looking for a Kindle that you WILL use to it's full potential and you're into apps of All sorts ( cause the Kindle Fire can do a WHOLE LOT )  then the KINDLE FIRE is Exactly what you want : B U T if you just want a Kindle solely for the purpose of reading and NOTHING else then STICK with your basic Kindle :) Seriously just to Specify that the Weight Difference between the two Kindle is Phenomenal, HUGH!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware
Reviews.Author: Joy McVey
Reviews.Content: I received a Kindle Fire Gen 1 in January 2011. Within a few months of regular use, it began having an issue with the charging port being loose and wouldn't charge. Amazon sent me a new kindle, no questions asked. 3-4 months later, the same thing happened. They sent me another one. I've had the third one for about a year with no issues, but now it's doing the same thing again....except now it's out of warranty, so the best they would do for me is offer a discount on a newer model kindle, and the one I have is essentially a $200 paperweight.I understand how warranties work, and yes, I did get a lot of good use out of my kindle, when it worked right. It's a good quality product, other than the poorly designed charging port, and once it's out of warranty, Amazon wants you to buy another one rather than stand by their product. I'm not the only person with this issue - if you google "kindle fire not charging", there are many others who have had this exact issue. (this video is not mine, but it shows exactly what has happened with all 3 of my kindles: [...] Amazon knows of the charging port issue, and will leave customers with a flawed product that should last far longer than a year and a half.

Reviews.Title: kindle broke within 14 days
Reviews.Author: Amy McClary
Reviews.Content: I purchased the refurbished kindle.  It worked great for the first 12 days.  At the 14 day mark the kindle broke and will not turn on or charge.  I was past the return policy date, so I stand with a broken kindle and will have to purchase a new one.

Reviews.Title: i LOVE THE FIRE; I LISTEN TO MY MUSIC WHILE I READ.
Reviews.Author: Dorothy J Graham
Reviews.Content: THE KINDLE FIRE CAN DO SO MUCH!  I CAN READ, LISTEN TO MUSIC, PLAY GAMES, AND I AM STILL FIGURING IT OUT.  I AM SO IMPRESSED WITH THE HELP YOUR CUSTOMER SERVICE FOLKS ARE OVER THE PHONE.  AS I AM NOT OF THE TEC SAVY GENERATION.  NEVER ONCE HAS A C/S PERSON TALKED DOWN TO ME, THEY ARE SO WELL TRAINED WITH THE PATIENCE OF A SAINT, THE MANNERS OF THE "UPPER CRUST" AND REMAIN HELPFUL AND CHEERFUL FOR HOW EVER LONG IT TAKES FOR ME TO GET IT.  THANK YOU AMAZON

Reviews.Title: i wanted to like the 2nd gen kindle fire
Reviews.Author: Angelo Malixi
Reviews.Content: i purchased my 2nd gen kindle fire in dec 2012.  it's now july 2013 and the results are in: i really dislike this product. i'd almost say i hate it but hate's a strong word.  i frequently refer to it as a piece of sh*t.  for as long as i've been buying from amazon, which has to be close to or at least over 10 years, i've never written a review for a product until now.for the first two months it worked fine. no problems at all.  then the keyboard started having clitches.  i'd press a key when typing text and it instead would display the letter next to the key i pressed (e.g. letter 'j' would display when i pressed letter 'h'). this happended for about 1.5 months until i did a soft reset.next problem is the kindle would restart itself automatically after doing an upgrade.  no warning was given, it would just shut down and restart. frustating b/c i didn't know an upgrade was happening (again, no warning) until after the kindle froze and the reboot displayed the upgrade prompt onscreen.third complaint, it's slow loading pages on the internet. additionally, sometimes a page would lock up while the page is loading or after it had been loaded.  frustrating.fourth complaint, the touchscreen is crap.  it's not as responsive as the screen on my iphone 5 or iphone 3gs.  i'd tap on a link and nothing. tap 2, 3, 4 more times and nothing.  sometimes times i'd get frustrated to the point where i'm applying uneeded pressure to the screen.  this is my biggest complaint. furthermore, scrolling is sometimes a pain.  for instance, when i'm on the google news page, the screen has trouble scrolling or won't scroll at all but i can press links.  annoying!final complaint, retrieving emails is painfully slow.  i use yahoo mail on my iphone5 and kindle.  it takes 3x as long getting the email after i refresh the inbox.i bought the kindle fire as a consumption device - to watch amazon prime movies (about the only thing i really enjoy doing with the product), surf the net (this is a pain since the touchscreen is crap and pages lock up), and compose/respond to emails (but since typing has been cumbersome i do this mainly on my iphone 5 - did i mention that sometimes it'll display a word twice after i select it from the auto-text).before i purchased the fire, i strongly considered the fire hd and ipad 3rd gen.  b/c of it's price, the second gen fire seemed like a good value.  i honestly regret buying the fire and now realize i should have bought the ipad.  you get what you pay for and i paid for crap. the user experience is not as tight as the ipad or even iphone. i would not reccommend this product and the only reason i gave 2 stars and not 1 is b/c it works well with amazon prime movies.  i'm now trying to sell my kindle for half the price i bought it for.

Reviews.Title: Great!... until it stopped working
Reviews.Author: duyfh
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved my Kindle Fire and used it everyday. My kids also regularly used it for games. Everything we used it for worked great for us. Then, after having the Kindle Fire for less than two years the charger no longer worked and it eventually died... permanently. I contacted Amazon and apparently this is a very common issue with the Kindle Fire. I had been thinking of upgrading to another Kindle and planned to keep the Kindle Fire for a long time for my children to use, so the fact that after less than two years it was basically trash was extremely disappointing. I never would have purchased it, knowing that it would last such a short time. I contacted Amazon and they offered to give me a reduced price on some of the other devices, however, it did not include any reduction on the 7" HD, so I basically would get $20 off the closest similar device, and up to $100 of a much more expensive device. Not worth buying another tablet that is going to die in such a short time. After a few contacts with Amazon concerning my frustration they basically said, contact us again to see if we can do something else for you. I attempted to contact them two other times and received the same result. I would have preferred that they just left it how it was rather than having me waste my time contacting them two more times to be told the same thing. I have never been displeased with customer service with Amazon, generally I am extremely pleased, but this whole incident was a very disappointing exception both with the device and with the customer service.

Reviews.Title: really bad
Reviews.Author: lollypopboom
Reviews.Content: it's terribal it won't charge correctly, app store doesn't work, bookstore won't. work,it always says I need need redownload games and when I delete them to redownload them it says the connection isn't. working when I have all bars of internet

Reviews.Title: It comes with a wall charger
Reviews.Author: Kitty le hero
Reviews.Content: I've seen a review saying that the Kindle Fire doesn't come with a wall charger. It actually does come with one. I got a Kindle Fire for Christmas from my parents and I surprisingly saw a wall charger. It's kinda cheap, and after using it a whole lot I kinda made it bent and when I stuck the wall charger into my Kindle Fire it was loose  but not to loose or a lot loose. I also realized that the Kindle Fire wall charger also fits into a Kindle Fire HD. How do I know this? My mom got one for Christmas so I checked to see if it fits in her Fire HD, and it actually fits, so for people who don't have a wall charger for their Kindle Fire or Fire HDs, there are wall chargers out there for Kindle Fires. :D

Reviews.Title: review of refurbished kindled fire 7:
Reviews.Author: Barbara L Naugle
Reviews.Content: I bought a refurbished Kindle Fire 7" and it also has problems. When I'm reading a book, it randomly inserts foreign letters instead of English text (Korean maybe), not for a word or two but for entire pages.  It does the same thing in several game apps.  I do not endorse refurbished anything from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: BATTERY WILL NOT HOLD A CHARGE
Reviews.Author: NICHOLAS WEIDNER
Reviews.Content: i WOULD MUCH RATHER HAVE MY ORIGINAL KINDLE. THE KINDLE FIRE IS HEAVY, AWKWARD AND WILL ONLY HOLD A CHARGE FOR A THIRD OF THE TIME THAT MY ORIGINAL KINDLE DID, I ONLY USE IT FOR READING SO THE OTHER APPS ARE USELESS TO ME. i WOULD MUCH RATHER HAVE MY ORIGINAL KINDLE.

Reviews.Title: NO CHARGER INCLUDED! SHAME ON YOU AMAZON!
Reviews.Author: Janie C.
Reviews.Content: A couple of years ago I purchased a Kindle Fire for my wife to replace her regular Kindle. We've never had any trouble with it and it's used almost every day. We've been very pleased with this product. Recently, my wife's aunt saw it and wanted one for herself. After talking her through her options she finally settled on the Kindle Fire just like my wife's, so we placed an order for one and received it today. After opening the box we discovered that THE CHARGER WAS NOT INCLUDED! At first we thought it was an error, but after visiting the website found out that the charger was sold separately. SOLD SEPARATELY? THIS IS THE DUMBEST THING I'VE EVER HEARD OF! Even the cheapest cell phones available come with a charger! SHAME ON YOU AMAZON! I know what most of you are thinking, "just plug it into a computer USB port and charge it". That might work fine, but her aunt does not have a computer!Now we have to shell out another $20 and wait another couple of days to receive.I WOULD HAVE EXPECTED MORE FROM AMAZON.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: sharon bonner
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire doesn't hold a charge long enough if you want to travel and read. It seems every time I want to take my Kindle Fire with me I have to make sure it's fully charged. Most of the time I read with it plugged in. I think  I would be better off to just go back to reading a regular book.  I wish your product held a much longer charge.

Reviews.Title: Kindergarten Teacher's review of Kindle Fire 2nd generation tablets
Reviews.Author: K-03 CLASS
Reviews.Content: I bought five of these with my teacher bonus a few months ago for my kindergarten class.  The students use them with me in my small group rotations for language arts, math, and science.  I looked at several different tablets, but only took home a Fire and A Nabi to try out to see how I liked them.  The Nabi had a lot of non educational stuff preloaded that I would not use, also the students would have to page through the Nabi AppStore page to get to the books etc.  I called the Nabi help line and found out you could not relocate it away from kid's view.  That reminded me of candy at the grocery store checkout!  I tested both during our Christmas break and chose the Fire.  I love Kindle's free Freetime (not the paid subscription service).  I  did try out the paid service, but as it was similar to the Nabi's mix of edutainment/games/books so I decided to go with the non subscription Freetime.  I love the way I can use Freetime to tailor content specifically for each of my groups.  I have purchased lots of interactive book apps from Oceanhouse Media......anything they do is top quality!  The great thing is that every book or app I buy from the Amazon appstore then shows up on all five of my Kindle Fires.....Scholastic Storia expected me to by the SAME book five times to get it on all of my tablets!  I have discovered apps for science, math, social studies, phonics, vocabulary, sentence writing, letter formation, reading, drawing etc.  So far I have purchased about fifty apps for use throughout the kindergarten year.  The children are so engaged with the touch technology and the Fires have fast and beautiful displays, plus they are the perfect size for small hands.  I bought bright red rubbery bumper cases from Cellularvilla to protect the Fires. I am very pleased with my purchase of five Kindle Fire second generation tablets and my students love learning with them.Also I love to read and have owned a Kindle reader for many years so the price and quality of the Fires is inline with my prior experience with Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: janet bidle
Reviews.Content: I bought this prior to going on vacation to use on the airplane. I thought the kids could watch movies.  We bought some movies before we left but were no able to view them. It seems you have to have wifi to be able to view, even though we bought them and downloaded the movies.  We went with people that had a Nook and they were able to watch their movies without connecting to the internet. I am very disappointed. This means they can't watch anything in the care either. Wish we would have bought 2 Nook's instead.

Reviews.Title: NEVER TAKES A CHARGE
Reviews.Author: lynch.
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd Kindle sent to us (first 2 were Generation 1), although Amazon is great about sending a new one out, it would be nice to keep one and have it work!

Reviews.Title: Great till it wouldn't charge
Reviews.Author: Liz
Reviews.Content: I really really loved this tablet. I found it easy to use and the graphics were terrific. Then one day it just wouldn't charge. They shipped another one out but Im wondering how long this one will last? Seems to be a problem with many Kindle users. They should offer a trade in.

Reviews.Title: Bad Battery
Reviews.Author: Kelly CAP
Reviews.Content: I have had the Kindle Fire for a few months and the internal battery will not charge. I can not turn it on. I can't figure our how to get warrenty service.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY
Reviews.Author: S. Cuesta
Reviews.Content: I AM ACTUALLY REALLY DISAPPOINTED IN AMAZON, DO NOT BUY IF YOU LIVE OUTSIDE U.S.A. WASTE OF MONEY DIRECTLY TO THE TRASH, YOU ARE NOT ABLE TO DOWNLOAD APPS IF YOU ARE NOT INSIDE THE USA TERRITORY, AGAIN IT WOULD HAVE BEEN GOOD GIFT BUT ENDED AS A SAD FACE OF MY KID. THOUGHT IT WAS A REAL CONTENDER TO THE IPAD, I WAS WRONG...

Reviews.Title: One happy daughter!
Reviews.Author: Audrey
Reviews.Content: I got a kindle fire for my daughter for Christmas. She loves it. She plays games, watches movies, read books, and listens to music. She is one happy girl!

Reviews.Title: Very frustrating and disappointed
Reviews.Author: DG "DG"
Reviews.Content: Kindle didn't work! After 3 hours on the phone with two different individuals that I had a hard time understanding I decided to give up and send it back

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed in customer service.
Reviews.Author: Kathy Viscosi
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire was not shipped in a packing box.  It came in the Kindle box.  There was not a charger, there wasn't a packing slip.  A sticker with my name & address was slapped on the side of the Kindle box and that was the way it was shipped.  So, I never actually used the Kindle because it came without a charger.  I think someone messed up somewhere, so with that in mind I will not be ordering again.

Reviews.Title: The Most Overrated Product of 2012 Award Winner.  Battery is still an issue that was not fixed and it hangs-up all the time.
Reviews.Author: Marcus Napthen
Reviews.Content: I hate to say it but the Kindle Fire is "Big Money Wasted" in terms of performance and glitches that were not addressed even though Amazon said the new Kindle solved the previous e-reader issues.  First off, we ordered two Kindle Fires for two of our kids, and the problems started from the get go with one of the Kindle Fires not charging properly.  We did an overnight charge into a wall socket and one of the Kindle Fires did not even reach it's charging capacity.  (BTW:  We did all the troubleshooting so let me stop everyone in their tracks before I get a flurry of "fix-it" responses.)  Also, the other Kindle Fire is not even close to the battery life that has been touted.  We are getting about 3 hours of battery life instead of the "up to 9 hours" as advertised.  The processor is no better than our previous Kindles and I also notice quite a bit of hanging when the kids are using any type of app.  We actually have to shut down and restart the whole Kindle to get it back on track.  IMO One of the absolute WORST products that has been touted as revolutionary.  Save your money and stick with the older more reliable models.  The Kindle Fire wins my dubious "Most Overrated Product of 2012 Award"

Reviews.Title: Thoroughly enjoying it
Reviews.Author: Professional shopper
Reviews.Content: I've only had my Kindle for 11 days, so this review might be updated as the weeks go by. I do need to mention that my first Kindle had to be replaced within a few days because I could not download books without having to turn it off and back on again. Customer service was very helpful in this matter and I received my replacement the next day. This new Kindle has not given me a bit of trouble and I am really enjoying it. I love the fact that there are free books available because I doubt that I will ever pay for a book. I've noticed that I really have to move quickly though, because a book that's free today might not be tomorrow.I've had no problems connecting to the web or playing games. The games that I usually play on my iPhone I am now playing on Kindle and it's so much nicer playing on a larger screen.The only negative thing that I have to say is that the battery does not last long. I'm constantly charging it and I'm concerned that in the future that I'll have issues with the port where the charger goes like so many others have complained about. If that happens, you can bet that I'll be returning my Kindle for another one as long as it's still under warranty.Overall, I am very satisfied with the Kindle Fire and will purchase another one for a family member.

Reviews.Title: Always "FREEZES," can't deliver CONTENT (music, games), & doesn't turn ON half the time
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline Lee
Reviews.Content: // To view this video download Flash Player (version 9.0.115 or higher)'); } } catch(err) { fp_resizePlayerSpace('cv_mo2MNJSSDP40SVD', 0, 0); } return false; } function _cv_mo2MNJSSDP40SVDloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { var swfLocation = "http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/am3/20120510035744301/AMPlayer._V148501545_.swf";
