logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo2MNJSSDP40SVDcurrentClick) { return cv_mo2MNJSSDP40SVDcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 0:11 MinsHorrible investment! Purchased for my kids to play educational games. When used as 'designed,' it doesn't work. In the middle of playing a game, it stalls. When streaming music/Pandora, it gets 'stuck' & makes a HORRIBLE, obnoxiously loud stuttering sound (which, of course, wakes my kids back up). I called Amazon & on the PROMPT it says to "push #3" if your Kindle is 'frozen.' Um. Hello? If there are so many problems that it's on ur PROMPT, maybe you should FIX it. Took me 3 hours yesterday trying to fix Kindles we've only used for TWO MONTHS. I went to the store i purchased it from, they directed me to their Help support who directed me to Amazon's Help support who had to escalate the ticket to another support desk. Once I had the supervisor, she told me to go back to the store!! (i.e.- Product Support?)Bottom Line: It doesn't stream content without errors/failures/interruption (basic videos, music, etc). You have to turn it off/on 7 times in 15 minutes to reboot!! Although purchased for the express purpose of advancing their knowledge, the kids HATE the Kindles & don't WANT to use them because "they NEVERRR work!!!" Save yourself some money and purchase something else. Definitely NOT worth the money, the migraine, or the time investment.Update 12/21: Now the Kindle won't turn on AT ALL. A technician said he hears Kindle problems constantly & strongly advises a Nexus & its Quad-core technology. U can download a Amazon/Kindle app so it will have same look/feel. More FREE apps, better technology, richer screen, better performance, Same price - $199. Amazon is exchanging my Kindle (thanks to $50 warranty I purchased). Hope, the replacements work...but not holding my breath.Update 12/23: Set up the new Kindle. Within 2 MINUTES(!), it wasn't working correctly!! The attached video shows the same high-pitched 'stuttering' sound. The only way to 'clear' it, is to power down. The new Kindle ALSO freezes & has to be turned off/on to work. It ALSO doesn't consistently turn on. Had it less than 24 hrs.

Reviews.Title: Best new toy for couples that read in bed...w/o lights to keep partner awake.
Reviews.Author: Waldo Pepper
Reviews.Content: There were two things that kept giving it 5 stars:1. The lack of someway to turn of the auto screen orientation so it would stay either vertical or horizontal without changing to make it easier to read while laying in bed.2. The lack of a battery meter in the border somewhere.

Reviews.Title: Wish I had known before buying Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Bethresh
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire will not play Flash Player.  If I had known this, I would not have purchased it.  I like it, but I had a very specific need when I purchased, and that was to view webcast of barrel races when my horse is competing at a show I can't go to.  I don't want to carry my heavy laptop on trips just to watch webcast.  But, unfortunately, I will still have to carry the laptop.  Very dissapointing. I should have done my homework, but I assumed that flash player was a standard these days.

Reviews.Title: Amazom rocks!
Reviews.Author: dkseal
Reviews.Content: I have bought several Kindles, the latest was a gen 1 kindle fire. Unfortunately, the device quit charging 6 days AFTER the warranty ran out...I called Amazon, and they made it right by sending me a 2nd gen fire. It is slightly different (to be expected), but I am grateful to have it. Thank you Amazon for making sure your customers are happy...a very rare commodity these days!

Reviews.Title: Great Kindle
Reviews.Author: Kendra
Reviews.Content: This kindle is wonderful, my daughter and I each have one and love them. They do all that we need and more!

Reviews.Title: Bought as a gift
Reviews.Author: Denise
Reviews.Content: I bought this for a gift for my mother and she is really enjoying how quick and easy she can look something up. My mom would of liked a book to learn more stuff she can do with it, so she had to go down to the book store and buy one.

Reviews.Title: Great little device
Reviews.Author: Ann B. Goddard "L.LaRue"
Reviews.Content: Very fun and easy to use. However, it was for my father, who is older. It really would have been nice to receive an instruction manual with it. Really? You're making us pay to learn how to use it?

Reviews.Title: Beyond Expectations
Reviews.Author: Sbuff
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle Fire!  The screen is a great size and the graphics are clear.  Downloading ebooks, games and music is very simple and Amazon makes it a step by step process.  Great product!!

Reviews.Title: Life changer!
Reviews.Author: 84trillion
Reviews.Content: I received the Kindle Fire as an unexpected gift last holiday season. I had no desire to own an e-reader but decided to see what it was all about.I absolutely and completely adore my Kindle Fire. I carry it with me constantly, use it every single day and had no idea it would be such an amazing device. I read more because of the ease of using the Kindle - I can read in the dark before bed because it's illuminated, I can read anything I want thanks to the gigantic Amazon library, I can practice my German by reading the free German children's texts I've downloaded, and it always saves my page even if I fall asleep or am otherwise interrupted.Not to mention, the Netflix app is great!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire Review
Reviews.Author: ashleymaria
Reviews.Content: I have had my Kindle Fire for about a year now and I absolutely love it. At first I was hesitant to switch to electronic books but once a read my first book on my kindle I realized how similar it was to a real book. It is also super easy to buy eBooks through amazon. You don't have to worry about going out to the bookstore and looking around to try and find the book that you want, you just type in the book that you want and it downloads instantly. Also, with the Kindle Fire it is nice that you can download magazines, movies and games too so it is like a tablet. I highly suggest investing in one :)

Reviews.Title: Ready for next tablet
Reviews.Author: Amy "homesteadblessings"
Reviews.Content: I have had my Kindle Fire for a year now and I have mixed feelings about it. I really like the quality of it but am ready for a new tablet (prob Microsoft surface or the bigger newer Kindle Fire with the camera :0)  The choice is hard right now. My overall complaint is the lack of ability to customize it. I really hate the home page interface and the whirly turntable on the main screen....It is always filled with useless stuff. I wish that you could customize the opening screens and backgrounds. My last Gripe is that I can't organize the book and Apps list at all. I like to use the kindle fire to pick my next book because I can look at the covers, but there is no way to quickly look at a book description without going back into the store and looking it up. I wish I could easily get more information to help me choose my books.The 7" size is good to take along easily. I did not get used to reading on it, because I don't like to finger swipe the pages. My regular kindle is much better for intense reading. My only other complaint is the battery life. It does not last very long. Overall I do enjoy the apps, magazines and web browsing ability of it. I have been generally happy but am looking for a little more at this point. The Kindle Fire is GREAT!!!! but I think I need a little more.

Reviews.Title: DEFECTIVELY DESIGNED CHARGER CONNECTOR
Reviews.Author: Bond ""James Bond""
Reviews.Content: We purchase this Dec. 2011 and my 9 yr old LOVED it. HOWEVER, there appears to be a design FLAW in which the receptacle in the Kindle Fire will eventually come lose and not allow the Kindle cord to stay connected to charge UNLESS you PERFECTLY set the connection, which will take 5+ minutes AND it does NOT come lose on it's on (which it will based on the lose connection and wait of the cord/connector). WE tried EVERYTHING and even had a new one sent to us under the warranty, but to no avail. Several of our friends say they have the same problem. This is VERY frustrating for our 9 yr old and us.AMAZON...are you reading this?  THEIR IS A DEFECT WITH THE DESIGN BETWEEN THE USB CONNECTION PORT AND THE CORD.

Reviews.Title: Biggest waste of money possible
Reviews.Author: artistnatural
Reviews.Content: Save your money.  This thing is like a horse collar.  Big heavy paperweight.  The touch screen is unresponsive.  I have several times almost pitched it against the wall.  Weighs you down -nowhere near as good as the Galaxy Player 3.6 or 4 or 4.2 or 5.  Mine has be mostly unused from the day I bought it.  Wish I could return it and exchange for the G player

Reviews.Title: BUYER BEWARE
Reviews.Author: Judith Brain "jbrain"
Reviews.Content: To start I am very much a kindle fan, I was on the waiting list when they first came out.  I recently purchased 3 more as gifts for different birthday/christmas presents. 2 of the kindles were fine and the recipents set them up correctly, the 3rd was set up by my 12 year old niece, when she started up her kindle she did not reset and make her own account, ALL my information was on HER kindle; books I've read, my credit card #, that is hooked to my account, all apps and everything that is on MY kindle showed up on hers.  I feel this is a HUGE privacy issue, and potentially a costly one.  I called amazon and was told that if you already own a kindle and purchase other ones for gifts if you don't check "the this is a gift box" all your information will be in the new kindle purchased, and was told I should have known this since I had already purchased a kindle. NO WHERE when you are purchasing a kindle is any of this posted. SO BEWARE GIVING THE GIFT OF A KINDLE YOU MIGHT BE GIVING MORE OF A GIFT THAN YOU INTENDED!!!

Reviews.Title: Very good
Reviews.Author: MICHAEL MCNEESE
Reviews.Content: The kindle fire is a very good product but should offer a longer battery life for the price.Reduce the screen brightness and turn off WiFi to extend the battery charge.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Liz K
Reviews.Content: my husband got me the kindle fire for my birthday and I love it,the touch screen is wonderful the only complaint is the battery life.

Reviews.Title: got the kindle fire for my birthday
Reviews.Author: Nessie
Reviews.Content: I was excited that I got the kindle fire for my birthday and I do like it for the most part I have my complaints I think that amazon should have sent it with the wall charger seriously  who wants to wait hours and hours for it to charge and I have to say the battery dosen't last very long eaither I can get maybe 4 hours of play on a fully charged battery which I think sucks and I also don't care for the ad's every time you turn the kindle fire on.

Reviews.Title: Dear Amazon
Reviews.Author: MP5512
Reviews.Content: I am writing this in customer review, because I can not seem to find a place to review Amazon Customer Support.  We have had this machine and many other kindle editions and for the most part love the device as well as the customer service.  I have a major complaint today though because my device does not seem to want to charge.  It seems as though any and all issues we have ever had with the kindle involves charging.  So, Amazon I ask that you live up to your customer service reputation in the past and replace my daughter's kindle free of charge for it was within warranty when we started to have problems.  Her kindle was not charging and we called, within warranty time frame, and they sent out a charger...stating it was the charger.  My daughter charged the kindle and a couple of months later....same problem....at first it worked good then it slowly started to get worse and then no screen and no charge at all......all your customer service rep (although nice) was able to offer was a mere 29.00 waver off the price of a re-furbished, no warranty replacement......So I ask you Amazon....please do the right thing....we have been local customers for years.......

Reviews.Title: Nothing but frustration.
Reviews.Author: Tom C.
Reviews.Content: I had such high hopes for this device... It's been a year since I received the device for Christmas and I wish I had returned it within the 30 days.  There seems to be problems with everything, the default browser crashes, the streaming for Prime movies, lag, stutters and disconnects, books that are supported on the kindle app on a galaxy s3 PHONE isn't supported on the fire.Movies that I buy and download onto the device won't play at times, example I bought the first season of Community and downloaded all the episodes onto the device with the intention of watching them on a 10 hour plane ride.  I get on the plane and every single episode would not play. I reached out to Amazon and they said It was my internet connection...  What?  Why do i need an internet connection to play a movie on my device already?  Furthermore my WIFI connection is fine when it comes to Nexus tablet, and Ipads not to mention my laptop, desktop, and ps3, but the fire is the only device that drops the connection every couple of minutes...I tried to replace all the default apps with independent ones, but the amazon app store is a piece of junk.I briefly considered picking up the Fire HD during black Friday but remembering the frustration i have had with the Fire I have made me change my mind.I love Amazon, and Amazon prime is great, but the Fire is a piece of junk.

Reviews.Title: careful when charging
Reviews.Author: David Beason
Reviews.Content: I was given this as a Christmas gift 2 years ago.  I have been very happy with all of the features on this device.  My only complaint is the mini usb connection port.  I have to admit to using my kindle while it was plugged in and charging, I do not recommend this.  My port has been tweaked and I am no longer able to charge it.  I would recommend this product to someone looking for a tablet, the quality of the tablet is excellent aside from the delicate usb port.

Reviews.Title: WONDERFUL DEVICE, IF YOU CAN GET IT TO CHARGE
Reviews.Author: Michelle "book worm333"
Reviews.Content: I've owned my kindle fire for two years, and after one month's use, the plug in adaptor became loose, and I lost the ability to be able to charge my device. When it does charge (has to be pluged in at just the right angle), then it's a fun, beautiful tablet. Sadly, have gotten to use my kindle fire very little over the last two years because most of the time it won't charge or turn on. Scared to ever buy another kindle because of this issue. It was a gift, so I had no way to return it.....

Reviews.Title: Battery failure after 2 years
Reviews.Author: T. Ross "newby"
Reviews.Content: My 1st Generation Kindle lasted two years before dying.  The battery life wasn't great from the start. Eventually, the thing wouldn't charge.  I contacted Amazon and was told that the one year warranty had expired. They were nice enough to offer me a new one at a discounted price.  I declined. I really liked the Kindle but won't buy another one.  My only complaint was battery life.  I'll wait for the Ipad 5.

Reviews.Title: The port where the charger plugs into the Kindle still has problems pluging in the battery charger..
Reviews.Author: Margot Lincoln
Reviews.Content: The design of the pott weak and subject to charger failure. Kindle design must be changed. At least tell us that the plug on the charger will only insert into the Kindle one way. ie mark the charger "this way up"

Reviews.Title: Don't bother
Reviews.Author: nkl9980
Reviews.Content: Bought a Kindle Fire last summer, it stopped charging just after it was out of warranty.Was able to return it for a replacement, but the customer service rep made it clear I was getting an exception I really wasn't entitled to.Second kindle fire had a screwed-up touchscreen and was obviously re manufactured.I'm going to wipe it and throw it away. I'm better off with a tablet and my first-gen kindle e-reader. I enjoyed it while it worked, but I can't justify any more expense or frustration with kindle fires.

Reviews.Title: Will not charge!
Reviews.Author: Sierra M.
Reviews.Content: Everything seemed to be going fine but then it got a little picky on being charged. I had to hold the cord at a certain angle ect. Now it just won't charge at all.

Reviews.Title: Loving my Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Heidi G.
Reviews.Content: I don't know why I waited so long to order a Kindle Fire! I love it and use it hours each day. I love that it is user friendly, a touch screen and stays charged well.  It is a lifesaver when I'm on the go!!

Reviews.Title: kindle fire 7 wi-fi 8 GB
Reviews.Author: jeri dover
Reviews.Content: My son gave me a kindle fire 7 for Christmas 2012 and he brought it at Best Buy. I had a lot of problems with it.  I called Amazon.com their staff of young people for this company was wonderful to me. They replace it and I was happy for a while.  The music I download from amazon started having problems as well with my kindle 2 in 4 months.  Sunday I called amazon kindle dept. again and they refunded my money and moved me up to a kindle 7 HD with 32 GB.  I can't wait to get my new Kindle HD 7. I am a senior who enjoys good movies, music and good customer service from amazon.com.  My God Bless the staff of young people at Amazon, they're the best! I will always be a customer of amazon. May you have a wonderful bless day.Happy Customer,Geri D :)

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire 7"
Reviews.Author: sugar
Reviews.Content: I really like the updates on my 2nd Kindle.  Its much easier to use.  I love it.  This item is way above my expectations.  When the first kindle wouldn't juice up anymore, I panicked.  I got my new kindle the next day.

Reviews.Title: I Cannot Believe this!
Reviews.Author: Dana Corby "Leslie"
Reviews.Content: I was given a Kindle Fire for Christmas 2012. I loved it! But it shortly began having trouble holding a charge for longer than about 2 hours and eventually stopped charging at all. I called customer service and was immediately sent a replacement.Within a few weeks, the new Kindle Fire stopped charging at all. So I contacted customer service and was immediately sent a replacement. It wouldn't charge at all. So I contacted customer service and it was determined that I probably had a faulty charger. They immediately replaced it, and since I'd already returned Kindles 1 and 2, they also sent another Kindle Fire. I charged it up, and loved it! Two days later -- TWO DAYS -- it stopped charging. I haven't had the heart yet to contact customer service.Amazon Kindle needs to rethink their customer service policy. It's all very well to be responsive and liberal in the matter of returns, but they'd save themselves a ton of money and have much happier customers if they'd just sell reliable products in the first place!

Reviews.Title: Amazon Should Acknowledge The Design Flaw in Kindle Fire 1st G USB Connector.en.
Reviews.Author: BrianT
Reviews.Content: My wife is on her second Kindle Fire. The USB connection in both units failed.She has friends who have gone through more failed usb connections than she has.When she reported to Amazon that her 2nd unit had failed,they couldn't help her since her original warranty is up.She has had the second unit for less than a year.I looked into having the kindle repaired by a 2nd party.It will cost about 50$ plus shipping. So I checked out a how to video on youtube.  [...]  It has had more than 19,000 hits! So, I think Amazon is well aware of this congenital defect. I think they should replace defective units with a refurbished unit. Chances are the refurbished units are returns with failed usb ports.I will bet that the soldering connections that fail on the jack will be have better soldering on the refurbished unit.

Reviews.Title: Disposable Tablet
Reviews.Author: bogart
Reviews.Content: Bought 2 Kindle fire for my kids last 1/2012. One of my kids kindle fire need new battery. I called Amazon and said the warranty is only for a year and said only help that we can do is to send it back to amazon and Amazon will give you a discount if you will buy a new one. thanks Amazon for the good customer service and reliable tablet (kindle fire) and Hoping you will get our loyalty for this kind of service.

Reviews.Title: 2nd kindle with charging issues
Reviews.Author: iheartcofee
Reviews.Content: On my second kindle fire that has quit charging. Apparently they don't extend the warranty for the replacement so I would have to buy another.  Not gonna happen, not wasting my money on kindles anymore.  Buyer beware, they refuse to admit there is a problem and they are in no rush to fix the issue. They just want to make money off people who are unaware.  Very disappointed in Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I wanted
Reviews.Author: Jose V
Reviews.Content: My desire when I bought the Kindle Fire 7" was to be able to borrow books from the library to read on the Kindle.That is working well; in fact, I attended a workshop last week on using the Kindle at the library & the staff is thereto answer any questions I have on the operation.

Reviews.Title: Waste of money
Reviews.Author: tuffnurse "supertuff"
Reviews.Content: I received the kindle fire as a Christmas gift when it was first released. From the beginning, there were problems with the charger being very finicky - it had to be placed in a very particular way just to charge properly. I should have reported this from the start, but as I could always manage to get it to work, I never bothered. While reading on the kindle fire was easy and enjoyable, I cannot say the same about using the browser. It crashed regularly, and was easily overwhelmed by pages with a lot of images (for example, shopping online). The touch screen was difficult to use and not very sensitive. For example, scrolling and selecting from drop down menus was always a chore. This had nothing to do with the cleanliness of the screen. The battery life was also quite short. I could only use it for a few hours before needing to charge it.I am using the past tense in this review because the charger finally stopped working, and I now have a completely useless device that is less than 2 years old. As the device is only covered by Amazon for one year, I have no recourse at this point, and there are no repair options. I never expected to have to dispose of such a costly device in such a short amount of time. I would not recommend this product to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire 7"
Reviews.Author: Cheryol Miller
Reviews.Content: I love the color.  I have a black and white Kindle that I've had about 4 years and also like very much but the color is really great.  I like the other features it offers that my other did not or I didn't know how to use.  I liked that I was able to transfer my books to the new one.

Reviews.Title: Very nice but not perfect (but what is?)
Reviews.Author: Timothy J. Gannon
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect reader with excellent readibility and battery life. It doewn't work so well as a tablet. resizing and pushing buttons is tedious but ok for minor usage. I'm so glad I have this reader. OH YEAH... Great for viewing Amazon Prime videos!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Nice but doesnt seem to hold a good charge to it
Reviews.Author: Ro13135
Reviews.Content: I do enjoy the Kindle Fire, had a hard time figuring out why it was so bright and I had to lower the settings but on the other hand it does not seem to hold a battery charge like my original Kindle. I seem to be constantly charging every 2 days which I do not have to do with my original one. Still has some kinks in it for me. When I shut it down to charge it starts up?? also it goes thru the display telling me how to work the Kindle FIre which I Don't know if I can stop that. Wish it has where I can make collections like I can on my older model so now I get books downloaded to both and save them on my older model.3 months later the battery still does not seem to hold a charge compared to my older Kindle I am charging just about every other day still.

Reviews.Title: go with the nook or ipad
Reviews.Author: leo "chicken salad chopper"
Reviews.Content: I received for Christmas 2011 by Nov 2012 the screen froze no problem they mailed me another which lasted until May 2013 went to return and turns out warrenty on replacement is three months after that they offer you a discount on a new one.  Helloooooo why would I invest more money in a product that even  amazon doesn't have faith in.  My sister received an I pad and my best friend received a nook that same Christmas but only I got Scrooged.  Very disappointed in you amazon,

Reviews.Title: Great tablet "Kindle Fire"
Reviews.Author: Esther N. Nicholson
Reviews.Content: I am excited about my new kindle fire. It's a great way to check e-mails, facebook, and google for research. I am enjoying the free apps from Amazon. I have not had any problems with the kindle fire, and am using it most every day!

Reviews.Title: Be careful if you need support
Reviews.Author: jbenz
Reviews.Content: I have a kindle fire that would no longer take a charge,so I called customer service. After speaking to 3 representatives I'm frustrated, annoyed and have a splitting headache but have no idea what they are sending me as a replacement... The first representative told me that they would send a new kindle right out to me, they just needed a credit card number to charge, if I did not return the broken fire and the the charge would be $199. I did not have my card with me so they said to call back and they would mark my account. Number 2 said that this problem was common in this model but it would be replaced with a new one not refurbished, I would be charged $199 if I didn't return my broken Fire and I could upgrade at an additional cost but first I needed to try the newer charger, so they sent it to me. It did not work. They did not call back as per their confirming email, so I called again.  Number 3 said I could upgrade, my warranty had expired but there was an extension because of the battery issue but now I only have one day left, to make my decision. I was then told I would probably receive a refurbished one with a 90 day warranty, but if I wanted to upgrade I could buy a refurbished upgrade with a 1yr. warranty or a new one at the regular price with my Fire as a trade in for $50-$100 and again I would be charged $199 if my fire was not returned!!! I asked for a Supervisor. Number 4 was a supervisor who said there was a misunderstanding with her people and she would speak with them, but couldn't offer me an explanation as what I would get for my  trade in so I asked the Supervisor how much I would be charged if the Fire was not returned so I could insure it and she told me that they would send me an insured mailing label for the return but I would still charged $199 if I don't return it (like I really wanted a broken Fire). Is Amazon going to charge the Post Office $199 if it's lost???? I have no idea what I'm receiving new or refurbished or what model Fire I'm getting so I took the replacement one in complete frustration and going out to look at the other Tablets with a better Customer Support.  I have never written this kind of review before but I had heard of the great customer service and support for the Fire from Amazon and can't believe that this is what I had to go through when all I wanted was a repair.

Reviews.Title: the "new" kindle"
Reviews.Author: Shelly Morrison
Reviews.Content: still is not at good as the first one, if they changed the charging port it may be a better product. Still not happy with the kindle fire

Reviews.Title: never again
Reviews.Author: Holly Vandevanter
Reviews.Content: this is my 3rd one and still after just a few weeks having same issue with where it plugs in to the kindle. very loose, and now takes forever to charge.

Reviews.Title: I WANT MY OLD KINDLE FIRE BACK!!!! :-(
Reviews.Author: Desne Penman
Reviews.Content: ok so my 1st gen kindle fire charging port was not working (known flaw) and Amazon were really helpful and sent me out a replacement one right away. WOW! really good of them. The problem is that though its the old casing of the kindle fire, the software is the new 2012 version. AND IT SUCKS!! big time. I cant stress enough, I HATE THE NEW SYSTEM!!My reasons:1. They've laid out all the tabs - ie videos, music, pictures, downloads, etc at the top instead of all under media - the result is that you now have to scroll to reach the 'web' and other tabs that don't fit on the screen.2. You cant disable the swipe function, which randomly decides to take over your keyboard.Really I just hate the layout, which can be dismissed while reading if the touch screen wasnt so sensitive (overtly so).I cant say how long it takes to pull down the top menu to access the volume and brightness, but because the screen is soo sensitive it selects the wifi settings instead and then that starts a whole mess of headaches.When my kindle stopped working i just wanted my old system back, i was hoping that because of the new model being realised that there would be old models ready to replace broken ones, but they're just using the casing.I am currently looking into downgrading my kindle (why mess with a working formula?).Finally what drove me to write this review: my touch screen has gone bonkers! It selects what it wants so it takes 15 mins to get past the unlock screen (which i've had to disable) and if i select a video i must be prepared to watch the wrong vid, be unable to adjust the volume and take ages to use the back arrow. I've reset it and scanned for viruses, but nothing has helped and it really is pissing me off to the point where I just dont want to use my kindle at all, and my kindle is my life.Please amazon again why fix a working thing??!!UPDATE:Even though I was told that my kindle was $159 and I received the second generation kindle costing $159 I was charged the full price $199. for the fire HD. Amazon you thieves!

Reviews.Title: Dissatisfied
Reviews.Author: Maria C. Fani
Reviews.Content: I am very unhappy with the kindle fire. I am a voracious reader and the battery life is terrible. I have to charge the kindle every day sometimes twice a day. I also travel to warmer climates in the winter and cannot read the kindle on the beach or by the pool. It is terrible in sunlight. That said I have just ordered the kindle paperwhite hoping for a better experience.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire 7"
Reviews.Author: Karen Pollard
Reviews.Content: I am so disappointed in this Kindle.  I previously have been reading on the Kindle that has a keyboard.  I loved it, but was wishing I had a Kindle with a built in lighted background for easier bedtime reading.  So, I asked for this one for Christmas.  First, it only holds it's charge for about 8 hours and that's if you're NOT even using it!  Second, I find it very challenging to figure out how to use it.I am SO sorry I wasted my money on it.  It sits on the nightstand unused while I read on my old Kindle which holds a charge for days and days!

Reviews.Title: not happy with replacement kindle fire
Reviews.Author: jennie barrios
Reviews.Content: I loved my first kindle.  I needed to exchange it when the charge port loosened.  My replacement does not work as well.  I called amazon seemed like the problem was solved when I cleared history. 2 days later I had the same problems. The sad thing is I really wanted to buy another for a gift .  I will be buying a different brand next time

Reviews.Title: Very dissapointed
Reviews.Author: great game lots of cute clothes and hair styles.
Reviews.Content: I purchased two kindle fires for my girls for Christmas ages 6 and 11. I purchased them mostly on reviews that I read. I should have returned them right away. If you are looking for a tablet to surf the web this tablet is adequate. I purchased them fo surfing and playing games. The playing falls flat! Most of the game are slow and unresponsive. The games freeze and you have to constantly restart them if you get them to work at all. In addition to that I find the app choices quite limiting. I have an Ipad and the differences are like night and day. I purchased them so my kids can have their own tablets and leave my ipad to me. That didn't work because a lot of the apps they  had on my ipad are not available on the kindle and if they are available a good portion of them don't work. In short I would not buy or recommend a kindle.

Reviews.Title: UNSATISFIED
Reviews.Author: Joy
Reviews.Content: I ordered this item but found it undesirable and heavy.  Was not what I expected.  I returned it with shipping label from Amazon.  Was due to receive refund but never credited.  Would like  a refund.  Called Amazon.  Representative confused.  NO ACTION TAKEN BY AMAZON.  Very unusual because Amazon is usually wonderful in handling problems.

Reviews.Title: Can't watch downloaded video's when away from wifi
Reviews.Author: Jake Burdeaux "Jake"
Reviews.Content: Was away from wifi for awhile & when I tried to access my downloaded video content, I received the message that I was currently offline. My device videos were listed, but I was unable to click on any of them. When I was able to quickly connect to wifi & then disconnect, the videos were once available to view offline. Must be another bug in the system.The point to downloading video to your device is to view them when wifi is not available, this kind of defeats the purpose of that!Also, when I buy kindle books, I can download them to my PC-kindle, transfer them to kindlefire, but can't turn them on until I get to a wifi connection.I don't understand the difference with this? With my kindle-keyboard, I download books to my kindle-pc, transfer them from there to kindle-keyboard, and voila, I am able to get on the bus and read them. But, not with kindlefire, I can do everything, but I then have to wait until I am in a wifi area to be able to start the book, what is up with that!?!Same thing with music, I buy albums, download them to kindle-pc, transfer them to my kindle-fire, but they will not activate until I get to school and click on them there when my kindle-fire connects to wifi.

Reviews.Title: instructions
Reviews.Author: Sue
Reviews.Content: I received my Kindle Fire for Christmas and really like it. However, it would have been even better if it had come with some written instructions, as I am a senior citizen and not very tech savvy. It sometimes takes me along time to find things.

Reviews.Title: Mixed feelings about my Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Cyndyrella
Reviews.Content: I got this kindle for my 5 year old daughter. She absolutely loves it! She used to ask for my ipad, but now prefers this one because its smaller and easier to carry and hold while we're on the road. I truly love the Kindle Free time! A few weeks after we got the Kindle I saw the ad on the lock screen for the  Kindle FreeTime Unlimited, it had a month trial, we gave it ago, and I think its just awesome, and soo inexpensive!!! The only negative thing I have about this device is the area to connect it to get charged. Ever since we got the device, I noticed the indicator light would turn on when plugging in the cord, but once not touching it, it would turn off and doesn't charge the kindle. This is very frustrating. I have to gently move the cord until I see the light turn on and quickly put something like a book underneath the cord to hold in place so it could continue charging. Even so, at times, we leave it there thinking its charging when it really isn't. I don't know if we got a defective device, or if all kindles connection ports are like that. I read alot of good reviews and since I got this kindle for a reasonable price, I didn't think I would need the extended protection. Now, I regret I didn't buy it. My advice, get this awesome little device, just make sure you purchase the additional protection. If I didn't have this problem, without a doubt, I would rate it a whopping 5 stars!

Reviews.Title: This Stinks, shame shame amazon
Reviews.Author: Michael E. Parie
Reviews.Content: this is my daughters tablet, like most parents I seen it was advertised as being great for kids, well all not so truethis is not some crazy ol nut here complaining just for complaining like most reviewsit does work & works OK, for what little it does do,  so let me explain why....You have to load all apps through amazon, they want your $$$, they control this device even though you own it, talk about control issuesit has an old android operating system, so its capabilities are limitedno provision to add an external memory card like other even cheaper tablets offerthere is no way to make adjustments for most common items without fighting the deviceif you load an app from elsewhere you have to click on many tabs to make this happen, its my tablet let me chose where I purchase my appsno way to control the volume in most apps, tell me how a child is able to do this, they can not. as an adult I can just barely do it with two handsfreetime has issues, I posted a response in the kindle forums on how to get out of there if the screen freezes, amazon didnt know howno way to get back to basic menu when reading Ebooks it seemsif it wasnt my daughter xmas gift & she wouldnt cry I would send this hunk of junk back asapI also believe it has to have a wifi connection even in order to workkeep your money and buy a cheap droid from elsewheres as it will have more apps pre-loaded on it & have many more options that this one needs & lacks

Reviews.Title: Kindle fire7
Reviews.Author: Janet Rodden
Reviews.Content: so far haven't been able to use it as I have to have WiFi -which I didn't know and also because I had to buy a charger- I'll probably like it if I ever get to use it- I have a cable internet connection so don't know how to get WiFi as the router I bought doesn't have the correct connectors

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Laurence Klein
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed with the Kindle Fire! It's heavy, difficult to hold without unintended page turning. No way to go to last page read. I returned it!

Reviews.Title: Do NOT buy this as a gift for anyone without a credit card
Reviews.Author: R. T. Holland Jr. "Three Creeks Farm"
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift for our Godchild.  She is 16 and therefore does not have a credit card. I wanted to also give an Amazon Gift Card of Amazon Prime.First, you CANNOT purchase Amazon Prime with a gift card.  Strike Number 1, Amazon.Second, you cannot purchase ANYTHING...even free stuff...for the Kindle without a credit card number, even if the user to which it is registered has a gift card. Strike Number 2, Amazon.Can't download a free app, can't download a free book, can't buy ANYTHING, even on the gift card unless you give Amazon a Credit Card number.This is the most STUPID and RIDICULOUS thing I have EVER seen. What's even worse, Amazon does not TELL you of these limitations when you purchase.There are MANY other options.....try NOOK.  Unless you plan to use this product yourself or give it to an adult who has a credit card, DO NOT buy!!!The Kindle itself is great.  As a long time Amazon customer, I can't believe this stupidity!I will keep this in mind before I purchase anything else from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: The Kindle is nice, but the USB charger is terrible.
Reviews.Author: C. Davis
Reviews.Content: I bought this item for my Mom for christmas. She loves it, and I think the Kindle Fire is an awesome little product. However, the USB charger that it comes with requires up to 13.5 HOURS to charge the device. They should have included a wall charger instead, because over half a day just to charge something you paid $160 bucks for is outrageous.

Reviews.Title: Good but no Flash Support
Reviews.Author: VMan
Reviews.Content: Cannot play embedded Flash, which is what Yahoo videos are.Heavier and Bulkier than the Nook HD.No camera on the Kindle Fire (but there is one on the Kindle HD.Therefore, no Skype.Would I get again - prob not.If I can live w/o a camera, I would get the NOOK on sale.For a lower cost option to Apple, I would like a combo of a camera and a SD Card...Next Gen?

Reviews.Title: a bit hard to operate
Reviews.Author: Jose Chavez
Reviews.Content: I don't know if it's me, a first time owner of a kindle, or it's just the device, but I find it hard to operate. For instance, cannot change the homepage... btw, it doesn't come with the power adapter, just the usb cable.this is an update... after having learned how to use my Kindle, I have sadly realized that it is NOT possible to install apps if you are out of the US, that really is bad news... I cannot install any app unless I'm within the US.I wonder why on earth Amazon decided to do that and more important, is this ever going to be reverted? I've been an Amazon die-hard fan, but with this experience, i cannot help to feel deeply disappointed...

Reviews.Title: Only one issue
Reviews.Author: TRANDTR "T.  Ritchie"
Reviews.Content: I like my Kindle Fire very much, use it daily, and have no complaints about how it functions.  The display is beautiful, sound is good, it works excellently for reading, web browsing, games, listenting to music, and watching TV/movies.  My single complaint is the poor battery life.  Even with the wireless turned off the battery life is less than expected.  I highly recommend this product but be aware that you'll need to charge frequently or use it plugged in (which is what I end up doing quite often) - be sure you use a plug-in charger and don't rely on charging it via USB, which takes forever and ever.  I use my older Kindle plug-in charger and that works just fine.

Reviews.Title: Nice product, but not thrilled
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought this device because my 2 year old Kindle keyboard "died."  It's great that I can see things in color, but like most "tablets," it's very hard to read out of doors.  It should come with an instruction book or something, because once I got it set up and wanted to change something (volume), I couldn't figure out how to get back to that.  It doesn't come with other than a USB port charger, so that's an added expense; and the battery doesn't last anywhere near as long as the website boasts (I could read several books AND play games on my Kindle keyboard for several days, and the battery on this one seems to last only as long as one book-about 4-6 hours).For the price, it's a decent tablet, but be prepared to spend extra for both a charger and either a screen protector or a stylus (the screen picks up fingerprints and is easily smudged; something the screen protector seems more resistant to).

Reviews.Title: Gift
Reviews.Author: Cheryl
Reviews.Content: Christmas gift daughter will love it !! I'd cant Wait to give it to her thank you  it's just as is should be

Reviews.Title: Now Switching to eBooks
Reviews.Author: W. T. Towles
Reviews.Content: I've always been an avid reader of traditional paper books but now have more books than I have space for them. When I saw Amazon's sale price on the Kindle Fire on cyber Monday, I decided to give ebooks a try.Before I tell you what I think of my new Kindle, there are a couple of bones to pick. First, I expected the Kindle to come with a way to charge it that doesn't take over half a day. I only discovered after placing the order that a plug-in, quick charger is optional, so I had to pay about $16 extra to get the charger separately (they arrived in the same Amazon box). You should price the Kindle to include the charger.Second, it is apparently only possible to register the Kindle wirelessly and not by using the USB connection. I don't understand why this should be, but if I were Amazon, I would fix this problem before Christmas day. Otherwise, lots of people who get a Kindle as a gift but don't have WiFi access on Christmas morning are likely to be angry. As it was, my Kindle was delivered late in the afternoon and I had to wait until the next morning to get to my local library to link up, get it registered, and download my first books. (UPDATE: Looks like you have already made wireless registration unnecessary.)Now to the Kindle. It is fantastic! I think I have now explored every part of it (and have developed a very light touch in the process). Overall, it is a technology and design marvel, very much like Apple produces. I have no doubt that I will be doing all of my future book reading on my Kindle. As an important side benefit, I kept working on getting the Kindle linked wirelessly to my iMac and finally succeeded. Feeling on a roll, I worked on my balky wireless printer and finally got it linked too! Amazon gets credit for making an old guy feel like he's not quite a hopeless geezer yet!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire -- doesnt come with wall plug any longer
Reviews.Author: Kellie J. Cobern
Reviews.Content: The only thing keeping my review from being 5 stars is that the newest Kindle Fire I purchased only comes standard with the USB charger.  Apparently you now have to purchase the wall outlet part of this item separate.  BOOO!!  That is just silly!  If I am going to pay for a device that comes with a charger, it should come with the connection to plug into the wall.  What happens if a person doesnt have a computer with USB to charge this device?  Way to take the cheap route Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Don't leave home without it  :)
Reviews.Author: Michele Rathbun
Reviews.Content: I've had my kindle for about two weeks now and so far I love it.  My only REAL complaint is there are no instructions.  It comes with a tiny piece of paper that tells you how to charge it, how to turn it on, and how to unlock the screen. That's it.  There is an online help function, but that only works if you're somewhere where you can access wifi, which in my case meant a drive to Starbucks or somewhere like that.  You can also BUY an ebook other people have written that tell you how to do things, but my thought is, it's an eReader! You can't include an ebook version of that online help file? Or an ebook instruction book??  Just automatically included like you include certain apps?It's not that it's excessively difficult to use, but I don't know WHERE to find what I'm looking for, so I fumble around between screens until I find what I want, and then when I need it again, I can't remember what I did to get there the first time, because I had to open and close so many things in the process of finding it.That problem aside, which doesn't have anything to do with the device itself, I LOVE this thing.  The screen is beautiful, the touchscreen nicely responsive, the sound is clear and nice, and I have ALWAYS loved the ability to carry a ton of books with me wherever I go.  I never have to worry about getting bored, because I always have a book.  Like I told my friend, who has one of the eInk kindles and got stuck somewhere unexpectedly without it, NEVER leave the eReader at home!  :)Can't say much about the video features, other than the pictures are very sharp and clear, because I only got the fire version because I like my cover images to be in color. I love my cover art.  :)  So I don't use it to watch videos or anything, it is primarily an eReader for me. The other stuff is just gravy.  :)

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Jen S
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet and I love it!  The only negative thing I have to say is about the battery life.  Amazon states that the battery lasts 9 hours- I doubt that my battery has ever even lasted half that amount of time.  I know a few other Kindle Fire owners and their experiences are the same as mine.  Maybe the stated 9 hours are if you are only reading, but this is more than an e-reader and I bet most people spend a majority of their time using it as a tablet.  It is a little disappointing- I find myself having to charge it everyday.  That being said, I am overall very happy.  The picture quality is amazing and surfing the web is just as fast as on my home computer.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Nicole
Reviews.Content: I chose to rate this high, because we recevied the device on time, packaged well, and the device is working perfect.

Reviews.Title: a gift
Reviews.Author: Kim Procknow "kimba"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for a gift but now I want one.  Great for reading magazines, especially if you are a traveler.  And the price can't be beat!  I have a 2nd gen. Kindle which I still love too.After receiving it I realized there is no wall charger...REALLY?  I would have happily paid 10 dollars more at the time of purchase but evidently didn't read the whole description.  Oh well, my bad

Reviews.Title: Alright for the most part
Reviews.Author: aries_BLU
Reviews.Content: So I received a Kindle Fire as a gift for Christmas last year (thanks sis!), and I was really surprised and excited about it at the same time. I was actually thinking of purchasing a Kindle at the time, but never thought of going for the Kindle Fire. For one, some of the other Kindles were going for a lot cheaper than the KF, and I am a big book reader, so I thought one of the regular ones would be a good fit.I've had a few issues with my KF that have luckily been fixed with a hard reset, so that much I can be thankful for. The picture quality is amazing so there are no worries for those who desire a tablet to watch movies or the latest television shows. Music is also great on here.One thing I don't like is the downloading process for apps. I purchase my apps online through Amazon, and then I go to my KF to download them. But there seems to be a lag or something, so the app is never in my "apps" area, and when I go to the App Store it says that I have already purchased it. It is quite the ordeal just to download something I purchased, which is super annoying to have to do every single time.What I don't like is the inability to sufficiently organize the books on this Kindle. You can sort your books in three categories, but that is about it. You basically have a big and open list of books made available for anyone to look at. I am a huge reader and since I can remember throughout my 22 years of life that has always been the case. So I have tons of books. Literally TONS of books and am grateful for that, but at the same time there is no way for me to organize them on the KF, so therefore only a few are on my actual Kindle, which is really sad, but I simply cannot have a lot of books on here at once. For example, I would love to be able to put my books in folders or groups like you can on the other Kindles that aren't fires -- by collections -- but I cannot do that. They are just in an annoying list.Also, if I open a book but change my mind on reading said book, my position in the list refreshes back to the top.  If only I could organize by author or genre. I would LOVE to organize my books by author, but that simply isn't possible, and reading is the main reason I have a Kindle. It's quiet the conundrum and annoyance that I constantly have. I have been in contact with Kindle support about this feedback three or four times, which has been asked aplenty for a long time, but nothing has come from it. It's really disheartening, for at the same time there are some covers of books that I'd rather some people not see (for example my supervisor was thinking of buying the HD and wanted to see the navigation of my current one. I got a little *ahem* worried because it was a spur of the moment request), but if there were some form of organization I would have no issues with anything. Is it bad for me to want to organize my books so I can have some semblance of order? Is it bad that I want to be able to organize my books so I can see what I actually have? Amazon also isn't the only source I purchase my books from, so collections would simplify my input process.

Reviews.Title: Exchanged the regular Kindle for the Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Fran Collins-Leech
Reviews.Content: Absolutely love the brightness of the screen - my eyes "thank you" - now I can read in bed before turning off the night light.

Reviews.Title: best 7" tablet I have found
Reviews.Author: Sheryl
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best 7" tablet /e reader I have owned or used. It does so much and moves so fast and smooth it is a true pleasure to use. The screen is incredibly clear. The e reader is much easier to see than other tablet/readers. The text to speech function is a real plus.It is so nice when you have to set it down and it reads to you while you do other things around the house. I love that I can cook, do dishes, fold laundry etc, and still enjoy my book! As far as I know this is the only tablet that has this function and in this price range you can absolutely do no better. There are some tablets that are selling for considerably more and do not do as much or work as well as the Kindle fire. Save your money and jump on this tablet. You won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: Great Value for the Price
Reviews.Author: TomeTracker
Reviews.Content: After much deliberation between the Nexus 7 and the Kindle Fire, I opted for the Fire which I have found to be a great value for the lower price. I went for the version with the ads and they have been no problem whatsoever. They're gone with a swipe to unlock. Internet browsing and email are easy in addition to a very user-friendly reading experience.

Reviews.Title: kindle fire
Reviews.Author: grennturtle
Reviews.Content: The Kinde fire is hevey compared to to the original. Also battery does not last as long. I love to read, but my wrists and hand swell from the weight of a book. Next time I will go back to the orignal kindle. The Kindle fire is great for the healthy..

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Eric Krieger "Eric Krieger"
Reviews.Content: Awesome product!!  I am very happy with my decision to purchase this Kindle vs. the Apple Ipad, apple isn't that great from what I have heard and seen for myself.  But the Kindle fire, used on Wi-fi has amazingly fast speeds and easy downloads!  If you are thinking of getting this, I HIGHLY recommend this product!!  Well worth the money and the seller shipped super quick!

Reviews.Title: No communication between Amazon and our internet!
Reviews.Author: HLY
Reviews.Content: We just bought a Kindle Fire 2 weeks ago and I'm not happy! When we had originally bought it, we took it to my Dad's house and registered it, downloaded some apps, etc. Worked fine and we loved it! When my 11 year old daughter brought it to our house, we tried to download some books and other apps, and we kept getting error messages that said there was no internet connection and to check the connection and try later. This went on for 3 days! We have a Verizon mifi 4g LTE wireless internet that we take with us. We have no in home internet, we just use the "box!" Way cheaper for us then to have home internet and then have to depend on public internet coverage when we're away. We love it and have never had an issue with this device as my phone and laptop work fine off of it. When I called tech support for the kindle, they told me that sometimes Amazon cannot communicate with a specific internet connection and that's why we can access the internet on the kindle, but CANNOT download ANY apps, books, movies, etc. We were told to take it back to my Dad's  house and try again on his internet (which is Embarq) and see if it would work there. It works FINE at my Dad's so it is an issue with Amazon not being able to communicate with our device! I've never heard of anything so dumb in my life! Why would I want something that we have to find public internet access or tap into somebody's else's internet in order to be able to use it. If she wants to load something at home, we have to make a list and then wait till we get somewhere in order for her to be able to do anything! I was not impressed with tech support because they told me, "Well, why don't you get a router for your home computer and then it will work". Why would I have 2 internets just because Amazon cannot communicate??? In the 5 years that I have had Verizon, we have never ONCE had an issue with this device! And the funny thing is, the kindle will hook up to our internet so that she can watch youtube videos or check FB, etc, but you cannot purchase anything from it, including free apps and books. We have decided to sell it to another family member who can get it to work with their internet. I'm looking to replace it probably with an ipad or a nook as these do not communicate with Amazon. I think the kidles are great, but make sure it's compatiable with your specific internet before you waste your money on something you can't use! Overall, I'm disappointed with Amazon mainly. All the technology out there and they can't communicate with a very well known internet provider? I'm tired of all this and she just wants something that will work, so we are just going to go with a completely different device.

Reviews.Title: I love my kindle, I really do, but....
Reviews.Author: LittleMissLovelyEmilyBook
Reviews.Content: Let me just start off buy saying that I love my kindle fire. it was gifted to me on my birthday (1/17/2012)So i have had it for almost a year. It was my second e-reader, and first amazon product. My first e-reader was a 'Kobo Touch' from Borders, and was purchased when the company was going under.. My kobo was the love of my life for a short while. I found myself reading from the app on my laptop more and more, and using the device less and less. It was not a good experience.Anyway, About a year later, I had been asking warily for a new e-reader for my birthday. I came home that day, and there it was. When I first got my kindle, I was slightly confused about how it all worked, and was again wary. It took me about 10 minutes to figure out how to go about purchasing books on the device. After that, it was perfect.But then....A few months after I had gotten my Fire, it began frequently freezing. (Bare in mind I was in not way ruff on my kindle, and had not dropped it.) One day, my kindle's battery died. No big deal, right? Wrong. I plugged in my kindle, and waited patiently for the orange 'Charging' light to come on. It didn't.  I tried restarting my kindle, but nothing would work. I left it for a while, then a few hours later took it back to the store in which it was purchased. I came home with a new kindle, and all was well.A few months later....My Kindle Fire started to freeze again, and I would restart it. Then, similar to what happened the first time, it died. Thus I tried to charge it, and again, it didn't work. Frankly, I was annoyed. After spending around $200 dollars(USD), My kindle was just going to continually fail? There was no reason for it. I again got a replacement for my kindle.AND AGAIN....Only about a month for two later, I needed another replacement. This being my third kindle fire, in less than a years time. This time though, when I was getting my replacement, I was told it was most likely my own fault my kindle failed repeatedly. After this, I became more careful in what I did with my kindle.NOW...I am happy to say I have not needed another replacement, but my kindle STILL freezes at least 5 times weekly. Sometimes more. Maybe this is due to heavy use?? I don't know. Overall, I do love my kindle, but it is buggy, and I find myself annoyed constantly that it is not 3G. I often find myself finishing books while out and about, and then having nothing to read because I cannot get into the kindle store without WI-FI.*SUMMARY* In all honesty, I still love my kindle deeply, but will not be purchasing a new upgraded model. Though i wouldn't hesitate to buy another kindle. (Like the Kindle Keyboard which I am considering.)Reading on the kindle is nice, but it can sometimes skip pages. Often I find myself watching movies or tv on my kindle, and I love it, but it is very grany in close up shots. The internet browser is nice, but not perfect. Overally the kindle fire is a nice starter kindle, If you dont mind the freezing, or it being a bit heavy and laggy.I am giving The Kindle Fire 4 out of 5 stars

Reviews.Title: Not so easy to use
Reviews.Author: Tinker10
Reviews.Content: I like the looks of the new Kindle Fire 7" but it is not as easy to use as I had hoped. Not to mention that I had to buy a users manual to learn how to use it. My suggestion is for the users manual to come preloaded on the new Kindles all of them!!

Reviews.Title: Needs an instrucion book
Reviews.Author: versailles
Reviews.Content: I am not a computer expert.  Therefore I need an instruction manual.  To just receive a blank kindle is of very little use to me. It is as dumb as me

Reviews.Title: New Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Karen O'Connell
Reviews.Content: OMG!! I am so happy with this!! Thank you Amazon. It couldn't be any easier to use especially for those of us who are technologically impaired. It came earlier than I was told, which was great.Thank you, thank you, thank you!!

Reviews.Title: Still learning
Reviews.Author: Erin's Mom
Reviews.Content: I got this yesterday as an anniversary gift. I haven't done a lot with it except mess around with some of the features. So far I found that it is VERY slow downloading even just a book. It uses a lot of Wi-Fi so it's next to impossible to use a laptop while the Wi-Fi's on. I absolutely hate the carousel. I like to organize my books into folders, like on the kindle touchpad. But as an e-reader I am satisfied.Review update: on day 2 my kindle did an update and now it is so much faster, it only takes a few seconds now. And I figured out how to remove items from the carousel. I still don't like everything I click on going to the carousel though.

Reviews.Title: Magnificent Device!
Reviews.Author: Ms. Stuff Inc "Ms. Stuff"
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased the Kindle Fire for my 11 year old son who loves this device! It was ordered and received rather quickly.  It came already registered when delivered.  I did not know that it had so much to offer!  There are just so many things this little device can do!

Reviews.Title: AWESOME!!
Reviews.Author: Dani
Reviews.Content: I've had this Kindle since last christmas. I love this thing and the battery life is awesome. Even though I love it so much, I think I'm going to trade this and my iPod 4 in for the new iPod 5 when it comes out!! I recommend it if you don't mind not having a camera. The apps are a little slower than on my iPod though.

Reviews.Title: Wish I had waited for the Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Howard Goodman "Hgeep"
Reviews.Content: I bought the original Kindle Touch 3G, which is great, but when the original Fire came out, I just had to have it (especially since Amazon sent me a $30 off coupon) and I've enjoyed it.  I still use my Touch for travel, since it does have the 3G and I can buy books on the road.  At home, I always use the Fire.Long story short (too late?), I just bought the Fire HD at Best Buy and I do like it a lot.  But since it's only "incrementally" better (i.e like the iPhone 4s over the 4 or the 5 over the 4s, etc.) than the Fire, I can't justify keeping it, so I'll be returning it.If I didn't have my original Fire, I would certainly keep the HD because it is a neat gadget and the cover which wakes it up is also a great improvement.Shoulda waited . . . . . . sighhhhhh

Reviews.Title: Impressed
Reviews.Author: etorres49
Reviews.Content: Step up, a lot of new features, very enjoyable. The downside of the new kindle fire 2 is all the adds, like on the start screen, their are adds.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire Refurbished
Reviews.Author: gloaab
Reviews.Content: This is not as good as my original. Too many ads & crashes a lot. Would not buy this edition again/

Reviews.Title: Loved Kindle Fire Previous Generation
Reviews.Author: mstig2012
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love my kindle fire previous generation, this one makes my second purchase and I love it. I had previously upgraded to a kindle fire hd 8.9 and I hated the kindle fire hd 8.9 they are not worth having.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Monte J. Rice "country girl"
Reviews.Content: I had a first generation Kindle Fire that needed repair work on the charging port. I had the extended warranty on it, so Amazon just chose to replace it with a second generation Kindle Fire.  AWESOME!  They are amazing. Great clarity, wonderful ways to use them besides reading the books.  I'm in love!

Reviews.Title: Refurbished Kindle works good
Reviews.Author: Todd Van Horn
Reviews.Content: Am enjoying the refurbished kindle, but disappointed that the text to speech feature does not work.  Still a decent machine and it works and charges well.

Reviews.Title: excellent deal
Reviews.Author: shannon l. oles
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent deal.  I was unsure what a kindle was when I bought it,  but it will be handy.

Reviews.Title: Certified Refurbished
Reviews.Author: Carol Finley
Reviews.Content: I am really enjoying my certified refurbished Kindle.  I was disappointed because there were no instructions for transfer and I had to start all my games over.  Also they sent it to the wrong address.  So I had trouble with Customer Service not the Kindle.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: jennifer
Reviews.Content: I am loving it! Works great. Has all the capabilities I need without the price of a tablet. Definitely a great product.

Reviews.Title: good for reading in bed
Reviews.Author: M B PHILLIPS
Reviews.Content: My friend has one and found that she was pleased.  She recommended that I should have one. I gave it a try.  I'm enjoying it.

Reviews.Title: Love my kindle fire
Reviews.Author: ali
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love my kindle fire.  Wasn't going to purchase the prime until I used it the last month.  I have been watching video for free that I am really enjoying.  If you don't have prime I highly recommend getting it.  It is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: Great Kindle
Reviews.Author: netherfield "netherfield"
Reviews.Content: I use it as a tablet and a Kindle.  I wish I could use iTunes on it, but haven't been able to figure it out so far.

Reviews.Title: excited new kindle user
Reviews.Author: Noemi
Reviews.Content: It has been great, I did not realize kindle dis so much. My only concern is the volume stopped working out of the speaker but worked with the headphones, I had to shut it down and restart to get them working Again

Reviews.Title: meets all you needs
Reviews.Author: dolores
Reviews.Content: it's everything i expected it's so easy to down load the free apps that you have. it's so easy to use.

Reviews.Title: The 21st century
Reviews.Author: Paurik "a seeker"
Reviews.Content: It has become made my train trip to work every day a lot quicker, you can use it for music, videos, movies or books, I am back to reading a lot more, get one you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: Came with a crummy charger.
Reviews.Author: ANNYOAKLE
Reviews.Content: I bought 2 of these in December for my grandkids. They came with a real wall charger. This came with a USB port charger that tells you on the screen it is only a trickle charger that won't work if it is turned on. I am kind of disappointed since I finally have one for myself and on the second day I still can't use it. I use Amazon a lot. You couldn't spring $3 more for a real charger? I would have paid it if I was offered the option. I had to order one from Ebay.  I hope it charges soon so I can see if it works.

Reviews.Title: Kindle
Reviews.Author: Carole Webb
Reviews.Content: What do I do to charge it?  no cord came with it and also no information on how to use.  I cannot get it to register online and I do not have wi fi at home so I am having to buy a router and set up it is a pain I thought I could plug it into my laptop and use it It does not work that way

Reviews.Title: Works well
Reviews.Author: William Kisse
Reviews.Content: These work well in our application and I recommend it.I will purchase again.Thank you for a good product that meets expectations.

Reviews.Title: Not for the computer illiterate.
Reviews.Author: Kay Balciulis
Reviews.Content: I thought the charge on the battery would last longer.  It is very easy to read and the pages turn easily.  I am still not familiar with all the things I could do with it.  I need a sheet of easy to understand directions.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: cameron mcgriff
Reviews.Content: It's was great I brought it for our son he loves I think I may get one for me :-)

Reviews.Title: As Expected Great Product
Reviews.Author: t.hekkema
Reviews.Content: I purchased the refurbished Kindle to replace one that recently had the screen broken. Processing and Shipping was very fast and was exactly what we expected once received. It was a great option to replace the older kindle.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: G.Blasdell
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this to everyone! There is nothing I dislike about it at all! I love reading my books on it. There are a lot of free books, apps that you have access to. ENJOY ENJOY ENJOY!

Reviews.Title: My daughter is so happy
Reviews.Author: Moudou
Reviews.Content: Great deal I made for my daughter she love to read and she is so happy and everything goes well about kindle.What ever read this publish it Amazon is the best place online to meet your expectations.I hope amazon stays the way they are.

Reviews.Title: ENJOYING KINDLE!!
Reviews.Author: Lisa Wyatt
Reviews.Content: I HAVE REALLY ENJOYED MY REFERUBISHED KINDLE IT MET ALL EXPECTAIONS AND MORE WOULD RECCOMEND TO ANYONE THE PRODUCT WAS EVERYTHING SAID IT WOULD BE

Reviews.Title: Perfect!
Reviews.Author: Gabriela Zepeda
Reviews.Content: Perfect for want I need it for! Reading & Netflix!! Kids have the iPads but still want to use the kindle! I tell them nope the kindle is only for mommy. �

Reviews.Title: Refurbished=garbage!
Reviews.Author: Kamau
Reviews.Content: My daughter's kindle batter port broke a month after the warranty expired (go figure), and amazon offered me a good deal on a refurbished kindle since I couldn't get hers replaced. I should've known it was too good to be true. Normally I don't have issues with refurbished electronics, but this product's touch screen doesn't work at all, unless you use a stylus, and the numbers jump so much I'm not even able to input my wifi password. I'm better off saving to buy a brand new one to replace her old one.

Reviews.Title: LCD Kindle fire
Reviews.Author: RICK MEREDITH
Reviews.Content: I can see why Kindle upgraded this, but it's still a good product it's now used by my daughters to get used to using a tablet.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: momtoamiracle
Reviews.Content: I bought my refurbished kindle fire two months ago.  It works great.  Coming from an ipad it took a little getting used to, I don't find the MoonReader app as easy to use as ibooks but I'm adjusting.  Overdrive works just fine, battery life is not quite what the ipad is but that is ok.  I didn't have to buy a charger as I already had a charger for my kindle keyboard.I've had no trouble with it, works perfectly for what I need it.  I had amazon points so it made it even cheaper.  I'm saving up more to get another.

Reviews.Title: Loveeeee my kindle :)
Reviews.Author: Kimberly
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I both got each other a Kindle and pretty much love it :) We sold all of our old books/bookshelf so we have so much more room in our house

Reviews.Title: Awesome gift.
Reviews.Author: stacey gonder
Reviews.Content: I gave this as a gift for Christmas and the receiver loved it. They are still getting a lot of use out of it.

Reviews.Title: My Refurbished kindle
Reviews.Author: Sheila Hinds
Reviews.Content: I chose this rating because it deserves it, have not had any problems.  When i received my Kindle it was very easy to setup and transfer my data from my old Kindle to my new one.  I would and have already recommended, this to my friends.Thanks!

Reviews.Title: kindle fire the tiny bookshelf.
Reviews.Author: rhonda L Keel
Reviews.Content: Got this for my daughter b/c she loved mine.  Although I still love the feel of a real book, its handy if you want the latest book and have no room formore books at home, I have hundreds of books but found I can store as many on my kindle, i can borrow and delete books at my discretion.  Can access apps, games, internet etc.

Reviews.Title: I enjoy
Reviews.Author: jackie
Reviews.Content: I enjoy this kindle but I wish the instructions were visual. Some of us need to see it in writing

Reviews.Title: I love my Kindle Fire and recommend it highly.
Reviews.Author: B.Jeanne Gallagher
Reviews.Content: Love my Kindle, read 1 or 2 books a week on it. Love to play my games on it also; especially when I am away.

Reviews.Title: Why didn't I get this a long time ago?
Reviews.Author: Cat
Reviews.Content: I have a Kindle that was specifically for books and I love it. I finally went out on a limb and upgraded to the Kindle Fire. I love how clear the picture is and all the apps that are available. The options are endless. I would highly recommend the upgrade to anyone who is addicted to cell phone apps and to occasionally read.

Reviews.Title: My son loves it
Reviews.Author: Cloudydaze
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my son, arrived quickly and he's totally enjoying it.  It's nice to have for him to bring along for long drives and trips.

Reviews.Title: Well worth the money
Reviews.Author: Lisianne
Reviews.Content: I found this device to be in like-new condition -- not a scratch on it! It arrived on time and functions without an issue. However, the cord that came with the device does not work. The plug portion is fine, but the cord itself is not. I charge using my Kindle charger so returning the cord is not worth the bother.

Reviews.Title: My kindle
Reviews.Author: Valerie Doran
Reviews.Content: Works great everything went great.  My mom loves it!  Very fast shipping, exactly as ordered.  Will order again, well as soon as we need another.

Reviews.Title: Great warranty for a refurb.
Reviews.Author: user of electronics
Reviews.Content: Works great.  I turned it into Android tablet running KitKat.  Does what I want.  Will get a lot of use from it.

Reviews.Title: Great, except for the ads:(
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: The Kindle itself is great, having to pay to remove ads is alarming......the original Amazon I purchased, the glass cracked, then broke....is there any way to replace the glass?

Reviews.Title: Great customer service
Reviews.Author: William Hughes
Reviews.Content: I love the new kindle.  I am very impressed with the customer service.  Thanks for being so accommodating.Kay Hughes

Reviews.Title: Our 5th Kindle!
Reviews.Author: crs
Reviews.Content: We are a Kindle family.  We wouldn't buy any other tablet.  We have been very pleased with our ovreall purchases.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product
Reviews.Author: jean vatnsdal
Reviews.Content: I love it.  Easy to use and easy on the eyes.  Excellent product.  I would recommend the kindle fire to anyone.

Reviews.Title: my review
Reviews.Author: Rebecca Dudyk
Reviews.Content: The kindle fire 7 is an excellent reader. The many options for the text of a book is a huge help. Having a learning disability words get mixed up sometimes. With the options available I can reduce the the chance of this happening. The battery life is good. The set up is easy to use. I would recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Janice Troilo
Reviews.Content: My Kindle Fire was a gift from my sister and brother-in-law.  It was given to me to replace my Nook, which was more problematic than not.  I am totally pleased with the Kindle Fire.  It exceeded my expectations.  You definitely need an otterbox to protect the Kindle; however, they are a bit expensive.

Reviews.Title: Only complaint!!
Reviews.Author: William Houck
Reviews.Content: My only complaint is the fact that I can't get the games I had on my earlier kindle. This one says it isnt compatible???? WTH??

Reviews.Title: Refurbished Kindle
Reviews.Author: Sylvia Finch
Reviews.Content: So far it works good.  As I said in my phone conversation, being on a fixed income, I can't replace my Kindle every time the plug in receptor becomes lose and it won't charge.  Maybe some better creation tactics would help your sales.  Sodder the receptor!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: RangerJohn
Reviews.Content: I had bought my wife a Kindle Fire when they first came out and I have watched her enjoy hers so much that I decided to buy one for myself.  I really enjoy using the Kindle Fire.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire Review
Reviews.Author: Thomas J. Fenton
Reviews.Content: This device is as good and reliable as a new one. I am enjoying it and look foreward to additional books and aps.

Reviews.Title: This is no substitute for an I pad or anything with good WiFi Capability
Reviews.Author: Emerick Vann
Reviews.Content: While this device does an an OK job as an e-reader, do not expect its WiFi and internet connectivity to be as good as other pad devices on the market. It may connect to Amazon easily enough to order a book, but falls short for other wireless connections. I recently took the Fire overseas so that I could stay in contact with family using email. I found that the fire was slow, and would seize up and usually fail to respond to selection commands I initiated to read my email. It was so bad that I gave up using it and was out of contact for two weeks. Other people in my group using a Samsung Galaxy or an Ipad had little problem at all the same WiFi locations overseas. It appears that the Fire processing is fine tuned to communicate with Amazon, but fails miserably in communicating with other sites. However, at home using my wireless connection, it seems to work much better. It is just when in another country at various WiFi hot spots the devices fails. Since the IP communication protocol is the same world wide, this is a mystery and something that Amazon should correct. Did they fix this in newer models? Who knows. I wish now I would not have spent the money on this device and purchased an Ipad instead.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: RangerJohn
Reviews.Content: I had bought my wife a Kindle Fire when they first came out and I have watched her enjoy hers so much that I decided to buy one for myself.  I really enjoy using the Kindle Fire.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire Review
Reviews.Author: Thomas J. Fenton
Reviews.Content: This device is as good and reliable as a new one. I am enjoying it and look foreward to additional books and aps.

Reviews.Title: This is no substitute for an I pad or anything with good WiFi Capability
Reviews.Author: Emerick Vann
Reviews.Content: While this device does an an OK job as an e-reader, do not expect its WiFi and internet connectivity to be as good as other pad devices on the market. It may connect to Amazon easily enough to order a book, but falls short for other wireless connections. I recently took the Fire overseas so that I could stay in contact with family using email.
